reviews.review: Nice place. wonderful flower setups, very colorful and always nice and organised, but not suitable for the warm months as everything is outside on direct sun.
Amzing. Only visit it when the weather is good because if it is hot you wouldn't last there for over 30 minutes!

Official Trip to Dubai, UAE. Went to Abu Dhabi, UAE on an office assignment this summer. One weekend decided to take a bus and visit Dubai. I went straight to the Global Village but it was closed till 4 pm, so I had like 3-4 hours to spare. The local cabbies told me about this garden but i wasn't interested at all on seeing any garden. But since there was nothing else to do around there I decided why not. When i entered the place it looked like any garden but as i went deeper into the garden I realized how wrong I was. I was completely amazed by the food court area with the colored umbrella on the roofs
Amazing day. To go out of the city for a while, miracle garden is the place to be to chill out and see a colorful park of flour
Wow. A must visit in Dubaibeautiful different arrangements of flowers.Went there 3 times and will definitely love to go again

The park is closed. Please be sure before going to the miracle garden that is still open because i paid the cab driver and once i was arrived, the garden was closed. Also the bus 105 from the Emirates Mall is canceled for ever, you have to take a taxi now if you want to go in the Miracle Garden
boring and very small. it is expensive, not worth the moneyjust you go there once and it is too small and good only for pictures but not worth the errand

Kind of fun!. It was fun to see, because it's a bit out of the ordinary, but not really something I would like to recommend to people that come from countries with a lot of natural vegetation. Use your time to see something more interesting.

Yet another meh. I'm not really a big fan of flowers so probably it's a bit unfair that I make this review. But still there are places that feature things that you might not like but somehow ending up being fun. Unfortunately this is not one of them. If you have a general fondness for flowers, by all means go here. If you seek exotic fauna then you can probably skip this. If you have no interest in flowers and just want to go somewhere, then go somewhere else.
A must for flower lovers. Well maintained and flowers in a good state regardless of the heat. Make sure Your skin is covered well,- hardly any shades available.
oasis in the desert. It was like finding an oasis in the desert, you do not expect to see something like that in this city, very nice.
Amazing. We were happy to be there. The gardens/flowers designs were nice and attractive, however there should be more interesting activities.

Nice gardens. I decided to take a trip and visit the Miracle Gardens. It is quite big and provides a wide array of flower displays in all shapes and sizes.
I recommend visiting but either at the beginning of the day or towards sunset when its cooler and easier to walk through.

Beauty of flowers. The place is a bit difficult to reach by public transport. Better to take a taxi from nearby. The walk under the sun is a bit tiring but the beauty of the flowers pays it off. Well maintained and very nice forms given. But the price of even a water bottle inside is exorbitant.
I expected more. It is nice but I expected more. The restaurants and cafeterias have bad plastic tables and chairs and are dirty.

Very creative. Well laid out garden with creative designs. Flowers were starting to wither as expected during this part of the year. Parking at the first gate as you enter was chargeable - if you drive around to the bottom gate area, there is ample free parking.

Miracle by Man. Nice garden and it takes extreme effort to make something like this in the desert terrain !!!
Plots are very nice and flowers too.
Good to walk with Kids !!
Heaven. All around full of beauties.....Cars made of flowers.....Hauses made of flowers.....Dont forget to visit butterfly valley alsooo.....
Must see. A stunning show of primarily petunias and geraniums. So creatively displayed in massive quantities. Loved the experience. Open only over the cooler months. Highly recommended

I like this garden , it is an amazing place. There are plenty of beautiful flowers with special colours of flowers . The design of the garden is awesome , and very relaxing place for family and children , friends to spend a wonderful half day out . Each season has its special design on the special occasions. The design team , marketing team and flower garders have done great jobs .
Very nice family attraction. very nice family attraction. it's a little ways out of town, but worth the trip. nice quiet gardens with beautiful views. really enjoyed it.
Beautiful!. Its a beautiful garden full of sights to see! However it gets extremely crowded during winter months and is difficult to have a relaxing pleasant time
Creative designs of flowers.... I visited once together with my family and I was amazed with the colorful flowers and beautifully arranged.
Very Good. It was very good to see all these flowers together in different style and shape , the way to the garden needs GPS

hard work .... but....Nothing to Rave about. Well we went there last March 2016 after listening so much about it.Plan was made and on my day off we went,,,, the marks i gave was for the hard work done in arranging and planting those flower!!!! yes flower,, it was only ONE flower with different colors. i don't know about you but that didn't impress me at all and after roaming around for a couple of hours i was board to the bones and had to find my way out. Sorry not my cup of tea it seems .
Beautiful!. This is a beautiful garden, very lovely things made out of flowers, I definitely recommend going there.
One of the best attractions in Dubai. You have never seen so mamy flowers and installations with flowers as you will see there. Price a bit high but it is worth to visit.

A true miracle. I visited Miracle Garden with my mother in December. Not really knowing what to expect the garden was an absolute gem in the desert. Millions and millions of flowers wonderfully thought out and executed. Simple structures and shapes transformed into a wonderworld of brightly flowered visions. If you appreciate hard work and bright colours, don't miss this!!!

Must Visit!. You have to marvel what has been done in the middle of a desert. This is outstanding - although open in the winter months ( naturally!) it is a must visit if you are here -a little out of the way so getting there and back could be a hassle at times also whilst there DONT forget to visit the Butterfly garden - that is phenomenal too

Oasis. Greeen and beautiful as it is,the miracle garden attracts many people.It is a good place to visit, a green getaway in Dubai.The flower combinations are wonderful, except there are not many varieties of them.But in general would like to advise to visit.

Beautiful Decoration. Miracle garden dubai is able to maintain its flowers and beautiful look year round.The Dubai garden miracle showcases a wide variety of different flowers that are arranged in different shapes. The blooms of these flowers have been fashioned to look like hearts, stars, igloos, pyramids and other figures. The floral patterns will change with the season, so any returning visitors will get a brand new experience. We went on last September 2015, This place is also recorded in Guinness world book .
Blooming Garden. A very good place to spend with your family during the winter-spring (Nov-Mar). The garden is full of bright flowers providing lots of photo-ops.
Definitely worth a visit. Too many Butterflies in one place. Definitely you will not see this as time wasted. Make sure to come early and park next to the entrance.

Beautiful place in the middle of desert. Absolutely beautiful garden with loads of flowers and shapes in which the flowering plants are grown. Have always wondered how this has been maintained so green all through the year. Love visiting this with kids
Average place. Place has some flowers but few variety. Entry fee is a bit high though. Well place could be skipped.

Quite pretty but also wasteful. Visited here because we thought it might be interesting and sure, we were not the only ones. The park was packed with people. There are flowers everywhere and it is quite amazing to see something like this out in the dessert, but one must surely wonder about the waste of resources to create this. Second mayor downside is that the foodstalls don't take credit cards.. and of course there is no atm anywhere near here.. that is quite ridiculous.

Like a real Miracle indeed. Ideal time is to visit is just an hour before sun set. The illumination gives a totally different sight from the day time and both are beautiful. Ideal time of the year is from Nov to Feb, I believe for we visited it the Jan and also during march / April. During march / April there was hardly any flowers. It is just like a Miracle how they have created a beautiful garden full of flowers in this part of the world. Spend at least a couple of hours admiring this work of art, to enjoy it fully. Every step will be a photo spot.
Miracle garden in Dubai. I think it's a place that worth at least one time باغ گل دبی مجموعه ای رنگارنگ ازگلها که به طرز زیبایی تزیین شده وبه یکبار دیدنش ارزش داره

Excellent day trip. Well maintained and colorful garden considering the weather conditions. They always try and change the theme to attract visitors all year round. I believe that it is closed during summer for maintenance.

Piece of art. This place is basically a very huge miraculous masterpiece made from a combination of colourful flowers. The amount of time and work that the staff must have spent coming up with ideas and designs should not be underestimated, specially when you think of the hot climate of the city of Dubai! Recommended.

Interesting and Refreshing . The place is really interesting and a must visit because of the various floral designs and patterns.
The most interesting thing was the HAPPY BIRTHDAY written with various flowers.

A LOT of flowers. Yes, there are certainly many flowers here, but I think this attraction is more for the locals and expats living in the UAE looking for some colour in nature. It doesnt offer much if you are coming from overseas, but it makes most Dubai residents happy when they can see the amazing amount of colour around them.Try to avoid during (and around) summer time as there are very few places to hide from the shade. Found that out the hard way...

Hidden gem. Such a stunning place to walk around. So many beautiful flowers and things to look at. Make sure you take water and a hat as there isn't a lot of shade. Well worth a visit and it's super cheap.

simply amazing. i am in love with this place, the way it is design it is amazing. I highly recommend this to all the tourist who wants to visit Dubai.It is easily reachable also from Emirate Mall which is again outside of emirate metro station one can get bus till miracle garden and while back from miracle garden has their own bus which charge i think 10 Dhms.
Just beautiful. One huge garden, beautifully set and kept. Ideal with small children. Entry fee acceptable. Closed in summer. Don't go on a hot day, no shade

Unbelievable these natures in the desert. To be honest you cant imagine that flowers and greens can grow in the desert, amazing work done by government to develop and maintain this huge variety of flowers in such a fantastic decorative manner, is really fantastic so it is perfect for you to have some romantics moments ..

Vibrant. Suggested place for honeymoon photography. So colourful and attractive. The flowers are almost the same, there is not much varieties but in different colours. November December is the best time to visit Miracle Garden. Hats off to the organizers for the great plan and maintaining the greenery. Easy accessible. There is RTA Taxi and Buses every 5 minutes from Emirates Mall to Miracle Garden.

miracle garden dubai. what a place a nice beautiful park full with flowers and all kind of flowers you can find here you can find world famous buildings make with the flowers a natural beauty must visit this place
wow. amazing garden...........really miracolous!I look so forward for november to come again and bring all my family again. Stunning
WoW. Must visit this garden, wonderful place, feel the beauty of flowers, well maintained, all season flowers, very attractive for children
Amazing!!. It is really a good place to hang out with family and friends.closed during summer.definitely a must visit place if u are coming to dubai.
Amazing. he Dubai Miracle Garden is a flower garden located in the district of Dubailand, Dubai, United Arab Emirates. The garden was launched on valentine's day in 2013.
nice day out. If you enjoy strolling around a park full of flowers then this place is worth a visit! I lost count of how many photos we took between three of us.

In the middle of the nature. A miracle garden indeed. It was an option for an afternoon, and I am glad we chose it. Beautiful place, many, many flowers beautiful designs. There are places to sit, have a drink, eat an ice cream. There is also the option to have a tour on a small car.

beautiful theme very colourful. it is a must see for tourists the butterfly park alongside the miracle garden truly is an add on.takes you to a beautiful world of flowers around a theme.one gets to see wonderful colorful flowers very fresh and maintained well. A perfect attraction for tourists where amazing pictures can be an added incentive takeaway.

Real Miracle!!. It is really like a miracle to have such a nicely landscaped garden in the desert.the arrangement of flowers and plants grown are very good.certain parts are so nicely curated that one may feel as if the flowers are not real.flowers arranged in train,car or house shapes are a delight to watch.it is not just for flower lovers or children but everyone to see the effort and care taken by the garden authority.

A Little Miracle in Dubai. This Garden ( Tourist attraction is closed during Summer) it's a very laid back atmosphere. It's a must if you visit Dubai as it's full of hanging pots and plants. Flower Lovers must visit this attraction which will give you goose bumps for the amazing walls that have been creatively made up. A little miracle in the Desert is how i see it. December would be crowded however the weather is perfect for a visit to the Miracle Garden in Dubai.

Surprising variety. Visited in March before summer started, and I was quite impressed by the variety of flowers and plants on show. there were also a kids trampoline playground with inflatable slides to add to the fun,. thgis was a welcome option that keeps the children active. highly recommended.

BEAUTIFUL. It is a place like no other. Better come early so you can enjoy the sunlight because it is a really big place and with pictures, walking and all it looks like 5 hours are not enough!!!Amazing place to spend your day!

Holiday. Amazing place.. In a dessert how they managed to plant these beautiful flowers.. Best for you to have your own ride to go to this place.. Its extremely hot to roam around during noon time. Bring umbrella, water extra top

Really Miracle. This is wonderful place like wonderland,,,amazing,,
what a art and creativity,it feels so good to be around so many flowers and to see so many colors at one place...

Heaven in desert!. Never thought in such a hot place, a garden can be there that too full of absolutely colorful flowers. I tool it more like some wonder world kind of stuff but once i entered into this, just one word... Marvelous. Hats off to the all the people who care and maintain the garden despite of so much of heat in this part of the world.

Lights like marriage in India :) Beautiful thought. I visited this place with my family and was not expecting so many lights with re-cycle material. The concept of making place like this is really good and the planning is amazing. Each of the section is dedicated to certain waste materiel re-cycle which I like the most.
Amazing!!. Definetly worth the 30 dirhams! Was the most beautiful display of flowers I have ever seen!! It is done beautifully and truly is breathtaking!

''It's A MIRACLE...........''. The Miracle Garden is a very good attractive place to someone who loves nature. I went there with my family and everyone loved. It's nothing but a world of flowers, It's an awesome place for photography, and if you haven't visited here once you should have a go. Hope this review is helpful for you. Please vote.........
Truly miraculous . The garden is located at a small space. But it was awe inspiring. The way they have made all the shapes and themes with the flowers , is really splendid.

It is an amazing place to view.. It is a very nice place where you can see lots of flowers gardens and of different types and models. You can enjoy the view and the smell and take memorable pictures. My only comment is that it is a congested area where the flowers gardens are close to each others.
stunning. superb during winter season mid oct -end feb. its closed during summer. one word -Wow! flowers in plenty beautifully presented.

Indeed a Miracle - if you think you are in the middle of a Desert! - Visit during Winter ONLY. Beautiful place - colourful flowers - indeed a wonderful experience!. The butterfly garden is not that worth though.

more Flowers than you have ever seen. We enjoyed our visit, and it is a very nice place to stroll with your family or as a romantic visit.My only complaint is that there could be more variety of flowers. But what they have done with what they use is amazing. The Butterfly Garden is the highlight of the garden. It is a must to see and explore.Bring a camera to both as you will want to take a lot of selfies or photos of each other as there are a lot of photo opportunities.
Beautiful!. Went with the family and it was really nice, all the flower structures were well done and very interesting specially for young kids. Avoid public holidays as it gets really crowded.
Beautyful. Great place where to have a walk and spend time. They have really seen so much trouble with it. Loved every minute of it :)

Flowers <3. The garden such a beautiful area to walk and relax. A Must Visit.
you can spend one hour if you have nothing else to do in Dubai. Kids will enjoy it for sure.

Cute Garden in a Dessert. Flowers every where and colorful. Good place to take lot of pics.
Our visit was unplanned, we just went there as we had some time on our last, but amazed by the way this garden is built. Its really a miracle, a garden like this in a dessert. I would say it is a must visit in Dubai.

Flower and nature lovers, come on!. I am not that fan of such places but I was amazed with the variety in the place. However I prefer the natural things and these flowers Costa lots of money to stay I've in 48c degree. Rock bottom, very beautiful place to vist

A Fairy garden in mid of the dessert. Full of flowers and different varieties. A must visit . Kids will enjoy it for sure. Well maintained area . Crowded during week ends. Recommend to go on week days. then you can enjoy the place and take good pictures.

Flowers lovers. Beautiful garden but not amazing.
You can spend one hour if you have nothing else to do in Dubai.
Don't go there if you are in town for few days.

amazing place. I visit the garden with my family and it was an amazing experience for all of us. the garden such a beautiful area to walk and relax. it also a good place the take photos as all of the place full of flowers and colors.
Paradise in desert. It is really a mind bogling place. The flowers are just amazing and you cant believe that actually this place exists. Open 4-5 months a year, definately worth visiting.

An extraordinary blaze of colour in the desert. This must be one of the most extraordinary gardens of the world. Acres of flowering plants in a country that mostly comprises sand desert.
It only functions in the cooler months of the year but it is a really good place to visit if one is there at the right time.

A beautiful places to be. If you have time to spend a day on this area of Dubai..take a taxi go to Miracle garden avoid the heat on the afternoon and catch the sunset or the sunrise and then go to the Outlet mall Dubai ..This place is really a miracle in the middle of the Desert the entrance has a fair price and you can buy drinks and something to eat inside the park !!! defintely I will go there again next time
Nice. It was a nice experience but was expecting more butterfliesThe place looks quite oldI like that there was a movie after the tour Which the children lovedIt was worth the trip you its a must see
Really miracle. A very nice with its own type of garden which is undoubtedly among must see places in Dubai. Colorful flowers, lovely atmosphere. We do really enjoyed this amazing garden
wonder of Dubai. Beautiful is not a word to justify it's beauty. Awesome creativity and maintain it is even a great work...Must visit with kids and family.
flowers flowers and flowers. So many colorful flowers everywhere in garden amidst desert that too into different shapes and structures
Crappy. One of the worst places to visit in dubaiHonestly it should be placed in every corner of those Emirates and with free entrance as it has nothing you can admire at all

Was blown away!!!. What an oasis in the middle of the desert. This garden can give any tropical or European garden a run for money. Was totally blown away by the explosion of fragrances, colours & variety of flowers!!!
colorful. It is one of the best gardens i have ever seen, especially that it is located in a desert, very nice place for families.

Flower land. I travelled there in Jan - Feb 2015. A very colourful and vibrant place. You see flowers everywhere. Beautifully done up and maintained. The flower exihibits have been well placed on model houses. It houses replicas of huts, tombs and of the burj khalifa, etc. Cars have been used as good exhibits. One needs to walk a lot. It is wheel chair accessible. Few eateries there. Make sure you have transport taken care of. Nice place to see flowers but noting else in terms of recreation. Wonderful to see flowers growing in the desert.

Lively and Fresh Experience. One of the colorful and beautiful garden I have visited. The authorities have put in lot of efforts to make most out of the flowers and the colors. Especially the houses / huts, tombs, replica of burj khalifa etc makes it an excellent treat for eyes. Its a recommended place to visit during winter at a nominal fee.

Dr Michael Kitchens . Dubai Miracle Gardens is absolutely fabulous!!
Their presentation of floral exhibits is amazing. If you visit Dubai you see the miracle gardens!!!

Can be better. I went there with family. The park is good but not waaaw. I expected the park to be better. It is not big, not diverse flowers, not many flower shapes, not many cafes and very few restaurants. I travelled around the world, copmared to botanical gardens and flower gardens oversees, this one is below avarage. I liked though the butterfly garden nextby.
Colorful, Lively. the miracle garden is a must see.Wonderful flowers, colors, and mood.Children will love it also, The flowery statues are beautiful

Beautiful!. This is one of the most beautiful garden I've ever seen. Its amazing how these flowers grow and look so healthy in the middle of the dessert. Wonderful place for families. They are very creative with the flowers. Have lots of beautiful backgrounds for those photo lovers. If you love flowers, this is the place to go!

Truly a miracle. Its a miracle to grow any vegetation in Dubai's harsh climate and to have a garden filled with amazing arrangement of flowers is truly a miracle. It is a great place to get away from all the craziness and it is very inspiring. There is a mini pizza hut place inside and a few other places to eat and drink and they are all reasonably priced. I visited in January and the weather was very pleasant.

Paradise!. If you love flowers then this is heaven on earth! Just so lovely and beautiful everywhere, a must visit place for flower-crazy people. There are food stalls inside if you get thirsty and hungry.

End of season. Have only rated as average as it was nearing the end of season (mid May) and all the floral displays were past their best. Can only imagine how beautiful it must be earlier in the year when it's cooler.
Amazing Place. Its wow. You are definitely going to mesmerize the beauty of this garden. Its clean and well maintained and lots of visitors al around.
Some green in Dubai. Amazing place spending with your family, taking a lot of pictures and of course all the area is so green that you feel that you are out of the dessert.

Original Flower Crown. I strongly recommend for this place to be visited during the first days it is opened, though there will be a lot of people for sure, but the pay off is way better, because you will be able to see the flowers fresh and really vibrant, I was able to see these flowers also before in Al Ain and they have surely evolved way more now that they are in Dubai, the place is bigger and grander and the designs are way spectacular, glad that they have improved and innovated more.Also, bring an umbrella if you plan to visit in the morning or afternoon.If you want to be able to walk leisurely without bumping into another person then just like me now :) visit the place when it is almost about to close :D

Nice Place. amazing colorful place, nice place to take kids where they see colorful flowers
the place is too sunny and there is no enough shades
Wonders. The place is so so beautiful that it can not be explained in words .think should be made part of the city tour . A must visit

In awe every visit. This is somewhere that you could spend hours just wondering around. The use of flowers to duplicate certain structures is so clever. Every visit there, introduces me to something new... I've even seen people come there to do wedding photo shoots.

The worst thing you can see in dubai. Let's be honest , Dubai is not famous for its nature . The miracle garden is insanely tacky arrangement of limited number of flowers. And gigantic plastic sculptures of ladies with shopping bags. And yeah, burj Khalifa made of months old wrinkly oranges. You can't walk on grass, mind you. Food and beverage options are pittyful. There is nothing natural about this place. Very artificial , tasteless and unfriendly. If you ever enjoyed a walk in a real garden , you will detest this place. Being a resident , I think this is one of the worst places you can go to.

Use of natural flowers in the best creative way!!! Extremely beautiful.. I had heard alot about this place and my sister ensured that I dnt miss it on my trip to Dubai. When I entered the garden I was awestruck with the magnificent beauty and use of flowers. Very colourful and vibrant.... I am sure lot of efforts has been put on the upkeep and maintenance of the place... I truly loved the place... If you are going with your kids then you surely have to visit miracle garden. It lives upto the name... Miracle... Tip: Try and go in the morning to avoid crowd and to get the best clicks... Also, it is a huge place so please keep 2-3 hrs.

Flowery Delight....what a sight!. A fantastic place to visit with family and friends. They have the best collection of plants and flowers that are artfully planted or placed in various shapes and sizes. Absolutely brilliant and soothing for the eye...quite different from the concrete structures you find elsewhere...a must visit place. Avoid visiting during hot sunny days or when sun is at the peak.
Truly Miracle garden in desert. Beautiful garden. Just amazing to see floral garden in a city where you see is tall building. Opened during winter, worth the visit

Wonder of Nature. The best place to visit in Dubai! Who would have thought of a garden in a desert city like Dubai! That's why they call this a miracle. Every year, this park never fail to amaze me. I used to visit yearly and they always improve the displays and arrangement. Every inch of display means a lot of creative ideas from the gardeners. And the flowers are really kept maintained and fresh. So first class to the creative team who always gives smile and amazement to each and every of their visitors.

natural colours in Dubai. This shows the best efforts always produce colorful results. It is hard to believe on eyes that we are in desert.Best place to relax and connect with nature (fauna and flora) after spending time in concrete jungle, shopping malls & shopping mania of Dubai.After noon are good to be in to see the flowers and live performances (music instrumental) adds to ambiance.Don't miss Egyptian restaurants, especially Chief Spinning moves.

Interesting spot in Dubai. Before going to the Miracle Garden I didn't really know what to expect. I had heard positive and negative things. However, having been there I can only recommend it. The selection of flowers are impressive and so are the decorations.

Magical . Miracle Gardens is so peaceful a wonderful escape from the hustle and bustle of the city while still being close! The level of care is obvious when strolling through the gardens. The displays are carefully thought out. A must for a visit, particularly I found for older couples.
Superb. Be there in the middle of the nature sorounded by all the colors :) Beautiful place to see it photographing and good time

Nature's wonder. Miracle Garden which is located in Al Barsha, DubaiLand, Dubai is one of the best attractions that dubai has. Whoever likes the nature and its beauty, he has to visit it. It has ample space and most types of horticultural attractions. It is completely a different world which has to be experienced. The only problem we faced is its location. The location is not properly guided; entry and exit to it is little bit difficult, rest it is ok - hope the authorities would take care of it.
Heaven of Flower. Its just amazing work done by goverment !!! in a deserted place, to develop and maintain this huge variety of flowers in such a fantastic decorative manner, is really fantastic !!!
Attraction. A wonder and marvel considering you are in a desert. The sight of the varying plants is unbelievable. Not included in your sightseeing tour. The entry fee is well worth it
awesome..... simple awesome place to visit. Perfect blooms and excellent structures to demonstrate the beauty of folowers

Beautiful place. Its one of the most beautiful places i have ever visited, you will find very beautiful crafts from flowers you will find different types of flowers, you will feel the freshness in the air....and i bet you will have the best pictures if you are a fan of photography....
Best appreciated during Winter. Different types of flowers , arrangement and design your can see from here. If you like gardening and flowers, then this place is perfect for you.

A beautiful man made garden as the name suggests.. A beautiful man made garden as the name suggests. A prefect day outing destination when the climate is good. Loads to see and also good eating and relaxing placesavailable. One is awed to see what can be done with flowers, fruits, creepers.

Must visit for winter season in Dubai. I went there for an hour or less because the weather was hot. The beautiful thing is you can see a lot of flowers and they made some shapes from it. Its clean and youre not allowed to smoke inside. Its an open space, and you can use golf cart too if you dont want to walk. They open only in winter if i am not mistaken.

To dream among flowers. We spent a few relaxing hours among carriages , castles, houses covered in colorful flowers . I was impressed by the effort of fitting and maintenance of such a place in a desert area
MIRACLE OF FLOWERS. The flower decorations are really beautiful. It is very clean. Flowers are decorated in to different shapes, that i have experienced no where.
Pretty. It will shock you at how they can design the place made with fresh flowers. Nice for picture taking.

Wonderful Park in Dubai. Dubai’s Miracle Garden recently celebrated the inauguration of the Dubai Butterfly Garden, the world’s largest and the region’s first indoor butterfly garden and sanctuary for over 15,000 butterflies from 26 species.

Not for a sunny day!. Do not visit on an afternoon or do carry an umbrella with you. The place is beautiful and is a must visit. No public transport to the place and we had to take a cab. Food is not allowed to be carried inside the premises. No need to book the tickets online since the queues were very small.

The Flower & Butterfly Garden. This is mainly a flower garden, the beauty of the gaden makes it miracleous thats why the name Miracle Garden. Very beautiful place full of different kinds of flowers. Opens only in winters.
Day visit. An unbelievable garden, it's amazing what theve done to create this area. A must visit for all the family.

Burst of color in the midst of desert. A must visit place for tourists and residents alike. Ideal place for photography. Kids and disabled friendly. Best to travel by own transport as the place is outside the city.
Beautiful place . I went there with my family. The garden was very nice, beautiful, and awesome. But the interring price is too high. AED 50 for one person!

All over Dubai, this is the place to enjoy peaceful time. City of concrete, that is it, long high twisted high towers, even on the beach, became all full of concrete buildings, suddenly, out of no where, I found this place, and it was exactly how it looks like, small water fountains like water fall, gives you the water fall sounds, bright colours of all sort of flowers, some fruit decoration but it was not a real fruit of course otherwise it will be waste of food, peaceful place, very peaceful place
don't forget you camera and your tripod. I love flowers and parks and this beautiful park gives you a sensational experience . better to visit in spring .

Visit in the cool months . Miracle gardens is closed from the end of May until the summer heat is over. It would be worth checking in advance to see if the place is open. Great family activity which is relativity cheap for Dubai. Across the road there is also butterfly gardens which is run by the same people which is open from 9-6pm as that's when the butterfly's sleep and is open during the summer. Both sites have a nice area to eat including Starbucks coffee

Not open in summer. I am sure this would be an amazing place to see - if only it was open in summer! We did our own thing whilst in Dubai and arrived to find the gardens closed for the summer renovation! This as not stated on any web info at the time. Disappointed as it is a long drive out of town. Went to the butterfly garden instead which was lovely and we were glad there was a second option in the out of the way area. Advice - check opening hours and season before venturing out there.
Good experience. This garden have good collection of flowers and moreover the attacted is the way it is decorated and presented.
Awesome, a day well spent. The beauty is amazing. The flower decorations are really beautiful. It is very clean. Flowers are decorated in to different shapes, that i have experienced no where.

It's great for a walk on a cool day. There are plenty of flowers everywhere and it is a beautiful park. However, after about 10 minutes, the novelty wears out and there doesn't seem to be much to engage the guest. The floral arrangements in all sorts of structures is a fairly good try but misses a story that connects it all. If you've never been and are considering a visit, it is worth your time if you like flowers and the temperature is reasonable. The weather can make or break this experience.
lovely bloom. very interesting use of colours in this garden using flowers!Since it's open for a short time in winters it's a must visit . Feels like being in europe!

nothing to see. if you come from outside dubai, this means that you came from a place with flowers.in this place there is nothing to see but flowers designed in a nice way, it is very expensive, not recommend on hot summer times and I don't like it.
Great for a short day trip with the kids!. Great for a short day trip with the children. I would recommend going in the morning to avoid parking issues. Great place for families and children.

Garden of colourful Flowers. Miracle Garden is beautiful garden with every bit of land covered in flowers.As we enter the garden, we can see 2 peacocks made of flowers. As we go further a mini city where houses are made of flowers.We enjoyed the mesmerising look.

Colorful. It is very beautiful. It is too hot. It would nice if there was some shade. But I must admit it is awesome. They have made things covered with flowers. Nice rated. Rated as a Must Visit place.
Flowers Everywhere!. Full of flowers with different structures made out of flowers. This is next to the butterfly park so you can do both of them in one day!

Fun family day out. I have been here a few times and more recently with my baby. It is a lovely place made better on every visit with new arrangements and (F&B) offerings. my last visit was in February so they had many attributes to valentines.

One time going place. Miracle garden is good for one time going because you will not find any new flowers varierty.same flowers are there which you can see every where in dubai.But one time its worth watching palace.
Miracle Garden. It was very good experience. You will enjoy beautiful scenic gardens. You can spent couple of hours...!!!

Beautiful Idea. Spectacular men made garden that provides enjoyable and relaxing day out for all as this garden changes every so often for their new ideas and obviously UAE's traditional themes, scores 10/10

"Beauty at it's best". You feel so happy and refreshed when you visit the Miracle Gardens in Dubai. Make sure you arrive at least by 11.00am to fully enjoy all the wonderful flower displays. Travel tip: Used Uber to get there from my hotel. 20mins away.

Very good in winter. We visit is during winter it was veey nice.
Nice things that they did for flowers. Nice to visit for one time.
Parkings need to be organized.
Simply a Miracle. As the name reads, this surely is a Miracle Garden. You would never expect such a beauty in a Desert. The choice of colours & types of Flowers will definitely sweep your feet off.

Incredible garden in the desert. This retro-style garden is a total surprise. The only drawback is that there is no public transport (at least in a convenient way) to get there. However it is worth the visit but avoid the hottest months, otherwise the heat will not allow you to enjoy it.

World‘s Largest Vertical Garden’. we made a taxi to visit Miracle flower garden located in the district of Dubailand, Dubai, although a desert wouldn’t be the place where you would expect to find the world’s largest natural flower garden, Dubai being Dubai, is also a place where you can expect the unexpected.it is spread over 72,000 square meters making it the world's largest natural flower garden featuring over 109 million flowers planted.The traditional flowerbeds are arranged in arches and flowerbeds forming various shapes and patterns, with topiary-style displays, apart from blooms that take the shape of stars, hearts, igloos, pyramids and many more. No wonder then, that the Dubai Miracle Garden gained world recognition by the Guinness Book of World Records as the ‘Largest Vertical Garden’.
Miss. I have visited The Butterfly Gardens is next to Miracle Garden and it was a fantastic experience. I would recommend this to my friends and family.

Good for kids. A must watch for kids. Show them how beautiful the nature is. Those who are doing any research on butterflies too. A place you can visit on summer as it's indoor with controlled weather. Refresh your mind with the chirping sound of birds , flowers and butterflies around you . Thanks
Family-friendly park. Park is perfect to visit for families and couples during all winter. Perfect for weekends for all time.
Flower Power & Photo Shoots!. If you're into flowers & "photo shoots", then this is the perfect place for you. There are photo opportunities here, there & everywhere!

Amazing displays Worth a visit . I'm a horticulturist and keen advocate of seeing unusual garden designs or landscapes. The use of annual bedding plants is very clever and they achieve amazing displays and structures giving a real wow factor. It's not an all day trip , maybe a morning or afternoon, once you've seen it all there's no point hanging around. It's a bit of a journey there too , near the race course , so the taxis fare wasn't cheap. I'd certainly go to say you've seen it , you'll have seen nothing like it before.

Its very pretty garden. Its a very pretty garden and they have worked alot to built it. But not sure if its worth going all the way to see it. Plus there are no good places to eat just walk around in the heat and look at the flowers

A bit over the top, but worth a visit with your mum in a wheelchair!. My mum was over visiting Dubai, not liking heights and in a wheelchair I was a bit stumped for what to do in Winter, so I took her there in Feb this year. It's worth a look - even if it is full of the same flower, it is still impressive and a good way of spending an afternoon. Went later in the year with my brother and his kids and went to the butterfly garden, but being an animal (insect?) lover I wasn't too sure how I felt about it - lots of butterflies drowning in the water features, and people ignoring the 'don't touch' signs... On the whole though, both worth a visit.

Garden of middle east. Since its in sand city, view is splendid like you are in austria...Perfectly organised place. Place is always crowded with visitors and best time will be weekdays. Weekends are not good if you are planning for an easy ride

must visit. as soon as we entered, our mouth uttered "wow" .Clusters of flowers at one place all beautifully placed with amazing motifs like girl, train, huts, peacock etc. and there was also a butterfly garden filled with thousands species of butterfly which may sometime sit on your head or collar. we really liked the place and would highly recommend.
Locked . Pretty nice looking place... Not sure about the hours when it's open. The willow trees are pretty cool looking and it has nice sitting.
As the name says. Beautiful views to enjoy in winter. Am not too sure about summers as it could be quiet hot. Ticket prices have gone up over time.

You will regret if you don`t see it and you will also feel sorry that you saw it.... If you don`t want to regret not seeing it I recommend you to go there but if you go with taxi you will pay some $$ also when you want to return you will find yourself in the situation of not having a taxi at all to take home. You will be able to take the bus but you will pay more than taxi could cost you from the garden to your hotel. If you have a rented car you will be alright don`t worry. The garden is beautiful but not so impressive if you have botanical gardens in your country, There are a bunch of flowers put in order to form shapes. Most of the flowers we have in our own country and are the cheapest one so....nothing impressive. I think if you have children they will be very impressed, they will definitely enjoy the view.

Very Pretty. Amazing place and lovely flowers all around. Very nice displays of flowers and designs. We all really enjoyed, it was a relaxed evening spent with family. We took lots of pictures and just something different to see.
It Truly Is A Miracle Garden!. Open between November and early April (?), it's a must see if you are in the Dubai area. The artistic arrangements of flowering annuals is definitely beautiful.
Disappointing. Save your money, go to a proper botanical garden in your country or elsewhere. It's not a miracle garden, just a bunch of beautiful flowers randomly decorated.

Suberb. What a place to go visit. The care and attention they have taken with the displays and flowers, sculptures and everything is great. There are shady areas and seating everywhere of all kinds to enjoy when the sun gets too hot. The place is like a maze, you think you've seen it all and then you find another part. Highly recommend a trip here. Food and drink very reasonable prices - you can't take your own in though.

Amazing Atmosphere !. We visited this Garden in Dubai - indeed a miracle as the name suggests - with millions of flowers . Various plants with flowers of different colours pruned to the shape of villa , cars etc. make you feel like a dream world ! Must visit in Dubai !! Dr.K.Sundar,Dubai.

Must be visited if you are in UAE. During winter time, it is such a nice place. You feel lots of efforts exerted to create this piece of heaven on earth. Just the prices for food and beverages are a bit expensive.
Amazing wonderworld. Amazing place to just go and enjoy with family, it will bring the inner child out again, like a magic world here in the desert, absolutely a must to visit

Really nice!. An ocean of flowers in the middle of the desert?? Creative ways to display a variety of plants and shrubs?? Don't believe it?? Go and discover for yourself!! A great excursion for the entire family.

“This really is a miracle in the middle of Dubai !!!. the real miracle in the middle of Dubai A very nice garden beautiful place and lots of creative stuff. what a Great Breath taking place i love it !!!

Truley Colourful Miracle. Miracle garden is world's largest natural flower garden decorated with more than 109 million flowers planted. This is unexpected place you can find in between the desert.Miracle garden remains open from october to april. Entry fees is around 20 to 25 AED, but worth for a single penny.A must visit garden when you are visiting dubai (specially evening time).Visit with either family or couple it will give you a extravagant joy and lifetime memories.

Visit with family . It was amazing garden to visit with family an gorgeous wonderful flowers huge and small many colours and many kind of flowers and they made from flowers many famous shape from many countries and shapes like heart and and umbrella and towers you should be there very early to see all the wonderful garden tickets easy to buy and free for children under 3years and for old people

Thrilling place for outing with friends . You will have so much fun there. evening time is the best time . you will see lots of creative stuff like house with full of flowers and miniatures of famous stuffs.....

Miracle explained as miracle. Liked it went with family and friends nice art memorable pictures being what more can I say about dubai as it itself says miracle and well explained miracle garden the houses I wish I could stay in one

FLOWERS ALL AROUND. Miracle Gardens in Dubai is worth seeing and you will enjoy. In Dubai, you see modern city with high rise buildings. But if you go to Miracle Gardens, you can see a different Dubai. Soon you enter the park, you see flowers all around and I did not see such a garden at any where. In a desert city, such a beautiful flower garden!!!. Really amazing. One should not miss it. Many of the tourist packages do not cover this, as it is a little bit away from the city and the entry is also seasonal, I think it is from November to April (to verify). I visited in January 2016.
A must see. This is a seasonal garden, considering that it is in the middle of an area with a very harsh weather.It is a real miracle to take care of this garden.
Beautiful. Awsome place. Difficult to imagine that such a place can exist in desert. I would place this in must visit place in Dubai if you have few hours.

Wort it. Its something really amazing and worth seeing. It is in the middle of the desert. Firs i see the garden in photos but ohotos do not do justice at all. Great place to spend couple of hours....
Beautiful. It is amazing to see something so beautiful considering you are in the desert. Gardens are not really my kind of thing but I did enjoy this as it was something so different for Dubai.

Very beautiful. We decided to go to the miracle garden to burn time since we had a little bit of time before going to the mall. The garden is awesome and to think that this is maintained in this desert is amazing. But it was a little pricy for the size of the park.
Beautiful . very beautiful place to relax and take unforgettable photos full of all colours flowers. Very Crowded on Fridays.

A piece of heaven on earth. This place is the Alice's wonderland no doubt! It is really a sightseeing, breathtaking, very much relaxing, calm & very beautiful place, green areas & shapes everywhere.The keepers really have managed to preserve such a delightful place underneath the burning sun; the place is very green, well organized, clean & most importantly calm peaceful.You can never stop taking pictures in every corner there because of the so many beautiful areas all around the place, also, there are some restaurants if you want to have a quick bite & a playing area for kids too.It's an attraction that I strongly advise to visit to have a lovely day away from the loudness of Dubai.

For Flower Lovers. Awesome place for people who love flowers. Food options are limited and visit only during better seasons. Afternoons can be hot but winter months are bearable. We did not stay back to night to check out the lighting but it roughly takes 2-3 hours to cover entire garden.

Website says "Open", but IT'S CLOSED!!!!!!!!!!!!. We took a taxi all the way over, only to find out IT"S CLOSED!!!! But the website specifically said "Open"! We went to the HORRIBLE butterfly gardens next door, and it was not great!

Not to Miss!. a garden in the middle of the desert! it's really something amazing and worth seeing..we had gone there last year..and revisited it this year..we found that there are many improvments and new designs..we really enjoyed it

Photos do not do it justice. I seen loads of photos of this place before i went, but the photos do not do it justice at all. Its a great place to visit, and very cheap cost 30 AED which is around £6 and you can wonder around for as long as you want. If the sun is too much go in the evening. I went during the day, it was hot but not unbearable. I'd advise a sun hat, sunnies, sun cream factor 50 and lots of water and you will be grand. They offer a buggy service that takes you around the park for 20 AED, which we used when we started to get tired.
Once a worth visit. This place is a fairy tale for the flowers with flower structure ....great place to spend couple of hours ....with friends and family

Nice garden. This might be a fun a nice place to visit especially for couples! It is a little romantic (there was a wedding couple in their wedding dress the day I visited). It is a little further out of the main city but worth a visit if you have no where else to go. It's not an exhaustive tour given the size of the garden; I wouldn't plan to spend extended hours here.
amazing view. miracle garden is a great place to visit in dubai, this is only in season time only. we can take many good photos from here

Not really my thing but it wasn't to bad. Like the title of the review says, this isn't really the kind of thing I enjoy doing but it wasn't as bad as expected, I got dragged here and to the butterfly gardens by friends. So I was expecting a boring day out but quite the opposite it was fairly interesting actually. And I guess you could say they were pretty. However there was a pretty poor choice for food!

Good for a little green and some flowers in Dubai!. The Miracle Garden is just what it name implies - a miracle! It is hard to imagine hundreds of thousands of flowers and plants in the middle of a desert, but the garden is lush and full of life. I found this a great way to spend an hour or two with guests when they visit Dubai - it is very cool to see such beautiful flowers, especially in contrast to a desert safari and the lack of green we have living here. The price is not too expensive - just make sure you go during the winter months... it does not have much shade and can get quite hot during the spring and summer.

This really is a miracle. Beautiful flower all around you. I went to this in December 2013 and the flowers were all in full bloom. So much thought has been put into this attraction and it is a pleasure to walk around. I visited this attraction on 31st May (the last day for the current season) and unfortunately a lot of the flowers were dying. This is closed now and will re-open in Winter. This is definitely worth at least one visit. It's also fairly cheap to get into (25 dirhams each)
Flowery Dubai. Probably for middle aged couples. Good for children as well. Worth for one visit. But the thought that a garden full of flowers in desert will make you feel amazed. cheers Dubai gov.

Enchanting Flower Garden. It is really a miracle to have such a flower garden in a desert place.Relatively special type of tall green trees surround this garden.Beautiful flowers of different colours planted in earthen pots and are placed in different slots in specially made arches,some look like cottages,cars,train coaches,houses ,gates etc and various other shapes.Main feature of the garden is that flowers have been arranged in such wonderfully novel way giving an enchanting,captivating and eye-catching look to it.At first look one is mesmerized by sheer beauty of the flowers and their arrangement.Fountains add to the beauty and grandeur of the garden.Best time to visit is in winter 3 hours before sunset and the evening to enjoy the beauty of the garden during day time and evening.In the evening it is transformed in to a fairy land .Other features are beautiful display of coloured umbrellas,hung from bamboo roofs covering the eating places.A must visit place in Dubai.Bus service available from Emiraes Mall.

Beautiful!. This park opens between December and Mid-may we visited early May and although the place was still very beautiful a lot of the displays with the flowers had started to die due to the increase in temperatures! I Would recommend the best visit to be in January when the flowers are in full bloom. There are Plenty of places to eat and drink. As soon as you walk in there is a photographer that will capture your experience and you have the option of buying your photos and memory usb at one of the desks within the park. There is an entry fee that is not too expensive for the experience you get in my opinion. There is a glow in the dark park that we missed out on as again it opens during the cooler months. My 4 year old also enjoyed the experience. My husband sufferes from hay fever and he was absolutely fine!

absolutely stunning place. I wanted to visit this place for a long time and omg lad if finally got the chance! WOW so much bigger than i expected and really amazing set ups of the flowers, even trains and building made from oranges! A really beautiful place and a must have touring your camera along!

A place to relax. We started around 11AM , and did not get enough of the so many colors and shapes... cars, bicycles, trains peacock, towers and houses shaped with millions of flowers.... I would suggest to spend at least 3 hours

Better in pictures. It was nice to take some relatives to the miracle Gardens along with their kids, but I was a little bit disappointed. The location is difficult to reach and there wasn't enough signage on the road to indicate how to get there once you take the man exit. When you reach there, you'll be surprised of how small the area is, and how basic the flowers that they've planted were. Again it's a cool experience, but not worth the 45 mins drive and getting lost along the way.

Flower love. If you like flowers and appreciate being in a beautiful place this is the correct place. It is not open during the summer so make sure you can visit it when you will be in Dubai. It is beautiful and you can seat and jus watch how amazing this place is.
Wow. Breath taking place, packed with joy and very nice terrains. When you are in Dubai and see such nice flowers and landscapes; You will be totally surprised.

Nice Walk in a beautiful garden. A very nice garden in the middle of Dubai highways with beautiful plants sculptures and artistic small landscape. A walk in the green in Dubai is not easy to have and this is a good quick trip.

Its really a miracle !!!. The place seems to be a part of heaven...the smell of plants everywhere makes u refresh ur spirit..everything there is INCREDIBLE .. but please TAKE CARE ..never try to visit it before sunset by maximum two hours .. u'll melt.. secondly take lots of snacks and water with u coz the varitey of food there isn't good and also VERRRYY expensive
Miracle garden. We went in may and it was soo hot ...However, it was a great experience!Beautiful flowers and the venue is very nice to see

In the pictures it looked better. Maybe we choose a wrong period to go, but the pictures were way more appealing than in the reality.I was a little disappointed by the condition of the flowers, but hey... this is Dubai! Good job on the effort!I hope on my next visit it will be nicer.Good for a romantic trip.
Nice try. It's a nice try, but I expected a lot more, to be honest. Perhaps future upgrades will make the place a bit better. It's worth a visit, for sure, but I would not return.
Flowers in the desert. We spent a couple of hours wandering around here admiring the hard work that had been put in to keep these lovely displays looking their best. Well worth a visit

This Place is closed between May 31st to November 30th. There was no indication on any travel site about the timings this place has. Being super far away from anything else our journey to here ended up being a frivolous one. They need to put up the info on relevant travel sites or even google maps !
Relaxing place. All the miniatures buildings from inside are made from flowers and fruits. Is a great place to go if you want to relax. They also have a second garden called Butterfly garden.
Excellent . The most surprisingly and refreshingly beautiful garden in the midst of desert. It is really a miracle and an excellent photo op moment for the photos. Wonderfully maintained. Excellent.
Master gardening. Of course it doesn't compare to gardens such as Keukenhof gardens in the Netherlands, but really very pleasant and refreshing walk through.
Wonderful Place. It's really the Miracle Garden. You'll see too many kind of flowers and roses for first time. This place is good for friends, couples and families.
Amazing. To have something like this in middle of a desert is truly amazing, though not too many varieties of flowers,but still worth visiting
Fascinating!. It's stunning! Flowers were arranged in an unimaginative ways! It's very relaxing and comforting. You'll be amazed on how these plants were arranged! Beautiful!

Refreshing scene change. When my mum visited me in Dubai I took her to Miracle Gardens. It is incredible how such a garden can be maintained in the desert, and is indeed refreshing to spend some time there and admire all the beautiful flowers. Don't expect a romantic English rose garden, its a lot of kitsch but still worth going if you want a scene change from desert sand and spend some time outdoors.

You must go here!. I visited the miracle Garden in May and i absolutely loved it! You will need a couple of hours to walk around the garden. Me and my husband got bus105 from the Emirates mall for 5 dirhams each. It costs 30 dirhams each to get in. The ticket price was cheap compared a lot of other things in Dubai.

Magical like Disney, Colorful like Life.. We were lucky to see it end of April as they have extended it till May. It is one of the many reasons to visit Dubai before Summer.A must when you visit Dubai. Trust me, it adds color to your travel picture collections. Not to mention the wide array of floral arrangements and landscape that is pleasing to the eye. The flowers are no special breed, but the way they turn out on a landscape is really notable.Not too much crowd when you go on a weekday, that lessens the probability of photo bombers. The flowers die out on a summer so they are only open 'till April most of the time. Highly recommended!

Garden at its best. Its bit far away from Dubai city but worth a visit. You can catch a bus F30 from mall of emirates.The bus runs every 25 minutes from 2pm to 10pm. on your arrival you wont be disappointed its very nice done. we stayed there for 3 hours. Its full of nice flowers which is treat in the middle of desert.

Don't get caught out its closed. I spent three hours walking, catching trains and taxis to view it and it was closed. In total with return taxi trip 130 uae and I didn't see a thing. It's not widely publicized that it's closed. So disappointing

beautiful beyond😀😀😀😀😀. it is the most beautiful place to visit in dubai. so many flowers in different colors. diffrent shapes covered with different flowers. it is best place for couples and make a memorable day. best time is to vist on april. it was most cherishable event on visit to Dubai
wonderful. last time that i went to Dubai go to miracle garden with my husband. is was very beautiful place that you should see when you go to dubai

Flowers.. Greeeen.. Flowers. It is a Miracle.. They have named it right.. I was amazed to see the flowers and how green this place is.. i wonder how they maintain this place with millions of flowers (The Weather can reach up to 50'C) still it is amazingly beautiful and all the flowers are excited to welcome you. Must see place.

Magical visit . We went around 4 o'clock , early visit is better to get good look around and loads of pictures with natural lights. Facilities to use are clean and easy to access. Prayer room available too. Selection of food and drinks and ice cream. Good place for kids to run around and have fun. It's better to go early and spend the day there. Very nice and clean , well maintained. Will look forward to go back again. If you like flowers and gardening , it is worth going to. It's very creative way to have great selection of flowers organised and put in pretty amazing way . Would highly recommend to visit as family, couple or on your own. Costs 20 derham or 30 . Get to emirates mall by metro then a taxi for 25 derham takes you there .
Stunningly beautiful. An oasis in the desert. Truly a miracle. A shower of flowers can just about brighten your day. The blossoming flowers even in the month of May is nothing short of a miracle

Unbelievable beauty in the middle of the Desert!. You have to see it to believe it ! A true masterpiece of art of gardening with colourful foliage in the middle of the desert which mesmerises you for a moment to make you believe you have landed amidst an Oasis. Hats off to the grit, determination and effort of the workers behind this show. Absolutely worth the bucks
Impressive . This is a truly impressive display of beautiful flowers, growing in the middle of the desert So much care goes into each display Truly brilliant

It truly is a miracle garden. I haven't seen such a beautiful graden in my whole life. It is full of different models in which most are situated in dubai like burj khalifa, large peacock with beautiful feathers and many many small beautiful houses all made of from plants and flowers and all this is spread all over the park and the park is huge. The entrance gate itself will shock because there is huge gate from which you enter in this beautiful world.

Fun place to spend time. We were with the family in this garden in June. It was a bit tough for the taxi driver to find this place, but eventually when we arrived we enjoyed the scenic landscape thoroughly
Bit of a disappointment!. Maybe because we actually visited it on the last day...we found it average...over hyped! But knowing U.A.E I am sure they will come back even better than the previous time

Amazing.. From the minute you walk through the gates you feel you are in another world. I found it breathtaking. All these flowers growing in what once was desert and in such heat. The design of the garden is wonderful. So many colours - I particularly loved the female figures. This should be on everyone who enjoys flowers - bucket list. Amazing!

amazing. I went to the miracle Gardens with my daughter. It cost us about 35 dirhams each which was well worth it. It was the most amazing place with millions of plants. There were waterfalls and sculptures of every kind imaginble. Agreat day out for the whole family. Highly recommended.

Truly a miracle. It is a miracle to have such a beautiful garden in an area where there is no rain - so much though has gone in to the design and the different exhibits. Unfortunately it was about 40 degrees so not really conducive to walking but we spent about an hour there.

Well maintained flower garden in the middle of the desert. A wonderful experience to be in the middle of thousands of flower varieties, grown around marvellous structures such as landmarks of the country, vintage cars, animal & bird structures & much more.. Surely it's a good experience for people of all ages including children & elderly!

A Flower Wonderland. Wow, to see the creativity using flowers, most of which you probably haven't even seen. Truly a sight to behold. The colour and romance it is magical, and all of this in a Desert, certainly living up to it's name.

FLOWER IN DESERT. i visit here 19 may 2016. Earth laughs in flowers ‪#‎Miracle‬ Garden‬ is the most beautiful and biggest natural flower garden in the world, contain more than ‎45million‬ ‎flowers‬ ..IT WAS NT IN OUR PACKAGE . WE went there via private texy. the cost of per person is 30 dhiram. u can pay vi acard or cash.. its open area.so b careful for summer. u can use umbrella, or there is stroler for childern, its cost is also 30 dhiram as rent.its very beautiful lovely n magical thing is that its flowers design change every year. aprox 6 moths it open. may is last month. n after that it close for new change.u must visit if u lr flower lover. its amaging that in dubai, where only desert is every where,bt here earth play with flowers.

Best place ever. If you like nature it s one of the best place to go and spend an half day.it s just amazing,no words to how explain it.we loved.unfortunately it s not easy to go,you need to catch up a taxi but it s worth,cheap entrance ,30dirham around 8-10€...

miracle garden. Indeed it deserves the title. I have never seen in my life such a beautiful garden, so many beautiful flowers, plants, little houses of all shapes and sizes. The garden is in the Guiness book of records and the nr. 1 attraction in Dubai.

Good value, and magical. The garden is something totally unexpected on the edge of the desert. Great photo opportunities and something a little different in contrast to all the other sights of Dubai. We took a taxi both ways to and from the metro station we wanted. It was quite reasonable and easier than waiting for a bus in the heat. The Tourist Bus also stops here I believe.

Average. I felt the entry fee for this place is priced high. nevertheless i expected something unique. i dont know if i went in the wrong season (summer) but it felt a bit dry and monotonous. there are no unique flower, dont expect a botanical garden feeling. there is just one or 2 types of basic flowers that have been used all around. i see those flowers all around the city alongside the roads and it is well manicured. however, the miracle garden is certainly not any miracle of sorts. it is okay. maybe something different to do on the weekend. it is quite big though and lots to walk. but it was a little repetitive to me.

A real wonder.. Beautiful by any standard.How they get all the flowers to bloom together is real miracle.the variety of flowers n colours show the determination of the Dubai authorities n their committment to excel in whatever the do.Has a reasonably good food court as well.Wonderful!!!
Nice to see. Its a nice garden, however I found it not well maintained. Arriving there by taxi. There is no taxi rank on the way back. It's too expensive to enter.
Trip To Dubai. Have your camera and jumping poses ready! The Miracle garden is absolutely stunning! You can eat, stroll around the colorful garden and take amazing pictures.

Went there during Christmas. Went there during Christmas and it's full of people. Would love to come back again but not during holidays. It was kind of amazing to think on how did they make all of it considering this is a hot country (except during wintertime of course) and in a desert country. Amazing place!!!
Beautiful . To see so many beautiful flowers grown in a desert area is something to really appreciate...simply awesome

What a wonder!. To think that all those beautiful plants can grow in scorching hot conditions is testament to the great work by the gardeners at Miracle Garden. Some wonderful sights there.Location was a little far out of town so expect to pay quite a bit if you are catching a taxi there, and try to plan your trip so that you arrive either early morning or early evening. We visited at mid-day and the heat was quite unbearable.
No words to describe this wonder!. Though you might mistake it to be an ordinary garden, please don't miss an opportunity to visit this place!

A bit of a hype. Read the reviews and decided to give it a try. However, i was not impressed. It is a nice effort in the desert but i take it as a arrangement of pots and the variety of flowers are very limited... The effel tower with artificial oranges is not great either. I would restrain from making direct comparison to places like garden on the bay or keukenhof or kew that would be unfair. The services are not great either- i witness a visitor being called off for sitting on the ground for a picture. The information are not great neither. Access to the park is not that easy or cheap ( by taxi).

Most beautiful. This is a must visit garden during winter. The garden is a beautiful creation in all it's colorful glory and beauty. The garden is accessible easily by road and one can also do shopping in the global village.

Flowers!!!. 'Wow' was what we said when we first entered the miracle garden! An enormous place made from flowers & plants..the colours, the maintainance, the formations-all beautiful! You cannot resist not taking a picture on every stop you make. A lot of walking to do within the gardens but mini cars also available for those who cannot walk and they take you round. You also get refreshments which will keep you going..you can spend the whole day here!

Wooooooow heaven. This is heaven, the place is wonderfull i liked it so much, just need good weather unfortunatly it was too hot, so my advises is gi there before sun set by two hours, bring with u water and snacks, to go there i took metro to mall of emirates then bus no 105 to the garden gate
An array of flowers in the desert. A great afternoon out in Dubai. You don't feel like you are in the desert. With plenty of places for food and dink this is an idyllic place to be.

Beauti in the Desert!!. The place is location outside of the city some 21km from the Burj Khalifa. Place is really beautiful and great to see. we went there on our own, the ticket cost around 300 dhiram each. We went by using metro and bus as it located outside of the city you dont have metro connection. We took metro till emirates amll and from there we took bus to miracle garden. you will find the bus after interval of 20 min. It is open till 5 PM i believe, and bus service too close early. so check for the last bus from there before entering so that you can plan accordingly if you want use bus.

A fairy garden in dessert. We visited it twice in March and early April, they said it would close from May to Sep because the weather in UAE. So if possible to be here from Oct to Apr this garden is a must visit in Dubai. Some of my friends said all flowers is beautiful and colorful but not special species! Just think how can they do it in the middle of dessert? All around are sand dunes one after another.It is Miracle!

Truly miracle. It's was really miracle in hot atmosphere they have made such a beautiful garden with variety of flowers .we were lucky we could visit is as if closes on 31 May and would open back in november

Attraction of a different type. Dubai has many parks but this one is different. Miracle Garden is not exactly a miracle but it is still a beautiful place to visit during weekends. The flower arrangements are very well done. My favorites are the miniature houses covered in flowers. In a dessert environment this is a refreshing change. My only complaint about the place is the entry fees, which I consider to be bit too high. Also a few better cafeterias than what are on offer will enhance the attractiveness of this place.
Must visit . Lovely place . Beauty which can't be described in words.. It is just a sight seeing place so if u r looking for activity it isn't the right place

" Really Miraculous Garden !!". This Garden is really a Miracle in Desert.. Every visitor came here is just amused that how come they build such a beautiful place here in Dubai where water is precious thing..Because this Garden in in the middle of Desert & is so Green...This place is must see thing in Dubai.. It takes 30 AED to enter in this garden.. They build so many flower artefacts... They have there own Eiffel Tower, Taj Mahal & Burz Khalifa & so many other things..One of the care taker told us that they changed it every year.. Every year is a new theme. So every-time you come,you will get new Miracle Garden.. A must visit place to spend the a quality time with your friends & family..Enjoy...

Definitely worth a visit!. If you love flowers and plants or you just want to be impressed then this is definitely worth a visit. The sheer fact that this beautiful oasis exists in the middle of the desert makes it worth having on your must see list if nothing else. We visited in May, check when open as closes during the hottest part of the year and as already quiet warm/hot best time to visit is at night. Allow a good couple of hours + at least if you want to have a proper look around. Food and drink outlets inside so head there for a bite to eat in the evening and a look around and you won't be disappointed. Also trampolines (extra cost) inside for the kids but our 6 year old was very happy to wander around and enjoyed it as well. We would like to return during a cooler part of the year and see during the day just to get a different perspective but was beautiful at night all lit up with the lights. Lots of great photo opportunities!

Very pleasant. This is a very nice, scenic, and peaceful way to spend an afternoon. If you make it out here, don't miss the nearby butterfly garden, which has a separate entrance and fee, but well worth it.

It doesn't deserve the attention it has. Besides the really bad customer service....
If you will go during summer time, try to go on times that the weather can help taking proper pictures and that you will not have a hard time with the heat too.

Colour plus!. This is a fairly small area of gardens, but it is intensely planted with very brightly colored flowers. There are ordinary flower beds, but also cottages, windmills, and other buildings as well as peacocks and other shapes totally covered in flowers or plants or dried fruit. Stunning! Our cameras were clicking busily! The entry fee was very reasonable.If you want to get out of the sun, there is a lovely shade area under colourful hanging umbrellas with various cafes and stalls around the edges, and plenty of tables and chairs to have a welcome rest.The gardens would be suitable for wheelchairs and baby buggies. Paths were wide. All was very clean and well maintained.

A truly miraculous garden, in the desert!. Dubai Miracle garden is a must-see if you are in to flowers or beautiful scenery. I have visited twice, the first time with my partner and the second time I took my family when they came to visit me in Dubai. It has been very cleverly created, with fantastic, pretty designs and clear maintenance - I dread to think of the water bill!I wouldn't recommend visiting between the months of April and September as it is just too hot and you cannot truly enjoy it. I think it is closed for some of the summer months anyway - but I may be wrong. The last time I went was in early April 2016 and it had already started reaching the 30s in temperature and we struggled walking around and got bored faster as there is not much shade apart from in the umbrella-roofed food court. But still - worth a visit for a few hours!
miracle garden dxb. LOts of artistics flowers :) open your fantasy . best place to bring friends . best place to enjoy and relaxxxed , definitely go back .

Miracle Indeed!!. Visited the Miracle Garden a couple of days ago, a taxi from Jumeirah Beach Residence came to under AED 50, the entrance fee another AED 30 per Person.We reached there just an hour before sun set and to see all the colorful flowers were a treat to the eyes. The lights coming on after sunset added another dimension to every aspect of the garden.Plenty of food stalls and the washrooms are kept clean. The only drawback we encountered was when we requested the security to take a family picture he point blank refused.But overall a must see when it reopens as it is apparently closed during the summer months and rightly so.

Pretty impressive. Considering that this garden is built in the middle of the desert, it is quite impressive. It is a garden of topiary, with cottages, castles, bugs, cars and bikes decorated in annual flowers. There are a couple of raised areas to see the whole garden. If you like gardens, definitely worth a visit. I think that a visit earlier in the year, like January or February would be better than the closing weekend. Some of the flowers were looking tired, nevertheless still well worth the visit. There are plenty of venues for refreshments and a kiddies jumping area.

Amazing!. There must have been literally millions of flowers and plants. Just the fact that they could keep them all alive and watered in the desert is a feat in itself. The imagination that has gone into designing this is superb. Well worth a visit even for none gardeners and flower lovers.
Very beautiful. It is a place for people who love flowers and trees. It is quite well maintained. Great place to take your photos.
Lovely. Make sure you go before end of May as they close on the third week of May. Can be very hot as its all in the open but plenty of places to sit and eat and prices reasonable.
Marvelous. A garden like no other. entrance fee of 30 Dirhams is worth every bit of it. will definitely return whenever i visit dubai again

Go.....whatever Monty Don says!. This is a garden basically in the middle of nowhere. It's terribly old-fashioned insofar it uses loud & garish bedding plants for everything-who cares! This is Dubai in the desert so plants have to be refreshed quickly and cheaply come the summer months.It's fun, it makes you smile and is well used by tourists and locals alike. BTW there is a bus out there.

Oasis- simple beauty. If you love flowers, trees, plants and men's artistic mind then this is the right place to visit.Well maintained.Beautifully designed.Photo paradise.Visit in day time preferably early hrs.Respect nature dont harm it.Enjoy

How such a garden in desert!. It is really interesting that you see a lot of flowers in well arranged themes in middle of the desert.
