Actually, it is a heaven for lovers of photography and there are many things to shoot.It is located far from city center and not accessible by public transport, but City Sightseeing hop-on hop-off have a loop that stops here. Orange route of this buses pick you up from mall of the Emirates 3pm or 5pm.
Amazing. Such an amazing experience,.. flowers all over.. how they do that .. a must go place in the middle of the desert..loved it..

A secret hideaway. Not very well promoted, no clear management, no events or reasons to visit - but if you happen to stumble across the place, or someone suggests it - go and take a look. Lots of potential, a pity they don't seem to want to promote it/stage events there.
Superb. Combination of art and nature excellent experience....If you have extra time in Dubai you should definitely go to Miracle garden

Not so much of a Miracle...in May. You can get here easily by 105 bus from Mall of the Emirates (Google Map does not privide this option) and it is about 15 min away and costs 5 AED. We have visited in may and already most of the flowers were fadded away, however it can be impressive through the arrangements, so I would recommend a visit in cooler season. The buterfly garden is separate, about 2 min walk after exiting the Miracle Garden. However we have not taken the buterfly garden tour, as we found it a bit too expensive (50 AED per person).

Impressive place. Very nice place with a lot of flowers and breath taking views. Next to it there is also the butterfly garden which should not be missed. A great overall experience and unique pictures taken here.
ok but would not go again. It is a nice place but not as superb as I expected. The variety off flowers are limited and repeated across the whole garden. There is food court as well and a coffee shop.
a colorful world. If you have extra time in Dubai you should definitely go Miracle Garden. It is hot the walk but the colors and flowers was so good

wonders in desert...!!!!!!!. this simply awesome place in Dubai, a flower garden in desert... we visited in april 2016 which was fag end of the park closing dates . but still it looked awesome to see flowers and the garden so well maintained.

Superb !!! Really a Miracle. Really amazed to see the garden like this specially in dubai with soo hot weather ; the way they have maintained the garden is really recommendable
beutiful designed you will be amazed to see few wonders of the world over here made out of plants and flowers

Don't miss it. An excellent experience within a mix of art and nature.
Flowers design is amazing, you meed to be ready with your camera to take unforgettable shots.
We visited also the butterfly section that is simply magnificent!
I do recommend visiting it when having a good weather while butterfly area is a closed air-conditioned area.

Glad I went but not as good as I thought it would be. Visited miracle garden after being told how beautiful it was by friends. Went there with a buddy and yes the flowers were nice but it was nothing over the top in my opinion. I would recommend it to others but I cant really see going back again for long time
Lovely Park. nice park, nice atmosphere but i think the food and the entrance fee are little bit high comparing with the time that you could spend inside.
Really great experience. This was a nice walk through a really pleasant garden. It was a really great date and perfect for photo opportunities. Be sure to go on a day that isn't too hot though.
Beautiul place. Beautiful gardens in the desert - real miracle. A place for rest and romantic,ice cream and fruit salad.

Mrs . Isis. Waw waw waw its really a miracle .its really amazing garden i didnt want to leave it i just wanted to spend more time and go again but i had no time . If you ever go to Dubai before doing anything or even think to do anything just go there first so you can feel the beauty , the professionality and the service there . Nothing else i can say except one more time that its really a Miracle Garden

Must visit if right season. A visit to the Miracle Gardens is a worthwhile excursion in Dubai. However no easily accessed public transport so the best solution was to hire a car. We visited just before the Gardens close for the Summer but still quite delightful. The gardens are all outside with no inside conservatories so make sure you don't visit on a very hot day.

Miracle Gardens Dubai. If you are a keen gardener or like flowers you must visit these gardens in Dubai, It is absolutely brilliant of what can be done with flowers, peacocks, houses, Burj Khalifa tower, trains and lots of other things, all beautifully done with flowers.
like it name!. just beautiful, clean, and smell so well!! we loved walk around, and have ice cream in fruit! very unique!
Nicely maintained garden amidst the desert.. We had been to here in April. Many flowers were replaced by the decoration of oranges etc. yet highly maintained.
Its a miracle. Miracle Garden is indeed a miracle in hot weather in dubai.this lovely place is one of a kind that you shouldn't miss to visit.

Well, Not the "BEST". It is a nice but NOISY place to visit.. I gave it a 3-Star because it was average.. I would've gave it a 5-star but it was not worth it. Don't go there if you are a fan of flowers because it's boring.. Not- So- Peaceful place.. It is best to go with children

Beautiful, good visit on a "cool" day. Nicely built. Beautiful flowers. Flowers are of different colors however, they are of the same type/shape. There is a butterfly garden besides this, which also pretty good.
Takes about 15 min bus ride, 5 min taxi ride from Mall of Emirates.
Need ~1hr to to cover it all. There are snacks/ice cream shops inside garden.

AMAZING to view in the desert. We arrived early & bought a tiny umbrella at the gate as it was 44 degrees on that day.Spectacular array of colours & arrangements over acres of desert. How do they do this, I guess with millions of litres of desal water to keep up the blooming, not a droop in site!Cafes & icecream parlours drink vendors placed all through out the gardens + chairs to sit on under cover ~ worth the trip!

Disapointing garden. The garden isn't as miraculous as expected. It doesn't look professional especially with all the Disney graphics which they use.The park isn't crowded and looks really poor. You get they wanted to achieve, but it is poorly executed.

A Man-Made Wonder of Nature. Dubai Miracle Garden has earned UAE another record in the Guinness Book of World Records. That alone is enough reason to see the garden. Whether or not you are a nature enthusiast, DMG should be in your list of places to visit while in Dubai especially during its open season. The park closes during summer and reopens on winter. Every year the park just becomes more and more amazing. One thing to note though, F&B outlets here have a steep price because of its proximity outside the city.

Not at all up to 'Dubai standards'. We went here on the back in two recommendations from locals. We were very disappointed as the parc is no where near what you experience other places in Dubai. Not very well maintained, many of the flowers where dead, low standard on toilets and outlets. No where you got close to a wow factor. We spend less than 1 hour and went straight back.
Afantastic. We went to this park in May 2016. It was fantastic and well laid out. The lights depict varies topics from lands and flowers to animals. Plenty of parking spaces and areas to sit.

Wasn't very impressed. It is a huge garden. It happened that I visited on a really hot and humid day which was not good. There were flowers that were dry and dead already (i believe due to the hot weather - and due to the storm of showers that Dubai had and broke many flower statues). It is something to see but definitely not in May.

the most amazing way to present different type of flowers.. At the Miracle Garden you will find the most amazing ways different type of flowers presented. Easy access, reasonable charges, so much to see. Perfect and unique place to visit at any season of the year. Simply Beautiful.

Garden. For an evening to spend walking between beautiful flowers and gardens Bring with you water and a hat because you ll be walking for more than an hour There Are stalla where you can drink and a little bit of shades once in a while Incredibile place

Don't go expecting great flowers. Flowers were chosen for their colour and longevity so do go expecting a botanical garden experience. Locals (ie Indian and Pakistani expats) found it delightful but those of us from Canada and Europe with great access of botanical gardens would find the flowers rather dull and the structures kind of meh. We spent maybe an hour and a half here and it isn't close to the city. An Uber ride probably took about 1/2 hour. Save you time and money and go to the nearby more facinating Global Village.

Picture perfect!. It is my second visit here and the last time was in 2013.Remarkable increase in the flowers and more seats to take a rest. There are also more food stalls now. Good place to take photos and I got a souvenir penny.

Impressive but maybe some ac places are needed. Impressive to find in such a hot climate so many flower arrangements, few of those already though started to dying from the heat .More shaded areas should be provided for the visitors and maybe a closed ac room to cool down as this time of the year it is extremely hot .

You will love the visit. A little out of town in distance but a most to visit ,the flowers on display is great a most visit on a cool day or real early as it does get hot real hot ,reasonable price 30 dirhams per person about ($9)

Riot of colours aptly named as Miracle Garden. This site is a little far off but totally worth the visit. We took a taxi from Mall of Emirates (closest Metro station) and it cost me 27AED. At 30AED entry per person this place is amazing. All the plants are potted but we never realized it. This place is extremely colourful for for visitors in the sunny days recommend you carry sunglasses and apt sun protection. Superb place for some magical pictures and I will surely visit this place again when in Dubai.

It was nice. Enjoyed the butterfly garden, access in 50 AED. Another 30 AED to access the Miracle Garden.Note: There are different from each other, each has its own entrance fee, 5min drive apart from each other

Miracle..indeed. Indeed a miracle considering this place goes completely void of flowers in peak summers. In case you are avid lover of flowers and greenery in all, this is the perfect oasis for you. Caution: there are no AC or cool shades so if you can't stand the summers of Dubai then do not plan this place for your own well being :).

Flowers in the Desert. Dubai is no stranger to accomplishing the impossible, and Miracle Garden is one of them. Imagine some of the world's most famous structures built out of flowers. That is, on its own, nothing original. But, can you imagine maintaining and taking care of these flowers during some of the hottest months in the world, and with an almost non-existent winter? Now, that's a miracle. I visited the Garden in December; which meant the weather resembled late summer in Europe. Keep repeating to yourself that this garden was nothing more than just a desert, few years earlier.
A wonder world of flowers. Miracle Garden is Dubai's flower garden with a unique style of flower arrangement and a destination to calm our mind with it exotic presence.

A Garden in the middle of a Desert. I cannot believe that such a garden would exist in the middle of DXB, yet in the middle of the desert of DXB.First of all, access is easy and loads of parkings. Entrace is around 30AED which is almost nothing. Go inside, walk around, enjoy the greenery. If tired sit on a bench, under a tree, on a hamac, in a snack....Place is really well designed and architected. Kids will love running around in the place and enjoying the different statues/mock ups made with flowers.Must visit if u have kids.Beware that if ur staying at the JBR and decided to go visit this place it would take you around 30 to 40 mn of driving

Quirky but well woth visiting. We thought that we would be in and out of the Miracle Gardens within thirty minutes. How wrong were we!!! The garden is huge, with many interesting and creative use of flowers. Iyou need to set aside a couple of hours to seethis wonderful place.

Amazing feat considering the intense heat. As a gardener I couldn't get enough of the beautiful flowers and the unique way they are presented. A must see, take a taxi and wander around at your leisure. It was intensely hot that day and altho I wore a hat, a sun umbrella would have allowed me to stay longer.

Amazing!. When you arrive at the Miracle Garden, remember one thing, you're in the middle of the desert... and you have all those flowers!I was really impressed by the quantity of flowers, the houses totally covered with flowers, the coaches, the "decoration", etc.I really recommend it!!It's far from the city, don't hesitate to take a Uber, that's easier to find than a taxi.

Petunia Galore. Take out a few hours to enjoy the Miracle Gardens. Do not go with expectations of a botanic garden. Its primarily petunias. There are several places to sit under the green trellises. Do not go in summer as the heat of Dubai will mar the experience. Avoid weekends as it is very crowded and you will not be able to take photographs. The landscaping is mediocre and not worth the price, you pay to see it. Kids will really enjoy it. There are food outlets and kiosks inside.
Flowers galore. Loved the different and creative flower arrangements. It's like setting from a children's story book:) A great place to take photos.
To be seen. It's definitely worth a trip....it's one of these things that you do once or whenever someone is visiting youGreat for families!

Impressive garden blooming in scorching heat. We visited in early may (few weeks before the gardens close for the hot summer months). Unfortunately it was TOO HOT for us to walk around so we rushed through about half of the garden. It was quite impressive given the heat and the surrounding desert. It must be a lot better to visit in winter.

Amazing Place!!. It's a nice place to visit in Dubai!!.. Very good for taking photos.. It's nice if you want to have a relaxing ambiance as well.. But Reminder.. It's only open every winter in Dubai (October-April).. 😊😊😊

Beautiful & Serene. Had it not been for a friend who lives in Dubai, we would never have known of this beautiful floral garden. Unfortunately it doesn't seem to be very well advertised and we definitely think it should be in the top ten of visitor attractions. There is also the butterfly garden but unfortunately due to heat exhaustion we gave it a miss.
Emazing. Good in winter until it is closed, I was surprised that you can take a nap there in a private flowerish place

Beautifully done. very nice garden, beautifully done. It is worth seeing if you have some spare time. best time to visit is November to April, as it is not too hot. it is also like 2 minutes walk to the butterfly garden, which is nice to see too.
Flowers in the Heat. This place is really a miracle as you get to see so many flowers well maintained in the dessert.Its a must do during winters.

No words can describe this. If you go to Dubai you can't miss this! It is breathtakingly beautiful. The arrangments must of taken such careful planning. You can get there by taxi from the mall of Emirates. But be warned it is Hot, hot, hot!!! Take an umbrella or hat and loads of sunscreen, there is a shaded area where you can sit but the displays are all in the sun.

ohhhh wow. lovely place to visit we visited for the first time even though we have been to Dubai many times before.Worth going to see once. i advice to go either am time or 3-4pm so its more cooler if too hot you will not enjoy.enjoyed fresh orange juice and popcorn was nice good place to visit if visiting Dubai. ensure you drink plenty and take water with you.its about i think 5 -7 pounds per person not that expensive be care full when getting taxi back if you get private taxi black or white rather than normal taxi it will cost you like 15 pounds as its far from some hotels so get a normal taxi probably cost you around 12-14 pounds roughly as we got private not knowing it costs us around 19 pounds from there to grand hyatt and going only 10 pounds on a normal taxi so be warned

Incredibly tacky. Incredibly tacky tourist spot. It's quite a way out of the city - about 50dh taxi, then 30dh entrance fee. Yes, lots of pretty flowers, but ruined by plastic models etc all over the place. Seems like they built it just for the postcards. At the back there is a semi-circle of (overpriced) snack / drinks stands and shaded seating area. Not really worth more than an hour, and for the money not worth going. Also there is quite a lack of information - no signposting, no maps guides etc. Flowers etc are not labelled - lack of educational opportunity for children. Shame, it could have been done a lot better.

Heavenly. If you like to take a lot of pictures, then this is the place for you. Lots of flower decorations make for super insta picturesTake a bus from 'mall of the emirates' to get here if you want cheap. Or just take a cab if you don't care. Great eating options. You will be pleasantly surprised. Can get a little repetitive after a while. This place is good for 30 minutes. Enjoy!

Beautiful!. This is a really lovely place to come to relax taking in the fantastic sights. The gardens are just amazing. There are flowers absolutely everywhere and there is so much to look at. It's just beautiful.I would definitely recommend doing this on a slightly cooler day as it's completely outside.Well worth a visit.

A must place visit in Dubai (except summers since it is closed). This is THE PLACE to visit in Dubai. It is so full of flowers and artistically designed along with different fountains and lakes and maintained at the best level. In a place which is desert land, you will be awestruck to see the beauty and will feel you are not in a desert land.Make sure you reach at around 4 PM to click pictures in daylight so that you can enjoy the sunset as well. This will be unforgettable!P.S. This place is closed in summers. Exact dates and timings can be found on the official website of miracle garden.
Is this true?:). You won't believe that you are in a middle of a desert, since you see a variety of flowers. Believe it or not, It's like Amsterdam:)I guess it was my best experience in Dubai.

Truly Miracle!!!!. This was the best part of our Dubai tour. The Miracle garden is a truly miracle. The garden is with full of flowers everywhere. How it is maintained in Dubai is breathtaking. The garden is nicely arranged with lot of themes like Peacoks, Eiffel tower, house, etc. Each & every corner is very good. My daughter enjoyed a lot. If we do not visit this place, it was really a loss. It is little away from the main city.

WONDERFUL PLACE. Such a lovely place to go.... Surrounded by millions of flowers amazing!!! Food is nearby if you feel hungry while strolling the garden. Better to wear comfortable shoes, flats or rubber shoes. But be careful not allowed to hold anything in the design only stand and make photo... One thing I noticed, even I see millions of different flowers no one has a scent..
Wow!. One of the best place that I have ever been and visit! It is my favorite place that I visited. I'm speechless. It's wonderful!!

Kudos to whose brain child it was. I don't think I can do justice by describing it in words but the photos should do some justice. Colorful, beautiful, very well thought off and designed. It's not just another botanical garden.
Awsome...but. Its great and nice...a must see in dubai for sure but its a shame they close the butterfly gardin so early as its too hot to visit them both at noon, yet its nice
Aw inspiring miracles in this season!!. One of the best flower gardens, and really well maintained. A must visit in Dubai for all non seasonal experience of a seasonal garden in a desert.
A must see . Everyone must see this. You have to pay but it is worth it. It is nice to walk around for families. There is a huge range of flowers in various designs.

Nice place to explore but not in summer. I visited this place in May. just the beginning of summer. Though it was 9 am, two hours I spent I did with difficulty due to the heat. But it's a nice place with lot of flowers and trees. Well kept too. For a person coming from any country where greenery is there, this is not a must place to visit. If visiting avoid summer!

OMG. you might have seen pictures.. you might have judged and hated couples posting cheap pictures with flowers..
but you have to go to miracle garden to experience the amazing work done here! great value for money as well - AED 30 ticket/head available at the counter (next to the entry gate)
Very beautiful. An amazing feat to build these beautiful gardens in the middle of a dessert. Would have stayed longer but foolishly we went at midday in 40 degrees.

EXCELLENT. This is an outstanding flower garden,perhaps one of the best if not the best in the world.The different types of fresh flowers have been decorated in such beautiful ways that it's an absolute joy to view same. Whenever you come to Dubai don't miss this FANTASTIC garden.

Abundance of flowers. Nice place to relax in Dubai. Flowers and plants kept in all imaginable ways. Visit the place before evening and enjoy the natural and illuminated looks. Take also a good SLR camera.

Visual Feast. The fact that this garden sits in the middle of desert worth a visit. Perennial flowers are planted in frames in interesting forms, cars, houses etc.. It is a beautiful garden. Be aware there are only food outlets for snacks and a small food court with modest offerings. There is no indoor area cool off. It is best to visit between November -May.

A must visit in Dubai. This was by far one of the finest man made places I have visited. So many colorful flowers presented in such beautiful landscaping. We visited with kids and all of us had lot of fun taking pictures and looking around. There's no corner with does not have beauty. It's like walking in fantasy land. Recommended for people of all ages.

Great!!!. If that's not a great place for pictures, then I don't know which is! I took my parents there during their viait and they were mesmerized, especially my mom who has made our home look like an indoors garden :) I found it very relaxing, therapeutic even! They have snacks and drinks, also some restaurants, ita a great place for a winter afternoon or summer evening (a lot of walking to do, so you need to be comfortable with Dubai's temperatures)
Amazing. How do you keep a garden like this in the heat.Truly amazing, colourful.Don't recommend going in the middle of the day even in "spring"
Floral formation in everyday objects.. Was in awe at the concept and designs of the garden. Miles and miles of beautiful flowers in. Desert. Clean and cool.
Beautiful Place. Its a very beautiful place. If you love nature , specially flowers you will enjoy being here. But there are no activities to do, just enjoy being there and click pictures..

Pretty if this is your cup of tea. My friend really wanted to go, it is pretty and it's just amazing the work which has gone behind this all. We went at 12pm and it was too hot for us so plan to go earlier or later in the evening if you do go. It's cheap but fairly out of the way as we came from Bur Dubai. Worth a visit if you like this kind of stuff but it was not my cup of tea personally, but my friend loved it.
Garden Anyone?. Another site to go to is the Miracle Garden. It is a sight to behold with their art placed with plants.

A day to remember. It was a spectacular place to go to. It provides peace and serenity to people who will visit the place. It is amazing as the place is situated here in Dubai were it is usually very hot. We will definitely come back and go around. I highly suggest to wear flat shoes when coming here in order for you to see every corner of the place.
Love it. This was seriously one of my favorite destinations in dubai! Its a great place to hang out, take pictures and chill. I would do it again actually...

Nice place but I think that there are better places to see in Dubai. It's not a bad idea to spend 1-2 hours here with your spouse. there are lots of nice and "love addicted" figures made with flowers and funny things. Anyway, there is nothing so surprising and pheraps I would have appreciated much more something addressed to "scientific garden" rather then a "simple garden with surprising shapes of the things you see".

Fantastical Flowers. I had seen pics from Miracle Garden prior to my Dubai trip, so I made sure to visit. It was truly fascinating to see the whimsical flower displays in a desert climate. They were very creative and well kept.

Totally awesome . Beautiful flowers are arranged into pieces of art. Great getaway from crowded dubai if you want some peace and some romantic or family time. It's a good walk for 2-3 hours. You can find restaurants if you get hungry but note that it's not the most cost effective solution. Nevertheless it's a lovely place. Visit along with butterfly garden.

lovely and not expensive. it is absolutely beautiful there! i really loved the area ! also there were popcorns and fresh orange juice inside the garden! you can take pictures and enjoy live music too while walking in that amazing place !not expensive ,the ticket cost 30 aed!
A garden that truly lives up to its name.. Truly a sight to behold. The colors and arrangements are breath taking. It makes for beautiful photographs. Really worth the trip out of town.

Amazing. Visited miracle gardens on a thursday afternoon its wasnt so busy, so got to make plenty pictures. Definitely worth going as its just amazing..lovely colours and lovely structures. I would however recommend to go after 4 as it can get too hot.

Day out with the family. Decided to pay the gardens a visit after reading some really fantastic reviews. We arrived late afternoon by Bus from Mall of emirates, the sun was still out, We left when it was night. This meant we experienced it during the day and night. The garden is mind blowing a wonderful place to relax it smells great. With so many designs and beautiful sections we spent most of our time taking pictures so taking a good quality camera is a must. I would definitely visit again I would also recommend Miracle Gardens to any one in search of a good day out. You will not be disappointed.
amazin. what a place what a garden , colorful piecefull , only they need to improve the facilities of restaurants cafes , the rest only go and see and dont forget to bring your photo camera
Worth a Look. Amazing display of flowers. Hard to believe you're in the desert. Probably one of the top three attractions on my visit to Dubai.

So much to see! Well worth a visit.. I have never seen so many beautiful flowers in all my life. You could spend hours looking around. Simply Amazing place, toilets were spotless, staff were friendly and polite.

Day Trip Out. The gardens are a great place to visit especially if you're into photography. Bright colours and some truly amazing arrangements. If your a visitor tonthe country then the easiest and most inexpensive way to access the gardens would be by bus, the buses travel very regular, driving by car is a little more tricky as the roads in Dubai can be a little tricky to navigate. Please note if you are using the bus service you cannot pay by cash, you need to purchase a prepaid NOL card. This is very inexpensive and easy process and available in all metro stations and mall outlets.

Worth visiting once in Dubai. The garden is excellently kept and name really fits - a magical garden in the middle of the desert. Away from the busy metropolitan city of dubai, definitely worth visiting in my opinion. Just a small hint how to get there - take the metro to Mall of the Emirates station. Just before going in the mall take the stairs to go down to the bus station and get bus 105 (approx. 15 mins). Bus Stops you exactly near the back gate of the garden. Easy and cheap
A day outing. Went morning in private taxi. The Garden is so beautiful & I will recommend to everyone. Took a lot pf pics.

Heaven!!. It was very beautiful but I went there at noon and was hot. It can have more facilities for people. But as a general very good place for couples. Very lovely place for taking pictures and to spend time.
Flower. If you are a flower lover, do not miss the place! When you walk around, you can feel the relaxation.

Beautiful. If you love flowers and creative thinking you will love this place. It is amazing, the thought that has gone into the place. Take your camera for colourful beautiful pictures. From hanging umbrella's with hanging baskets to cars ,houses, so many unusual flower containers

Waking in the flower gardens, a unique horticultural masterpiece.. I was very impressed but the well up kept grounds with the large variety of plants, flowers. The floral sculpted shaped figures were amazing and attractive. The park has several restaurants and food court, and plenty of places to take beautiful photos. It is romantic and entertaining. A good place to spend a day of relaxation. It is located in Dubai land and near this park there are other parks at walking distances such as the Strawberry and Butterfly parks.
Beautiful Beautiful. Great imagine ! SO Pretty .... Lots of different sights to see covered with delightful flowers ..... Go when Day changes into Night!Its for everyone !Cheap and amazing .....
Magically enchanting !!. Paradise on earth!! The place is mesmerizing with millions of flowers surrounds you. It's just amazing! No wonder it's world record!! A must visit
Beautiful day out!. If you would like to take a walk in the greens, this is the best place in Dubai. Pretty flower arrangements, great for a photo shoot or just a walk with family.

Flowers and nothing else. First of all I am not an ardent flower fan. May be that's why I didn't enjoy this, much. U can visit here if you love flowers a lot. But there are not much activities to do, so after may be half an hour, you will get bored
Miracle as it is in a desert. Amazing creation right in the middle of a desert!Pretty big place but then this can be avoided if you are short of days..

Beautiful. I was amazed by this beautiful gardens. The flowers are fantastic, the amount of work that must go into growing, planting and maintaining the displays is phenomenal. Plenty of shady places to sit and have a drink or eats.Spent a good morning there.

Very beautiful Garden, it is good to take photos. This garden is really like a miracle since it is surrounded by dry sandy desert. It is full of beautiful flowers. If you have a car I highly recomend you to visit, but if not. It is a bit tricky to get there. The garden is amazing, but it was so hot and I think this was the only thing bothered me. There are some stalls there where you can buy fresh drinks and ice cream.
Flowers and Flowers. Huge place.. slightly outside city , but a paradise for flower lovers. How can such a beauty survive in middle of dessert is surprising. A good place to visit.

Afternoon visit with Family. Great to see Flowers in Desert. This place is accessible by Taxi and one can spend around around 2 hours. Lots of opportunities for photographs and kids love this attraction.
Amazing Flowers. Amazing flowers and OK food court, but amazing design and very creative ideas did with flowers and other things.

Unbelievable garden. As the name suggests the miracle garden is one of the miracles in this world can you think of a large garden with lacs of flowers and buildings made of flowers and of oranges small homes of fruits and all of these are real fruits and flowers can you think of this type garden in desert like dubai. But yes it's true. Everyone who visits dubai should visit miracle garden for whole 1 day it is Barry large ad he or she will not forget garden in whole life

Lose yourself in a beautiful world of flowers.. With timings 9am - 9pm: weekdays 9am - 11pm: weekends at 35 AED; indeed Dubai Miracle Garden is one of a must-see tourist attraction in Dubai. Get lost in a world of flowers and stunning flower miniatures of famous architectures and land marks around the globe. Yes, it can be pretty hot so make your are equip..
Pretty. Lovely oasis of flowers of every hue. My little one seemed entranced and loved every minute of it . Recommended.
A Photographers Paradise. For people who love gardens, flowers and colours, don't miss out on a couple of hours of walking through this amazing garden centre. So worth it

Another magical garden. This is absolutely a miracle garden built in the middle of the dessert. There are different species of flowers displayed here and it is amazing. This is a must place to visit when you are in Dubai. Only inconvenience is, it is difficult to get a cab outside the garden unless you have your own transport.

Beautiful - Best Thing to Do in Dubai. After the malls and the concrete, i walk into this beautiful garden and was taken by surprise. Its beautifully planned and the landscaping is mind blowing. You can easily spend and hour or two here. The variety of flowers is stunning... Much better than going to the Atlantis Aquarium...
Amazingly done. This garden is amazingly done and is a very nice family visit point and one needs one and a half hour to see it around .
Beautiful. Can't believe Dubai have got one of the best gardens in the middle of the desert. Again one of the best I have seen.
Very beautiful place to visit.. This garden is very beautiful and is a very peaceful place to visit. I really enjoyed the few hours I spent here.

Indeed a Miracle Garden!. Me and my husband had visited Keukenhof Garden in Netherlands... and so having a garden in the midst of the desert in Dubai is indeed a Miracle Garden!Amazing flower arrangements and wide display of colors is quite impressive and in this heat it's really a miracle that it can all look so pretty. Respect to those who have taken hours of hard work with millions of flowers to create this garden. Recommended length of visit: 1 to 2 hours depending on the weather..A must visit and Highly recommended to everybody!

Beautiful. I loved the Miracle Garden and decided to venture there because of the reviews on Travel Advisor and because it was listed as one of the top ten things to see in Dubai. I thought it was worth the ten dollar entrance fee, but it does lie outside of the metro limit. A taxi is needed. Make sure you use the official taxi (a taxi sign of the roof). There is a marked difference in Price Also, take the metro to the Mall of the Emirates, check out the Indoor ski slope, and then hop on a taxi from there. It is worth the trip, but I am apprehensive about recommending it because it is a matter of taste as well as the weather can impact one's experience. It might be too hot or too wet.
Nice experience. it's a nice experience to see so much green and flowers in Dubai. It cost around 30 AED per person but it worth the money. Impressive.
Great place. The name is correct , it is really Miracle garden, very nice, Dubai surprises me more and more, This place shows what can be done by man, even in desert!

Garden oasis in the desert. My wife wanted to visit this attraction, as she is a keen gardener. Worth a visit, a large array of flowers, many shaped in various tourist attractions Takes a good hour to walk around and there are many food and drink outlets. There is a butterfly garden next door, which also attracts many visitors, although we did not bother. The gardens are an attraction you will not be disappointed with, but once seen, probably no reason to return. Managed to get a variety of good photos whilst there.
Good to see. The Miracle Garden in Dubai is good to go and visit. Not quite as spectacular as the gardens elsewhere, but then this is the desert. A good few hours out with loved ones.
soothing. very well maintained clean and a variety of flowers and fauna right in the middle of the desert. a must see

Blooms in the Desert. It is ideed a miracle having a garden in the midst of the desert!Travelling solo is not an issue for me, especially with this kind of view. It feels like walking in my dreamland. Seeing the amazing flower arrangements and wide display of colors is quite impressive.I particularly like the houses (I called it the Blooms Village) covered with beautiful and colorful flowers, I wonder how it feels like living in such a home.After the relaxing tour, I had this mouth-watering Egyptian Fatayer (Honey-Cream flavor), it is a must-try under the colorful hanging umbrellas.
Heaven on earth yes after kashmir. It was like WOW! entry fee 30aed worth each n every penny! The way garden Is maintained is super awesome and try to cover each n every beauty inside it

A REALLY RELAXING LOCATION . I recently visited Miracle Garden. It's located 15 minutes of the city from the Marina district.The cost is 30 Dhms per ticket and you walk around the garden for as long as you wish.It is very well maintained with so many quirky gardens and themes. It's definitely well worth taking a trip out to the garden and viewing such a wonderful bright garden in the middle of no where.

Not too impressed. No arguing that it must have taken hours of hard work and millions of flowers to create this garden! And in that heat I suppose it must be a miracle that it can all look so pretty. But I don't know if it is maybe because I have seen Keukenhoff that I was not that impressed. If you have the time, go and see it but if you are pressed for time, rather maybe skip this one.

Nice garden of flowers. The place has a huge variety of flowers with shapes like cars, train, burz khalifa etc. The one i liked was an operating watch with dates changing on a daily basis wishing birthday on that day
Amazing floral display. Interesting designs using flowers and paths. Inspirational ideas for gardeners. A refreshing escape to color and form in a very different landscape.

Not worth it! Over priced!. Even when you have nothing else to do in Dubai, don't go there! Millions of flowers put on metallic structures. No creativity whatsoever, really hot during the day! Just skip it!

Interesting experience. It is astonishing green and multicolor flowers garden in the hot and sandy peisage of Dubai. It would be a relaxing weekend day walking around among flowers, having a bite and a cold drink.

Wonderful. Dubai’s Miracle Garden recently celebrated the inauguration of the Dubai Butterfly Garden, the world’s largest and the region’s first indoor butterfly garden and sanctuary for over 15,000 butterflies from 26 species.
beautiful. I was amazed as to how beautifully the garden has been designed and maintained given the heat that we have in the UAE
Very good in Pleasant climate at around Dusk. Very good in Pleasant climate at around Dusk. Beautiful flowers, clever arrangements. Advisable only when temperatures are below 28 degree C.

A must see. We spent the afternoon here and this really is an oasis in the desert. It is about £6 entry per adult. The gardens are made up of several designs or themes and the colours are amazing. If you want to do something different and take home some fantastic photo memories then take a trip here. Do not miss out !

More kitsch than miraculous. We were taken here by friends after lunch. It is pretty much in the middle of nowhere and as it contains a large amount of flowers in the middle of the desert I guess that's impressive. However....The flowers are mostly the same, its more the quantity that is impressive and they are shaped into a large number of different shapes and objects. Unfortunately, rather than being really creative and / or artistic its rather childish and looks more like telly tubby land as one of my friends commented. If you've been to a proper flower or garden show in Europe then this pales by comparison as it lacks proper design. However, if you haven't then I'm sure it will impress.The other point of note is that there is zero information about the types of plants or even a section of plants perhaps showing what is native to Dubai and what isn't. There is no ecological information at all.

Entrance over priced. I wasn't impressed.
DH 30 entrance fee is a rip off.
yeah, there are flowers all over and is nice, but nothing much to write home about. Just feel I have ticked a box in "To do list".

Excellent Flower Park..!! ( In Dessert). Just Imagine that It takes lot of hardwork to maintain this flower park in Dessert..!!This park remains open in Winter months only (i.e OCT TO APRIL) . Ticket is around 30 aed per person.Almost All quality flowers are Available ..Cars, Fountains, Peacocks, Hearts and Clocks made by flowers were Amazing...!!Inhouse Pizzahut, Egyptians, Continental foodcourts were there to serve your Tongue.Overall excellent...!!

Amazing garden in a dessert. I saw a friends pictures taken at the Miracle Garden and decided to visit the garden as I was going to Dubai. Miracle garden is an appropriate name considering it is in the dessert. The garden has a several variety of flowers in different shapes and colors. There are castles, Eiffel Tower etc and these have plastic fruits like oranges on its frame. I thoroughly enjoyed walking and viewing all different concepts. My favorite was an upside down VW red beetle car with water falls and a woman's face with flowers around the head. I strongly recommend a visit to the garden if you are in Dubai. There is also a play area for kids. I went in April at 6:00 p.m. and it was not too hot. Once the sun sets, the flood lights come on and the place is very well lit. Several concepts have lights that change colors. They have sitting area in case you want to take a break. There are stalls all around selling water, drinks and snacks and restaurants. The entrance fee is 30 Dirham.
Miracle Garden. A pleasant gardennicely arrangedwell maintainedworth to visitgood for family outingnot advisable in summer

World's Best. Indeed Miracle Garden I was amazed how beautifully the flowers are being designed and arranged. with it's sophistication, elegance and style. You would feel different at the entrance it will bring you to an enchanted place. It's a must place to visit. Not to forget your camera fully charge in order not to miss out every single moment.

Mosha in miracle garden. Great place to spend the day there if the weather not hot becouse it is an open eara . They serve every thing food snack toys for the kids ... gift shop things to remember cups,snow ball and more . It's a flower garden ... great place for the family ... relaxing ... free parking you will have fun and take your camera with you alot of picture you will take

A must see!. Flowers galore and a great outing for a family and for gardeners and flower lovers! At every turn there was another amazing display of glorious colour and creativity. I think there would be few people who would not like this. (Unless they do not like flowers!)

Wonderful Place... Relaxing... Its my first time to visit Miracle Garden i really enjoyed the view. Its amazing and relaxing. Next season im planning to bring my family to see this wonderful and beautiful place. One of the best thing to see in Dubai..

Expected a proper garden but got a Disney-esque kiddies set up. A total joke, and given the taxi fare and entry fee a very expensive one. Yes, there are millions of flowers but it is not a place for anyone genuinely interested in gardens. Very disappointing.
Nice location for family trip. Appreciate the efforts in maintaining the flowers and plantations in the extreme weather conditions of region.

Miracle garden in Miracle city!. The name of this garden couldn't be more apt!Visited in the last month of its operation (garden is closed from May to September or October )Best time to visit is at dusk. Entry fee is slightly pricey at 30 dirhams per person including children . However it does make up for the ticket price when you walk inside and find yourself in a sea of various colorful beds of flowers and flower decorations. Everything is spotlessly maintained (like most Dubai attractions ) and the garden is floodlit after sunset so that you don't miss out on anything. It's not that big so that it takes only around 30-40 minutes to walk around and digest this miracle built in desertland!Plenty pf photo ops for enthusiasts. Also there's a large trampoline area to keep the young monkeys busy. Overall a thumbs up to Dubai authorities for daring to create a garden this size in this environment. Worth a visit to appreciate this concept.

Flowers flowers everywhere. This exceeded my expectations. From the time you enter, all you see is a riot of colours everywhere. It is bigger than expected and very well laid out. We were there in March in the late morning, but the sun was already making its presence felt. Fortunately, there are cafes and sitting areas dotted around for you to escape the heat.

this place is actually a relief to our eye sight. After seeing so many places with brown color sands, this place is actually a relief to our eye sight, beautiful color combination of flowers make you relax, its good place.

Stunning Display of Flowers. For a garden in the middle of the dessert this has to be one of the best gardens I have ever been to. A lovely display of flowers in a neat structured manner is good to spent a nice relaxing time. Highly recommend visiting this if you're going to Dubai.

Exceeded my expectations. When I first read about the Miracle Garden I expected it to be quite small and not much to see - I guess you don't expected flower gardens to be spectacular in the desert!In fact it is quite large and there are a lot of different 'exhibits' to see. They have made houses, windmills,cars, trains all from beautifully coloured flowers. It is quite a feat of imagination.The only downside for me was that it was a hot day and there is not shade whilst looking around the attraction. There is a nice shaded food area in the centre, where you can buy juices, ice creams and things to eat however.At the time I went it cost 30 dhs to get in, and parking was plentiful. Go early though, it gets busy (and hotter!)I understand the park closes for the summer months.

A nice colourful place to visit.. This is really a miracle. The kind of effort that must be required to maintain this garden must be amazing. There is a riot of colours everywhere and some of the shapes are really great. You will be clicking photographs everywhere, so make sure you have enough space. IF you have time to spend you can relax in the comfortable sitting areas covered in green and flowers keeping the sun away. A must-visit place.
Beautiful. Riot of Colors. Really a miracle to see such a beautiful garden in a desert. Nature meets creativity here. A place not to miss in Dubai!
Truly a Miracle in the Desert!. What an awesome experience to see beautiful flowers intricately cared for and decorated in large frames of houses, faces, cars, etc. It is an oasis to the desert!

If you are into flower arrangements, get here!. Flowers and patterns from flowers form the essence of this place, which is open to public during the cooler season simply because that's when the flowers thrive. A small fee lets you in for the experience.
Flowery evening. A garden full of flowers (in the middle of the desert...!!) arranged in various shapes and objects. This shows what Dubai is capable of, no feat too difficult.
beautiful. must visit this place if you like flower millions of style and decoration you like it. its open for every one open only few months November to april only.
A delight. Aparently there is a shuttle service from Mall ofThe Emirates although we drove with family. An amazing garden in the desert covering several acres.

Beautiful place for Flower lovers & amazing decoration. I found one of the best place for flower lovers and flower decoration was amazing, every flower lover should come and see this, must visit place in dubai, flower decoration is world best, monuments created & decorated with flower, Car and train decorated, superb place, worth spending time in garden like this,

Fun day out. We visited the gardens with a group of local women, and it was a nice day out. If you go expecting NOT to see a botanical garden, then you will come away enjoying it. They really can't grow that many variety of flowers--mostly petunias, but have also added hollyhocks, gaillardia and some others. It seems a little strange to see flowers growing out of peacocks, and giant hearts, and of course the Burj, but in a quirky way adds to the fun of visiting Dubai. What is beautiful is seeing the huge masses of flowers in a desert.

It really is a Miracle!. This was one of the most enjoyable experiences of our stay in Dubai. The gardens are beautiful with some of the most incredible flower arrangements. We walked at our leisure enjoying one display after another. Some were quirky, some stunning, all of them worth viewing. Best bang for your buck!
Amazing park in center of a desert. It was a amazing experience to visit Miracle Garden. Art and creativity using natural beauty. Some designs were copied from famous EU destinations.

Absolutely Stunning!. This is a must do when in Dubai. My family & I hadn't planned to go to the gardens but I am so thankful we did. The gardens are just so beautiful, the whole family had a great time. I definitely recommend booking a photographer. They spend the whole time with you capturing unlimited amazing photos to keep. Truly a magical experience!

Less than expected, visited many gardens before although smaller but felt real, this one felt like fake.. I think it's a waste of time and money to go there. It feels as a fake without the real taste of nature. I strongly advice aginst going there unless you have children below 8 years whom can enjoy running there.

Wonderful Place.. The amount of work and the maintenance put in this place is just beyond phenomenal. You would never things so many beautiful plants in the desert in scorching heat but it's Dubai and they make things happen with money.It does very hot during summer months so be prepared with umbrella's and water because you will feel the heat from top and the ground. Younger kids might get bored very quickly but it's a must visit and take some great pics.

Beautiful must visit. It was so beautiful. Has so many great picture opportunities. Go on a nice weather day. It is huge so dont go with limited time. Tickets are easily outside so no need to buy online. Just check the dates and timings online.
Real Miracle of 50 lac odd flowers. THis was one mind boggling experience we had in Dubai. Must Go whenever you visit Dubai. It is really magicial experience as the name suggests.
Fest for the eyes. If you want to smile and have a color bath.. this is the place. There are so many flowers and blooms. If you love flowers you have to be here..
Just beautiful! . A must see while in Dubai. We were hyped to visit and it did not disappoint. It was not crowded during our early afternoon visit on a Tuesday, making it serenity at its best

Nice place for family and kids . I stay in Dubai for last 7 years but I don't have time to visit miracle garden finally today I visit with my sister and brother they really enjoy the place and they are so happy with flower and extra things which one is made over there I will really recommended to all the visitor who came in Dubai you guys need to visit that place it's really awesome .

Beautiful gardens. An outstanding array of flowers in the middle of a desert. It's a wonder how much care is being given to this garden in order to stay beautiful all year round. A must-see. Entrance prices are pretty affordable in my opinion.

A wonderful place to relax. A place with so many colors it will instantly telex you. The atmosphere is excellent and what they created there is really amazing. It cand be reached by taxi (the Mall of the Emirates is the closest metro station from where to take a taxi) or by bus (105 from in front of Mall of the Emirates). 30 AED entry fee. I highly recommend a visit.

A Pleasant, Pretty Spot in the Cooler Months. We caught the Metro to the Mall of the Emirates and then caught a taxi here. We had woken early after our flight & were glad we arrived at the gardens when they opened at 9am. It was still pleasantly mild & very quiet so we enjoyed our visit very much. We walked around and took lots of photos before walking across to Butterfly World for a visit. We then grabbed a taxi back to the Mall of the Emirates. An early morning visit to the Miracle Gardens is perfect, although we have heard that a late afternoon/evening visit is also lovely. There are plenty of eating places, a children’s playground, covered carts for hire, & other facilities here. It is also quite easy to find a taxi for the return journey (or the bus). The entrance fee is also quite reasonable in our opinion. We couldn’t find the gift shop but were assured it was there.

Very very good garden !!. Excellent colourfull garden, with cozy paths, very clean, millions of flowers and colours, congatulations for the idea !! i realy enjoy that day at Miracle dubai garden. Don't miss, really worth it !

Must go if you love flowers and gardens. Another great visit to Miracle Garden, I visited 2 years ago and this April again when my parent`s were visiting. Nice to see all the changes from the previous visit, my mom loves flowers she felt like in heaven, we took 1 million pictures. We were there in the afternoon , it was pretty packed but we managed to go around and have some snacks and enjoy our time there. Nice memories here, would go again next year. The entrance it`s cheaper 30 aed than Butterfly garden and it`s better.

If you like seeing the same flower over and over and over and over, then this is the place for you!. How many different ways can you present a Petunia?Billed as "the world's largest natural flower garden" I didn't know what to expect when I first visited Dubai Miracle Gardens, especially since it is located in the middle of the desert. I do have to give credit to the gardeners for keeping the Petunias alive in this location, and for the creative objects (cars, falcons, pyramids, etc) they complete cover in the flowers, but it's far from being a natural garden. Black sprinkler tubes crisscrossing every square inch of the gardens and watering timers are a must to gardening in Dubai, but are something I've never seen in a "natural garden" before.Dubai Miracle Gardens is a good place to take visitors for a short stop if they've already seen and done everything else there is to do in Dubai, otherwise, I wouldn't recommend making a special trip to visit it.
Must see. if you are in Dubai, you should not miss this place, the time, efforts and money put into this place is amazing, one of the GREAT achievements od Dubai

Nice to see, but a bit of a drive. Miracle Gardens were nice for a quick visit, but it was a long way to drive for an attraction that doesn't really take long to go round. The flowers were beautiful, so I you wanted to chill and have a relaxing stroll it would be a nice place to go.

Its a wonder. The entry fee is nominal , its a spectacle , my wife and daughter dragged me to this place but no regrets - the park / its flowers is so well maintained - it surely is an oasis for those who know the region , it does not have metro access , best is to take a taxi . Suggest you visit this around 2.30pm spend around an hour or more and move to the Global Village and spend the rest of the evening there as they are close by and you will save on commuting .

A great morning out.. this was very surprising....and well worth a trip. Youll only need an hour....the refreshments are far from perfect, but at least you can grab a coffee and a water...the displays are wonderful though.
Packed. Nothing special: Packed, overrated, no credit card accepted. Far from the city, skip it unless you have a lot of time to spare

Where are the bees?. One of the best man made gardens. Its like a little city made of flowers and even has a castle made of lemons. Although there were millions of flowers I didn't see a single bee (how weird is that).Not to visit on a hot day.

Magical Garden. You need to see it to believe it....Was recommended to go to these gardens early but never realised that any amount if time is less to explore the entire place properly...we went late n missed out the butterfly garden as it closes at 6pm...so go as early as 3-4in the evening...to see all this..The evening was pleasant with cool breeze And the thousands of varieties of flora.....Amazing to see so much the Arabs can do in a desert... Hats off to them...

Truly a miracle!. The name says it all! It's truly a miracle seeing a garden blooming in the middle of a desert. It is the most beautiful and biggest flower garden I have ever seen. The garden showcases a wide variety of different flowers that are arranged in different shapes and maintained around the year. The timings are 9am to 6pm. You can catch a bus from Mall of Emirates which runs at a frequency of 20 minutes. The last bus departs from the garden at 8pm. The garden has a lot to offer for selfie enthusiasts. All the time we were clicking. There are endless options of eateries. There is a Butterfly Garden adjacent to it. We had visited the Miracle Garden in the night so we could not make it to the Butterfly Garden but I would advise to visit this place during daytime so that one can enjoy the beauty of both the gardens at its best. So plan accordingly so that you can visit both the gardens in a day. Plan accordingly so that you can visit both the gardens in a day.

Best Flower garden i have ever seen.... I went there by day and i loved it,so did my family...hue houses and monuments made by colorful flower,nice for walking and tons of pictures,restrooms and cafes are available , make sure weather isnt too hot or you will melt there..will definitely go there again at night..Its a spectacular place to see...i define it as a must..cheap entry..
Extende family trip. Overrated and not at all price worthy coz we were in all 12 people including children and it was a disappointment in terms of pricing

miracle!. leave at least 3 hours for this attraction if you wish to explore it all and enjoy some time in this beauty!! All well decorated and you can have a soft drink in the middle to enjoy some more time!
A Must Visit!. The colorful flowers all over the place will blow your breadth away. Choose an early evening/late afternoon time to visit the place to avoid crowd.. They have good eating options too..

Something different: the wife and kids would love it.. It is very innovative. A nicely designed concept. At the end off it it is a simple thought of arranging flowers in small containers/ pots in a particular fashion to radiate beauty and to make your house look neat. A family can spend about 2 hours happily in this garden.

Average experience. Same flowers, some of the set-ups are beautiful, some well not so much. we were followed by guards always telling the children off if they stepped one foot onto the grass. Overall found it overpriced for what it is.

Its like nothing !. We went to visit the Miracle garden with our parents and it was a great picnic for us.... Dubai has created a lovely, colourful and picturesque garden with beautiful architectural designs to completely the magic. It has floral settings created on lovely row houses, cars, peacocks, miniatures of Burj Khalifa, Eiffel Tower, lovely cycles etc. There is a wide variety of food selections available at the garden with seating ares as well. You can rent a caddy for people who find it difficult to walk and there is also a children's play area in the garden for entertaining the kids. The entry fee is 30 AED per person and it remains open from morning 9 to evening 11 on weekends.
My Second visit. This is my second visit to Miracle Garden. It is as wonderful as the first one. Enjoyed lot with family.
Awesome!. Flowers, flowers everywhere.. And very creatively laid out. Definitely worth a visit. Plan to spend more than 2 hours there but do remember to wear a hat as the sun is scorching.
Amazing experience. Amazing experience,enjoyed a lot ,very nice food and service ,Thanks a lot and Most properly will come again.
Endless gardens of flowers. Nice calm place. Too many flowers around you in one place. Put in cars, as cars, as birds, walls, etc... A nice walk to have and nice photos to take. Parking is outdoor.

Go either early in the morning or late in the evening! It gets very hot/humid with all of the watering.. Well worth the price of admission. Stroll at your own pace around the gardens. Lots of photo opportunities to see flowers in the desert.

A lovely garden worth a visit. Miracle Garden is an innovative development wherein certain type of flowers suitable for local conditions and fruits (like oranges) are decorated in different arrangements in an outdoor botanical garden set up. The garden is kept open in non-summer months for obvious reasons and it is a pleasure walking around and click memorable pictures. The efforts taken to create and maintain the garden are laudable considering the local weather conditions.  The garden is adjacent to Butterfly Garden; however there is a separate entrance ticket and AED 50 fee per head for that garden. The fee for this garden is AED 30 per head and it is definitely worth a visit at least once. A family can easily spend 2 to 3 hours in the garden. If you also want to visit the Butterfly Garden then keep another minimum couple of hours at disposal. The garden is extremely crowded on Fridays being a common public holiday but Saturdays are better and of course the visitors to Dubai should plan to go there on week days. Ideal time of visit could be in the mornings or late afternoons. They have made ample arrangements in the garden for people to sit and relax, it is another thing that some people misuse the facility of stretching in the areas meant for a bit of a break for families and elders. They have a few eateries (outside food is not allowed) and washrooms. Parking is big enough. Travelling there by car is recommended although public transport is available from Mall of the Emirates and surrounding areas.
Amazing miracle garden. Perfect place for romantic couples and family. Huge improvement from last year. Well done to the management:)
Good day at miracle garden. Very beautifully arranged flowersGood to see all the flower decorationSeen first time such beautiful models made of flowersVery clean and beautiful place to visit
Saudi Arabia. Amazing garden we had a nice time there  I recommend to visit this garden before sun rise. There is a lot of flowers and nice design

It's a beautiful garden. Its a very beautiful garden, to have made this garden with Dubai's weather its very interesting but first there are no good places to have food and second if you have gardens in your country then this is not that special
Miracle Garden in Desert. Its is a beautiful garden with a lot of flowers EVERYWHERE. Best place to take lovely pictures. I recommend to go early because it will be hot in the noon.

Simply Amazing. A place where you can find tour Eiffel, burj khalifa and most common icons all around the world, built with flowers. If you love nature, flowers and creations this is a must see in Dubai.
Where creation exists .... Place where you can find tour eiffel, burj khalifa and most common icons all around the world gathered in this beautiful place full of creativeness.
Amazing !. Didnt even know so much was possible with flowers!! Located pretty far from the city, u need to take a taxi as no public transportation mode is suitable for this. But worth the efforts!

Wonderful day at Dubai Miracle Garden. Dubai Miracle Garden, is the world’s largest natural flower garden. Spreading over a span of 72,000 square metres, it is filled with over 100 million flowers throughout the entire garden. Opened since Valentines Day 2013, the garden has managed to captivate the hearts of many couples as well as families from all around the world.The Miracle Garden is located in Dubailand and it attracts 55,000 visitors every week. Bursting with vibrant displays, they have created all kinds of sculptures that blooms with flowers – landmarks, houses, hearts, animals, you name it.The flowers are maintained using waste-water through a drip irrigation method. In particular, they use 200,000 gallons of water per day to water all the flowers. There are also more than 45 species of flowers that is acquired from all around the world.Throughout the park, there were many recreational areas for visitors to simply relax and just enjoy the scenery. They thoughtfully provide shelters to keep us cool from the scorching desert heat.Food stalls were also plentiful. There were heaps of food stalls at the middle and the back section of the park – indian food, egyptian food, lebanese food, pizza, etc. This place is probably a haven for many couples but it can be enjoyed by anyone really. It’s amazing place to soak in the romance as well as the serenity of the surroundings. We had a great time roaming around the garden.The entire park was clean and very well maintained. With their huge range of impressive flower sculptures, Dubai Miracle Garden is an fantastic place to spend quality time and take amazing photos with your loved ones.
Mesmerizing. Dubai has created yet another wonder in its desert sands....tucked away yet in the city, beautiful and enchanting place!

A garden in the Middle of Desert. A miracle unfolded in the middle of the desert! The world's largest natural flower garden with more than 45 million flowers. It opens during winter season here in Dubai and will close by summer season.

Slightly disappointed. Not a priority in terms of places to visit in Dubai if you there for a few days. Kids may enjoy it. It is a small theme park with flowers without rides except from the buggies, which can drive you from one point to the other. We went there because our friends' daughter, a toddler, loves flowers. Entrance fees: 30 aed.

Worth a Visit. We decided to go after seeing some photos & we are glad we went, We got a Taxi from Dubai Marina - 50 Dirhams. There are lots to see & lovely to walk around & admire the lovely flowers & colours. Entrance was 30 Dirhams each. We also went to the Butterfly Garden - they are located next to each other - the Butterfly Garden is a must for young & old, the picture gallery at the entrance is stunning with all pictures made up with butterflies. There are loads of species flying around - the are beautiful & stunning - Entrance was 50 Dirhams each.
Awesome. Miracle garden is one of the best place for flower lover and specially for couples with stunning style.
Lots of flowers. I love flowers and really enjoyed wandering around here - it is inexpensive and is great for all ages - lots of photo points and places to have a bite to eat it's drink!
Musit Visit. Best place to see in dubai and so beautiful not really far from the city. if you travel to Dubai you must come and see this gardern
FANTASTIC! . This garden is really a miracle the biggest gathering of flowers and colors u may ever see It's like a color pallette where u can never be bored.. I enjoyed every single moment there
Stunning. Well worth a visit absolutely beautiful, we got the Metro to the Mall of the Emirates then a taxi, lovely afternoon , only 15 dirhams entrance

At last, some nature in this unnatural place!!. Dislike Dubai because it's probably the most unnatural place in the world so it was a huge relief to see flowers, albeit that they are forced and not naturally growing, still nice to see though.

Nice to see some flowers. Overall, it was a nice outdoor activity with the family. I can't imagine how much water would be needed for this place! One can see where the temperature might have killed some of the flowers and there are bare spots or replacement flowers placed. Some of displays had all of the flowers removed and plastic oranges as replacements. Would have been nice to be able to get into one or two of the displays to take some nice pictures.
Amazing place to visit.. Nice place to visit. Don't forget to take your camera. It's worth visiting. But try to visit in weekdays as it will be crowded on weekends.
Must visit. Colorful, vibrant and refreshing. A lot decorations with flowers. Bit surprising to see such greenery in the desert. Must visit butterfly garden.

Best place in Dubai. This place is like heaven during week days (when the crowd is less) ! Unfortunately I went on a friday which is a public holiday and it was crowded. Crowd was the only negative factor here. Otherthan that, the location is truly like a fairy land.  Best time to visit is between 4pm till night. Because view is entirely diferent with day light and night time and if you go there by 4pm, then you can witness both effects.  I didn't know that there is a butterfly garden next to this and I missed it.  Transport is little tricky and specially the way back to town. I used mobile apps to order a taxi but even that was very fast as this location is idle.

Awesome Garden!!. Dubai Miracle Garden with full of spectacular and colourful flowers will always cherish in your mind.In this kind of climate the garden is very well maintained and worth the money you pay.There are different varieties of colourful flowers grown in a variety of landscapes making it very beautiful.Adjoining this garden is also the butterfly garden,where one can see a variety of butterflies.
really miracle. appreciate the efforts, definetley recommend for families for photos and beautiful flowers. activity for 1 to 2 hours.

Creative flower decorations. Huge collection of decorations using flowers and fruits. The miracle lies in doing this in a desert. Otherwise there is nothing extraordinary about this place that makes you go wow. Flower varieties are pretty basic - there are no rare flowers or anything of that sort.

Amazing. If you are in dubai even for a weekend as we were this is a must visit place.. little bit far away from the centre of the city but worth to visit for sure.. Enjoy in the walk and different colours of flowers .. also has few restaurants where u can take a break for lunch or dessert ..

BEAUTIFUL MUST SEE. The garden is a long ride outside of the city, but I really loved it. The flowers and organization was so nice. Relaxing. We were told about this by our guest relations lady at our hotel so thought why not it's a great way too spend a few hours the flowers look really nice and smell great and what thay can do with a few oranges is amazing I would recommend this as a relaxing couple of hours but not a day or even a half day experience loved it

Simply beautiful flower garden. it's all about the flowers beautiful and relaxing environment. recommended for evening visit. The displays are marvelous very well organized. but there is noting to do just the view and relax. it's AED 30 per adult and it's worth the money. not for adventure seekers

Be amazed with the beauty & colours. A must visit place whilst in Dubai. Especially if you are a nature lover & fond of colours, then this place is for you. It will only takes you about 2-3 hours to visit this lovely garden and you’ll have a lot of photos taken to be treasured. So make sure that you squeezed this in your itinerary in Dubai. The Butterfly garden is also nearby, so if you have time, you can drop off there too.So worth it.
It was a nice outing with the family.. The site is a must see. Its lovely to see so much green and flowers in the middle of the desert. The arrangements are also made very nicely and look lovely.
Great day . Visited the park. it was amazing lots of flowers all types of flowers, the kids enjoyed every bit of it. I advise you all to visit the park.

worth to visit. if you visiting Dubai with children, I would recommend to go there. It is really well planned garden with different relaxing attractions and all were in flowers. Admission fees is AED 30 per adult and only child under 3 years old is free. You have to reserve at least 3-4 hours.
Good place to visit. Good place to visit with family. Excellent selection of flower with different style.I recommend every one to visit this place at least one time.

Nice. Very good,all kind of flower,and wether also is good ,many people to here and take photo each other ,inside also have restaurant.it is every easy!

like a part of paradise in the heart of deseret. my family visited this garden at 28th of march . very beautiful and amazing place. it is a paradise for lovers of photography and selfie . i think the best time for visit at this season is between 5pm to 7pm.
A feast for the eyes. This is a lovely colourful garden,full of bedding plants laid out on lots of structures and models.Very beautiful. There is a food court too with lots of choice for snacks.

Great flowers but very costy. Beautiful experince where me and family saw thousand of flowers however the tickets should have between 10-15 Ad whereas they were 35 each. But I will surely love to go again such was its scenic beauty
Very nice garden . It is a so beautiful flower garden. There's a playing small area for the children. There are so colourfull flowers with various shapes .it's very fun and breezy.

Dubai Miracle arden. Dubai miracle garden is located in Al Barsha South. The park has world’s biggest flower garden with approx 40 to 45 million blooming flowers that re arranged in different shapes. The view of garden is very nice during day time, but it looks more beautiful after sunset when the garden lights are on. the entry fee is 30 DHS per person. there is also a souvenir shop for gifts. person visiting to UAE should not miss this beautiful place.
Miracle Garden. a little hard to find but an astonishing garden. Not beautiful but an overwhelming mass of flowers, mostly petunias of all shades and some amusing buildings. worth visiting.
best place for relaxing. it is the best place for relaxing i have ever seenthe garden is charming and fascinating more than i can describe(must visit)

A relaxing activity. I really enjoyed visiting the Miracle Garden and seeing the vast expanse of floral arrangements/pieces of art around me--they never seemed to end! Indeed a miracle . This place is a must visit in Dubai!! You will colours all around as far as you can see... Delightful, pleasant mesmerising place.
Just amazing beautiful. The flower garden of all flower gardens. Never seen anything like this, just amazing. Can only recommend it. Only open in winter season.

They are part of Dubai Land. Dubai is commonly mistaken to be a very dry, arid locations that has very few attractions to offer. In reality, nothing could be further from the truth! Dubai is home to the worlds tallest hotel that acts as a ski resort as well. Dubai is also home to another modern marvel of the world called the Miracle Garden. This Garden is one of the most beautiful and breathtaking sites within Dubai.

a real miracle. this place is absolutely a mircle.it's like you entered the heaven...the fee is so cheap only 30 dirham.but a beat far from city center..and there is no metro station around miracle gardensome buses are provided for ppl that take you to the miracle garden with 5dirhams. but the buses start from emirates mall to the miracle garden(every 30 mints).so you need to get to the mircle garden to use these busesthe best time to go there is before the sunset.cus the weather is much better and you wont be a good target for the sun :))the best place to take beautiful pictures .so don't forget your camerait only be open about 4 months during the year.so before you start your trip to dubai check its site

Amazing colors. "Wow!" First impression when you enter. The amazing mix of colors is just out of this world, it's hard to think you are in a desert when you see it ...can it be improved! Yes definitely. They could use more varieties of flowers and more information about the flowers would be great. Still it will not disappoint.

RHS needed for SOS. The concept of Miracle Garden is well intended and there are some interesting fixtures. However, there were no 'tellers' explaining plant varieties and it seemed quantity rather than quality was the main design feature. Some of the famous buildings featured in the garden were clad in plastic faded oranges and other faux fruit with ruined its initial impact for the viewer. The price tag of 30AED does not, in my opinion represent value for money. Having said that the Egyptian fatayer vender was outstanding.

Miracle Garden,Dubai. I love strolling around the beautifully decorated Miracle Garden. I love the different colours of flowers. The decorations are so artistic and creatively designed. Pleasant to the eye.

Best bit of Dubai. While it is crackers to put on a display like this in the middle of the dessert I loved it, but then I am a gardener.It is north of everything but the city sightseeing bus does have a loop that stops here.It is bigger than I expected and is spectacular, I daren't even think bout how much water is needed t keep it going but it is a riot of colour and engineering, think Chelsea meets your local garden centre. more hanging baskets than I have every seen in my life and petunias on a massive scale and others of course.Good for families and plant lovers but also just for the spectacle.Plenty of food outlets, loos available with attendant so clean.30AED we thought good value, spent a couple of hours there easily. It is open late and therefore is lit up in the evening which hadn't occurred to me unfortunately and we didn't have time to stay later but would be worth planning to cover that too.An oasis, almost literally, after the rest of Dubai which is largely skyscrapers and a building site.Take a hat or umbrella as a sun shield if temperatures high, it was ok in March but will getter hotter of course.

Romantic and fun. Miracle garden is a view to see, first if you like flowers it’s the place to be, they have tons of flowers shaped into many great structures, and big enough to make you go around for more than hour without repeating the same spot twice. Second its amazing day out for couples as its romantic place and many places to make memories in pictures as well, I would highly recommend it in Jan and Feb as the weather wouldn’t be so hot and you could enjoy the outdoor walk.

Miracle indeed and well groomed. this was a pleasant surprise for us during our 4 day vacation. the garden was well maintained but thought it was pricey. They could have included the butterfly garden for the same price as well.
Beautiful!. Great place to visit with little children. Just wonderful! The garden is tastefully done. There's a food shop where you can buy some drinks and snacks. Definitely recommended

Truly a miracle fairy tale place!. Beautiful garden with amazing creations from flowers. Beautiful . Such a beautiful place, this was the first place we visited on our recent stay, as it was closed during our visit last year. It is hard to believe this is situated in a desert. Flowers garden nothing else. It's a garden with flowers Why miracle ?!!Good for taking photos for several minutes and you should pay nearly 10$ per person for several minutes only Go to safari instead

gret evening hangout in winters.
