pretty flower everywhere. its a nice place to take pictures, so bring your camera !! coming from the tropics i find Dubai very barren as there are not many trees and plants around, so i can see how this is a miracle garden .

Really a MIracle!!. Amazing Garden. Beautiful Garden 🌷🌷 but ...... I went there in spring, it was 32 degc ☀️ and my kids are not really enjoying the place. Please avoid to visit in summer or spring. If you do please bring a lot of water with you and umbrella Otherwise i would suggest you go between Oct - Feb. The fee is 30 riyal to enter the Miracle garden only quite expansive, in europe or Asia place like this you can enter it with a minimal fee or even free.
Magic Garden!!. Thousands of colourful flowers in superb creations! A magical village that everyone must visit. A true oasis in the desert!

A Unique Place. A must-visit if you are in for pretty sights & a romantic walk or two with your loved one!The floral arrangements are unbelievably captivating ...a dreamland for selfie seekers. Could get really really crowded on weekends though.

Breathtakingly beautiful!!. It is just too beautiful!!As soon as you enter the garden the sweet fragrance and the spectacular view mesmerises you.The entire garden has beautiful landscapes created with flowers and is very creatively done up.From Houses, to boat, to a lady's face, to arches to peacocks, this place definitely catches all your attention. The variety of flowers is not much but the presentation and colour combination is commendable!You can catch bus 105 from Emirates Mall for 5dhs one way, and get the non stop service to Miracle garden and also cover Butterfly garden.The bus frequency is every 20 mins!The garden is pretty big and has a lot of options of eateries and resting spots so you can lavishly spend your time there.Do take a hat/cap along in case you are visiting the place in the afternoon.

Amazing Garden. Who would have thought this place existed. As you enter the garden you are already greeted by colorful and lovely floral arrangements, tastefully done and creates an soothing environment like a world of your own. Feels like in wonderland...

great family favorite. really cool place to visit with family or friends. beautiful gardens and great atractions, limited F&B options

Good but don't expect too much. It is a good place to visit but I think you should go to other places before this one. Go early o late afternoon because the place is hot if the sky is clear. We spend 1.5 hours and I believe that it's more than enough, unless you are a flower lover. The ticket per person is AED30 (about 8 euros).

good attraction in a desert. It was good to see so many flowers in such a dry climate. It does become somewhat boring after a while . There should be some other adhoc activities in between to keep people excited as it becomes monotonous
Great plae to be with family. Unless you visit you will not believe the way plants are grown and variety of flowers in a desert. I loved the way they created Tajmahal.

Nice to see some flowers in Dubai and make pictures. Good place to take your older relatives visiting dubai or to snap a few instagram pictures.
It's quite small, can be seen within 2 hours.

Garden without Miracle. Nice to see all kind of flours in one place. But if you are expecting to see something like botanical gardens then your are up to a big disappointment. You also need to make sure you go when weather conditions allows.

A garden oasis in the desert!. Unbelievable experience! When you visit, you forget that you are in the desert with all flowers and floral designs! Very reasonable admission price as well! Beautiful place. Miracle Garden was a very beautiful place. Very relaxing atmosphere. Food a bit costly but well worth it. There was so much creativity with the way they arranged the flowers. Simply stunning.

GOOD TO KNOW WHY THIS GARDEN IS A MIRACLE!!!. Who could imagine you will find so colorful flowers in the desert!!!20 mns driving from Mall of the Emirates! Better to go when it is not so hot but anyway, you will esily understand why this garden is miracle!

Flowers in a desert is a miracle. Seeing so many colourful flowers in a desert like dubai is the reason why its called a miracle garden. Wonderful display of colours all around the place which gathers huge attention. For nature lovers and photography enthusiasts this is a must visit. Couples can spend some quality time around. Take the bus no 105 (every 20mins) from mall of emirates to reach miracle gardens. Alternatively take a taxi which should cost around 30AED from mall of emirates. Avoid going around afternoon as standing around in the sun can be a bit of an irritation.

Wonder at Desert. Miracle Garden of Dubai is the actual wonder created in the desert. You would find only colours colours colours and only Colors inside the Miracle Garden. Flowers in each and every shape size and colours are available here. Ticket to the park is reasonable at 30 AED per head. Time required to visit 02-03 hours.Take RTA bus no 105 from Mall of Emirates, bus stand just below metro station.Friday/ Saturday bus stats from 1200 hrs.Other days from 1400 hrs.

Amazing Collections !!!. Just feel that you are one among the flowers !!! There are so many collections of flowers with well decorated postures and creatures. Worth visiting when you are in the desert land looking for colorful flowers !
Awesome. I went this garden 3 times with family guest. It is really so beautiful but tickets is expensive. Very well maintain good place for romantic shooting.

This Year's Highlight. We have been going to the UAE for the past 7 years but this was our first visit to the garden. It was simply heaven. What a place - millions of flowers in a wide variety of imaginative tableaux. It is impossible to show how beautiful it is in mere photographs. Lots of shade around and plenty of places to eat and drink. We will be back next March.

The largest garden in the world! . This was one of the bucket-list day trips, coming back "home" this vacation. My grandmother (in red) particularly loves gardening and her eyes certainly lit up as we made our way through the lanes of the world's largest garden (which ironically happens to be in the desert ). The garden consists of iconic landmark buildings/sculptures covered in colourful flowers. I was expecting to see more variety in this regard, however it seemed like only marigolds were used. There are also several fresh juice vendors and fast food joints with a flowery food court situated in the central part of the garden. Overall, a fun day out and definitely recommended for all you botanical lovers out there.
Superb. This place is fascinating. I always visit this place once every year. Every now and then they changed it to something more interesting.
superb garden. excellent garden with flowers of all speices. surpriesed to see so much in a desert. well done dubai people. take time to see it atleast 3 hours

Execelent effort in desert. Some difficult to reach at your own..take a metro to mall of emirate Station and take taxi from there for 25 dirams..or otherwise include in your tour itenerary from your tour operator, vast variety of flowers arranged in a very unique way..a must see garden

an average time pass. we were family group on a 6 day visit to the town & visited this place at about 5 pm. On the outset it is actually a miracle to see what they have achieved out here in the middle of a desert but above that there is nothing to excite you. This place just gives you a lot of photographic oppertunities but you do get bored after an hour or so as there are no activities ( other than a chargable play area for kids.)The food options are good &aplenty & the roasted corns @10 DH are a hit out there. My suggestion ,give this place a miss unless you have extra time to kill or want new photographs for your DP.

Lots of color. This was one place that my wife and I thought would be interesting to see before leaving town, and we were not disappointed. The park is about the right size and has a lot of variety of colors and flower types. While it may not be exciting, it is a peaceful, colorful and fragrant place that all ages can enjoy and it is unique.

Nice for a wander but don't go out of your way!. Came here simply as we were passing en route from another weekend trip. It's a beautiful garden but overrun with screaming kids during the daytime. The kids, as is usual for Dubai, are loud, poorly behaved and actively destroying displays in full view of parents!!! It will pass half an hour enjoyably for an adult- no more!
Garden in the desert. This garden is gorgeous. 45 million flowers in all shape and size. It's the place you should miss when you visit Dubai(if it's open).
Sunny day in Miracle Garden. We've been there in a warm day. The garden is so beautiful. We've enjoyed the colorful area. you also can visit the Butterfly garden which is so close by 5 minutes walk

A miracle Indeed. Miracle garden is a true miracle, why is that? when you see such a green place and full of flowers in the middle of the desert! that is great.Transportation, if you have a car, it's easy to reach it, use GPS, if you are going by taxi, except to pay a lot, depends from where you are taking it, there is another option, there is a shuttle that departs every 20 min from mall of the emirates.Access: ticket price is 30 DHS, and the park is open from Oct-Aprthe garden is nice, alot flowers from all types, great walk between them, pick a nice weather day, there are alot of facilities (restrooms, umbrellas shops, etc...)its nice if you have kids, to spend few hours there.if you are planning to eat there, dont count on that, only places to sell coffee, water, juices, etc... no proper place to eat, i only saw a shawerma place, and a burger place.overall, its a must to go while you are in dubai, after all, it won a Guinness record!
Amazing!. I highly recommend this attraction!!!!!! The Garden is absolutely amazing. You feel you are in sort of magical movie!!!

Beautiful Gardens. I really enjoyed the Miracle Garden. It is full of beautifully arranged flower displays and an absolute joy to walk around. It is immaculately and thoughtfully maintained and there are plenty of shady areas to rest in and to admire the beauty of it. A perfect way to spend a few relaxing hours in the desert.
with my family recently. it was a good experience. I haven't seen a display of so many flowers. so creative. I recommend all visitors to Dubai to atleast visit the Miracle Garden once
Good place. If you want to go for a photo shoot pourpose then it's a good place to visit otherwise there are only structures made up of flowers nothing much.

So many petunias.. An unusual place for a European as these were mainly plants you would see in a British park, obviously manipulated to create the wonderful arrangements. Extremely colourful and designed to offer loads of photo opportunities. Quite small , but really popular for those from hotter climes. I actually saw people wondering around with jumpers and coats even the staff, as its only open in their winter months. How he plants weren't drooping when I was there. Still my daughter loved it(Very good for selfies)

26.02.2016. This is really a miracle garden! I enjoyed every minute of our being there. All flowers smell so nice. And there are so many beautiful things made of flowers there. It's like a fairy tale in reality. I would recommend everybody to visit this place in February - March.

Amazing. the best time to visit this garden is winter season. it was lovely to walk between flowers in different designs and creative shapes. My kids had a lovely time there as my mother did. garden with rest areas and small coffee shops.

Outstanding. Its literally outstanding and its really awesome. The glittering and scintillating lights. The astonishing variety of flowers and wonderful colors all around with children's play area - really awesome.

WOW !! Never expect. We life in Dubai since so many years.... and still the City is able to surprise you. It is unbelievable if you remember that Dubai is a City in the Desert.Great flowers all looks so fresh and well arranged. We had been their with my parents .... spoiled from flower gardens in Europe...but still so impressive.The team send a good amount of flowers to do different arrangements. Maybe the variety of flowers is not the highest, but what they build or create looks gorgeous.Thanks for a colorful afternoon out.

Beautiful Garden!. We were really impressed by the Miracle Garden. It is kept in pristine condition and has wonderfully creative floral designs to admire. There were lots of food options in the food court area and great photo opportunities all around the garden. A great day out for all to enjoy!
Lovely gardens. Lots of themed gardens, plenty places to sit and lots of eateries, they do loan free of charge a wheel chair for the less mobile, because there is a lot to walk round.
Artistic and beautiful. Miracle garden is truly miraculous in every sense, right from the beautiful variety of flowers to the wonderful imagination put to practicality. Not to be missed.
A feast of beaty for the eyes.. The most unique garden with the most beautiful displays. They even offer a photographer to capture these memories for a lifetime.
Amazing Place. this one is like an oasis in the desert, all the possible beautiful flowers and colours on earth are in this garden. a must visit in Dubai

Filled a cloudy afternoon. We decided to visit the Miracle Gardens one cloudy afternoon. I think it's about £6 entry fee. A lot of the flowers are the same but this is understandable. The displays are really lovely and its well worth a visit

Fantastic gardens !. This is an unbelievable sight in the middle of the desert ! You MUST VISIT ! Seeing is believing believe me you can't afford to miss these gardens !The flowers and lay out are really great !Cant praise them too much! VISIT PLEASE ,
Wonderful creation!. Lots of flowers will welcome you upon entering the garden.. Its relaxing and enjoyable to have pictures with those, arrange in various shapes and characters. Fantastic!

A fresh breeze in hot dessert . A wonderful colourful spot where you can enjoy spending a couple of hours in....
If you really want to enjoy, then avoid Fridays and Saturdays...

Garden in desert land. Surprised seeing Garden such a beautiful in desert land. Greenary restored via drip irrigation. Beautiful cars, scultptures and world glimpses with flowers . A must visit place for single,couple or family.
Opening only in winters 4 months.

Flowery. Worlds largest flower wall. Name is in world record. Beautiful garden
Beautiful place to visit with family to see flowers beauty.
Must visit. Its awesome place to visit ,if u want to relax and have peace of mind with coolness of eyes then plz visit this park
Beautiful. Pictures do not do this place justice. You must go and see it. So peaceful. We were recommended by a few people to go and see this place, so glad we went.

A great break from the buzz of the city. I recommend this site as part of half a day break in Dubai. Enjoy great flower displays in peaceful surroundings. Avoid mid day hours it gets really hot even in the winter!

Update to my Miracle Garden review. The good thing about going to Dubai Miracle Garden now is the transportation. Every 5 minutes there is a bus departing from the bus station. And It is cheap. You can even go there every time you want to. As to the Miracle Garden itself, it is a must see. Although I like the designs last year but it never fails to amuse me. I loved the colors and the flowers of course. You will not feel hungry or tired because they've put places to sit to take rest and food stalls. It's a little crowded during weekends so prepare yourself, much better if you want peace, you should go on weekdays.

Beautiful. A really nice place to visit in the cooler months especially if you have kids and love flowers. Beautifully landscaped and a heaven for photo lovers. Definitely worth a visit. They should include Butterfly Park in the same ticket price.
Pretty Cool. Was a nice family day out to this location. Will go again to take family when they visit. Felt good been surrounded by flowers and plants. To my surprise my little boy liked it too.

One of a kind. If u r traveling with childrenIf u like gardenIf u have visited Dubai for ur honeymoonIt's a must visitIf u r with friends or couples then it might be a little ok stuffFood inside is expensive but the area is clean and well maintained

Lovely Garden in the Middle of the Desert. . First thing first. Its well priced as everything else in Dubai is over priced. Nicely done up garden and it amazing they created such a place in the middle of the Desert. I do believe its a place worth visiting in Dubai. A good hour is required to see this place. There is a free bus from the Mall of Emirates to this place.

Pretty. The gardens are pretty and colourful but not as sculptured as I had imagined. Lots of loose type flowers in pots, hanging baskets which are mainly arranged around structures such as little houses. Nice enough to get out of the city and sandpit for a walk around. Would be nice for families as there are a few novelty things for kids to do and plenty of food stalls too.

Wonderful garden. An amazing must see flower garden located in Dubailand. Shuttles are offered from the malls to the Miracle Garden or you can use a taxi since it's a bit far from the main Dubai attractions. One of the best gardens I have ever seen, great effort to maintain the landscaping. Different shapes of colorful flowers creativity. Entry fee is 30 AED per person, great for families with young kids or older kids, lovers or if you are a solo traveler. Inside the garden you will also find places to sit, eat, drink or use a clean toilet. You can also visit adjacent to the Miracle Garden a newly opened butterfly indoor garden. Get plenty of memory cards you won't put your camera down.

Unbelieveable. If you show your photos to the people and ask them where you were, I can guarantee you that no one in the world will imagine that you were in Dubai desert!!! Best ever garden seen anywhere in the world.
In the middle of the dessert...... Not really a fantastic display under ordinary circumstances, but this IS the middle of the dessert, and it is beautiful.

Beautiful. Amazing place in the middle of the dessert. It was a great surprise and we really enjoyed walking about for a couple of hours. The weather was a bit hot for a day in March but there are plenty of ways to cool down. The proximity to the butterfly garden is a good advantage and its well worth visiting, I wish they would have a discount for visiting both places, but they don't.
Romantic Place!. After 5 oclock best place for couples!!!)))) A lots of flowers and warm atmosphere )) We are going monthly there))

Nature at best. Indian can learn a lesson by visiting this park. We are destroying our nature whereas Dubai is growing plants.What a place. Full of different flowers and aptly named Miracle Garden.Must on Dubai trip

Flowery! :D. I have been to Miracle garden twice already and I may say that this place is really relaxing, because of the flowers, and amazing flower arts that you will find in this place, every year they are changing the design of this place that you will really look forward to what will be its next design. It is really a must see if your a tourist here in Dubai. :D

FreshDay. Even though it is far a way, yet you can go there using the public transportation, from Mall of the Emirates Metro station by Bus and back the same way. It is a wonderful garden to spend 2 to 3 hours day time, fresh and colourful, you can take a lot of pictures there.

What a Beautiful Garden!!! . It is one of the best garden I have ever seen, it is spectacular, it is very well maintained and what a fantastic efforts to keep the landscaping colorful and beautiful in very hot and dry country. It is a must see garden in Dubai. Very cheap to enter and recorded for family with young kids or older kids, lovers or if you are traveling on your own!!!
Relaxing Place. I've been here several time but definitely we'll coming back next year a good place to relax and taking good memories with friends.
beautiful to visit. very nice to visit but for 1 hr maximum to take photos and studff as you don't have anything else to do .

Wow !!!! . Mircale garden is ❤ .Truly a miracle in the desert. Beautiful flowers, amazing decor , famous monuments shaped with flowers. Dubai Miracle Garden is open until 31st May, will be close from June 01 up to September. So plan your dubai visit between October to May, (if you want to visit miracle garden )Of course cooler months are best to visit this place . Dubai Butterfly Garden is open whole year. Alot of places to sit & relax in this beautiful garden . Food is also available & its not overpriced. Quite far from the metro so you need to go there by taxi. Entry fee is 30 Aed. I hope it helps .
Too many flowers. This outdoor garden offers beautiful sights of sculptures made of flowers and trees. Never go there on a hot day.

Feast for the eyes. The most picturesque place in Dubai - A land covered in lively colors (flowers planted are for the eyes not for the nose - most are not fragrant). Try to schedule your visit during a weekday since both locals and tourist flock during weekends which makes it harder to get a decent shot with yourself in it.

Really a Miracle. A must visit place to include in your things to do list in Dubai. Nicely decorated and planned, this garden is really a miracle in desert. 30 AED per person is what you'll pay as an entry fee. The photos on internet will tell the story how beautiful this garden is.
Just wonderful!. Different colors and designs. Many places where you can be seated. Affordable price for the ticket and long opening hours. Guess it is better visited in the morning.
Fantastic place. The flowers in here are amazing. It is hard to believe you are on the desert. You are free to wander everywhere and lots of places to sit. The food places are not over priced either.

Beautiful relaxation. Something beautiful and different after busy skyscraper life. Quite far from for example the metro so you need to have your own car or go there by taxi. Nowadays also some bus goes there but I can't remember which one.

" WOW Flower in Dubai ". The flowers garden showcases a wide variety of different flowers that are arranged in different shapes. The blooms of these flowers have been fashioned to look like hearts the flower garden is obviously well maintained with fantastic hard work in Dubai.

BEAUTIFUL. This was my favorite thing to do and the reason why I took a 3rd vacation in Dubai. I had been twice in the summer and the Garden wasn't open so I FINALLY made a winter trip. It was WELL worth it. If you like flowers and beautiful things do this on a day when you have time to stroll and take tons of pictures and really enjoy the scenery.

Veeeeeery majestic. Let me tell you something. There's a miracle in the desert. You really have to see this place. I would definately go back a thousand times. There are lots of flowers, beautiful views, famous monuments shaped with flowers. Perfect.

A must visit when in Dubai. Take a day to visit the Miracle Gardens in Dubai, you won't be sorry. Of course the best time of the year to do so is during the cooler time which is normally between late September and May. Don't forget your camera and if you are a gardener yourself the plethora of ideas that you can take home with you are invaluable. We are creating a mini version of the flower "stream" that represents water flowing from an urn and is so easy do do with pot plants. Apart from that the sheer beauty of the flowers and the flower "houses" are unbelievable to see. Peacock flower statues, flower monuments and many other stunning flower arrangements to be seen. Even if you are not a gardener, the sheer splendour of this display makes it a must see. Refreshments are readily available and parking is more than adequate. Don't miss this one.
Eye Cooling Experience. Miracle Garden is the one of the biggest wonder in Dubai, The City Of Wonders. Once you have entered in Miracle Garden you never think you were in Dubai... amazing
Miracle Garden truly a miracle!. To have and maintain such a large area of beautiful different flowers in a desert is indeed a miracle. Do remember to carry your camera and selfie :) with you.

Amazing garden. You can see a lot of green at tha middle of the desert. Have a lot of flowers. You can see houses, cars and bicecles cover with flowers and you can take a lot of beautiful pictures . I definitely recommend it!
City of Flower. Miracle Garden is a city of Flowers. Beautiful houses has been built on flowers. Italian design is a main attraction over there. The place is far away from main city Dubai.
A Beautiful Garden.. Beautiful well maintained garden.A Must see in Dubai.You will find butterfly garden near by.Different kinds of flowers.

Average. It is good to look at initially, but as you proceed inside; you see similar flowers in different colours and different arrangements. So it gets boring at times. There is a lot of walking to do. For those who have travelled at other destinations, this place is below average. And honestly, there are better things to see in Dubai itself.

Beautiful Garden in the Desert. The miracle garden is really beautiful, the flowers are displayed in a very nice way. You can take lot of pictures there, but the weather is very hot although i visited it the begining of March so you can't spend a lot of time.

Beautiful . Visually spectacular garden where flowers are cleverly arranged to make a feast for the eyes. Entry fee of 30AED a fair price. We were there in mid march and some flowers were starting to wilt and die. Best time to go probably early February when flowers in full bloom
Great . Excellent arrangements.so much enjoyed.will be back again soon nice combination of flower design most of 7th wonder they make from flowers

Its a WOW and far from boring!. We hired a car & driver for the day from the hotel and did this as the final venue. We were told it was good but nothing prepares you for the spectacle its fantastic and to use that overused word Awesome!Yes its a long way out of town but there is now a bus and the HOHO also go and its 30dhs to get in (don't know where the other prices have come from in some of the reviews?) AND disabled are free, Sue walks with a stick and that got her in for free!You can hire a buggy/golf cart to go around on (we used the wrong gate to be by them but they were wising around the garden)The spectacle is mind blowing so many blooms all in full natural colour in the most fantastic displays, it is a must whether you like gardens or not I defy anyone to be bored!No areas to be developed no planted areas no gardeners, goodness knows when they do it all but 2.30 in the afternoon there were just people milling around looking in awe!You are well exposed so take a hat & sunblock!There is a café area that is far from special but does a job.It is a must & we will go back another time when we have more time!

Wonderful Flower Garden. Overall, the garden is amazing, I can't describe what I see, you should have plan to see this garden when you visit Dubai, it is perfect place to take rest, ad see the beautiful nature from world in one wonderful place.

A must visit when in Dubai. On my multiple trips to Dubai, I somehow have never visited this place but in this December when we were in Dubai we took time out to go and see the miracle garden. A little far off from the city Center, but the place is amazing and the wide variety of flowers those we say there were amazing. Well manicured lawns and the garden areas and misanthrope of world monuments in flowers was just beautiful. The kids too will love this place. The only way to reach this place is by a taxi, but they are easily available

Nice lovely place. A Wonderful place where you will be filled with awe and splendor of this amazing place. Every single thing is made up of flowers, divided into sections and every section presents a theme. There is 60 dhs per head charge which is worth spending. Ideal time for visit is before sunset in order to get the real feel of all the colors surrounding you. It is little far from city center and you need atleast 1.5 hr to completely see the garden.

Amazing display of flowers. Simply the best display of flowers you will probably ever see anywhere in the world. There are fast food shops where you can eat. It's a little far from town but its definitely worth it. I recommend coming during the bright day light so you can take some good photos.

Colourful, beautiful and quite unexpected in the nicest way possible. A visual feast of flowers, blooms and design, this is definitely a charming place to visit. Go mid week to avoid crowds if possible

Really a MIRACLE. The place is really a miracle with millions of flowers blooming in the middle of the desert. This garden is beautiful & the videos & pictures do not do this place the justice.One has to visit this place to experience the beauty. Though MG is a lil distance away from the main city, it is worth the trip. Like any other attraction in Dubai MG also has the basic facilities like snack, beverages & Sanitation for the visitors well covered. An entire day will also be short to see this place, however a short trip is definitely recommended; especially if one can club it with City Sightseeing or Big Bus trip.
Miracle Garden. Our free day was occupied by this Miracle Garden.Miracle Garden is really a miracle place to visit.Flowers, flowers and flowers and so much a pictureseque place.

A Miracle indeed. Must Visit. Wonderful place. you will be filled with awe and splendor of this amazing place. Every single thing is made up of flowers. divided into sections every section presents a theme.The place charges 50 dhs per head (considering the maintenance cost of this place).Ideal time for visit is before sunset in order to get the real feel of all the colors surrounding you. Night time is also not a waste as it is brightly lit which gives you a good experience.It is pretty far away from city but RTA’s Public Transport Agency has launched a new express bus route — Route 105 — that will take you straight to this man-made wonder in no time from the Mall of the Emirates (MoE), which is accessible via Dubai Metro from the airport and various points around Dubai.The bus fare to Dubai Miracle Garden: Dh5 (about $1.40).
Amazing work. This name is apt for this garden. They are maintaining wonderful garden in desert. Better to visit in early hours to avoid heat. Taxies are easily available

Nice place to visit with family/partner.. Very chilled out place to visit. As you would expect, the smells and the colours are fantastic...its very relaxed and you can just sit on the grass and relax. Ive visited once and that's probably enough for me... But if you are visiting Dubai and enjoyed chilled out surroundings with nice flowers, then do visit. Best to visit during the week as I hear it gets busy at the weekend.
MUST go when in DUBAI!. Amazing place and great contrast to Dubai in general. Colourful and peaceful place. I suggest to take some food with you and have a picnic with a family.
Flowers everywhere. Drink a coffee in the middle of the miracle garden! Flowers everywhere, fairytale houses and delights

Far from downtown but worth it. Lots of flowers, different compositions, best to visit at evening and night. Taxi from Mall of Emirates costs around 30 dirhams. There is also a bus 105, which costs only 5 Dh, but you have to have a silver Nol card.

Well worth a vist. Excellent place to visit and wonder how they manage to keep all the plants looking in such good conditions.Easiest way to travel there is by taxi as taxis are plentiful and quite reasonableGreat place to visit for say half a day, thoroughly recommend

Nice for a short visit... if you like flowers. Lots of flowers of multiple colors. Nice but a bit corny. It's not a costly visit (30 AED = under 10 USD) and it's a good way of killing a couple of hours. Even less if needed. Thousands of beautiful colorful flowers to take pictures at.

Nice to Visit Once. I went here once last year and then again more recently and there have been some extensive improvements to the venue. The bottom line is this is a big area designed with flowers and that's all it is. It's nice to stroll around and see it once and maybe stop for a coffee in the shaded central area, but once you've got the idea of the place you don't need to spend much more time here or re-visit. A good place for photo opportunities and good to get some sun in another way than just sitting by a pool or at the beach but it's exactly what you're probably expecting and doesn't surprise in any way
wonderful for the evening. a nice place ...an oasis flower garden in the desert but try to reach the place 30 min before sunset and avoid holidays and Fridays as it gets very crowdy

Impressive. Did not really know what to expect but this is beautiful. There are so many lovely shapes of the flowers to see - impressive peacocks with all colours. You can wonder around here for hours and not get bored. So worth a visit.

Flowers everywhere!. It's truly a miracle in the desert! All the beautiful flowers , designs & architectures of the place is really amazing! Keep snapping pictures from left to right and when you get tired they even have a swing to sit on and relax. Per my 5y/0 daughter this is a relaxing place mommy! I never want to leave this place, it's like a sanctuary to me. If you get hungry they have a sitting area with colorful umbrellas as your roof to protect you from sunlight/ heat! It's a must visit when you're in Dubai but they said it get closed after April .

Truly a miracle. We drove going to Miracle Garden but there are also buses available for people who opt to commute. Got a little bit confused with the signs and turned the wrong way.Arrived at noon and parking was difficult.Some of the flowers were already wilting but maybe because the weather is already changing and the temperature is rising. Nonetheless, flowers were still very beautiful. Truly a miracle.

Nice stroll for 1 to 2 hours.. We went there with our 5 year daughter. It is opened only 3 months in a year. Even in February, the sun was very bright. So take caps, drinking water, sunscreen. We had fantastic pomegranate juice there. Don't focus too much in taking pictures. There are tons available on the internet. Just enjoy the beautiful flower decorations with a nice companion.

Flowers in the desert. You you can keep wondering how they have built such a beautiful landscape in the desert. The place is good to hang out for 2-3 trip. There is food available inside but its better we have it outside before we get in. Place is good. Worth a visit for a first time visit to Dubai .
Fascinating experience. The gardens are magical - the outlook, the atmosphere, all the colours and forms - they indeed create unforgettable emotions,

Amazing. Such a spectacular place...... Out of the ordinary architecture and excellent artistic displaysDon't leave Dubai without visiting though downside is that it is some distance from Dubai town - either get a taxi or wait for a bus service at a 20 minute intervals.

really its a miracle. went there in December last week when i visited Dubai for new year.very colorful flowers and million of varieties.we covered almost everything in 4 hours, clicked 100s of colorful pics its a feast to eyes specially whol loves colorful flowers.must visit when you are in dubai.they introduced direct bus from emirates mall to dubai miracle gardens

Peace of heaven. Naming this garden as "Miracle" is true, you won't think of leaving this place easily. It is spacious, different shapes made of flowers, lots of decorations, beautiful greenery. There is a food court, and some more shops of crafts. The garden can take around 3 hours, but you may spend a whole day there. You will take very unique photos at this place.Tips: - Ticket price is 50 AED, and working hours is till 7 PM, open only in winter.- There is a public bus (Bus no. 105) moves from bus station infront of Mall of Emirates, which drops you off, infront of the garden, with 5 AED. There is a bus every 15 minutes.
Beautiful Landscaping. A beautiful place to visit with your little ones and see the wonders that can be made out of flowers and fruits.

A miracle in the desert. This is a beautiful place to visit to escape from busy Dubai. Beautiful flowers and displays in a circular area. There is a small buggy which drives you around the outside circular road for 20Dh a buggy, we shared with another couple (arranged by the driver) for only 10Dh. It is not far to walk into the centre, lots of seats, till you reach an upper viewing area and a shady food area.

A site to see - amazing workmenship. It's a little out of the way from the main activities of Dubai but well worth the trip. The craftsmanship is beautiful. Only wished there were other things to due around it. Man different types of flowers and designs.

Desert Dream. Visited the Miracle Garden in a recent visit to Dubai. Cannot imagine how many flowers are used to create this oasis in the desert. As with all Dubai attractions, the standard is very high, clean, well presented and easily accessible. Minimum entry charge and well worth a visit to see the scale of the place.

Surprise in the esert. Dubai aims to surpass other cities by building everything bigger, faster -and they hope- better. One thing that they like doing is to flatter other cities by imitating them with more flashing versions of their attractions. When you enter the Dubai Miracle Gardens you will feel as if you are in an Orlando, FL attraction. It reminds me of the now closed Cypress Gardens. The amazing twist is that this flower paradise is in the middle of the desert. This is a great destination for families with kids or grandparents. Bring your cameras!

REAL MIRACLE. Beautifully maintained and well arranged Miracle Garden is really a Miracle in the Desert Country. Colorful flowers with world attractions displayed in a well disciplined manner. Simply superb !!

Something Very Different. We arrived shortly after opening time, a bonus being it was not too hot and not many people.If you want to see a botanical garde, then this is not for you. It is however, something different and amazing. Flowers planted in the ground, in hangers and just in pots on metal frames, using all sorts of different shapes.Very clean, lots of places to sit both in and out of the sun, plenty of refreshments to choose from.We went by taxi and when we came out there were taxis waiting so transport is. It a problem.

A piece of art. I was told about it but never expected such a piece of art,Visitors of Dubai should never miss it .We spent hours in it just admiring the effort put in its.flowers every were in every eye loving design.

Very innovative. Everything in the miracle garden in position and thought of with care and innovation. I could stay there for a day and still did not see everything. I was happy that it was winter and cool enough to see and enjoy.
FLOWER POWERR. The only place you can see dubai in a different way. Flowers everywhere and the greener part of the city.
Lovely afternoon out. Lovely flowers, tranquil area, lots of seating and shade. Numerous food stalls and drinks, good for locals and tourists.

A visit from a couple of days ago. I've heard somewhere before about this place and remembered it on my recent stop over from Zurich going back to Australia.It's a little hike out of the city but be amazed with all the constructions on the way to the Miracle Garden.The entry fee is cheap for about what your going to see. Remember that all this is made made in the Arabian Desert. The water is pumped out of the ocean and diverted to drinking water. This place would need plenty of is.Passing through the gates you'll know straight away what an amazing place this is.In about 1 hour you will see all colours of the rainbow with a sweet flower aroma in the air. Furthermore the people who created this park need to be congratulated. The name MIRACLE Garden is true. I visited the garden on my own but want to return one day and go again with the family.This Garden is for young and old, great inspiration for gardeners too.

It's worth going,if you love flowers. I really loved this place,it's v beautiful,clean garden,u get to see different types of flowers with beautiful colors,they have made this garden really well,but it has a entry free which is 25 dhs pp,lovely place to for pictures and selfies

Marvel in the Desert. This is a must visit place in Dubai. You will never expect such a green and flowery place in desert. This place is a little far off. But you will find taxis. Seeing is believing. Can't describe in words.

In Dubai probably one of the best places to visit. If you compare to what Dubai offers, probably it will be a great place to spend a day in a green place with some fresh air. Nice decorations made out of flowers, oranges etc. Really enjoyable walk. However if you have visited some other places like Madam Nong Nooch park in Thailand, this can be just a small part of it. Don't expect smth very special, but enjoy a nice sunny day with a flowers and nice decorations. There are some places with fast food available in the territory of the park. The best way to get there is by car.Ticket costs 30 AED per person, you can either book it online or buy it in a cash desk at the entrance.

Amazing Miracle in Dubai. Very good flower craftsmanship. Best place to click pictures. Very beautiful, colorful place to visit with your family & friends. There are swings, colorful umbrellas, lot of other flower woks all made with flowers.The flower displays are well presented throughout. Photography is must and many things to shoot. Best time to got there is around 4-6pm because of the good weather and sun light. Entry fee is little bit more.

Words can not describe the beauty to be seen.. We travelled as a family and can not express the delight in the floral display! So many plants with great imaginitive creations, Houses covered in plants., cars, buiildings, it just goes on.. you must go to believe what you see. Take a camera and your excitement ready to be enchanted by it all.

Stunningly beautiful. The place is very beautiful..very artistic and creative. best time to got here is around 4-6pm because of the good weather. make sure to charge your phones and cameras. but very corner of this place is a picture perfect.  30 or 35 aed entrance is all worth it. there are some snack bars inside Miracle Garden. since you cant bring any food or drinks from outside.

Place one must visit. A visit to this place with the beautiful flowers, possibilities to relax and enjoy is one of the very exciting points to go to. It's not far from center and easily to be reached by taxi.

Must visit miracle. The place is must visit in Dubai. Flowers in Desert and that too with uniqueness of Dubai. There are many things to amaze you. Photography is must and many things to shoot. The place is beauty and has flowers done in artificial things like car house even Replica of Burj Khalifa..

Great if you love plants. The Miracle garden has a large garden with different kinds of plants. They do some creative work with the flowers and plants and is good for a stroll. I am not a botany person so I did not really enjoy it and saw nothing that really would draw me in, but plant lovers will probably enjoy strolling around.
Very Unique!. Beautiful, even interesting for those who aren't into gardens.Recommend going before it gets to hot though!

Taking flower craftsmanship to the next level!!. Best place to click pictures, this place is so beautiful, you wont feel like leaving. There are swings in middle of park where you can sit and relax, food court is designed beautifully with colourful umbrellas. Wear comfortable shoes as the garden is massive.The butterfly garden is separate and has its own entry fee of 30AED which is a bit disappointing.

Beautifully done. Its lovely to see something like this in the middle east. It was AED30 to gain entrance and is very clean and tidy. The flower displays are well presented throughout.Security is in abundance and if you touch the flowers you generally get whistled at.Overall a very pleasant afternoon was spent here.

Refreshing.... I appreciate every flowers here. For the management, salute, as it's so amazing how they are taking care of all these flowers especially in UAE weather type. Great, the children enjoyed. Loves the photoshoots.
Amazing place in Dubai. It was really amazing place to visit. You don't feel that you waste the time foe nothing. Highly recommended for those who loves nature.

A Must-See. We have been in the UAE 3+ years, but we just recently visited Miracle Garden. It is absolutely breathtaking. We took my Mom to visit while she was here and totally enjoyed it. It supposedly changes each year, so we plan on going each year during the winter months, inshaAllah. If you're in Dubai when it's cool and Miracle Gardens is open, it's a must-see! My husband even enjoyed it ; -)

Could not imagine this kind of attraction in Dubai.. My wife and friends enjoyed so much on this place. Could not imagine that these much flowers was raised in the middle east with extreme high temperature and less rain.
Always something new. We have taken guests here 3 times since we moved to Dubai just over a year ago and there always seems that there is something new. Not too expensive either

Flowers never seen before!. Mind-blowing display of flowers, flowering plants and ferns. Please take your children along, for a view of a wide range of flowers and flowering plants. There is an entry fee, which you can pay at the entrance. A very good place for all those wow selfies :)

Overdose of flowers. Flower lovers: this is your place. I think they claim to have more than a million flowers in this place. There's a food court inside, you can get there by bus, the fee wasn't expensive (I don't remember now the price, but it was affordable). And a very nice place to go with your significant other.Very romantic.
Lovely flowers. Never seen anything like it. Flowers everywhere and so many. Cleverly arranged over buildings and arches of flowers. Also oranges and lemons to make up different structures.
Marvel in the Desert. You will ot believe your eyes once you look at how beautiful the flowers and the garden is. It is incredible and people of all ages love it

One Hundred Million Blooms. If you are in Dubai in the cooler months, October to April you should not miss the amazing Miracle Gardens and the Butterfly Farm. This is an attraction to suit all travelers from toddlers to the elderly. Everyone is catered for ; there are pushcarts for the toddlers and wheelchairs provided for those with less mobility. There are also golf carts if you are tired of walking. At the peak of the season there are approximately 100 million blooms it is a kaleidoscope of colour. Dubai has many attractions, do not miss this one.
Fantastic. Absolutely beautiful and a must see. It fills the heart with joy. Some nice restaurants are needed in the vicinity though not just junk food kiosks.

Exceptional beauty. I have no words to describe this beautiful attraction. How do they do this in a desert country? No matter how old you are, whether or not you like flowers you will appreciate how exceptionally it has been made from the landscaping to the monuments to the houses. Flowers everywhere.

pretty. i went twice to this garden. this year there was an addition called the butterfly garden where u go in tents full of butterflies in their natural habitat.the miracle garden is well kept ,clean with a variety of colorful flowers, u need a car or taxi ti reach this place. cheerful thats how i would describe the garden
floral beauty. great romantic outing if you are with your better half. lots of varieties of flora and fauna. wanna promose your mate , this is the place and she will melt...

colourful garden , very good for photo shoot. Liked to go there and have some photo shoot out of my busy business schedule. Every year they keep on changing many things and they always try to do differently. This year was far better than last year and very closed to reality.

Colours in the Desert. Another magnificent creation of the Sheiks of Dubai this bright and colorful garden of flowers in the city leaves one amazed by its vibrant and colorful beauty. Definitely worth a visit
Great Garden. Its a Great Garden Located In city Its Great To See Such A Beautiful Garden Amidst Desert Excellent Garden
Miracle Garden. I have visited two times their i think this year it is more colorful.No more words to explain excellent.Must visit

Wonderful and miraculous. The Miracle Garden is mind boggling. The land scaping and decorating of the flowers has been done with lot of thought process behind it.Flowers have been decorating village type houses, wind-mills, monument like Burj Khalifa, horse-carts, motor-cars, etc. The setting of the garden is just out of this world. Talking a small walk through the garden gives a sense of serene-ness and is very relaxing to the mind.

Stunning Colourful garden. The biggest garden full of flowers. There are cars, trains, many houses, towers, bridges, birds, butterflies and hearts made of colorful flowers. You can breathe deeply and smile. It is just like dreamland. You should visit in the afternoon due to strong sun. Don't forget to take your camera.

Miracle Indeed!!!. World's largest natural flower garden of this standard in the middle of the desert??? Yes, very surprising and equally delightful! This garden not even once failed to impress me, especially, how they are arranged. I had a great time strolling around and forgot for a while that I am in a desert city.I would recommend it as a must see place in Dubai.
Must visit. The garden is breathtakingly beautiful . It was astonishing to see such a large collection of flowers in the desert.

Blooming Desert. By international botanic gardens standards, this is nothing special, but if you consider that it is in the middle of the desert, it is a bit more impressive. All the flowers are petunias and geraniums. I suspect they are the only flowers they can keep alive under the conditions, so instead of a wide array of flowers, they have taken the flowers they have and built them into beautiful structures, like peacocks and mountains and the eiffel tower. Sit in the shade in one of the swings along the outer edge and watch the multicultural families strolling along.
Never to Miss. It is in fact a great place to visit. It is really treat to the eyes. There are so many flowers of different colours and very well maintained
Wonderland!. I had a great time strolling the garden and taking photos. You will feel that you are somewhere far in the neverland or even in wonderland. They even have their own eiffel tower.

Very colourful attraction!. They have done quite an extensive array of flower arrangements. It is amazing for such a country without much vegetation, they have done so much beautiful structures using single type of flower like petunias in several shapes. If you love to see flowers and colours , go for this site.
Love Beautiful Garden . It is a miracle. I have never seen so many flowers in one place. Admission is very cheap 30 AED compare with Dubai a tower entrance fee for 510 AED.

Beautiful. This attraction is great for people who loves gardens and flowers. The plants and flowers are just out of this world, especially how they are arranged. Everybody should go and visit this place when in Dubai.

Marvel created in Desert City. Commendable job. In desert cultivate and maintain variety of colourful flowers and plants is hats off. Entry Ticket is slightly over prised at Dhs 30 PP, but one has to see the efforts taken to preserve this garden.

Amazing. Amazing, spectacular, wonderful. In the middle of the desert too, all plants are real not artificial. Just catch a 105 bus from the Mall of the Emirates, one leaves every 20 mins starting at 2pm, only 5 aed to get there.
IT'S A REAL MIRACLE.. MUST VISIT, Its a miracle in desert , so many variety of flowers and fauna, tickets around 30 dirhms , but worth the price .

Colourful floral display in Dubai. We visited the Miracle Garden after touching down in Dubai on a Friday morning and it was amazing that they were able to maintain the beauty of the displays despite the severe weather conditions. One can consider visiting if they have about 2 to 3 hours to spare.
nice idea and interesting. the place is wonderful, but the ticket price is too much and also the food inside is bad and no many options

A must visit location when in Dubai. This is an amazing place considering it is built in the desert. It can get a bit crowded around the entrance but deeper into the gardens are quitter. The food and drink is a bit expensive but expected. Follow the signs on the road not your GPS though as mine sent me down near The Creek to start with

One of the Best Flower displays any where.. What a pleasant surprise - it was NOT in our itinerary but the tour operator driver too us there anyway - thanks Hameed Konikkal. The display and constructions are very very good. Great of travller who have youngster and garden lovers.

A must see at the right time of year. Went to the UAE in February and went to this amazing place. You can not even describe how beautiful the flower are here. It was not too expensive and included the amusement park with the purchase of the ticket. There is also a butterfly garden there as well and wish the option to go there and not the amusement park was offered. Wear comfortable shoes as there is a lot of walking involved. If someone in your party is not a flower lover there are benches to sit on, an area for kids, and also an outside restaurant area. This is only open in the cooler months so if you happen to be there take advantage of a once in a life time work of art with plants and flowers.

Extravaganza at its best. What starts as an eye popping experience at the start translates to tiredness by the end of it. Theirs flowers and flowers and more flowers with a variety of design. A not to be missed experience but its probably best to visit during early morning or evening hours else the sun is too harsh.

Worth your time and money - Must go if its open. For a very "cheap" price, you can see beautiful flowers and wonderful creations and structures in the Dubai Miracle Garden. Open only from November to March (i think) you have to make sure you go to this place.

It's a great choice!. For going to Miracle garden,It's better to go in the afternoon and stay there till night,You need 4 hours for seeing all places and it's lovely to be there at night to see all places with light-on in a cool weather.The entrance fee is Great but as you have to get a taxi to go there,It would be better to go in a group,so you will share the charge( Of course this is for on-budget travelers)It has some places to eat,sit and relax,WC and praying room)...so you can spend half of your day there and enjoy this beautiful garden.
A beautifull and creative garden <3. A beautiful and creative garden build with flowers and fruits. Wonderful and amazing. You get relax and calm. Just enjoy the smell. Wonderful
Awesome. This is obe of the most beautiful spots in Dubai.Such exotic gardens in the middle of the dessert.This is trually an awesome place that any visitor to Dubai should not miss.

Don't bother. A wasted couple of hours spent in petunia garden. All flowers much of a sameness. Gawdy and better suited to Las Vagas.Food is poor quality, expensive and covered in flies. Cheap to get in but wouldn't go again even if it was free.Once you've seen one petunia, you've seen them all!

It makes you forget about the desert. Really beautiful place, easy to reach, plenty of parking around. Reasonably priced. Huge area to stroll around and to enjoy an afternoon outside. Great for photos.

a true Miracle. I visited with the family and its very nice location for a peaceful afternoon. It is very well structured and there are multiple entrance. Plenty of places for couple or family photos and selfies. Entrance ticket: 30 Dhr Time: 3-4 hoursTip: good to have plenty of water with you. Its expensive in the garden.For opening queries, contact on FB page usually they are responsive.The garden is marvelous. I enjoyed the scenes from a structure that is in the middle.We also took a small taxi( not sure what to call it but mini golf taxi) that gives you a full ride in 20 dhr.People do compare miracle garden with Kukenhof. I have visited both and its unfair to do comparison. Oranges n apples... !!On the other hand, the mistake I did because of these comparisons is time. I have visited Kukenhof and it takes full day. However, for miracle garden 3 hours are sufficient.Hope this helps.

Miracle garden. Experience the artistic and intricate designs and landscapes made from flowers... The magnificent views are relaxing and inspiring, you'll think I've never seen anything like this before!!

We went there on Valentine's day, really a good mood and all happy smiling people. Very nice park, definitely worth the trip. You can easily spend half a day there and you will return with many fantastic pictures.
A must visit garden. This garden is amazing,it's one of a best garden we visited.You need to bring a nice camera so you will have a souvenier of a lifetime.

"Alice in Wonderland" Miracle in the desert. Incredible what water is able to achieve in the desert! Loads of flowers made into a lovely display. The whole place had a feeling of being in Alice in Wonderland. There is not a large variety of flowers, but the way in which they have been displayed is really quite something. Excellent shaded area to have a meal from the takeaway restaurants.
Phoolon ke iss shehar mein..... A must visit place if u r a nature lover....varied varieties of colourful flowers n many artifacts made of flowers.

Green space that needs a new lick of paint. Desert sun in Dubai is harsh, its bleaches hair, bones, paint. Miracle Garden, is a miracle that people actually go there. Apart from the upturned Volkswagen beetles, you will see concrete peacocks, concrete flamingoes, a fake roller coaster with a giant fake motor cross rider, a fake space shuttle, windmills made from concrete citrus fruit. Most of the plants are potted. If you love petunias, you love Miracles Gardens. There is hardly any trees, established plants in the gardens. It will appeal to those who like a spot of colour, it’s a green space in Dubai. It’s no Kensington Gardens, Mount Tomah, Central park. Miracle gardens will remind you of a garden centre found in hardware stores such as Homebase or Bunnings. If you come from countries with parks and gardens this place will disappointment.t

Peaceful . Enjoy every second of being there.Thanks to Dubai transportation system, you canreach this beautiful zone by bus at gate no. 2.Designs are very nice, it feels like the Wonder Land, of course with no Red Queen

Memorable time and worth a visit. Fond memories to cherish and we had a brilliant time with wife and kids... Played a lot and clicked many memories with the camera...Entry ticket is a a bit expensive but worth the money spent...

Best suited to families. It's a little out the way but on a bus route from Mall of the Emirates. It's a little tacky and tatty in places but the flowers are beautifully done. Lots of places to sit in the sun and enjoy a family picnic and food inside is actually very reasonable. For the entrance fee of 30AED I would say its reasonable. There are no rides and the butterfly garden is separate and has its own entry fee of 50AED which was a bit disappointing as there is only enough to occupy adults for an hour or so. Attraction wise I can see why it's popular with families but there is nothing about it worthy of being declared a miracle garden!
Never saw somethng like this!. It was amazing view of milions of flowers in different ways.I recommend to go early ,because is geting very hot.

WONDERFUL. We thought spend on hour looking at flowers, we were there four hours, it was so bright and colourful. No bees or wasps though which was strange with so many flowers. Highly recommend a visit, suitable for all age groups.

It is Miracle in Desert Must Visit. This was not covered as point in BigBus tour. You need to go here separately. But whatever be the case , you must visit this place when in Dubai/ By taxi it is 20-30 minutes from Dubai Mall. Landscape is excellent decoration is super , You can have nice walk surrounded by flowers. There are swings in middle of park where you can seat and relax and enjoy nature. Driver told us that this place is not open throughout year. There are some months when it is open. So better you check first before visiting. .

A Miracle!!!. Dubai's Miracle Garden is indeed a miracle. This is a must see place in Dubai. You will feel like you are in a different place or even in a wonderland.I never thought Miracle Garden is so great until i saw it, after living almost 1.5 years in Dubai. You will truly appreciate the work they have done in creating A Miracle in a desert!!!

Flower sculptures bigger and better of course - it is Dubai!. Miracle Garden is probably more suited to visitors to Dubai as opposed to us who live here simply because the cost of entry plus food and drink makes it pretty much a one off visit as opposed to annual one. It is however somewhere I would tell my visitors to go.Yes the flowers are beautiful and sculptured in all manners of fashion and it is a sight to behold. There are places to sit and just observe the flowers and insects. It is quite a surprise to see cars and houses made from flowers and there is an impact the first visit. I have been once about 2 years ago and havent been back but that's not to say it isnt worth that one visit.If travelling by car DONT park in the first car park - its twice the price of the one further down and ok you walk a little further but its not that far. Also the Butterfly Garden is in a separate part and it costs more on top and that is definitely on our annual list for a visit

Truly amazing. I very much enjoyed going to Miracle Garden, even though it was on a Friday, there was enough space for all visitors. Unfortunately it's a bit far from the city and going back we had to wait for nearly one hour to get a taxi.
Beautiful. Lovely place to take lots of photos. Everything looked very elegant. It's definitely something you should set an hour or two aside for during your trip!

Plenty of colour and quantity . A pleasant couple of hours in an immaculately kept garden. Many flowers, much colour but limited variety. The flowers are part of some good shapes like cars, peacocks, houses etc. Admission is 30 AED and there is a direct bus from Mall of the Emirates bus station every 20 minutes, fare 5 AED, number 105.

Simply Beautiful !!! True Miracle!!. You cannot stop clicking pictures here!!!This place is so beautiful, you will not feel like leaving from here. It is amazing how such a beautiful place is built in the dry desert area like Dubai. There are so many structures built with flowers and fruits and they look so very beautiful. It is a must see if you are in Dubai. Right from the entrance till you exit there are so many beautiful structures that you could fill out the memory card in your camera. All the wonders of the world are built and there are artistic faces and places!! Even the food court is designed beautifully with colourful umbrellas.See some of the pictures I uploaded to get an idea of how beautiful this place is.
Nice way to spend your weekend. Its a perfect example of oasis in desert. sight of flowers (lots of) after watching desert all the way are refershing to eyes.
not so great. It is nothing special. Just the same flowers everywhere. The food available inside is also overly expensive

Wow - a riot of colour in the desert. Went here with a friend to tag along. Really glad I did. Did not expect to enjoy the experience but it was remarkable to see so much colour in the desert. Peacocks of followers; ladybirds - just outstanding. The amount of work it must take to keep this place so green must be huge. Definitely a 'one of a kind' Don't miss it!

Beautiful Place - A Must Visit. Very beautiful place with a huge variety of flowers and other plants.They have a modest selection of food & beverages, as well as a number of snack stands.Best time to visit will be around noon (11am-1pm), when the sun is directly above you and won't ruin the photos with the glare. About 2 hours should be plenty of time to see everything and take enough photos to keep updating your profile pic for days.

Amazing. Really didn't know what to expect! It is gardens full of flowers. Big structures (cars,houses,bugs,landmarks) covered in flowers. Really amazing to see in the desert. Check opening times as not open at certain times of the year. My 9 and 10 year old liked it too. Especially the ice cream seats!!
Beautifully built up. Miracle garden is a famous attraction. Beautifully designed. Very much greenery around. Ticket costs approx AED30. Dont forget to take your best camera. Food available inside.

A deep breath in Dubai. Very relaxing, interesting and bit surprising considering the urban location. It is not a very wide park and you will see everything in a short period of time but you have food and drinks over there as well and therefore you could stop and enjoy a coffee in the middle of this colorful garden.

Colorful Garden; limited variety. starting from your first step, you will realize you are stepping into an amazing place; flowers are stretched as long as eyes can see, beautiful innovative constructions using plants and flowers with an amazing mix of colors.

Must see place for nature lovers. The Great Dubai is maintaining in open weather such a nice garden with full of flowers. The designs are so nice and the decorated many wonders of the world with colourful flowers. One should not miss this place as it is really beautiful.

Fabulous Garden !!! Fantastic Maintenance !!! . Hat's off to the designer, Gardeners and the whole maintenance team for giving us such a wonderful garden to enjoy with family and friends.We went to this Glorious Garden straight from the airport after keeping our luggage in Jood palace hotel (old Taj) since our flight reaches Dubai at 6.30am, as soon as we reached the garden and saw the beautiful flowers our tiredness vanished and we where fully energised, enjoyed a lot for 2 hours and took some gorgeous photos and videos to cherish.Must visit for all age groups when we are in Dubai, 30 dirhams each is absolutely worth it and we can combine Butterfly garden (50 dirhams each) and Global village ( I don't remember the entrance fee) to make it a one day program.

Dubai Miracle Garden. GThe Beautiful Dubai Miracle GardenMiracle Garden is one of a kind in the region and in the world for such a unique display and extravagant outdoor recreational destination.Visit the most beautiful and the largest natural flower garden in the world. Dubai Miracle Garden is the world’s biggest natural flower garden which consists of different types of flowers, special vertical and horizontal landscaping designs in each area. It showcases a wide variety of different flowers that are arranged in different shapes. The blooms of these flowers have been fashioned to look like hearts, stars, igloos, pyramids and other figures. The floral patterns will change with the season, so any returning visitors will get a brand new experience. Located in Dubailand, near the Arabian Ranches, the Dubai Miracle Garden comprises more than 45 million flowers spread across the 72000 sqm site, most of which, are planted for the first time in the Gulf region. The traditional flowerbeds are arranged in arches and flowerbeds forming various shapes and patterns, with topiary-style displays, apart from blooms that take the shape of stars, hearts, igloos, pyramids and many more. The floral displays will change each season, so visitors can hope to have a new experience when they visit the Garden each time.The Dubai Miracle Garden includes huge structures of sunflowers, seven stars, huge stunning flowers of 3D art design, seven flower hearts, seven pyramids and huge florally designed UAE flag. It also offers state-of-the-art amenities, such as open parking, VIP parking, prayer room sitting areas, toilet blocks, security room, ablution facility, carts for handicapped visitors, first aid room, retail and commercial kiosk, and all other related services for visitors.There are arch pathways, with hanging flower baskets, an umbrella pathway, a flower tunnel, Lilium flower lamps and a birthday corner with 3D design.Apart from the said, a Ferrari car with driver decorated by flowers, flower apple structure, a vertical buried cars zone, flower boats and Islamic Arch Design are all part of the Garden.Miracle Garden has the record in Guinness Book of Records for having the longest wall of flowers which will give a new landmark for Miracle Garden and for the City of Dubai, which is believed to be the leader in diverse and cultural tourist attraction.The Main Attractions : Butterfly Garden: The brilliant round-shaped garden is designed in 3D and decorated with flowers in a total 1800 square meters can accommodate 300 people per visit. Currently, thousands of brightly coloured butterflies are the latest attractions in the Miracle Garden. Fragrant Village: This enchanting fragrant village, also known as ‘Aromatic Garden’, comprising 10 flower houses and a large ‘palace’ complete with mind-boggling variety of flowers, also include sunflowers that track the sun movement. This aromatic garden includes medicinal plants from around the world, including more than 200 countries. Visitors get to smell, touch and make their own cup of tea, fresh from the garden. There are also seating areas and service counters too provide cups and seats for visitors.Edible Garden: The edible garden is the place where visitors get to pluck and eat fruit of their choice, without actually being chased by gardener. This section has variety of vegetables and fruits including tomatoes, strawberries, lettuce, and more. The vegetables and fruits are planted such that more stock can be added, as and when needed. A separate strawberry garden is being planned for Phase Two.International Garden: Here you can surely enjoy your voyage of discovery, with sculptures from around the UAE and several countries from around the world made entirely out of real flowers!Flower Watch (Floral Clock): The Garden house a floral clock, which is about 13 metres in diameter, made of real plants and flowers. The clock also includes a small bird house, with a bird tweeting every 15 minutes. The design of the clock will change twice a year (for each season).Colourful Peacock: The garden got colourful peacocks, out of which, two will be displayed with a large fanlike opened tails of 12 metre diameter, and one with closed tail around 13 metres in length, all designed with colourful flowers posed on the Green Floor.Petal Pedals: Your visit to the miracle garden will be incomplete without a walk to this place, where seven boats made of flowers are anchored in a lake, which is also made of flowers. Another fascinating sight here is the flower tunnel, apart from a wall adorned with names of countries.Children Play Area: The Children Centre is the place to be for kids. The games here are unique, and other than electronic games, which keeps children involved in physical healthy activities. The centre is suitable for children in the age group 4 to 14 years, and includes a small stage for magic and illusion show.Other amenities: Among the other facilities within the park are restaurant, sitting areas, shops, rest areas, first-aid rooms, toilet blocks, coffee shops, ice cream shop, small grocery store, men and women Mosque, garden trains, club carts, tricycles and ample parking space.

Amazing Flower Sculptures. Spent a couple of pleasant hours wandering around the Miracle Garden. Quite a unique place, beautifully designed, and well kept. Never seen flower sculptures like these before, so it was fun. Food and beverage options were pretty good as well. A good value experience for the family.

A miracle in Dubai . The miracle garden is an annual event whereby the landscaping is done with various flowers. Millions of flowers are used of different colours and sizes to make this place look very similar to Hitachi seaside park in Japan. It's an annual event and lasts for close to six months. It started in 2013 and we make it a point to visit this place every year. We prefer to go early morning as the crowd is comparatively lesser and it is easier to take pictures. Highly recommended
Stunning!. Absolutely stunning place to visit. The flowers are beautifully arranged and the butterfly garden is a must aswell.

A small piece of heaven on earth. This is an amazing flower park which everyone can enjoy with plenty of varieties and shapes. You will be dazzled with the well maintained arrangements and will certainly have a wonderful time. The park is big and will need around 2 hours if you want to see everything with closeups.Highly recommended!

beautiful Gardens. Went here one morning , what a surprise a hidden little treasure in the desert, houses , clocks animals you name it all decorated with flowers absolutely beautiful , real quiet when went , but cash only to get in .

Beauty at Every Turn!. Flowers and plants of all types shaped into many wonderful things to look at. It's a lot of walking to see everything. Your camera won't stop taking photos for hours. Very cheap entry fee. Everything is easy to see and the paths are wheelchair accessible.

Paradise of Flowers. Is just beautiful.. you can see all the art created just with flowers and the beautiful decorations. It was so nice. if you dont have a car and want to save some money, you can take an express bus at Mall of Emirates station that will take you there directly for AED 5, it is a bit far but is really worth it.

Relaxing feast for the eyes!. This is a great place perfect to escape the busy city life of Dubai. The air here is sweet and fresh. The gardens and beautiful, nicely landscaped. I especially like the little homes engulfed in flowers. These gardens have PLENTY of seating space, mostly in the sub though so I'd definitely bring a large hat and sunscreen, lots of WATER if you are coming in the hotter months!Would have loved to see a variety of special flowers, maybe a tulip area, a rosegarden etc.Entrance is 30 AED which is about 8$/p. From here you can walk for a min to the butterfly enclosures. Loads of food stalls available here too with shaded seating.

Nature's beauty - but man-made ;). Well, it is an amazingly well developed garden in the desert.It is one of those places which you honestly don't like but feel guilty to give a bad rating. There is no doubt that the amount of hard work put in making and maintaining the garden is literally miraculous. But when you put this place amongst desert safari, Dubai Mall and Burj Khalifa trip, Atlantis, Global Village etc. it just doesn't match the ante. If you are having a leisure trip of Dubai or stay at Dubai / Sharjah, then this could be a good destination to go visit on the "rest day" of your trip. And like many others have said, it is a good place to visit with family. You can while away a whole day even if there are kids and old people in the group. It is not a happening place. But it is not just as boring either. One thing though, if you are into colorful abstract and macro photography, you will love this place. Lots of wallpapers assured. Best time to visit: enter an hour or an hour and half before sunset. The lighting would be perfect to enjoy the colors of flowers and to capture them on camera too.
very beautiful. a great outdoor family outing. Just make sure to visit in the winter as can get too hot. We took lovely photos and the children really enjoyed looking at al the beautiful flowers.

A PARADISE OF FLOWERS !!. This is something to be seen to be believed.A flower garden in the desert with more than a hundred thousand blooms every day is something out of this world. It is a must see in your itinerary. This miracle garden attracts more than one million visitors a season.The entry fee is AED30 per pax.This is not to be missed.

Stunning gardens, loved it!. This place is beautiful, flowers everywhere. Good value for money compared to other attractions in Dubai. We went here at about 4:30pm and it was nearly empty but still bright and sunny heading towards the sun setting. I felt this was an excellent time to come here to avoid the crowds, and also as it was a week day too. I would visit again, hoping that next time I came they would have changed the flowers and have different models and displays.

Dubai Miracle Garden - Truely a MIRACLE!. Location: Next to DubaiLand, Al Barsha - DubaiWhen to Visit: Evening time preferred. Day time if the weather is cool.Description:I visited this place with my family and we all were really thrilled with the beautifully arranged flowers!!You can spend more than 3 hours here without getting tired. The flowers were arranged in a house shaped, peacock shaped structure and flowers just poured life into these man made structures!! replica of Burj Khalifa and Eiffel tower was a good sight. Kids, adults and old people will enjoy this place a lot!Allow yourself atleast 3 hours to enjoy this place thoroughly.I would suggest you to first see the place first once and then start taking snaps. Most of the tourists were busy taking snaps/videos and forgot to cherish the natural beauty of the flowers.How to reach:From Dubai you can take a metro till Emirates Mall. From Emirates mall you have RTA buses every 15 mins to the garden. If its Friday then Metros will not start untill 10:00 AM so better hire a cab. We were six people and hired a cab which costed around 100 Dhs from Bur Dubai. There are plenty of buses to and from the garden and they operate till late evenings so no worries if you plan to stay late. Maintain sufficient balance in your NOL cards (RTA bus cards) for your return journey.Pros:(i) Awesome concept, beautifully constructed and very well maintained.(ii) Plenty of benches to sit and enjoy the colourful flowers.(iii) Terrific place to take beautiful snaps.(iv) Reasonable ticket costCons:(i) Overcrowded on weekends. So, difficult and irritating to take snaps because everyone keeps walking in between.(ii) Outside food is not allowed inside the premises. So, fill your stomach before visiting this place.(iii) Cafeteria is very expensive. Final Verdict:Awesome place and a must visit for people of all ages.

A very Good Place to visit with Family. One of the must-visit places in Dubai, the Miracle Garden is known for its traditional flowerbeds fashioned in varied shapes. The multi-hues flowers welcome you in different shapes like hearts, igloos and pyramids,These gardens are definitely worth a visit

Busy. Miracle garden in a whole is a great site to see! Must see place for the nature lovers. However, when visiting please bear in mind it's extremely busy after 5! I had to wait 2 hours for a taxi so go prepared and to make the most of it go during day time so you are able to enjoy the sites and hopefully avoid being there at a busy time!
