great afternoon out. Spent the afternoon at the gardens. You only need 2 to 3 hours.
its cost Dhm 30 per person but worth the money

Waste of Time. Good for Photo Lover or else waste of time and money.
Garden was bad everything nothing look natural over there

Best way to spend your evening. The ever changing themes leave me wanting for more. Been here thrice. Never fails to excite me. The place is beautiful, no- doubt with the most artistic designs. Such stuff that you can only see in your dreams. Picture-perfect as always

Stunning!. Miracle garden in Dubai is absolutely stunning!. This is a place to feast your eyes and mind and the moment you enter, the vibrant colours grip your mind. There are many kinds of different flowers and at the time we visited, each garden, building was bursting with blooming flowers of all types of colour, shape and size. Entrance costs 30AED (seems expensive at first, but when you look at the effort and price of maintaining this garden, the entrance ticket is nothing). We took a round of the garden in a buggy with 2 stops for taking photos. The Buggy ride costs 20AED and quickly gives you an overview of the garden so that you can plan to cover the garden at leisure later. The ride takes about 10 minutes and then you are on your own to cover on foot.Buildings are put up and covered with plants with flowers. So they look very colourful. There are different shapes of constructions and there are plants and flowers everywhere. This is a heaven for photography - for capturing different colours, macro and wide angle photography.It is impossible to write everything that the garden has. One has to visit this place to truly admire the garden (specially given that this is in the middle of a desert). There is also a butterfly garden attached to this - we could not cover the butterfly garden. There is a cafe with a ceiling of colourful umbrellas to refresh yourselves.A minimum of 2 hours has to be reserved to do justice to this garden and this is a must visit place for visitors of Dubai.

Beautiful day out. These gardens are absolutely beautiful. Reasonable entry price I think 30 dirhams per adult. Children under 3 are free. Lots of spaces to sit down in the gardens and enjoy the view or take some photos. There are many food outlets which like all tourist attractions are a little pricey compared to buying from the supermarket. We had no problem getting a taxi when leaving. Don't forget your camera!!

The ladies would love it...but that's just about it!. Great place. Definitely a one-time visit if you're in Dubai. But recommended only if you are visiting with ladies in your life. Yes, the daughters, the mothers, the wives and the girlfriends would love it. It's an eyeful of wonderful and very colourful gardening.Bunch of dudes would be lost in this place unless you're:- Either into farming or gardening especially related to flowers.- being reminded of your childhood in the flowers...- Looking to find your next matrimonial match.May not be recommended for people with particular pollen related allergies and for very old people as there aren't enough places to rest tired legs since people who occupy the few existing ones sit on it like they've paid for a cinema seat!one time visit! Unless you're a ladies man. If you are then you might as well "reserve" those benches like the rest of them.
Absoulutley Breathtaking. This place is amazing. The amounts of flowers and the designs are just beautiful, Would certainly recommend visiting the Miracle Garden.
Flowers Flowers everywhere. Must go to just to see the flowers and arrangements. Unbelievable smells and sights. Quite a way out of Dubai but we'll worth the trip
Side Trip. Very good attraction for all kinds of travellers. It's one of a kind destination amongst GCC countries. A must visit while in Dubai.

Stunning Flowers. Really beautiful place to stroll around, flowers (and now fruit!) made into shapes like houses, animals, cars, etc. . Even the burj Khalifa and eiffle tower have been recreated! There are also plenty of (fast food) places to grab drinks, pizza, ice cream, curry etc. where you can take a seat in the shade to escape the sunshine. Great value at 30aed per person (free for under 3's) and the taxi situation seemed a lot better now too with plenty waiting outside. Top tip - there's a bus which runs to and from Mall of Emirates to the Miracle Garden.

While it's impressive, it is a one time visit. It is impressive to walk around, but it's really in the middle of no where, which requires a car or an expensive taxi ride. If you like flowers it's interesting to see what they did, but after you go once you really don't need to go again, since there is nothing else to do, it's a big park and there are much more easily accessible parks closer to the city.

Another modern wonder. Top Tip check opening months. This is an astounding achievement, to manage and maintain all these beautiful plants in such hot place. It's well set out with shade as well as sunny places to sit. Lots of refreshment outlets for food and drink and very moderately priced.
A beautiful Scenic view. it feels like you are in heaven, its pretty huge to roam all around the garden especially visit if you are a couple.carry your water bottle although you may get inside.

Good if you like flowers... Or like to take a lot of pictures with flowers. The place was full of creativity but there was also full of people especially during the afternoon that you can't get good photos without someone blocking the view.Went once with friends so it was fun but I wouldn't come back.
Beautiful garden. A lovely flower garden with many displays to enjoy, also has a food court with multiple venues. Worth the visit

Well done flowerscapes. We took bus 105 from Mall of emirates bus station, directly to the Miracle garden. The Miracle garden is truly a miracle of sorts, since we cannot fathom the efforts required to maintain an flowering garden in the Desert of Dubai and that too in uncontrolled conditions. Visit this place only if you love seeing a garden landscaped to perfection. Plants and flowers are creatively grown and that is all there is to the place. The flowers are the same, seasonal varieties throughout. If the sun is beating down, the only shade is provided by cafes and food courts. The place provides good photo op's, if the crowds don't photo bomb you. One needs to patiently wait for crowd to disperse if you need photographs without people. Even during a off peak day the place was crowded. The place is quite noisy too, with the continuous whistling of the security, who have to constantly remind stupid people (a large majority of the crowd) that it is not correct to walk on flower beds and also wrong to climb on creepers, just for a photo op. There is a butterfly garden nearby, but we did not visit it.
Wonderful!!. really a miracle garden, include this place in your Dubai trip. You will find the world in one place. couples this is the best place for pictures
excellent. Its Real Miracle.. In Dessert Area how they Maintain .. Very Nice maintain,.. nice Flowers, & design

Beautiful display of flowers everywhere!. We visited this garden before Global village just to waste time and wound up being our high light instead. From the entrance of flowered arch ways to the walk of flower display is just beautiful! It's even more amazing considering this is a desert and nothing grows on its own without irrigation. I live in the east coast in USA where it's very cold now so we won't have flowers for a few more months. Needless to say, we loved walking around enjoying seeing these incredible disobeys and smelling all the fresh flowers.

totally worth the trip. This is really cool! In the middle of the desert is a place with beautiful greenery and flowers. The arragenment of flowers is spectacular, very creative - we went in January so it wasn't too hot and the flowers were fresh. It is worth a visit for sure. Where else do you have a beautiful flower garden in the middle of the desert?

Expected more. Its a garden with different colors of Petunia flowers
I would liked it more if there was other flower types too
It is average in my mind at all
It is not a must see place in Dubai but u can take pictures
The only thing i likes there was the air freshness.

Excellent creativity and truly a miracle. I consider myself decently traveled person but I have never seen something as creative and as beautifully designed as this garden.They have made different landmarks from all over the globe like Burj Khalifa, Taj Mahal, Topikaki Palace, Eiffel Tower. The way they have made it is a true marvel. It felt like I was in Hobbit village for a while.

Must Visit. As the name says, it is really a miracle to see so much flowers and greenery in the middle of a desert. You can easily spend 2-3 hours inside. They have ample resting facilities inside. They also have food outlets which serve Pizza, Egyptian, Mexican and Indian food (there might be more options).A cab from Bur Dubai may cost AED 50 till this location. The entrance fee is AED 30. They also have a butterfly garden adjacent to miracle garden for which you have to pay additional AED 50.

Not exactly Kew Gardens. A good stoll out his time of year. Realistically okay until early May when the heat starts to really kick in. Good planting and at times the displays stunning but not a horticulturist delight if looking for exotic or rare finds but very artistic in the arrangement of the planting.

Nice setup. I am not much of a garden person but the setup that is there is amazing and beautiful gardens and very creative, the butterfly area is also nice and good for kids, its a long walk so make sure you take water with you.

Crowded but beautiful landscape and flower display. This place is about 30mins out from Deira so plan ahead of you would like to make the trip. In my opinion, this place is more suitable for adult as kids can't quite enjoy and appreciate the beauty of the nature. There are many stalls available for snacks and drinks as well as little toys for the kids. It can get quite annoying with all the whistle blowing from the staffs there when visitors get a too close to the exhibit or if they tried to climb on a railing or a step to take a better picture.

Couples please do visit for some amazing pictures. Yes, its a must go for all the love birds. You will see a lot of different spots where you can click away some of the most colourful pics of your life.
Amazing!!!!!!!. Finding so many varieties of flowers in desert weather in truly miracle!!!!!must visit place for everyone visiting Dubai.

Great for families. I really enjoyed this attraction, it was such a pleasant way to spend the day, and reasonably-priced too. I would absolutely recommend it to anyone visiting Dubai, especially families. Its very kid-friendly. Allow yourself a few hours to fully enjoy it.
Beautiful. The last day of our trip we visited this place. It's beautiful! There's a fee of 30AED. There's food court and the price is reasonable.

amazing flower garden . Nothing is bad about this beautiful garden.
1) specious parking
2) very well organized
3) very well maintained
4) clean
5) amazing flowers arrangements
6) plenty of setting areas
7) mosque is available
8) various restaurants
9) Unbelievable fragrance and scent
10) sensational colors, shapes, & arrangements ideas

Desert Bloom. Amazing display of flowers sculpted into various shapes, some very large. Very walk-able. If you like to see flowers used creatively, you will not want to miss this. Adjacent to the Miracle Garden ,by separate admission, is an extraordinary display of butterflies, both preserved and very much alive.
Beautiful. Beautifully done garden, with simple flowers arranged beautifully. Done forget to relish pineapple sorbett .
Crazy. A garden full of colourful flowers in the middle of the desert, how crazy is that! It is nicely done, though and the entrance fee is only 30 Dhs (no cards).

Truly, a miracle... I had seen pictures of this place & it was one of the things to do on the things to do in Dubai list....I took a local taxi, which I find is the best mode of transport in Dubai, unless ur in a big group, in which case you may need to hire a bus. The location is very near the Dubai Mall, Burj Khalifa & the Global village, so you could put a couple of things together and have a eventful day out.. The actual Garden is very reasonable to enter & once you're in, you will find an abundance of colour everywhere you look. Sculptures made from flowers & some made of oranges & lemons, so plenty to see. It's a very large round park & can get very warm in the sun. They're are not many shaded areas apart from the open food court in the middle of the park which are shaded by multicoloured umbrellas.. A beautiful sight in itself. The food on offer is great & again reasonable. Shops selling fresh tea/coffee and snacks like pizza, chips & ice creams.. The kids will love this place, just be careful not to walk on the grass areas, as you will soon a very loud whistle shooing you off..! I was there at the beginning of Feb when the temperature is no more than 25 degrees, but believe me, it feels much warmer in the bare sun that shines on you, in this vast open space. Plenty of photo opportunities all over the park. All in all, a must see. Lots of flowers, plants & places to enjoy, a true miracle seeing such vibrantly healthy gardens in a scorching desert......, after all, that is what Dubai actually is, a desert..! Have fun... x

It alright. Its an ok place with tonnes of flowers. Its beautiful with lots of photo ops but its just not my type, I prefer natural beauty. The flowers are not even the fragrant kind there like tulips or roses, which I wish they were.

Good. We made a mistake by deciding at the last minute to go there. It's far from the city so I suggest you go there first and then to the global village since they are close and may be you could go to mall of the emirates first . Another mistake was going before the sun sit the butterfly garden as closed and we took pictures at the dark even though there were good lighting . I don't really think it deserve the 30 Durhams ticket. The flowers there are average there were no special kinds of flowers but they where presenting them in a spectacular way. It's a bit like taking a break from the malls and visiting a natural place for a change.
Sight for sore eyes. Miracle Garden is located in Dubai Land, Dubai. Wonderfully maintained garden where you can spend hours together admiring the beauty of the flower arrangements.

Fabulous than previous year!. When you visit to Miracle Garden don't missed to visit the Butterfly Garden as it was beautiful like paradise but the entrance fee is a bit expensive.It will be good if there is only 1 entrance fee both for Miracle Garden and Butterfly Garden same as before.

30 dirhams! Worth it! . What a beautiful place to visit. We spent ages taking beautiful photos and selfies with the stunning flora.30 Dirham entrance fee is worth every dirham.I do not know how they keep it all looking so lush, and plentiful in. The raging gear but it's maintained to such a high standard.Gorgeous

A wonderful place!. That's an amazing way to spend some time when in Dubai. I was tired of malls and this was perfect! Beautifully designed and vibrant with colors and formations....every corner is one you'd want to take your picture at so make sure you have your camera ready at hand!

Not good, not bad. This garden is aesthetically and visually stunning. I absolutely love flowers and especially taking pictures, so I found many moments to capture while here. My fiancé on the other hand, did not enjoy quite as much. The place has nothing more to offer than picture spots. Perhaps they should work on having live entertainment or other sorts of engaging activities. You could spend about one hour here and then be done with it.

Incredible flower garden in the dessert.. No wonder it was Awarded as world largest garden by Guinness world records. Though it's quite far from main district, it is now accessible thru public transport.

Beautiful Flowers all everywhere. Go early as it can get busy. It's a decent sized (outdoor) place with loads of different designs of art work all created with flowers. It's a nice place to go to if you wan't you "get away" from everyday desert life and have a stroll around some lovely flavours and colour.
Excellent. Never seen such exclusive garden.Great for the kids and family.Make sure too take your camera.Reasonably priced.ill let the pictures do the talking

An oasis in here middle of the desert.. I was very happy to have visited this colorful and beautiful garden. So much effort was put into making this attraction as beautiful as it is. Bring your family or just go for a walk with that special someone. Don't forget to bring your camera. An absolutely gorgeous place to visit, have a bite to eat and relax.

A must visit. The miracle garden was beautiful... I haven't seen such beautiful flowers in Europe! The garden is very very well planned, each sight is beautiful. The entrance fee is only AED 30, much worth it. We took lots of pictures there as each sight was pretty... its a treat for a garden lover. I loved the place.

Nice but far if you don't have your own transport. The place is quite far from the center and it is not recommended to go by taxi. The concept is good and flower-lovers will really appreciate. However, I don't recommend going in summer as there's a lot of the flowers that wither becuse of the heat and all... I can understand though, as a garden that big is not that easy to maintain. If you go in the early evening, it can be a good walk with the family, take some nice holiday pictures but that's it really... don't forget to bring cash as you have to pay the entrance and maybe get a drink inside... there are no ATM close to the area.
nice and pretty place. This place was pretty and making some things with flowerromantic place a bad thing about place just limited kind of flower

Nice distraction in Dubai. Paid a visit here in the afternoon, it was busy but not too crowded. If you are a gardener then you will love this place, personally I am not but I really enjoyed the displays and the color, nice change from all the glass and steel that is modern Dubai.
It's miracle. It was crowded on Friday. But the garden is huge. It's beautiful. Best time to visit is end of January & early February. There are lots of restaurant & cafeteria.

Almost same type flowers. This is my second visit. Though i like their concept but somehow i feel they need to introduced different types of flowers. It seems you cannot see more than 2 or 3 variety of flowers. I guess because of the weather condition. But if they could come up with some ideas that would be great. Great place for family and tourist. Definitely a must check in place for tourist.
Beautiful place!. Very beautiful place. Huge amount of nice aromatic flowers everywhere around you. Just grab your family and friends and enjoy the fantastic rest there.
AWESOME ; MESMERIZING. In Desert , A Wonderful , Wonderful Garden with a lot of Flowers & Design . I Have not seen such a Garden in My Life , Specially in Desert area like Dubai. Superb .
A Giant Garden. I thought there was more to the Miracle Garden, but it's literally just a flower sculpture garden. It's cute for a date but that's about it.
Beautiful Garden. Lovely and nice place for the whole family to enjoy in a creative landscaping colorful and fresh flowers very well maintained. Recommend visiting the place.
WOW so many baby buggies!. The flowers were great but what was better was seeing so many families with babies from all over the world.
Very exited. A lot of colour, so romantic and my childrens love it very much, so beautiful place must visit and cannot forget.

It really is a miracle. The taxi took us to the butterfly centre (this costs AED 50) the miracle gardens are 2 minutes down the road (AED 30).This place is amazing, how the flowers survive in the summer heat is quite literally a miracle with help from a very good watering system.The central cafe is a group of different food outlets selling a variety of foods. Very friendly staff and a lovely idea of upside down umbrellas to catch stray flower petals and also to give shade. It is part of the hop on/off bus routes as well. They is nothing else to do once you have visited both sites so you need to check on the return bus times.Would recommend if you want a relaxing time away from the chaos of malls etc

nothing miracle. the name miracle do not mean it its just placing of plants in planter in different shapes ordinary flowers same flowers with different colours can say good try to creat turist place but noth worth to spend time & money
Loved it, every bit. Enjoyed it thoroughly. So colourful with such lovely flowers. Very well-maintained & is an awesome place for pictures.

Great achievement. A lovely display.It is remarkable that all the flowers look so fresh...and my first thought was...how is this place maintained.?Its very pleasant to see and great for photographs with all the bright colours everywhere.There isnt a variety of flowers though but its full of geraniums....which happen to be my favourite....as well as a couple of others....perhaps due to their longer lasting quality.

I completely loved this place!. If you want to see flowers in desert then Dubai Miracle garden is the place.beautiful colorful flowers with unique plantation is lifetime experience.i have seen garden in kashmir but they stand no where in comparison with Miracle Garden.plantation on cars,houses upside down,birds and many more just takes your heart away.this is must to visit..
Heaven on earth. Most beautiful garden... In Dubai. So beautifully done. Well taken care of. Very relaxing. An picturesque view.
Must Visit !!. Must visit when you are in Dubai. Excellent garden with lots of places to sit & eat. Great view from the middle of the garde,

Beautiful Flowers. We first chance upon this garden when researching on our trip to Dubai. We were drawn by the impressive photos posted by visitors to this garden. We took a cab from Emirates mall down to the garden and were greeted by a garden of colorful flowers. It's a nice place to visit in Dubai. Only issue we had was transportation as we had to take a cab to and fro from the garden.

Very Relaxing. Miracle Garden was a great place to visit. It only cost 30 Dirhams (about $8 USD) per person. The first thing you will notice after you get in is the wonderful smells of flowers. We went during the month of Feb. so the weather was perfect for our 1 hour stroll around the place. The follower arrangements were very nice. After being there for a little while you may even forget that you are in UAE. We walked around took lots of pictures and left thinking it was well worth the trip. In my opinion if you are in Dubai and have the time I would differently put it on the list of things to do in Dubai.The Garden is open Weekdays: 9AM to 9PM – Sunday to ThursdayWeekends: 9AM to 11PM – Friday and Saturday

Miracle Gardens.. The Miracle Gardens and Butterfly gardens in Dubai are really worth a visit. Looks like paradise. Thousands of flowersArranged in every way possible. A real wonder. A definite must see for anyone travelling to Dubai. While walking around in the gardens there's plenty to eat and drink. Worth it.

Lovely flowers in a great setting. Weekends can get quite busy. This is a park with floral displays and is fun, went with the family and kids. Had a good time walking around seeing all the lovely displays. Few of the exhibits have been converted to be made of oranges rather than flowers which is way to save some resources I imagine? Anyway it is a nice family day out and the butterfly garden is down the road but it can be busy on weekends so go early to avoid the crowds!

FANTASTIC! AMAZING MUST SEE!!!. This is the BEST attraction of Dubai that is must see!!!I would recommend to hire a photographer before going. everything is so beautiful you can not believe your eyes!
Miracle Garden is miracle. Miracle Garden is really miracle i spent 7 hours you will not get bored.. i took over 1000 photo. i recommend this place

Flowers and more flowers. We visited here in january and it was good time to visit there. Lots of beautiful flowers and different kind of structures made from flowers. It was smaller than i expected, it took maybe an hour or little more to see that place. Very clean garden with lots of place to sit down and eat something small.

A must-visit place for photographers. Small yet beautifully arranged flower garden that is a must-visit if you want to have some good clicks. Also a place of relaxation for nature lovers as the entire Dubai is full of artificiality.
something different. a pretty cool out flower garden in the middle of the desert. it's something that is cheap and easy to do which is sometimes hard to find in Dubai. great for kids!

Very Beautifully designed. visited on 21st Jan,16 . Very well maintained . Do not miss this opportunity if u r in Dubai . The structures made by flowers are amazing. I like all the structures peacock r most beautifully designed .

Extrodinary. Wow.... The Miracle Garden is simply magical... Such a beautiful place to go and visit. The various sculptures and creativity is wonderful. The entry price is extremely reasonable at 30AED. If you have the time to spare, pop next door to the Butterfly garden. There is a high viewing area where you can see pretty much the whole ariel view of the park from a good vantage point. If you wish to beat the crowds, I suggest you go early. There are plenty of food and beverage sites along the way and a good sized eating area with more food choices.Be prepared to fill your camera with wonderful photots.
My children are happy!. My children are happy which means the garden is amazing, fabulous and ect..... very beautiful flower and sculptures. fabulous job!!!

A wonderful place on yhe earth !. Flowers are the most beautiful thing in the world. Just visit the miracle garden of dubai and see the beauty and the nice arrangements of the color flowers shaped in a nice shapes.

Amazingly beautiful place. it is a must visit place in Dubai. January is the best month to visit this place since the flowers are on a full bloom. The place has many structures including cars, king size hearts, burk khalifa etc made of flowers. The place looks even more pretty when lit up in the evenings. Ample space to sit out, relax and eat.
Great place to visit. Visited twice with the family and must say that it is extraordinary place .so many flowers in one place never seen.Do not miss this place if pass to Dubai.

Colourful , Beautiful Garden. You don't have to be flower lover if you want to go here. It is very Beautiful , it has various designs wholly made of flowers. It is situated a little outside Dubai but its totally worth it . You can plan to go here if you are going to Mall of Emirates or Atlantis. There is no metro connection to Miracle Garden. You have to deboard at Mall of Emirates and take a cab which is easily available. Choose a time when there is no sun or else you won't be able to enjoy it. Selfie lovers will love this place. It takes maximum 1 hour for you to complete your tour of the garden and it costs AED 30 per person.

Beautiful flower garden. This place is amazing considering its in a very hot country. The most wonderful display of featured plants I have ever seen. So cheap to visit 6 AED admission cost. Another must see while in Dubai
Real Miracle. Dubaiii Is a Hot Climate for us. But Miracle mean we can see many type of flowers and good architectural valve from here.

Good sightseeing for Family. We visited this park in January and the weather was really good. The best time to visit is in the day post 3pm but before sunset. The park is huge so it will take you good 2 hours to complete . There are little eateries in the park. Its a good place for mid-aged couples and for kids. its good for nature lovers .

Amazing ! Best garden in world . I have been to many gardens around the world and in my country India too.But there's no comparison to this one.Miracle garden is mind blowing.Points:- Maintenance Creativity Beauty Artificially created sculptures Cleanliness Be there by 2-3 so that you see both in day and night.We travelled by cab from mall of emirates and costed 28 dirhams. You can save by taking RTA bus which cost 5dhms per person, so calculate according to size of group.Many taxi drivers will try to divert your mind by saying not to go there because not good , you wont get taxi and many reasons.But dont get diverted, its amazing.

had the most wonderful day in this beautiful garden ..simply amazing. We had such an inspiring day in this beautiful setting surrounded by a host of colours and shapes..love my garden at home .. But this was truly amazing and a must see for every gardener

Only For Flower Lovers. This place is only for those who love flowers , Nothing is much to offer for other people. Only amazing part about this place is, the challenge they accepted to grow flowers in deserted place. Only visit if you love to visit garden full or grass and flowers.
Colourful!. It is a good place to get lots of selfies with the flowers! The efforts of the staff in maintaining the variety of flowers at their best is truly commendable!
Garden in the DESERT. A very beautiful garden, well maintained with refreshing fragrances and offers you a serene atmosphrere

Petunias 'R us. Don't think of this as a gardener's paradise with a multitude of different exotic species. Think of this as a place to marvel at what you can build with a million petunias. Imaginative. Colourful. Weird.

A fun day out for everyone. Miracle Garden is abut out of town, but when you get there it truly is spectacualr! We went on a really hot weekday at around 3pm, which meant it was really quiet and we had a chance to enjoy all of it peacefully! You just need to look at my photos to see that it is an all-round fun day. Very much recommend it if you have a day/few hours to spare and want to see something floral!

Worth a visit!. A really nice, relaxing place. Gardens are maintained to a really high standard. A definite must see if you are in the area. Only 30 dirhams to enter aswell. Butterfly garden is located opposite but quite pricey.
Must go!. One of the best tourist places you should visit when you go to Dubai. It is just very relaxing to go around the garden. It is a great place to take photos :)
Lovely Flowers. Miracle Garden has an amazing diversity of flowers and we were surprised to see such a marvel in dessert.
Superb views. If u want to click lot of pictures with mesmerising views this place is must go .....thousands of different landscapes and views with lot of variety of flowers

Beautiful Garden in the Desert!!!!. I don't have any words to say other than SUPERB!! Garden is well maintained and there are lot of nice photo points to take good clicks:)Nicely arranged and so lovely place!There is an entry price of 50 AED / person and which is worthy.Garden has got few cafeterias - which includes Pizza Hut and a restaurant serves India Food.Please ensure to take Sunglasses and to put sunscreen if you are going during the day time.Easy Route to Reach Miracel Garden : Take a metro and get down at Mall of Emirate Station Station # 19 - Red Line, from there you will get Bus which goes to Miracle Garden - Bus # 105. Also you will get taxi's from the Garden and nearest attraction is Mall of Emirates

Pretty but quite cliche`. Was expecting so much more when I walked into the DMG. Was disappointed as I thought the Lalbagh botanical garden back home in Bangalore had better and more elaborate displays than this one. However, one must appreciate that they have maintained a garden of this size in the middle of the desert. WOuld recommend it only to families who want to take lots of pictures with strange flower patterns in the backdrop.

Really a Miracle. When you think of desert, you don't think of greenery and not surely of colourful flowers. But this place is a real exception. The entrance to the garden is as mesmerising as the Garden itself. Must see.
Just awesome. Very beautiful scenic view, everyone must have to try. Loved it. Simply, amazing place for photo shoot.
Amazing. A visit to this place is must if you are in Dubai. Nice places to click pics and spend time with your family.

Must visit!!!. Entry fee: 30 AED.
Open only during winters from Dec to May.
Must visit for all age groups.
Really beautiful....cant get enough of it...
Carry your best camera and dress colourful...carry extra batteries so that you don't run out of charge...
Plan your tour on a sunny day...Need at least 3-5 hours to cover the entire area...

A good treat to eyes and a place for nice pictures. It is becoming one of the highlights of Dubai. It is only advised to visit when the weather is good. It looks lovely. Every single plant / flower is positioned very well.
However there is no fragrance. .

Colour in the desert. A must see experience, just dont expect to jump on/off a bus. We waited ages for one and eventually got a taxi. The floral displays were magical and a real treat to see an over the top display of colour. I would recommend an early morning visit. Plenty of security there so keep off the displays, kids beware.

Stunning!. Just go you will not be disappointed, the most beautiful place and very reasonably priced entry .
Never seen so many stunning flowers in my life.

Visited Dubai 25 - 28 January 2016. Wow. Full of flowers and a paradise. Full of people and tourist with food stalls. Very clean environment and very clean washroom. Easy access with food. We need to go by cab. Easy access by taxi for return trip and just ask the driver to send to nearest metro station.

Quite incredible. This structured garden really is worth seeing, even if you're not a fan of flowers. The quirky installations are quite mind-blowing. Allow an hour; extra if you visit the Butterfly gardens next door.
nice nice nice. beautiful place with so nice and colorful flowers. That was so romantic place and suitable for people that want to take memorized photos. I recommend to see this place.

Dubai enchantment. Great place to visit and considering this is Dubai, the entrance fee (AED 30) is value for money. Bring the kids, the grandperants, their is something for every body. The grounds are vast with a great deal of variety of flowers and themes. Only draw back, food and drinks can be expensive, keep this in mind and you will not be disappointed.
Spectacular Site. Excellent display of floral arrangements well laid out well worth the cost of entry and time taken to wander around the site.

Great place to visit. Fantastic, beatiful gardens.Not a large variety of flower types but more like a colorful sculpture garden.Very pleasant for walking and enjoying.The flowers are amazing.These days are cold .. so it is v.good place to go, but not in weekend ( it is so crowd in the end of weeked)

Place full of flowers. The garden is real miracle for me. It brings me in the times when I was a child. It looks like a fairy tale. A thousands of flowers, a lot of nice places to sit and watch them. You can spend there half day if you have time.

Amazing gardens . Fantastic gardens. The flowers are amazing and you almost forget you are in a desert area. Vast expanse of beautifully laid gardens is so pleasing to the eye. Makes one feel very happy to be there. Loved it.

Quirky but Colorful. This was a fun place and a beautiful garden oasis in the desert. Not a large variety of flower types (not a botanical garden) but more like a colorful sculpture garden. Very pleasant for walking and enjoying.

Hardly a miracle!. The first impression is 'wow' but after a few minutes walking around the gardens you realise that there is no variety in the flowers. It is more a Spectical than a Miracle. As keen gardeners we were disappointed that all the flowers were petunias of various colours. The security staff were very keen on using their whistles when anyone stepped on the grass! It is 30 AED to get in and if you go out an exit to the Butterfly farm you cannot get back into the gardens even by showing your entrance tickets. I certainly would not go back.

Beat place to visit as couple in Dubai. . What a place to visit. Important things You can reach mall of emirates through metro.From mall of Emirates you can catch bus number 105 to miracle garden. One side ticket is 4 aed. But for that you need to buy a travel card worth 25 aed in which you will have 19 aed. Travel card is same for metro and bussesSame bus number will take you back from miracle garden to mall of Emirates. Announcements are made at miracle garden once bus is there. Global village is near by you can hire a cab from there. Average fair is 25 aed. But be aware of the route. Driver tends to take a longe route to charge extra.
City of Flowers. Miracle Garden is so Huge and has probably the largest different types of Flowers in the world. Also the food over here is worth a try

Worthwhile but not miraculous. To be honest, the only reason I have given this an average review is probably because I come from a country where breath-taking gardens are the norm. I was impressed by the work that is obviously put into the garden and the imagination behind it. My only criticism is of the selection of flowers. It was basically the same flower in different colours draped over each piece. Nice to see, i'd say worth a visit but if you're from a temperate climate and expecting a garden of similar quality, you may be disappointed.

Worth a visit if you are in the area. This is a nice 1.5 hour for a slow afternoon, it wasn't anything mind blowing but a very nice stroll through some nice gardens and some interesting food to try. The flowers are all the same type which is bit of a let down but the garden itself is quite creative. It costs 30AED to get into the park.

If you love flowers ... its a treat what Dubai has done with them. Flower Garden and Desert dont go together generally but it does at Miracle Garden .... Would definetly recommend it to tourist as well .... plenty of eating joints inside too .... recommend to visit early in the morning before the noon heat beats on you .... Cant wait to go next year and see the new upgrades
Lovely Garden for photography. A garden between desert. Very attractive shape made using colorful flowers. Loved clicking lots of pictures.

Garden experience. A visit to Dubai's Miracle Garden is really a wonderful experience. Once you enter the Miracle Garden, the entire
utmosphere will take you to a different world of fairy tale. We should admire the Authority's great thinking and skill
to build such a beautiful garden that too in an extreme temperature. Hats off ...

A miracle in the middle of desert. Its amazing to see how they have transformed a desert into a fairyland. At first i wasn't sure what to expect there but i was in a state of awe on seeing this marvel. You will feel like walking into a dream where all good things take a material form. For a couple of hours, The little child inside of me came alive and forgot about the worries lying beyond those floral walls.

Stunning!!!. What an amazing place if you like flowers and are interested in what has been created in a desert area. So colourful . We spent about 2hrs there but I would imagine that in the height of the season, you would need 3 hrs. It cost 39 dirams to get in and worth the cost. We got there from downtown Dubai by getting the 105 bus from the Mall of the Emirates and it cost 5dirams you need to by a card from the bus station which cost 15 dirams. But that is enough to go,on the metro etc.its easy to charge the card up when it runs out. You must check the running time is the bus as when we were there it did not start running till 1400hrs.

Very pretty. Although out of the centre of Dubai, if you like flowers its brilliant. Lots of very bright flowers arranged it the most amazing ways to form buildings shapes and structures that you cant beleive, even in January it was v hot take an umbrella as a parasole and suncream, well worth a visit.

Beautiful place, good cafes, convenient parking/shuttle bus from Mall of Emirates,. This is a beautiful place to visit, ideal for any age group, nationality and also suitable for families. It is very impressive to view the amount of work that has gone into the planning and implementation of the gardens. Alot of imagination has been put into the Miracel Garden. Various buildings, animals, scenery and worldwide landmarks have become transformed with colourful displays of flowers. There is a good selection of reasonably priced refreshment places including cafes. Parking is easy to find and in the front of the entrance. A shuttle bus is provided from Mall of the Emirates, but I have not used this yet. There is an admission fee. My only criticism is that you have to pay separate for the Butterfly Garden. It would be so much more convenient if you could buy a joint ticket for entrance to the Miracle and the Butterfly Garden, perhaps with some discount for buying a double ticket.

Beautiful Garden. Miracle garden is a very beautiful garden with a large collection of beautiful flowers of all the varieties you can imagine. It is an excellent place to visit for nature and flower lovers and very good for family outings.
Must visit place. Wonderful place to visit. This attraction is not open in summers. You can take a bus from Mall of Emirets or taxi will cost around 25AED.

A little slice of heaven...... WOW!!! We were there during December 2015 & what a spectacular visual & sensory experience!!! Such attention to detail. Its as if you are in a magical kingdom within a fairy tale. You have to experience this wonderland...a must see!!!

like heaven in the desert in winter.. like heaven in the desert in winter. world famous structures are made of flowers and oranges. good place for shooting photos.... many dubai visitors miss this place but should visit this oasis ...also have food courts for long stay.
Go if you have now else to be. Floral arrangments in the form of fairy tale houses and castles. Lemon and orange replicas of world famous landmark. That's about it.

Good , if you have some time . But not Must watch !. i have been here in Jan 2016 (winter). it is good gardens to spend 1-1.5 hours and if you have kids they will enjoy too. Theme changes every year, but it is very well maintained . Should aprpeciate the effort and beauty of the Gardens. Entry fee 30 AED is okay , but reaching this park will cost 70-80AED in a taxi (go and come) and not accessible thru' Metro.You have good options to eat and you get all types of food / snack items.Overall - Nice place to hang out for 2 hours , but only if you have some left over time in Dubai.
best thing i ever seen!!!. most gorgeous place ever. most amazing garden ever seen in life in the middle of a dessert. must see must do . great for pics. go in the day time before sunset.
Beautiful Flowers. It is one of the top attractions of Dubai tour. There are lots of things whicha re purely made of flowers and it is very beautiful.

If you love colour and flowers you will love this!. Fantastic arrange of flowers arranged in various shapes and buildings. Lovely to wander round and admire the beauty of the flowers. There are also a few eateries and shops if you need a bnite to eat and to rest your feet!

We liked it!. This place is beautiful. A lot of flowers and greenery. There are a lot of places to sit and have a rest, if you're tired, and food is tasty as always. It's one of the best places in Dubai.

Peace of Mind. Its one of its kind.. Totally fantastic and very well maintained.. You will definately want to spent some of your quality time here. All the shaps and whole idea is unique and vsry beautiful. We enjoyed here.

The most beautiful place I have ever seen. Once you reach Miracle Gardens, you will totally forget this place is actually in the middle of the desert. There are more than 45 million individual flowers here and they are all meticulously arranged to create a pristine scenery. I highly recommend you a visit there.The only reliable way to get there is by taxi, which should cost around AED 60 from Downtown depending on the traffic and the route the driver takes. There is also an entry fee of AED 30.Despite its completely outdoors, you are not allowed to smoke inside, so if you are a smoker, I recommend having one before you enter the area as you are likely to spend at least 2 hours in there.

Very good garden. It is situated near Dubai auto city.You can take a taxi or bus from mall of emirates.We went there on a friday,so it was very busy.It's worth seeing at least once,as there are a huge number of flowers arranged in various shapes.But I felt that the variety is lacking.We didn't see any roses,like in moghal gardens in delhi.Without roses it didn't feel complete.Anyway,a great garden to see when you are in Dubai,if it's open.The transportation is not easy.we had to wait for half hour to get a taxi.You must go to gate no.2 at the exit to get the bus to mall of emirates.We went to gate no.1 and no transportation was there.This is the only place in Dubai,where we felt somewhat scary during the night,because of the lack of lights and lack of transportation.

Miracle Garden. Another tourist trap, if you enjoy art and color then this is a. Nice place to visit however there is a lack in the variety of Flowers and everything inside is expensive, food and drinks included.
Excellent experience. I can say, Without visiting miracle garden your dubai visit will be incomplete.A number of flowers in a desert.

Perfect flowers in the middle of the desert.. This place is awesome for a couple of things. One, so many flowers in exquisite formations. Two, lively, vibrant flowers in the middle of the desert.
Expect to spend about two hours here. You don't know where to look first, at every turn you are amazed at the flowers, the decorations and wonder of it all.
Pretty. Great place for photos. Mostly non-native flowers but we'll tended and very colorful. Bring cash for refreshments along the way as it can get very hot.

What a miraculously manicured garden!. This is indeed a miracle garden...even before you enter, you can see the shapes so beautifully done, with flowers, that you believe you are in some wonderful land. We came here by cab, after changing metros as this garden is not near the metro station. The entry fee is AED 30 per person, and children below 3 goes free. However, no edibles allowed inside...so I had to leave my bag outside the gate on an unattended chair. I got it back after 1.5 hours, as is :-)This garden gives several opportunities for photography. Because there is always more beautiful shapes ahead. Be careful not to touch, though the guards ensure that very well. A great garden to visit in the winter!

Nature at its best. It is situated on the outskirts of Dubai. But once you enter it, i mesmerizes you. Since, we went in december the flowers were in bloom. Each and every section of the garden was worth time spending. Do visit it if you are visiting dubai when it is open

Stunning snd romantic . Beautiful garden where everything from the houses to hearts are made from flowers. This is one of the most romantic places to visit in Dubai. We hadn't heard of it previously, however on arriving in Dubai for part of our honeymoon, it was recommended to us by multiple people and it was really worth the trip out to it. It is quite a way out from the city in a remote area. Plenty of food and drink places when you are there. Take a camera as there's a photo opportunity around every corner!

*Dubai Miracle Garden. *Dubai Miracle Garden. Opened in 2013, the world's largest natural flower garden is an impressive sight, indeed. 45 million flowers on a spread of 72,000 m2. In the heart of the desert! Entrance fee 30 UAE dirham ~ 7 euros. Undoubtedly a ‚must-see’!

Interesting place. I enjoyed my visit here, I wished I hadn’t gone on a Friday as this is the holy day and it was extremely busy. Used the hop on hop off bus which took a long time as the roads where heavily congested.

Must do. The Miracle garden is wonderful.The flowers and plants in different shapes really provide several picture opportunities. It is wonder to see such a beautiful garden in the Desert. Hope you travel in January to enjoy this place. Not sure how it looks in the hotter months.

Beautiful Afternoon Out. A little pricey for Garden Entrance, but this is like no other garden that you've visited. With 100s if not 1000s of different flower varieties arranged in stunning shapes, sizes and characters. Sit, Take a selfie, breathe in the fragrances. Enjoy.
nice place for pictures. my children really enjoyed the place,flowers everywhere with different types of shape and colors,the place is awesome

Lovely garden, refreshing and inventive. We went to miracle garden on our honeymoon. It is exactly what it says on the tin. A great morning out and an inventive design for a flower show. The only drawback was that it was in the middle of nowhere so you have to make a special trip out to it. Everyone wants to photograph the same thing. My advice would be to go out of season to make sure you see all of the exhibits.

Oh! Its real miracle. This flower garden is a real miracle and amazing and spectacular attraction one must not miss before leaving Dubai.All different colors of flowers depicted in the form of various designs og mosque,cars,birds,trains,doors and what not.Its beautiful for nature lovers.Its a real beautiful flower garden and more attractive in the night with lights.Its pleasant and lovable attraction.The designs change every year and well maintained.You can see it again and again as it is different every year.MUST SEE.

Great Attraction, Rude Staff. You will find many variety of flowers here in bright colors and arranged in different themes.... Unfortunately the only flowers you will see are those that can stand heat.We encountered a lot of rude staff out there so be aware of this. If you plan to visit the butterfly garden make sure you are not going back to this miracle garden otherwise they will ask you to pay again regardless you show them your admission ticket..

Hidden Dubai Gem. Miracle Garden truly is a unique and beautiful place. It's as if you are walking through a work of art. It has been so thoughtfully planned and has really expanded and developed over the last few years since opening. My relatives ask to visit every time they come to stay as there is always something new to see. The flower sculptures, especially the cars are incredible, as is the flower covered mosque which is stunning. This is a must see place and something I've certainly never seen anywhere else on my travels. Good value for money and many different food and drink outlets.

Commercial and overrated. I really wanted to like this...but everything from the techno music, to the weird trashy Disney theme running through it made us leave within 10 minutes. To be fair you could see the whole thing within 10 minutes and that's being generous. Very commercial and unless you've never seen flowers before then I would give it a miss!!

very good. it's all about the name miracle garden the perfect place for amazing photos the only problem was the heat it was in april and very hot in dubai maybe in january the flowers appear more fresh and live

A Must Visit Place. We are regular visitors of Miracle garden. Our first visit to miracle garden was when it was in Al Ain, and then every year autumn to winter at least once we will visit the garden with family and friends.Its inexpressible, Bright colored flowers laid in such an artistic manner. It’s a “Must Visit Place in Dubai”. Usually Autumn (Oct – Nov) to Winter (Dec – Feb) is the best to time to visit Miracle garden. I would suggest visiting the garden in day light to feel the magnificence. In Autumn you can plan for a visit around 4pm in the evening, so that you can see the garden in day and night light. In Winter I prefer visiting the garden around anytime between 10am – 4pm, due to the extreme weather condition by evening. Plan a relax day out at Miracle garden - Take a stroll around the beautiful garden. Bring your cameras along to get some memorable clicks. Grab a bite at the food corner. Relax with a book or music.Timings: 9 am - 9 pm: Weekdays | 9 am - 11 pm: Weekends (Friday & Saturday)Fee: Regular Admission AED 30/- per person (Free for children 3yrs old and below)

The name sums it up!!. As the name tells it, this place is truly a miracle garden. One cannot expect that there would be such a beautiful place decorated with flowering plants across gates in the middle of a desert. But yes it is true,beyond the dates are various decorations made entirely from flowering plants. The skill and patience it takes to maintain such a place in those kind of conditions has to be truly appreciated.

Man made Miracle in Dubai. Visited Miracle Garden, Dubai during our family vacation at Dubai. It took us about a 45 minute pleasant drive by car to reach Miracle Garden from our hotel in Bur Dubai. The place has an amazing collection of flowers of all varieties-not a flower expert myself so reallly can't name them. It was a visual delight, very well maintained and has some quaint eating place within to have small snacks, refreshing coconut water and tea/coffee. We spent about 90 minutes in the place but you can easily spend a half day or more easily - it is so beautiful. A nice place to have a picnic for a leisurely family outing specially if you have young kids. There was a queue to purchase the tickets but I understand the tickets can be purchased online also. December was a pleasant month to visit. Photographs to follow. Worth a visit if you are in Dubai on a holiday.
Flowers, Flowers Everywhere!. A charmingly beautiful place to visit and to bring the family. Flower houses, gardens and more with nice paths to stroll and enjoy. Relaxing and intriguing....

Extremely picturesque . Had taken a trip with my mom and sister even after some bad reviews I decided to give it a shot...and this was absolutely worth every effort we took to get here I would hv regret everytime I would hv thought of it....in the middle of a man made city something sooo beautiful with flowers all around and absolutely well maintained. ...this place can not be given a miss when in dubai.Tickets price: 15 Aed per adult,kids and special kids freeTime taken : I took 2.5 to 3 hrs rest depends on how many pictures u want to take.Best time to visit :check the weather before coming ,in the afternoon it can get hot to roam around in a garden...
Miracle. The Miracle garden was, and still remains one of my favorite places to visit in Dubai. It's a nice place of leisure for young and old, family, friends and everyone.
Really a miracle. The beauty about this garden is the variety of flowers that they have. In fact a lot of shootings have also taken place at this venue.

Beauty of Flowers. If you love flowers then you should visit this place. It took us more than 2 hours for completing a tour of this place. Every design is good and unique. If you are visiting Dubai and you love flowers then dont miss this place.
The highlight of my Dubai visit. Absolutely beautiful. Spotless. So unexpected, but so enjoyed. Visitors to Dubai must stop to smell the flowers, millions of them.

Flowers looks like carpet.. For flower lovers. It is a very nice spot for flower lovers .. it looks like a flower carpet .. If u want to take photos with good ambience or good background. . You may visit this .. If u r not interested in flowers .. It is hard ..

Over the top, but beautiful. Visited in the cool month of December with my folks and a toddler. Advise to arrive in the morning as by midday it is hot and crowded. We got there 9:30am and had the whole place to ourselves. Flowers were amazing and the designs were elaborate. Seems a little over the top, but it is visually stunning what they have achieved.

Simply Stunning. I've been to Botanical gardens in various cities, from New York to Denver but nothing compares to the brilliance of the Dubai Miracle Garden. There are many different stunning displays here and every shot I captured on camera is so vivid and full of color. There are floral structures unlike anything I've seen. This is a must-see in Dubai and something you must see in person.

For flower lovers!. The miracle gardens are very beautiful. It is best to visit when the sun is not very strong. The gardens are big and you can easily spend a couple of hours walking around. They also have different spot to take lovely pictures. A nice pace for a family outing. I spotted a couple of cafes around but did not see many people using their facilities.

Beautifully made and maintained. This whole place is made up of colourful flowers of different species and kind. The designers of this place had given a lot of thought into it. It is a very beautiful place especially when you think that they have built this right in the middle of a desert. Do take your cameras along so you capture this place well. The food inside is a little expensive, but there is good amount of options and the food court has ample seating space.Don't forget to carry sunglasses as since this place is in the open it might be very difficult without shades if its too sunny.

A flower wonderland. Miracle Garden is a must visit attraction in Dubai & is like a wonderland where every thing is decorated & covered with flowers.
The garden is really big so plan to be there early as it takes around 2-3 hours to cover the place
A Flower wonderland. It is a must see when you are in Dubai during the winter months. Cannot believe there are so many flowers in a "desert"

Curiosity. Nice place to visit when you have a lot of time. The concept is nice but there s no variety of flowers. At the end it s not that much interesting , but if you come don't forget to visit the butterfly garden just 2 minutes from the miracle garden.

Breathtaking! A Picturesque Place!. Went there with 6 adults. 2 seniors and 2 young children on January 1st, 2016. The crowd was expected especially FGB credit card offered a buy 1 take 1 on that day. This was my second time in this garden and it still amazes me. The last time I went was in 2014 February and their decoration was hearts and romantic. This year, I saw new stuffs like the Eiffel Tower, Burj Khalifa, Japanese Castle (?) and Windmills. They were all in mustard/tangerine/orange colors and they look great in photos. The Burj Khalifa changes colors at night while the Eiffel Tower also had its on and off lights. Beautiful.The food was quite pricey but we manage to eat ice cream (ordinary quality) for 10 dhs a scoop. Average rates of food (no drinks yet) was 25-30 dhs. Luckily, I bought some taco wraps with salmon and lettuce that I wrapped in a foil. So good that it was perfect for that trip.Entrance was 30 dhs per head but we got a great deal from our FGB credit card, buy 1 take 1! Whoa! :-) Parking was ample though you need to walk quite a bit if you happen to arrive on the peak hours. We arrived at 3pm and managed to get a parking quite near the place -- after taking rounds.Toilet (female) was okay but very few -- like 4-5 cubicles only. NO DIAPER CHANGER FOR BABIES.I will recommend all tourist to visit this garden. Next , I want to see the Dubai Butterfly Garden.

it is really miraculous , a garden in a desert. This came recommended from a lot of friends and travellers , worth a family visit and YES , and boy was it worth . The care and nurturing that has gone into creating this is really worth mentioning . most of the flowers are on creepers and the innovation in landscaping it is appreciable. Since the climate also helped( still cool) it was really an enjoyable experience . A must see when you visit dubai

Miracle garden-must visit place. We visited Miracle Garden in the first week of January 2016 and enjoyed every moment being there. Beautiful flower creations, display of famous monuments with flowers and fruits and lovely scenic beauty bowled us over. We took hundreds of pictures there and enjoyed tasty snacks here as well. Reaching Miracle Garden was convenient. As we had pre booked our tickets for the place, so there was no waiting time to get inside.

Magical Beauty in the Desert!. The Miracle Gardens, about 30 mins by taxi from Mall of the Emirates, is a must to visit when in Dubai especially when you have younger children and want to get away from the hustle and bustle of the malls. It is amazing to behold all the various designs made from flowers. All super sized of course! The entry fee of 30 dirhams is a bit high but totally worth it. Can easily soend about 2 hours there. Don't forget to Bring a camera and take lots of photos. A little out of the way. Try to combine wih visiting Global Village which is about 10 mins drive away.

Truly a miracle by all means. If you happen to be in Dubai and miss this one, then you apparently are a crazy one. Its such a beautiful park. You would be amazed by each section of it. Wonderfully maintained.Tip - couple it with Butterfly Garden on the same day. Both are nearby. Do the Butterfly Garden first and then move on to Miracle Garden. This way you will avoid the rush and you will get better day light for outdoor photography in afternoon-evening at Miracle Garden. Though, check the timings for both :)

A Wonderful Place to visit!. The place feels fresh and alive with all the lovely flowers and decorations. We were so glad that we visited this place. It's not expensive to enter and there is so much to see. You'll enjoy it if you appreciate nature!

Nice and colorful. For those who like landscaped areas and colorful designs with flowers, this is the place to go to in Dubai. At first, accessibility by car was not easy so better be with a group (bus). Inside the park, the flower designs were awesome and excellent with a variety of displays. well recommended for families with teens

A must to visit when your in Dubai. My first day in DUBAI, is to see this place once and for all, we went to Union station to get our day card(40 derham) to room around DUBAI city, and we reach the place Mall of EMIRITES,took a bus to visit the Miracle Garden, but the bus will not take you there, you have to ride a taxi (40 derham) and pay the entrance 30 derham to explore all flowers that I want to see,A LOT OF DIFERRENT COLORS of flowers, Miracle Garden has unique way to offer you such a place in the middle of desert and it grown and offer you to see,at first I could not believe that DUBAI can made this as natural to grow such delicate flowers in the desert, seems fake that convince me to see in actual, there you are it's really Miracle garden but no particular smell of flowers you can have?.....but I recommend the place to see if you visit DUBAI,solo,family, tourist people you must.

Refreshing effect of nature. If you love nature specifically the view of colorful flowers, this garden spot is ideal for you. To avoid the sun's scorching heat, be at the site before 9 am or around 3 in the afternoon. The Egyptian fatayer as side food is a must try.
Must visit this garden. Must visit this garden. You need one full day to appreciate the design, the type of flowers, colors of the flowers, etc.

A Miracle. It is amazing that they could make such a garden in a middle of the dessert. Maybe that's why they call it Miracle Garden. Entrance is 30aed. For me, it is worth it. All you need is an hour to spare and a good camera.

Not a must see but worth a visit.. Even if you are not into gardening or gardens at all you could appreciate the beauty of this place. So many colours, so many patterns and creativity. It is definitely worth a trip if you are in Dubai and have time. I wouldn't say it is a must see if you are very short on time, but for me it was a lovely way to spend the afternoon with my best friend.

magical place. I'm a big fan for flowers, this place is a magical place and so different from what you can see in Dubai, far from the city and the modern lifestyle back the gardens and nature. you'll be so surprised to see so much colors of flowers and statues done out of flowers. beautiful place to go with the family or for a day out in the weekend.

Schmaltzy but pretty. Not worth $74 tour rate. Take public transport. Easy and cheap. Check open and closing times. This will never put the Bouchard Gardens out of business.... But it does beat Disney's Small World exhibit

Mesmerizing.. This place is generally not included in itinerary by tour organisers. But this place must not be left out. The scenic beauty and how they manage the place in the heat of deserts is not short of a miracle and hence the place is aptly called Miracle Garden. The whole garden is full of flowers of different hue and colours. The food court is also not that expensive if compared with other attractions in Dubai. The food court has variety of foods for every palate.

Pretty sight. It was a pretty sight and a creative display of flowers (and even fruits) used to adorn structures like houses, and planting flowers in bicycle pots and old used cars. But the variety of flowers were lacking. Best to get there in the morning as the sun gets note and crowds start filling in at 11am.

Nice garden but a short visit is enough. It's definitely a nice and a very well maintained garden with lots of eating joints inside the garden area. If your purpose is just to see the garden and not spend time in eating joins then I guess 1 hour visit is enough.

Lovely flower garden. Coming from Holland we suppose to know all about flowers. Very likely even more than people in Dubai. It is obviously very difficult to grow or keep alive so many flowers. The climate is simply not really suitable for flowers. Avisit to Miracle Garden therefore is best done in the winter say from november to march.You don't know what to expect and for most tourist it is probably half an hour drive from their hotel.On arrival you notice that they are ready to receive and welcome lots of visitors. When we came you could say it really was very quite. After entering through big wooden doors you step into the gardens. Paths leading you through all kinds of themse from windmills to upside down houses or small trains (country themes as they carry flags from different countries). After several visits to Dubai I was wondering where to go to next. This was on the list. It wasnt the most impressive excursion I have done in my life and I would not recommend this to first time visitors to Dubai. However if you have been here sevral times and you have nothing to do on a lazy sunday afternoon, just go there an hour or so and enjoy. It saves you a trip to the "keukenhof" in Holland where millions of people go to every year.

It really IS!. It is, as named, a miracle. Never seen so many flowers of so many colours displayed so beautifully and artistically. That too in a desert! A very clever irrigation system makes it possible. We have been before and understand the theme is changed periodically as is the colour scheme. There are shapes of all kinds the made out of flowers and huge expanse of areas covered in flowers. It is a place not to be missed. We have visited in summer and it was still beautiful.

A MUST-Visit Place: Feeling short of Words to Describe its Majestic Beauty. Duba's Miracle Garden needs no introduction for most travelers who ever visited this amazing city. Right in the middle of desert, it indeed is a MIRACLE GARDEN! With tens of flower varieties blooming all around in a huge garden with awe-inspiring houses, arches, global train, cars, peacocks and a mini Burj Khalifa all laden with hundreds of colourful flowers, this is certainly a place of beauty which is a joy for ever.I feel the same joy upon remembering this amazingly beautiful place which Wordsworth had expressed in "Daffodils"

Most incredible flower display!. We visited the Dubai Miracle Gardens in December 2015. We were staying along the Dubai Marina and caught a taxi to the gardens - which was a 15-20 minute drive. The gardens are incredible! The detail of the flower displays and shapes will blow you away. I'm not a massive flower or gardening fan, but I was able to appreciate the magnitude of the gardens and how much time, effort and work has gone into keeping it pristine and well maintained. The creativity and beauty of the flower displays is something out of this world. Take comfy shoes, because you'll do a fair amount of walking around the garden. If you stick around the gardens until early evening, the queues to get a taxi back will be really long and may take a while - just be patient.

Lovely flower garden!!!. Well maintained garden with colourful flowers grown on figures like houses, boats, peacocks, lady bugs, butterflies etc. Really beautiful and gives you scope for stunning colorful pictures tooo...Avoid public holidays as it will be crowded with people. It has an entry fee of AED 30/- per head and children below 3 go free. A food court is also available inside the garden.There is a butterfly garden adjacent to it with an additional entry fee.

An Evening in the Gardens. As a lover of flowers, it was a must for me to go to Miracle Gardens in Dubai. It's a lovely flower garden with lovely flower pieces that are insanely creative. There is a lovely area inside where you can sit down and have a snack too as well as kiosks all over the garden selling snacks. There's also a service where you can be driven around the garden in a golf kart. You do however have to pay a little amount of money for that but it's nice if you prefer not to walk. This garden was really absolutely stunning.
Oasis!. It's amazing please for taking rest after big city! A lot of flowers, amazing smell, very peace place! It's really oasis in the middle of the desert!!

Interesting oasis in a desert region. The idea of so many manicured gardens, three dimensional structures covered in flowers and flower beds in a desert region was intriguing, and captured the imagination on arrival. Sadly, however, many of the same flowers were used throughout the attraction, and the items on display were quite repetitive. It was also very disappointing that the butterfly house was not included in the ticket price, and we did not find the edible garden that was mentioned on the website.The gardeners obviously worked very hard to present it so beautifully, and the birthday clock was a nice idea. Unfortunately though, it only took a bit over half an hour to view everything on offer.We were glad we went early so that photo opportunities without crowds were possible. However at that time we didn't feel like stopping for food so this made the visit even shorter.All up, although a novelty attraction, it was a bit disappointing.
Disssapointing. If you love butterflies, this crowded, commercial experience with folk touching and trashing this loved species is not for you.
Miracle of flowers. Wonderful experience with the flowers and butterflies. Very nicely done display of flowers. Good place for clicking pictures...
Garden in the Desert. The thought of beautiful flowers in the desert makes one wonder the efforts taken by gardeners. Overall very good experience and seen variety of flowers

Boring place . It's sooooo boring, nothing to do and no actives at all !!!
The same flowers all over the place u can spend only 15 min to see all the place.
it is for real Miracle garden.. Very beautiful place, you would not see it anywhere else. they have butterfly garden by the Miracle garden for extra price. Great place for kids.
Not our scene. My mother wanted to go here and while she enjoyed it, it was not really our scene. For those that like flowers it probably is worth a visit but choose a day when it's not too hot!

A quick tip. Hi, I won't go on about the pretty floral displays as enough reviewers have said it all. I will just give a quick tip or warning. You are not allowed to bring picnics in, or picnic blankets of any kind or scooters, skateboards, games etc. now I can see why you are now allowed to sit on the grass as people would soon ruin the hard work of the Gardeners and trample over flower beds and there were so many people there that kids on scooters etc would be hazardous. Fair enough, but we didn't realise this and so came with different expectations. We went on a Friday at about 1-2pm and it was sooooooo busy that it took some of the joy out of it. If you don't like crowds sticking selfy sticks in front of themselves everywhere you walk then perhaps go early morning or not on a weekend if you can help it.

ok. a big man made park full of flower arrangements. at least the flowers are not plastic. its king of confusing how to get there you might need a GPS, even the signs for it are not visible. but the over all and layout of the arrangements is nice to the eye. there are enough refreshments. entrance fee is 30 aed and im not sure it is opend ll year round.
Mesmerized. Wow, what a place in dubai.... treat to eyes and colors to soul...It was fun experience.. my kid was crazy running around to see all those flowers and colors.

Manmade Miracle. Get down at Mall of Emirates station and hire a cab to the garden. Reach early or near sunset to avoid the heat. The flower display and the ambience is fantastic. Lots of space under shades to sit and relax. There are food courts and a must visit if you have kids with you. Next door is the butterfly park which is also worth visiting.

Garden in the middle of the desert. Not necessarily for the kids, this is an amazing display of live flowers decorating many displays throughout. Think of it as a Rose Bowl Float parade at a standstill:) A little pricey for a non interactive display but the feat of keeping up the gardens along with the amazing photo ops was worth it.

Beautiful Flower Garden. A treat to watch this garden,because the colour combination,and effort made by many people is reached to the heart,a fresh feeling,and the name itself suggests it's a Miracle Garden,

amazing...heaven on earth!. wonderful experience!
flowers all around you.beautiful landscape.a wide colorful garden in the dessert.its amazing how they maintained to grow these flowers in these place.a must see in dubai.
Awesome Garden. Very nice garden with theme flowers and lovely combinations . Better to go in evening. A nice and cool place to visit.

Beautiful Gardens!. I really enjoyed this place! It is stunning and well looked after, with many seating areas and snack places. You can easily spend a couple of hours, although we did go in the cooler weather.

a day full with energy. a wonderful place where you can spend your day between the cool breeze mixed with flowers smell. the feeling takes you to wonderland. i spent the day with the kids from morning and i did not notice that i stayed more than 4 hours there.
very beautiful. One of the most beautiful places in Dubai and the region where the beauties of creation that God created man to see and enjoy

Beauty at its peak!!. This garden is open only for a limited period. and i am really lucky to visit there. Any tourist shouldnt miss this sightseeing. People interested in photography will enjoy this place. Beautiful colors and flowers surrounding you is a feeling that will always be remembered.

Very Beautiful. The entrance fee is just 30AED. It is an outdoor garden. There r different sight settings in the Miracle garden, all made of flowers. It is really a miracle to maintain all the real flowers in the desert land. The themes r pretty, and colourful, esp for girls, we would love it, for picture shooting. They open from 9am to 9pm weekdays, 9am to 11pm on Fri and Satthere s a small restaurant, where u can sit and relax, chill for a while. There s a butterfly garden next to it, but not as impressive as the miracle garden.

Breathtaking. Wow, what an amazing sight to see. You'd never even think that you are in a place that used to be just desert sand. The gardens are made up of different colors and architecture. Make sure to bring a good camera along.

Gorgeous!. If you are in Dubai at the time of the year that this place is open, you cannot miss it! Beautifully decorated and the colours and structures are amazing. Picture heaven!! If you are a photographer you have to visit this place.

Colours fill the Eyes. Amazing and creative display of flowers. Sure it will attract all ages especially woman and children. Fragrance fills the air. To creat something of this magnitude and that too in the middle of the desert you have to applaud their efforts. Awesome display of fruits in the middle of the flowers garden was a welcome break. Avoid nights. Mornings would be crowd free and can also click good pictures.

Miraculous blooms in the desert. Miracle garden is eactly what its name spells... a miracle. Flowers of all hues blooming right in the desert is a wonderful sight for sore eyes and it gives a lovelyl feeling of being in a garden with birds chirping and kids playing around.

A stunner in the middle of the desert. This place is an absolute miracle. You got to see it to believe its beauty. How can you have so many colourful flowers in a desert! Its absolutely amazing. A wonderful thing created in a desert. The flowers are so pretty in colours and are portrayed so well.Fees: The fees of the Miracle Garden is 35 AED per pax.How to Reach: The best is to take the Metro to the Mall of the Emirates. You can cover that mall, and then afterwards, take a taxi to the Miracle Garden. The cab should take approximately AED25. This is the best way to do it. And from there, you can go to Global Village, which is also nearby.
Mesmerizing and Well maintained. Place worth a visit. Flower arrangements are impressive and you tend to click photographs continously. Beautiful and gives a fairy land feel

Very beautiful. I have seen a lot of photos of the Miracle Garden prior to our visit so I somehow expected a lot more when I entered the place. Some of the flowers had yet to bloom so I had to allow my imagination to go into play to complete the experience. The sun was blazing during our visit that we hurried to take souvenir shots and to make a quick tour of the place. Just the same, it was worth the visit. It is not just a beautiful garden but it too, has the added attraction of the flowery replicas of landmarks from other parts of the world like the Eiffel Tower of Paris and the Windmill of Amsterdam along with Dubai's Burj Khalifa

Seeing is believing. This is something to behold. Perfect lazy day outing with the kids (probably not teenagers). Many things to see and they do seem to mix it up each year which keeps it fresh and at AED 30 per person it is money well spent.

The name really mean it "Miracle". - Seasonal only (during November to April)- Cost is 35AED- Spend minimum 3 hours (especially when sunset)- No metro or public transport to this location (only by taxi or by city sightseeing bus)

Time to Spend. Good place to spend with family and not expensive. good to see the flowers , you feel they are not Natural. But sure you will feel happy and forget if you sit for a while with calm mind.

A little disappointing. Unfortunately the teal thing is not as stunning as the photos in its adverts. Flowers are beautiful and imaginatively used but, after a while this wears off as it becomes clear that they are just different shapes of pretty much the same thing. The houses etc clad in fake oranges and lemons are tacky.The saving grace is the entry fee of 30AED and the fact that it is easily reached.
