Clearly others liked it since it was very crowded - although this might have been due to the two things mentioned above.

A Miracle in the desert. The Miracle Garden is well worth a visit. The vast array of flowers in bloom will really take your breath away. It is amazing how they have transformed this bit of desert into a sea of colours. Allow at least 2 to 3 hours to walk around the gardens to get the most from your visit.
Part of Dubai tour . Best place for those who love flowers, garden. Preferred to go in the morning as crowd will be less. Go with dslr so that you get best shots. Couples can click awesome pics.

Worth a trip for first time visitor. If you are a nature lover and adore flowers, this place is for you otherwise it is worth a visit at least once when in Dubai. The flowers are colorful, fascinating and very well maintained with security around. Would recommend to go in the morning (they start by 9am) during week days as the crowd is less. The entrance fee is only AED.30/- which is cheaper compared to other attractions in Dubai. You can walk around, take pictures (although it is kind of irritating if you just want to stroll and look at leisure, and you're unable to as people are posing and blocking the way, however there are very few of these inconsiderate behavior, so it's all good :)The park is well equipped with washrooms, benches, snack & sandwiches outlets, have also seen a pizza hut available. Advisable time to spend would be max 30mins to 1 hour or more depending on your preference. Overall a nice experience to spend some peaceful time.

Not as good as I expected. It was a dull day so decided to visit the gardens. Though an oasis in the desert I had seen pictures on line and expected it to be better, it was not as tidy as I thought it would be and like most attraction full of food concessions.It not worth a second visit.

Beautiful garden on earth. My family love this place so much.. Cant imagine how beautiful this place is. Need to remember its only open during cool season, close on hot season. So best time will be on december. Next to butterfly garden but need to purchace another ticket. After visiting this place you can go to global village that open at 4 pm which only take around 10 to 15 minutes via taxi. :)

Not recommended for small children. we decided to visit the gardens based on the good reviews I had seen on tripadvisor, but we were disappointed. its really not the place to visit with small children as they are not allowed to touch any of the flower or step onto the grass, so you will be constantly holding your children back. be prepared for huge crowds, and massive traffic jams both entering and exiting the park.

Go early in the morning. I arrived yesterday just before they opened the gates, and that was the best decision I made all day, as it gets very busy as the hours go by. At 9 o'clock in the morning this park was still peaceful, and I had a chance to take pictures of just it's beauty without lots of random people in my shots. I love flowers, and I was amazed at how beautiful and vibrant everything looked. It's easy to forget that you're actually in the desert. At around 11 o'clock it got very busy, and it wasn't even a weekend. So if you love taking photos, do as I did and go early, very early! It's well worth a visit, and I will definitely recommend it to my friends. If they change the display on a yearly basis I will gladly come again next year!
Fascinating. The Miracle Gardens are a fascinating bright spot amidst the sand, and worth a visit. The Ladies, in particular loved it.

A good place for a morning visit. For the price and comparing this to the Dubai Glow Garden this is really a value for money. Nice for an early morning visit and worthwhile to explore. Great for picture taking, and amazing for this garden to be develop in a dessert location.

A Flower Oasis in the outskirts. The drive to Miracle Garden was around 25 mins from Oud Metha in my cousin's car. Please do reach by 4pm max & all the shutter bugs will be happy. The place is basically a 4 star rating only bcoz the flowers are not in their natural environment. The entire plants are picked up with roots & replanted in the sand with drip irrigation to give the look.That apart the level of detailing & effort gone into creating this flowery paradise in the desert is again only possible in DUBAI.Lovely place & selfie kings / queens will love it. There is also a small food area with nice juices & arabic pastries. Overall a good 4 hours spent.

Flower Garden. This garden use to be in Al Ain with free entrance. Now we have to drive more than 100km from Al Ain to visit. But it's worth it. A fee of 35 dirhams per person is charged with an extra 25dirhams to enter the Butterfly Garden.
Visual Treat. Do visit the Miracle Garden , A good break from the concrete jungle , visit in early evening to avoid the heat.

Just A Place Full of Normal Back Garden Flowers. Decided to pay a visit to this place since the weather was good and I have read so many good reviews...It was really disappointing...There was a lack of directional signs leading to this place and the roads were narrow causing a long queue on the day we visited. Parking space was very limited as well...The queue for the tickets was worse than the traffic jam as only two ticket booths were available....There wasn't anything special in the garden except lots of very ordinary garden flowers formed as houses, hearts, and different shapes....Having visited botanical gardens in Singapore (including Gardens by the Bay) and London, this garden is comparatively very normal and basic....there is no educational materials and everything in the garden are easily available in any garden centre or nursery...I usually take lots of photos when visiting gardens but on this occasion, I really didn't feel like taking pictures of ordinary flowers and Burj Khalifa or Eiffel Tower made from plastic oranges....And the plants are not that well maintained either....

Expensive park. Its a normal flower park that charged very expensive for the ticket.For dhs 30 per pax, only to enter this park, I think it is not worth for money.To enter the other park, bitterfly park, you have to buy a different ticket.It is a good place for winter outer if the price is not that expensive.Food availability inside the park also limited.

Beautiful Gardens. It's very beautiful what they've done in terms of creativity and architecture, however unfortunately (which could be mostly due to climate) there is not that much diversity in the types of flowers themselves.I'm a bit confused though why the security kept whistling at people who wanted to sit on ledges to take photographs, despite them not being near anything unsafe.Apart from that, it is a great experience that everyone in Dubai must check out.

Classic. Very nice garden which is maintained very well. It is very beautiful and must visit. Just make sure you visit butterfly show first as everyone was under impression that it's part of Miracle Garden but it's not. If you come out of garden you cant enter again with same ticket.

Awesome place. We went late in the evening...Yet had loads of fun....The colorful flowers around...The houses done in flowers...Everything was just beautiful....Would love to visit during the day as well

Incredible, fun and crazy. Excellent visit to a crazy world of colour, flowers and slight madness! Entrance fee was 30D and well worth it! We spend half a day just wandering round the marvels that have been created - all in glorious bloom! If you plan on taking in a picnic, don't bother as you can't take in food or drink (only water). Food inside is rather limited and not exactly cheap. Better just to try the watermelon, corn on the cob and finish with an ice-cream! The structures are really quite amazing - leaves you wondering how many people work on maintaining it overnight! A blooming great sight for the eyes!
Amazing. I think this is a great attraction. You need about 2hrs Remember to take lots of photos. It look like the pictures on Google. Alice in wonderland paradise.
Great way to spend an afternoon . We had a fantastic family afternoon at the garden. My expectations were low but was really surprised at the different creations made from flowers.

Big garden, but not at all a miracle. We expected to see something special, being called "miracle garden", but we didn't managed to find what it was :)). It's just a big garden with lots of normal flowers, which seemed to be a very interesting place for kids to play.Keeping in mind the distance you have to pass in ordes to reach it, I recomend it only if you go with the kids.

Must see!!. It is all man made but it's just out of this world it is must see if you r in Dubai.Best time to visit is near sunset as after sunset they have different lighting which makes garden look just awesome.

Just ok. I thought it was s normal park just with loads of nice flowers. With such an idea we went with my son and his bicycle. However no bicycles allowed and there's a fee of 30aed per person. Also very annoyed that to enter the butterflies you have to exit the garden without s chance to go back in. Btw, the butterflies have an extra fee of 50aed. I think all is nice but not worth what you pay. Maybe it's only my opinion since I'm not a great fan of flowers. Ah, also food and drinks inside are overpriced.

A place that is good to visit.. You can get there easily by taxi, around 18 km away. Walk for a few hours with refreshments. It consists of three gardens. Main Miracle Garden, Butterfly and back one more. Pictures speak for themselves, and so few pictures.

A bit out-of-the-way but well worth it!. This garden takes about an hour to visit and provides ample opportunity to take lots of nice photos (my humble attempts are attached). It's outdoors, so enjoy it while the temperature is 30C or less, otherwise it may get uncomfortably hot. Food & drinks are available - but you can also bring your own. Entry per person is 30 AED, which is well worth it. There are many shaded spaces (aka gazebos) for family picnic. Enjoy!

Very Beautiful. This is one of the must see attraction. So pretty. Just too amazing so many flowers and very colorful. A good half day outing.You can take tons of pictures there is also butterfly garden separate ticket for that. It is worth the trip for whole family all ages.

Good family time.... Good place to spend an evening in Dubai with family. We visited during end of Dec'15, it was quiet cold, suggest carrying some warm clothing if visiting during the period. Not much variety of flowers but very colourful presentation and very well laid-out. Great effort by the developers given the fact, the garden is in the middle of a desert. Need a car to get there. They seem to have a bus service from the Mall of Emirates (to be confirmed). They do have golf carts for people who cannot walk much.

Beautiful island of flowers stark in the middle of desert. It's a miracle how they managed to create a full in-bloom garden in the desert. A beautiful place to walk around, you'll need around an hour to cover it at a comfortable pace. Most of it is in the open, so evenings would be a better time to visit to avoid getting burnt in the sun. There is an entry ticket.Access would be easiest by a taxi from the Mall of Emirates metro station, if you are riding the metro. It's a relatively long 15-20 minute taxi ride, around 28-33 AED one way.

Beauty of Flowers. If one loves to be near the nature, a place must visit to observe how beautifully the flowers have been planted, arranged in different themes and combinations. A lovely place...............

Beautiful. A fun place for family. Amazingly colorful and love to see the creativity all around. The car waterfall was kinda misfit but rest everything was colorfully and aesthetically done. Don't miss fruit sorbets at stall over there.

Very pretty but beware of taxi scam. The garden is truly miraculous. Lots of beautiful flowers amazingly landscaped. A little far out though. The only drawback was the lack of taxis when we were ready to leave. Private taxis ask for a ridiculous rate as they know desperate visitors who need to go back have little option. The management should do something about this.

Magical Miracle. We were totally mesmerised by the Awesome views of the flowers in the Miracle Garden. It was like a fairyland and we had to pinch ourselves to convince us that it is real! These gardens are a treat to watch and an absolute Must See For all visitors. One feels as if he or she is in Holland and not in a desert area like Dubai. A visit to these gardens was one of the highlights of our Dubai trip and totally unforgettable. Tip - try to go early to beat the crowd and the sun! And take loads of pics!!

Worth a visit. Situated to the south of Dubai, this attraction is worth a visit. It is inexpensive to enter (if not easy to find by car) and comprises miniature structures ( including a replica of the Burj Khalifa) covered in flowers or fruits. Children clearly love it and it is very oriented to families, with plenty of food, drink and ice cream on offer. The structures covered in flowers are delightful and the array of colour is impressive, mainly generated by different coloured petunia but also marigolds and antirrhinum. It took us about an hour to walk around, but one could easily spend longer.

Green patch in the desert. The garden is beautifully arranged floral decorations and has lots of selfie & photo moments to offer. You will be overwhelmed by the colours & variety of the flowers here. A bit away from the city, but worth a flying visit.
Simply Stunning Garden. Beautiful manmade garden, I had gone with my elderly parents, they absolutely loved it and I also enjoyed a lot.

Beautiful colours but not much diversity.. Miracle gardens is a great place to escape the hustle and bustle of Dubai. It is quiet, family friendly and one could easily spend half a day there. There is entrance fee of 20AED but the park is open till late evening (9PM on weekdays and 11PM on weekends) so enough value for money.
Amazing. Only one word to say AMAZING.Well maintained, flowers everywhere in all shapes and forms, very well maintained. A must visit

Absolutely stunning...bit out of the way though. Been meaning to go there for the last few times when visiting Dubai and this time we did! So pleased. From the entrance to the grounds, it is beautiful. We did the outer circle first then weaved in and out of the other sculptures.Enjoy it, also it is a bit far out but take advantage of the bus service that takes you to Mall of Emirates.

Beautiful park just outside Dubai. We visited the park after being in Dubai Butterfly Garden because they are neighboring.It costs 30 dirhams and you can not pay with credit cards but only cash.Inside, as the name suggests, it is a huge garden of flowers of all colors and positioned to form castles and sculptures. There is also a shaded area with bars and restaurants where you can refresh.Taxi ride from the Mall of Emirates takes about 30 dirhamsI think it is a nice place to spend a couple of hours to walk outdoors

Marvelous garden with beautiful floral creation. Not a garden person but this place was superb. Best time to go in the evening around 4 and get the perfect pictures. Floral Eiffel Tower, houses, churches and beautiful floral work. Worth a visit!

Kitschy Garden. Not the least bit educational, at least in terms of botany. If you’re interested in observing a cross-section of Dubai residents take selfies and snack while strolling through a garden featuring a two-story popcorn box (from which popcorn is sold), overturned cars (an appropriate touch of local culture), and a replica of the Burj Khalifa made from plastic lemons and oranges, then Miracle Garden is not to be missed and a genuine opportunity to learn about the often peculiar habits of early 21st century humans.

Recommened place to visit in Dubai. I recommend this garden for Dubai visitors. a very colorfull and beautifull site viewing and sure the kids and adults will love it. its look like the gardens in Netherland but a little bit smaller. i have only 2 negative points and they are; 1st no public transportation can reach the garden except

Flowers bloom in a desert !!!. a nice addition to the many "miracles in dubai" , this one is a visual delight . and while visitors may be used to seeing such things ; residents of UAE don't have this pleasure .your eyes will be awash with flowers and colours , they just never end . a good place for taking lots of photographs - fountains , faux structures covered with flowers and pots ; its a great family activity . Facilites for food and beverages also available inside .Better to visit during winters so that one is not bogged down by the sun .

Awestruck by the natural beauty!. This garden truly justify the meaning of its name. As soon as you enter this park your eyes will start rolling out and you would like to capture each and every part of this park in your shutterbugs. We really had a magnificent time at Miracle garden. Take your cameras along and click endless pictures to savor lifetime memories.

fantastic flowers. this green area is a splendid flower display in the form of architectural flower displays and camera opportunity for all ages. children will love it as well as adults. many photo opportunities and background for just having a cup of tea or coffee and enjoying the lights. Eiffel tower also featured in lights and it will take some time to enjoy all this. bus available..no. 105 from emirates mall to Miracle Gardens. This will give you a peaceful feeling. about 25 minutes from emirates mall by bus.

Truly a Miracle!!. Some reviewers called it a fake or an imitation but this garden is truly magnificent! A lot of work has gone into its creation and maintenance. Conveniently reachable by public bus from The Mall of the Emirates starting at 12 PM, at 5 Dirhams.

The Colorful Miracle !!. Visited this place last week with friends. Close to dubai city however feels dissconnected as the location is very quiet and calm. Ample parking spaces and staff to divert traffic.The entry ticket is mere AED 30. This garden has abundance of flowers with different colors, shapes and sizes. They have smartly used the flowers to make different structures like a peacock, house, heart shape, burj khalifa and eiffel tower. The whole place can be covered in maximum 2 hours. I recommend this place for all those photographic fanatics as there are ample opportunities to capture some really amazing photos.

Dubai Botanical garden Emirates style. Very tacky, flowers everywhere without order or color code. Can be funny for kids I guess but quite boring. But still a nice place to go to disconnect from the city or the desert.

Diifferent, somewhat tacky. Far from the center, this garden is only worth seeing if you have more than a couple of days in Dubai. Unlike any other I've ever seen in the world, it is a good place to spend a couple of hours in the afternoon with young kids.

Lovely park. The park is truly a lovely place. There's not much variety in the flowers but the creative arrangements and radiant colors are simply spectacular. Bring your own refreshment as the stores charge you an arm and a leg. Also, try to have an umbrella on your visit as the place gets really hot.

Flowers used at its best and a must visit. Visited with my family and the place will mesmerise you from the time you enter the park and there are so many photos one will click. Every spot is postcard perfect and there is amazing craftsmanship using the flowers.Tip-- no food allowed. So don't carry any food from home.

Finally something new in Dubai. Great Family outing venue with wonderful floral decorations.Must visit for ladies and kidsNeed a good 3 hours with 15 - 30 minutes of break. Should combine with Butterfly garden which is just adjacent the park.Suggested timings 3-6pm

flower garden. There was a queue to buy tickets and I was not expecting such crowds on a week day evening. They should open up another ticket counter. Not much information on the newly opened butterfly park. When we checked with the security staff, we were informed that it would be closing in 30 mins, and then we wouldn't be allowed back in the garden unless we purchased new tickets, so it was best not to go.The improvement is that they now have a good amount of seating area.

Worth going to see. For Aed 30 per person, this is worth going to see. It's amazing because of the fact it is in a desert. The attraction is that it is very creative, but the flowers are limited to four or five species only.

Idea is great, execution is very poor. Last week we have been at the Dubai Miracle Garden. Many people were telling us that it was a great place and finally we achieved to go there.PARKINGParking problem was tremendous. For the fact that this place is in the outskirts of Dubai, the parking problem could be solved easily. The staff which is arranging the parking is not skilled at all. Somehow they are random people who just do this job volunteering, at least this was the impression. TICKETINGThis is an amusement park. Similar to Disney Land, similar to Universal Studios. It is a place where happy people come to enjoy and to spend time and money. But if the person at the ticketing office does not even look at your face and while ticketing he does not even smile, this gives a bad taste. For 30 AED I expect that this person at the cashier welcomes me at least with a "Good Morning Sir". But obviously this expectation is too high.ENTRANCEA huge crowd, unorganized, no overview and just chaos. Absolutely not Dubai-like. What we experience in Dubai is mostly run for excellence. But here we experienced the opposite.IN THE PARKHonestly, it is not my job to give ideas. My job is to pay AED 30 and to enter and to enjoy a day escape. I have been to many places in my life, such as Disneyland, Universal Studios, SeaWorld, EuropaPark and also Global Village. But I have never had to listen to folks songs or traditional music which was first of all too loud, and did not match with the theme. This kind of songs which this park is playing you normally hear in tea houses where frustrated people sit and sip their teas. How about playing smooth classic music? At the end of the day these flowers are not local flowers, they are most probably from the western part of this world. So it would not be contradiction to play also western influenced modern classic music.Apart from the music, for AED 30 I expect a bit more clean environment. For this you need to hire staff who are cleaning.How about a kind of Chu-Chu train for kids? In places like Ibn-Battuta or Festival City Malls they have such a train which drive kids around and they enjoy it. How about healthy food in a green nature park? I looked at the food option, it was totally junk food oriented. In a park where the theme is nature I would suggest that people can eat healthier food than in a random food court. After so much critics I must say the flowers and the colors are nice. In fact the idea of such a park is amazing, especially knowing that it is in a desert country, makes me happy to see this. But the execution of how the park has been set up and how it is managed, makes me very very sad.

Amazing display of flowers. We visited miracle garden on our honeymoon and loved it. Amazing display of flowers. Try and visit in winter either early morning or in the evening as it gets quite warm in the afternoon.If you enjoy taking pictures this is a great place and it'll take you around 2 to 3 hours to enjoy the place.There's a food court with different cuisines but it's not that great. No prominent food chains. We had pizza which was okayish.

Beautiful Park poor service. You will not believe if you only see the picture. this much beautiful garden and flower in this desert. very nice and beautiful flower shining every where in the garden. Truly Amazon Garden but staff and service man was assigned around the garden were not looks happy. They just rang the whistle and not explaining properly what is the mistake of guest.

Beautiful Floral Works. It was an excellent experience for me with my Family on Jan 2 2015 the day we visited Dubai Miracle Garden with my Brother & Family from Abudhabi. It is a recommended visit for any one visiting the Emirate on the Winter period and a must visit during this period. An enjoyable treat for anyone with or without a love of Garden.

Poor attitude by staff in ticket office. ticket staff quite ruff taking the money for the tickets, and didn't communicate at all with customers. The gardens were magical and well seeing. Enjoyed the whole experience!!

Truly a miracle. We visited miracle gardens and were blown away. We got the bus from the mall of the emirates at 14.00 they run every 20 mins after this and cost 5 diram each way. Enterance to the garden was 30 dirams money well spent. The gardens are amazing plenty of seats round about and kiosks for drinks and food. The toilets are plentiful and very clean.We spent 3hours here and said we would come back before we leave.I loved every part of the gardens and it would be hard to pick a favourite but I would say it is the clock. Before we left we went to the butterfly farm. 100 diagrams I felt was a bit expensive to go in but we went. Lovely to see but I will not be back there

KInda bizarre in a fascinating way!. This is basically lots of (mainly) petunias in baskets, tubs and fitted into structures such as house frames and different shapes. There are also lots of volkswagon beetles covered in flowers and acting as a fountain. Truly bizarre but worth the reasonable entrance fee. It is amazing that such a showy, flowery place is in the desert! Don't bother with the butterfly place, seemed rather expensive, and beware that you don't get ripped off by the food stalls in the courtyard area, I'm pretty sure we were.

Great place for a few hpurs. We took the bus which was unfortuanately not as efficient as the metro however once at the gardens they were spectacular and we thoroughly enjoyed our visit. Not cheap at 300 paper person but enjoyable.

Good and inspired place. Good place to visit with your beloved family, lots of flowers that gives you a fantastic feeling
I likes it!
Escape the City. This is a great place to go with family for some quiet time out. It's hard to believe that this amazing garden is in the middle of a noisy and crowded city.

wonerful...picturesque...amazing. the first thing tht came in my mind was how do they manage to keep the flowers alive in this hot summer... I was not getting tired of clicking pictures every second with every step in this garden... take a bow for such a wonderful idea of having a park like this in a sandpit Dubai... truly amazing the cafeterias do serve a good choices and also the place is so so so soooo beautiful ... visited this place with my boyfriend and friends we were truly mesmerized by its beauty

Unbelievably amazing!!. It was amazing place to visit with family. I was so amazed for everything I see in this garden. Refreshing and great to enjoy and feel the fresh flowers around you. I love the concepts, ideas and style they made to this garden. I highly recommend this place to everyone!!! It is the city of dreams and future
Color Riot. Its a visual treat for adults & kids alike with all flowers of different hues ... Its preferable to go in mornings or evenings to avoid the sultry heat during noon times..
Amazing Garden. It is the best garden i had visited , the creativity must be appreciatedflowers flowing from a cup...., house made of flowers etc were superb.

Our trip to Miracle Garden. A beautiful place and difficult to believe that a garden full of flowers can be seen at Dubai. It is a place not to be missed during a trip to Dubai. Although it is 45 minutes drive but it is worth all the trouble.

nice try. nice place to see when in a desert. they tried and succeeded to create this oasis. the flowers were common and as everything else in Dubai this is a (bad) copy of the Netherlands tulip gardens. I am nevertheless positive of the place as it differs from the rest of the place and is relatively cheap compared to the other attractions in Dubai
flowers with sand. it was beautiful,natural and amazing to saw beautiful flowers grown on sand...nice colourful backdrops and wonderful place for photoshoots

Beauty in the middle of the desert. Dubai is mostly well designed buildings. Not too far from the center these gardens flourish in a plethora of beauty. Even the buildings are covered with color. Must provide employment for a lot of people!
A burst of colour in the desert. A very unusual place to visit, as an abundance of flowers and colour coming from cars, bikes etc. Lots of photo opportunities, nice cafes for a quick snack

Nice. A nice garden with a variety of flowers.. full of colours.. it s nice if you have spare time in dubai.. quite affordable.. not the best garden i ve visited though.. sure if you have the time is a good alternative for a stroll.. more suitable for kids i suppose..

A miracle to behold. Lovely place to visit. Admission is 30 Aed per adult. Need a taxi to get there. From mall of emirates, it costs about 30 Aed. Best time to visit is late afternoon so that it is not too hot, sufficient light for good photos and get see the garden when the evening lights turn on. In december, it gets cool in the evening and sunset is around 5.30pm. Great place for both young and old. Can easily spend an hour or two walking leisurely taking in the beauty and lovely photo. Easier to catch an rta taxi from the carpark.

Miracle garden adventure.. The wonderful staff at the JW Marriott Marquis recommended the Miracle Garden which was next to the beautiful Butterfly Garden. We spent several hours walking around looking at all the beautiful flowers made into houses, gardens (even had a maze you could wonder through), characters, animals and so much more. I would highly recommend visiting this place.

Amazing achievement. We took the bus 105 from the Mall of the Emirates ......pity that the earliest bus only left at 2pm. It is indeed a miracle to have so many millions of flowers in bloom in the middle of the desert. One can only admire the imagination and ingenuity. I think my son summed it up succinctly " impressive but cheesy". Well worth a visit.

Awesome. More than 45 million blooming flowers in structures is a delight to the eyes. If you love flowers you will love this place. Various types of flowers and sometines fruits in different shapes and vessels. It starts in nov till few months only. Closes during summer. Nice for an evening stroll and to take photos. Its mind boggling hiw they have used limited resources to make this all!
Colourful and full of life. A great place to enjoy the wonderful weather and experience some colourful and interesting creations.
Real Flora and Fauna in Desert. Must Must Must VISIT For Every Traveler in DUBAI. Very near from our Hotel Holiday Inn AL BARSHA. Really a WOW Experience.

Heaven on Earth. It is a lovely place to visit and get enthralled in mind with family and friends. What a beauty ? It is very difficult to explain in words. Simply superb..As you walk through the line of flowers , you would feel like in heaven . Amazing and fantstically maintained flower garden . It is opened only during winter. It is worth spending money/time with family and friends...I request all to maintain the beauty very well. No one should spoil the beauty of the garden . Hats off to the organizers.

The flowers and oranges and lemon structures. The amazing thing about these gardens is I guess that all the flowers are natural and growing in the middle of the desert. The structures are very pretty and different but the flowers are those which are very common. I did not see any special or different flowers. My husband and his brother really enjoyed the different structures but for me it was not something very special.

Good place to visit in winter season.. The place has more flower base plants. Don't expect it to look like a botanical garden.
Little difficult to drive due to not having enough sign boards, suggest use of GPS.
Entry fee is 30 AED, and plan alters an hour to see it all.

Just OK. This is a nice display of colours, and arrangement but the flowers in use are very samey all the way through this.We took our parents who are keen gardeners and they loved it.I've been twice now, I think i've reached my limit on pansies.Good value at only AED30 as the entry fee, but is a bit of a trek out of town if you're not a resident.
Nice place to scroll.. Visit the Miracle Garden. The view and atmosphere, shapes will make trace to stay in memories. The great visit time will be for months October till mid-May.

Transportation to dubai miracle garden - By Aravind. Hi everyone,Now i am going to explain you how to reach miracle garden in public transport.Just simpleGoto mall of emirates metro station and find the mall of emirates bus station which is opposite to mall of emirates entrance.Board bus no. 105 which is direct to dubai miracle garden.Ticket fare in bus is 5 aedMiracle garden entrance is 30aedButterfly garden is also there and the entrance is 50 aedIt will be opened from october to mayWeekdays bus will start at 2pm and every 20 minutes you will get frequent busWeekends bus will start at 12pm and every 20 minutes you will get frequent busLast bus is around 10pm.Hope you would understood it.Never miss this placeAll the best

Very colorful display of flowers and fruits. Visited the place in December. I believe it's only open during certain periods in an year. It costed us 30 AED per person to visit. It was very beautiful inside and well arranged. Went on a Friday so was a bit crowded.

Flower wonderland in the desert!. What a place to see millions of flowers in the heat of the Arabian desert. To see how the flowers have been arranged to add a wonderland of color and charm. And to think that it is created where water is not easy to come by. This is absolutely a must-see on the Dubai bucket list!
Amazing place . Wonderful place for children and adult people! Flower and magic are owners here! Absolutely I suggest to visit this park

Nice view . We visited the garden during the sunset, this time is the best time as the weather is so good. The garden is so big and has different types of flowers in different designs. A place that you must visit in Dubai.

Great afternoon out!. Lots of flowers, great landscaping. Loved the hanging umbrellas covered walkway. Great place for a family afternoon or morning out. They also have several food carts around the Gardens and a sit-down food court area where you can buy different things.
A must visit. it is possible only in dubai they have created this lovely garden in the middle of desert. One who visits UAE must visit miracle garden.
beautifull only in the rite season. Amazing garden but do not visit in summer...the rite time to visit is in the winter and spring..it is close to the dubai mall.. so u can walk till there easily

Impressive. Dubai Miracle Garden is located next to the Butterfly Garden, about 20 mins drive from Emirates Mall. It's basically an extremely colourful park that recreates buildings such as the Burj Khalifa out of flowers and fruits. Although it's lovely I think it should have be included in the price of the Butterfly Gardens. I don't think it's worth the 30 aed price. Then again it's one of Dubai's cheaper attractions and it is amazing to see all that colour in the middle of the desert. We entered via gate two, walking about two minutes from the Butterfly Gardens and maybe didn't get the same experience as coming through the main entrance. We were bored after about 30 mins and there weren't any cafes or restaurants to stop and rest in, though there were food vendors dotted around. We probably won't visit again but worth a visit once.

Flower flower and more flowers!. It was Edward Scissorhands Garden! The ticket costs 30AED per person... U can see things that's made out of flowers... It was a big place, but not too big... It's a place u can spend with your family and make lots and lots of pics!

The security with whistles ruined the experience! . I love this park because of all the beautiful flowers! Buy what ruined it for me was the security folks. They were every where like hawks. Whistling at folks who barely even touch flowers. I saw a toddler walking to a flower bed n touching a flower ..there comes the security whistling. How can you enjoy nature and admire all the amazing flowers n structures when hear whistling n folks getting scolded. Sigh..On the other hand it was a amazing park worth watching during the day. There's refreshments inside. Ice cream, coffee tea. Give yourself good couple of hours to walk around n take pictures.

Flowers! Flowers and More flowers!!!. Very unique and beautiful garden.Very romantic as well. You might want to visit it with family and spend there all day, enjoying slow walks and small restaurants or you might just do a quick go thru. Dont forget to bring your camera
Beautiful. Went here this trip it was magnificent,I have never seen as many beautiful flowers ,it was set out great and could spend a morning going round it
awesomely miracle. its very artistic and very nice to visit its really worth your time and im very much impressed how they shape it to all kinds of forms

Amazing. A flower garden in the desert? We weren't sure what to expect but were amazed to find masses of flowers shaped in structures. Looked spectacular, so glad we went. Dubai never ceases to amaze.It was not busy when we went so we were able to enjoy and take pics. Location is a bit remote so had to take a taxi there. The entry fee was very reasonable. Well worth a visit.
Beautiful. Its nice but the entry fee is too high compared to what you will see once u are in. Its too far also. If lots of free time can go and see.

Miracle Garden. Miracle Garden is a 30 minute drive from downtown Dubai where you can experience moving from the dense busy city to a desert perspective. Entrance fee is 30 DHS per person. With Flowers the designers have built different buildings representing different cultures and faith which can be easily recognised. You can see the mosque, the temple, the church and the Japanese building. You can see birds design like the peacock. Nice walk in the garden and especially in the cool December. People visiting are in the relaxing and playful mood which create a great ambience. The food court offes snacks and a place to sit for some rest. A must see place in Dubai.

Awesome ... One of the best flower gardens I have visited and the place is well maintained. Best visited during November - December during their winter time when the climate is much cooler than the usual time of the year. There was a huge crowd and its always nicer to visit in the morning for best photographs and views. A very good place for a family to visit..

Beautiful!!. This is the most beautiful garden I have ever seen in my life. Dubai has proved that they are the no.1 in all the fields. They have built the most beautiful garden in the desert! It has all the fresh flowers and is maintained in a very excellent way. Ticket price is 30 Dhiram for every individual.
True miracle. Truly it's a miracle to see the castles and structures made of real flowers. A wonderful site in the midst of desert

Good if you don't get to experience much green space.... If you grew up in a barren landscape, this place would be amazing. All sorts of objects and international landmarks covered in (real) flowers and (fake) fruit. As someone from the east coast of Australia, I found this a little underwhelming though. We were only there for about 45 mins, and that was being generous and exploring everywhere. The music played on the loudspeakers is pretty horrible (like some kid playing really basic chords on an electric piano) - some classical music (for a calm atmosphere) or pop music (for something upbeat) would be a lot better. The Arabian couches to rest on were excellent, given the heat.

Too crowded. But so pretty. Its amazing given the terrain how they have managed to get this up. Not ideal to visit in the hotter months. I found it too crowded the 2 times i visited the place. Spoils a photo-op since there are so many.Not enough seating area. Ive seen people do photoshoots there.Very pretty indeed. Worth one visit.

Same flower different colors.. Miracle Gardens... is nice if you have nothing else to do that day. The flower arrangements are amazing and the amount of different colors is beautiful yet you cant help get the feeling that it is over the top and fake. It lacks the natural beauty normally found in gardens and I honestly felt bored after 20 minutes. I would recommend this for families with kids as they will be entertained by all the different colors besides that its not that amazing.
Wonderful Scenery. It was such a great attraction with wonderful display of flowers! Worth the money spent! We took many photos.
A miracle really. Seeing hundreds of plants & flowers in a desert land is indeed a miracle. They deck up the whole place with creative things, like making figures (houses, cups, etc.).
memorable . a must while visiting dubai. one of its kind, a rare open garden in the desert, which wins your heart the moment you enter it, unbelievable,colourful,very well organised and maintained.
Awesome. Lovely place with an amazing design which contain multi landmarks for various cities in the world .. Entrance fee is resonable .. Recommended

Beautiful and a must watch. Freshness at its peak! Can't believe such a garden in a desert! Amazing! If you are a tourist to Dubai, make a point to visit miracle garden. The garden opens in November (closed during summer upto Oct) though it is located at the outskirts of Dubai, it is worth the visit. You will also get eating stalls inside the garden You will have to walk a lot inside the garden and hence, visit during the evening hours, say after 4 pm. The entrance fee is Rs.30 Dhrms per person

Dubai Trip 2015. This place is really wonderful. We were lucky that when we went to Dubai (25 to 28 November 2015), this place just opened. You'd probably need to spend about 2-3 hours to really enjoy the place. However, I would strongly suggest bringing your own car. We came by taxi and by the time we were about to leave the place there was a long queue of people waiting for taxi. You need to wait for a taxi to pass by, which is not very often. Overall, it was an experience of a lifetime.

Miracle garden dubai. We were really very very excited to see the wonderful collectionsInside Miracle Garden. It will take you to a different world with a feeling of reading a fairy tale. Hats Off to the creators..

Amazing place in the desert. Had heard about this place from my mother (she had seen a show about it on TV). My friend and I went while on a recent visit to Dubai. Amazing to see so many flowers blooming in the desert. Also cool to see what they have done to display them. It is a bit of a trek (via car/taxi) so if you are short on time, I would skip this. If you do have time, it is well worth the time.
ONLY WOW CAN EXPLAIN THIS. TOOO TOO TOO TOO good. i have no words how good this place is. i am still wondering how they have done this miracle in desert.

Kashmir in Dubai. My son know about this garden through net. No tour operator is telling about this. When you enter the garden you will feel you are in another world. What human can do in this climate. No word to explain the beauty of this garden. One should give priority to this garden then burj khalifa.

Happy to have FINALLY Visited. On our prior trips, this place was either closed for the season or we were busy doing other things. Fortunately, the timing worked out well this trip. I am not sure what I expected but this place surpassed any prior thoughts. It is very different from any botanical garden and/or greenhouse. The displays were breaktaking; it was not at all crowded; and was a lovely place to spend a few hours. Words cannot really describe how wonderful this place is...even photos do not do it justice.
BEAUTIFUL AND MIRACLE. I think it is the bust flower garden in Dubai and it is very good for relaxation in free timeand the flower arrangement was very good for couples

Unique park. Very unique park. Fun for all ages, but only opened during winter season. The only annoying thing about it was a lot of security personnel that watch your every step to make sure you don't step on the grass. If you there, also visit their butterfly gardens nearby. The entrance fee to each of them is 30 dirhams.

A Miracle in the Desert. My first ever visit to the Miracle Garden this morning with friends from South Africa who we are hosting for a short stay in Dubai.Perfect weather with overcast conditions and a light breeze for walking around this open air venue. It showcases an amazing variety of flowers and floral sculptures including scale models of a Windmill, a train with a locomotive, the Burj Khalifa and the Eiffel Tower. An amphitheater, a small lake with fountains and sculptures of flamingos, a floral clock and several other floral works are also on view. A perfect setting for taking pictures and videos with benches available for periods of rest, and several outlets serving food and drink on the premises.We were lucky in terms of not many people being there and could walk around at leisure. Ample parking is available outside the three entrance gates and the entry fee is a modest AED 30/- per person.Definitely not a viable place to visit during the hot summer months. A must see in good weather for all residents in the UAE. The only issue with the location in DubaiLand is the lack of public transport and having a car is essential.

Pleasant visit but...!!. Our second visit, the first one being in April this year. We found that it did not have the variety of flowers that we saw before. The theme was clearly hanging baskets mainly with trailing flowers which were mainly the same varieties.It didn't help that it was a cloudy day and also the music was extremely repetitive which dampened the mood.I'm sure if you were visiting for the first time it would be a lot more interesting.

Beautiful Flowers Everywhere. I think it is the largest flower garden in the world. It is only available in winter season. The flowers arrangement is very creative and will make you really relief. You can go around the whole park in about two hours. Prepare your camera to take too many photos. The entry fees is 30 AED and the parking is free.If you love flowers, you will spend amazing time.The park is really crowded, take care of your children or they may be lost.
Miracle. this garden is a must do if you are visiting dubai. worth every penny.amazing art work and stunning views.

Nice Place to be visited in Dubai. Very pleasant visit Dubai Miracle Garden. The garden is very beautiful, and is one of the soothing oasis in the desert state view. Being in this park makes us as if it were in the gardens of Europe. Very Highly recommended.

Beautiful Arrangement of Flowers. This is not like any arboretum or botanical garden, the flower arrangements here are very colorful and creative. Only a few varieties of flowers, mainly petunias as this is their national flower. Like all other reviewers say, go in the morning, it gets very hot with limited shade. The cost of food and drinks at the park are very reasonable. Don't expect to make a full day trip of this, my husband and I saw the whole park in an hour and a half.

Nature beauty at its best. In a modern city like Dubai, this has to be proud to have possession. Each and every design of flowers is awesome, and really must appreciate those who are managing this wonderful task. Make sure that the season is winter, or else the garden may be closed.
For nature lovers. A highly recommended place. It is a must see for nature and beauty lovers. Make sure to take a camera with you as you cannot resist what you will see.
Must Visit - WOW. It is really Miracle :-) can't describe it..... it is amazing place you have to visit. Must Visit. WOW.

Lovely place . Went there as a quick visit as I've wanted to see it for a while. Was quite easy to find but I would suggest getting a SatNav!I thought it was quite cheap to get in to, AED30 each and free parking. You can't take your own food and drink in but you can get stuff in there which seems relatively cheap. Was a beautiful place which is kept immaculately. There are many flower arrangements which are stunning and it's lovely to walk around and see them all. I would suggest going on q cooler day or be prepared to get hot!

Fantastic colouful display of flowers!!. We visited the garden last week Friday and I would definitely recommend it.The entry price was 30 aed which I thought was very reasonable.The garden is well kept, clean, tidy and well supervised.Make sure to take your camera as there are many photo opportunities and things that you will want to capture. Generally people queue up and give you the chance to take pictures in front of the many wonderful displays, there are sometimes that the people waiting are still in view of the picture you are taking don't hesitate to politely ask them to step away. At the beginning we were slightly reluctant to do this but then we found people don't mind and sometimes they are not aware that they are in the way so it is worth asking!There are many seating areas in the shade where you can take a rest before continuing with your walk around, there is plenty to see! There are also kiosks where you can get food and drink around the garden!We used a taxi to get to the garden and there are taxi's around to get back to where you need to.

Haven of Flowers. Dubai Miracle Garden has eluded my visits since its start on a Valentines Day in the year 2013. Too much good feedbacks about this wonderful piece of land by my friends and we visited with certain level of expectations. Apart from the scorching sunlight, I do not have anything to regret our visit as this is simply marvelous. The idea of sporting an area clustered with different flowers in combinations which are pleasing to eyes is nothing more than intelligence. The garden is well sculptured and planned in an integral manner so as to give good retreat to anyone visiting here. Be it hanging baskets of flowers, Floral clock, flower shrouded train or well groomed grass to portray the famous iconic buildings, we enjoyed each and every view.Plenty of photo opportunities and anyone visiting here are advised to bring a good SLR to capture the beauty of this place to later reminisce. Parking was easier as there was plenty in the front and a bay across the slim road. You can be easily guided into this garden as there are attenders standing along the path giving directions. Home cooked food is not allowed inside; however there is no dearth of food outlets inside. This is open only during certain phase of year from winter to mid of following year.Must visit for anyone coming to this city (Dubai).

Flowers galore . The nearest metro station is Mall of the Emirates. After which, take a cab from there. It as difficult to get a cab backa especially during peak periods So the best you can do to call up RTA and book one. Or else, there are private car drivers who will ferry you to the nearest metro station. Plenty of thema at the car park. The car park is near Entrance 1.
Miracle selfi garden . It's a blossom place a must visit with family with kids Enjoyed the evening, well maintained Keep going

Beautiful place. I wouldn't say it's a 'must see' place in Dubai but it was lovely to have a stroll around all the flowers. The one annoying thing that kind of spoilt the mood was the inappropriate music piping through the speakers, it was like fast paced karaoke backing track which spoilt the calm and serenity of the Garden. Apart from that it was a lovely trip :)

Beautiful flower garden!. This is a beautiful place. It's has recently reopened, it closes for the summer each year so they can change the flower arrangements/refurbish etc so it's best to check that it's open before you go as you'll need a car/taxi to get there. Worthwhile visit and the butterfly garden is situated next to it.

ten million marigolds and a volkswagen fountain!. If you have an hour or so, trek out to miracle garden. Unique and kitschy. Pay the extra to see the butterflies. Only mini golf could make it better. Great frozen fruit sorbets at the stand. Bring your camera definitely!
Wonderful!. Great to see flowers and greenery in the midst of a desert! Overall layout of the park is nicely done.
BEAUTIFUL!!!!!!!. All those gorgeous flowers! So many colors and so many different shapes that are covered with the flowers. You have to see it!

A must visit place, definitely!. If you love nature and photography then this is the right place for you! Everything looks good in every angle to say the least. You'll enjoy spending the day being wowed by the beautifully arranged flowers that'll leave you out of words.
Really a Miracle. Best place to visit during winter season. I admire the efforts to maintain this in desert and harsh Sun.

MIRACLE IN THE DESERT. At only AED30 to enter this is well worth visiting. The flower displays are amazing and so colourful. Unfortunately I did not have enough time to enjoy this attraction fully but I will certainly re-visit when in Dubai again in April 2016.
flowery!!. truly a miracle in Dubai. different shapes of different things and characters made from best flowers of the world. must visit.
Must See Place..... Another Man made wonder in Dubai....Can u imagine fresh flowers in the Desert? The u must visit the Miracle Garden....

Nicely done but don't drop other plans. Given the circumstances in the desert, it is really nice what has been built - the peacocks are spectacular but apart from that there is very little that is attractive and stands out - good place for locals and children (families) to spend some time over the weekend. Given that it is far out, no need to change plans to see this place.

Awesome Creation. The place is truly a garden of miracle and a manifestation of God's Wonderful Creation in the form of artistry through plants and flowers. Best visited in the afternoon and during the cooler months of Dec, January and February. I will never get tired of it and really worth your visit. Plan to visit again this coming December 31, 2015 with friends.

Wonderful place! Must visit. We visited Miracle garden on 27th Nov 2015. It is very beautifully made and maintained. Every few steps you can see a new structure made from flowers which will make you go "Ooooh". Everyone visiting Dubai in winter must visit this place (it is closed in summer). There is also a butterfly garden right next to the miracle garden, although we did not visit that.
miracle flowers. if you are in Dubai,you should visit this place once.nice place to spend time with your family. Dnt visit here in summer.you can see the amazing view of the flowers.

Beautiful artistry. Outstanding creativity, it did manage to exceed expectations simply by the sheer volume and constant new ideas around each corner.Go with the right crowd and soak in the sights. Not much on offer to eat.A photographer's paradise.
amazing place to visit. if u coming to dubai u need to visit this place good spot for taking photos the art of the flowers intersting
Park wasn't open at the November. There is no a bus stop near the park. You can go only by taxi or car. Near butterfly garden. It always open

Quick flowery visit. The garden has potential to be a very interesting attraction, but it didn't impress me that much. It's a great spot for photos. I appreciated the fascinating sculptures, houses and and other things made out of flowers. I was expecting different types of flowers, different aromas...

Must Visit. Actually this place was not in our list and we added this spot because of free time and i must say our last minute decision was right. It is a wonderful park. We visited this place in December 2014. This is a beautiful park with lot of creativity.

Marvellous display of flowers. This place is a nature lover's paradise. Beautiful colours of flowers and creative arrangements and displays using flowering plants. A must-do for visitors. Each year they change the display, so you can always guarantee and new experience and great photo opportunities.

Pour disappointment!. I heard so much about the miracle Garden in Dubai so I've decided to take one of my friend to visit it last week. I heard its open to public from November till March so I checked the website and it showed the opening times and dates. You can't get to this attraction by public transport so we had to take a taxi. We were so disappointed upon reaching there to see a lot of construction work going on and all it was written on the gate 'closed ..will be opening soon'. There was no one to ask or to enquirer when will it be open again so we asked the driver to take us to the butterfly garden next to it which was also closed. It's a shame that such an attractive place so poorly managed I would say no use in checking their website as it will never be up to date!

Pointless. Someone decided to plant 3 million flowers in the desert to attract people. It is nice, but just doesnt make any sense. Amount of water they spend there is ridiculous and just another Dubai show-off. Dont wast your time going there.

Beautiful, Magical Place. Dubai's Miracle Garden is just that-- absolutely beautiful and the smell of fresh flowers hits you before you even enter. I was truly amazed at how everything was engineered and constructed. I left happy and satisfied with my visit and definitely think everyone should visit here at least once :)

Very Nice place. All the new bees in Dubai, must visit this place. It's a bit out the way but what to do, they needed a big space to creat that beautiful garden in the desert. Its very refreshing to visit there. Must GO.
Very disappointing. Nothing Miracle in it. Flowers and Plants found in this garden can be found in any house garden or park in dubai. Very disappointing and Boring! Even the cofeeshop there was awful
goood place. in my life i saw only one garden its i feel awesome feelings its nice to see this place once in a life
Incredibly beautiful. I couldnt define how beautiful it is. I was amazed since Dubai is a desert and too hot!!! Definitely one of the good place to visit in dubai. Miraculously beautiful!!!
Very nice !!. I dont know how dubai could manage to put all those beautiful flowers in that place with this hot weather it opnes only in winter very nice experience to find inner peace :)
fascinating experience. unbelievable variety of flowers and really amazed to see how Dubai is able to keep outdoing itself with unbelievable things

Thanks for not telling anyone it is shut. Travelled by cab for 20 minutes to view in real life the wonderful images from their web site. Unfortunately they didn't bother to tell anyone it was shut for renovation - thanks for nothing

A flower garden in the desert . Something interesting to find in a desert
Over 40 million flowers to see and relax at the food stalls and to visit the butterfly attraction

The most beautiful garden. I visited this place in the winters and it was beautiful. The blooming flowers got so much energy in us. There are cute little houses decorated with flowers and birds. Amazing place to have a relaxing evening and breathe fresh air.

Great Garden!. Well maintained huge garden. Amazing place full of green and flower in the middle of the desert! Very relaxing and enjoyable walk.. Must visit.
Cheers,

Nice. Nice thought but they could have maintained it a little better. Lot of flowers were lying dead and that really spoilt the show....Nevertheless its still a good tourist attraction for its uniqueness. Its quite far and there is no public transport to get here. We had gone to mall of the emirates and then took a taxi from there to get here. Its not open throughout the year
Mesmerizing!. One of the best place i have ever been more than 45 millions flower in one place and with different architect..its beauttiful for photography

Its really a miracle. Its really a miracle to see such a beautiful garden in a desert that's unbelievable.every corner is a beauty spot.its always better to visit when new flowers are added.and never for get to carry your best camera with you.

a good day out for your mum or young family. Really impressive garden, but understated. very relaxing day out for family or visitors, all under the sun though, so go in the winter. kids and senior will love it. not enough for a day activity though, plan something else too. food is limited, very basic.

Beyond the Excellency. Beyond the Excellency
Miracle Garden is some wonder in the Arabian gulf
marvelous and more
we enjoy every moment in it
opening our sights and minds toward the charming flowers
thanks dubai thanks every one work in this Miracle Garden

Beautiful place. Very nice and beautiful place specially for flower lovers, but even for those who are not really into it, will enjoy the place and different designs made of flowers. it might just be a bit crowded during the weekends, which is normal for people who are looking for a nice place to visit during their off days.

Tackiest place of Dubai. This place is really awful!
Paying 30 dhs to see some artificial tacky shaped-buildings is not worth it at all!!
Please invest your money in any other place!
beautiful. nice park but a bit boring. good to go in winter time, otherwise too hot. its good place for amazing pictures.

Beautiful. It is really beautiful and amazing to see what has been done with flowers and plants. If you love gardening, you will totally appreciate this attraction.
My advice would be NOT to go on a hot day. There is very little shade so go early or late to be able to enjoy the full experience.
Visit miracle garden. Great experience! We started at noon and left it was dark. So many photos of flowers arraneged in unbelievable shapes. Art!

A REAL MIRACLE. This is one place which proves that if "where there is a will there is a way".. all the superlatives I know would be insufficient to describe this beautiful garden. Its a little out of the way but worth it and more. A garden in the midst of the desert... this is something which would put many places to shame..
Only in Dubai. A must for all children. It amazes you that in the heat something like this can survive. Everywhere is always clean and very well presented.

Beautiful!. Splendid beautiful amaaazing and breath taking experience. beautifully done garden overflowing with flowers in all kinds of shapes and monuments. a very refreshing place to visit. But best to visit in a nicer weather as its open and the hot weather may fry the brains out.

Wonders of Dubai. Dubai Miracle Garden, I recommend you to visit every year they are always changing it and making newer modifications to it. First time I went I saw the Prymids, coming years I saw the butterfly garden as well as more landmarks like the Burj Khalifa and a house made from flowers. If you love plants this is the place to be for you. Its open in the winters only so dont miss the chance.

amazing flowers garden. This garden is so beautiful where you can enjoy the time you spend there. it is good spot for family and to spend your afternoon time between amazing landscape of beautiful lowers. this location is must to see if you visited Dubai.

" The Garden of Miracle". Visiting many times to this place. Heaven of flowers all around.
"NEVER GO THERE IN SUMMER". Taking photos there are best photos.

Nothing else like it in UAE. It is indeed a minor miracle to have this density of flowering plants in an area where such should not naturally exist. Arguments about waste of water aside, the Miracle Garden does at least get something for the resources employed. The artistic arrangements of plants into the shapes of buildings, cars, birds etc, is perhaps a tad kitsch but really when you see it you won't mind. It's a visual feast (not an olfactory one - these sorts of flowers have no scent to speak of) and particularly good for a mixed group on a nice (winter - Oct to April) day as small children and grandparents will enjoy equally. There are adequate facilities too - food outlets, prayer tents, toilets so once you're in you can relax happily for a least a few hours if not all day.

Great escape from the city. A very nice place to have long walks, icecream, and fresh air. Better be visited when the temperature is rather acceptable in order not to be annoyed from the heat and for the flowers to be in their finest conditions. Unfortunately we got to visit it towards the end of May :(. The visit was still worth it and the entrance fee is quite acceptable.
Weekend. Nice place to visit in Dubai, one can enjoy the decoration made with flowers of different colors.Ticket cost about 20-30 dhs.

Very Pretty!. Very pretty sight. Very beautiful and colorful. The structures and how things are put together are quite elaborate. You can definitely tell a lot of work went into putting everything together. Such a gorgeous place to walk through and take photos. The place does get pretty busy so there are always tons of people walking around
A Place from dreams world!. Fabulous and very interesting attraction, it is obvious that great efforts and high level of organization were spent in that place.Love it!

FANTASTIC MIRACLE PLACE in the desert. A MUST SEE. We went here last year (it's only open certain months; check the website) and it blew my mind!IT'S A DUBAI MUST SEE!! Wear walking shoes and have plenty of water and a great camera.

Prepare to walk and be amazed!. This is a pretty nice tourist spot in Dubai! The colors and how well they put this garden together is something everyone can appreciate... (good for families as well)! They have plenty of iconic landmarks on display using flowers, vines, and etc... Great backdrop for taking pictures!Unfortunately it was tooooo hot when I went. Even when I went early the heat was just too much to walk the entire garden! There's also not that much shade around the place besides the awesome umbrella display which had some benches under it, lol!I liked that there were some food carts scattered around the garden as well! You can grab a refreshing drink or enjoy a snack while you walk and take pictures!

Beautiful !!!!. Flower paradise in the desert. Very beautiful place to visit. Flower decors in cars, a house, peacock..etc. Children would just love it. But its closed during the summer season (Mar-Oct). A must visit when in Dubai.

A treat to the eyes. I have visited miracle garden thrice.It has never disappointed me.The color and arrangement of flowers are definitely treat to the eyes.It is closed for sometime of the year.So make sure it is open before planning for a visit.The garden is clean and has plenty of seating arrangements to relax now and then.I recommend to make arrangement to carry kids below 5 years,as we have to walk for more than 2 hours to complete the entire garden.

Impossible made possible. Dubai has a beautiful creation added on this very land , which surprises me a land of heat n sand has amazing flowers grown and it is indeed a beautiful place to be , perfect for photo shoots too , there is nothing impossible to do in Dubai
Flowery paradise :). Wonderful place, with amazing colourful flowers surroundings...I just love it, heaven for the eyes :)
Flowers in the desert. It feels unreal to see all those flowers in the desert and it seems like they keep changing the place.

Gorgeous Gardens. Beautiful flowers arranged in unique settings. One area had foreign miniature replicas of famous buildings, such as the Eiffel Tower and the Taj Mahal. Flowers decorated cars and some flowers formed peacock shapes and a huge lady's face.
Nature at its Best.... A must visit if this garden is open.... This is not normally open throughout the year.... So check if you are in UAE and can visit this place... Well maintained...
Past resident. Unbelievable to have all this in the desert. You will be amazed at the number of flowers. Definitely worth a visit.

must visit. visit after noon as its too hot.visit early if you do not want crowd and photo bomberscan bring wateramazing flower park. take as many pictures and if visit before sunset so you can easily see teh surrounding display

Strangely good. Not the easiest place to find, but it's rewarding when your sat nav somehow gets you there. A nice way to spend an hour or so amongst some beautiful plants and flowers with really creative displaysDidn't go for any of the food options.

Horticultural Miracle. This is a classic demonstration of the determination of what Dubai can do. Horticultural wonderland in the middle of a desert. Well manicured, well kept, different from the glitzy Dubai that we all known about. Worth a visit.

A miracle in the desert. The Miracle garden of Dubai is indeed a colorful miracle in the desert. The location of the garden is almost outside Dubai, so it is better to hire the taxi. The ticket is 30 AED per person, which is worth is you have minimum 2 hours of time to spend in this marvelous garden. It opens 9 AM daily and closes on 11 PM on weekends and 9 PM on weekdays.The garden has three gates in three different directions. The shape of the garden is like a round pizza, and you get to enjoy the each slice with different fun. There are lots and lots of flowers everywhere, spread across the garden providing the most colorful views. Each point in the garden stops you to take pictures. There are peacocks, a giant clock, an Arabic lady statue, a long toy train, the burj khalifa, colorful huts, funny cars, an upside down home, heart shaped pathway arcs, and a lot more. Everything is loaded or made up of the colorful flowers.The garden facilitates a big food court, having a lot of different restaurants and cafes.
Excellent. Miracle Garden is truly a miracle,It is one of the best place to visit in UAE. It is amazingly organized flowers with lots of formation. It is a must visit.
Heaven on earth. I was in awe for what I saw! It is amazing how talented and organised the founders are! Highly recommend!
Dream. Visiting this place is like entering in dream. What a marvellous creation in desert very near from Mall of Emirates but unfortunately this garden is seasonal.
beautiful beyond belief. As the name states, its a miracle indeed, a must visit place while you are in Dubai in winters. Its beautiful beyond belief

Truly Miraculous !! The Garden is must watch.... The world’s biggest natural flower garden, an another feather in the cap for the state that specializes in superlatives and the unexpected – surprise the world.. It’s located in Dubailand near the Arabian Ranches and has been made with millions of flowers. It’s a great tourist attraction which attracts thousands of visitors. Floral displays change each season so that we have a new experience and theme to enjoy each time. The most exciting feature is its been develop in this desert “through judicious re-use of waste water, through drip irrigation.”Amzing creation and themes it must watch for Family and Couples..Kids love to have their time out too and the entry fee is just few Dhs. A great way to have family outing.In you have romantic blaze in you this will really surpass your creativity..

MIRACLE GARDEN-NICE AND EXPENSIVE. Well, do not be surprised by Dubai's way to get the tourists in, and rip them off at the same time. I personally would not have paid to visit this garden.However,as my sister was very keen to see this place, I had no choice and had to accompany her.Of you love flowers, go for this.

attractive flowers. love the flower its very nice and they the colorful nice view for taking good picture.. many different design and its a big place to round... its perfect for dating and picnic with the family.. i recommend to visit here..

Butterfly and Miracle garden. This is must watch place in Dubai, there are two places here one is Butterfly garden and other is Miracle Garden you can visit both. Butterfly garden is available throughout the year, whereas Miracle Garden is available in winter season only.
A must-see!. What a beautiful place! This is definitely a sight worth seeing. Beautiful colourful flowers covering replicas of some famous attractions. Great place for the kids.
Though it took us several turns to find the place but it's worth it.. A must place to see when you visit Dubai, UAE. Amazing colorful flowers creating an aura of calmness.
Beautiful flowers, stunning walk. What a wonderful place to walk around. Cheap entrance fee too. A magical place with so many different plants. You can chose to stay all day too
Beautiful. Really is a miracle to see the different colored flowers spread out in the middle of a desert.The entrance fees i found alittle too expensive

Beautiful garden well maintained. A short drive from Dubai city center. Neatly maintained and well organized. Worth a visit especially in the winter months. Gives lot of photo opportunity for the visitors. Visited couple of times. Some of the themes were different from our earlier visit.

Good But not great!. May be i visited at wrong timing but considering i visited LalBaug which holds similar flower shows is far more superior in terms of quality. But i must say arranging someting like this in Dubai.. a desert area is itself if Miracle so my one extra start goes for that alone. Nicely built but better to visit it in its peak season times.

A flourishing experience. A very pretty arrangement of flowers over a decent sized park which is only open in the cooler months of the year. It gets quite busy too. Don't miss the butterfly park next door.

So colourful. I think this is the only 'diffferent' place in Dubai other than the usual malls and other man-made wonders.People who like colours and/or flowers should definitely visit. Good time to visit is after 2/3 weeks after the place has opened since all the flowers take some time to bloom. They have been increasing the entry fees and if they keep doing that every year it may not be worth to visit the place once it goes above say $15.
NOT so Impressive. Nothing to see really. Vast area to cover but nothing wow for Dubai.Entrance fee inexpensive but do not go out of your way to visit.

Flower oasis within the desert. It is always a pleasure to visit Miracle Garden. It offers astonishing flower compositions for a relaxing and enjoyable walk.Just remember that during weekends it is usually packed with people.
The most beautiful colours in dubai. Very nice place, its becoming always bigger and better, very good with friend and for kids (in the summer its close due to the extra hot season)

Nice place. MIracle garden situated on Umm Suqeim rd opposite Motor cityI wish there were more this typeof places in DubaiNever go on weekends as it very crowded with residentsFacilities are nice but they should install more tents to have shadeas thereis no place to hide from burning sun. Landscapeis nice but comparing to Singapore gardens looks ordinary. Good valuefor money
So Beautiful. It was so beautiful, Can't believe they built garden in the desert, Had a lovely memory pictures from Miracle Garden. Cant wait to visit again
Power Of Flower. curiosity will bring you here, imagine place full of flowers in the middle of the desert. i must say it will give you good pictures as souvenir :)

Beautiful, mesmerising. It is really miracle to see this blooming garden in the mid of a desert. the hard work of the staff and labourers of the garden are to be appreciated..... it was maintained clean, refreshing and lot of photo opportunities (selfies!!)Though as flowers, it is nothing that could be compared to the mesmerizing swiss or Denmark and other European countrysides.... but it is a wonder and a good relaxing place to shed your tensions in a spring afternoon..... You have to walk a lot with resting inbetween. bit expensive for just clicking some photos and taking rest... but for the effort they take, this money (the entry ticket) is nothing. do not expect lots of flora varieties, but it is the landscaping that's special.

flower flower ..so beautiful. Really really beautiful garden with many different design by flowers ..there was not many different kind of flowers but it is so amazing with the design,the bridge ,the house ,the water fall..made by flowers so beautiful. it is open only during winter must visit it.

A lovely surprise!. One would never believe that a luscious garden, so colorful and beautifully laid out would grow amidst the sweltering Dubai desert. It's a welcome change from the malls, water parks and usual tourist places to visit. It can also be quite romantic at sunset.

"Art of gardening". indeed a miracle, this garden is located in Dubailand near Arabian Ranches. Wonderfully bizarre ....an outdoor attraction for locals and tourist away from pollution of city..it has more than 45 million flowers arranged in wonderful designs.... worth visiting and the best part is that displays will change each season so that repeat visitors will have a new experience each time..

Good. Beautiful, nice, relaxing but not too bigThis would be my main comments about this attraction.It is located almost in the middle of nowhere in Dubai, you can take a taxi or the Hop On Hop Off bus, and I do think that the average staying time is around 1h.Guaranteed to see a lot of beautiful flowers in the "middle" of the desert.It's not open during Dubai's summer time.Pay entrance of 30 dirhams almos 10USD
Must is Dubai. Dont miss it out. Amazing flower garden with millions of flower. Best for photography. Lil bit far away from city, but worth travelling.

worth visiting. This place is worth visiting, we need to appreciate the efforts put behind this little garden especially considering the desert conditions, don't compare with Netherlands or something, but it is worth visiting,

Really Miracle. It is known that Dubai is the desert pearl, but it's a desert anyway.Once you step to this amazing place, you will feel like you're in some exotic island with all these amazing color mixing, shapes, flowers...etcand to make it more interesting, they just opened a new extension called Butterfly zone i think where there is more than 100000 butterflies from all over the world.Off course it closes from May to Oct i think because of the heat, but during winter it's a must go place...

A Master Piece of Art. Living in the Gulf all my life... I haven't ever seen greenery and beautiful colorful flowers like the ones in the Miracle Garden...The way its designed is so creative... very relaxing to just go an enjoy the beautiful colors...Of course because of the heat it is only open in Winter. A must visit when you are visiting Dubai...

Mesmerising. Its a wonder how this place is created and maintained .imagine a house built with flowers .....a castle with different plants and flowers.every little detail has been considered while creating this beautiful mesmerising garden.
Great place. It was really a great place to visit and worth the money. Good for family with kids. There's not so many variety of restaurants inside so make sure to eat first before coming here.

Flowers. very nice garden. It is really cool how they designed everything by beautiful flowers. If you love flowers you will love it there. However, this is not a fancy place to go, so do not wear fancy cloth. Also, you will see so many kids and I did not like the food there.
