Nice vist for an hour or 2. reasonable visit to spend an hour or so, not sure about the mircle, maybe teh only miricle is finding teh place in the first place.

amazing human creature. well,this is to be called miracle garden.cant say anything.absolutly great creation.and the main thing that the maintain of the garden all the colender days.invention of the drip irrigation change every thing.selfy sopt every where.have to wait bit of time to take aselfy.

Awesome place. It is such pretty place in Dubai which is also called as sandpit. Flowers of various kinds and colors will win your heart. Go in the morning to get good photos when it less crowded and there is sun.
Man made natural beauty. Really a man made natural beauty. Love to go there with kids and family. The flowers, plants and other attractions are lovely and fantastic

Magical Flower Garden. I didn't know what to expect when my friends invited me to go to the miracle garden. It was a pleasant surprise to see how the park was able to have such a huge collection of flowers assembled nicely. The place has arranged the flowers to form houses, cars, patios, even the Eiffel Tower and etc. It's a nice place to have photoshoots although it could get crowded yet you can find places to take solo shots. Some have limited access yet it's for the preservation of the place. I highly recommend visiting this place.

Must visit in Dubai. If you love flowers this is the place to be. Absolute awesome, kids love it. Walk thru flower decorations, the flower burj khalifa etc. Take your DSLRs or ur selfie sticks as you will be clicking al the way thru..
Parking is a bit hectic but will find one.
Great Flower display. The best flower park i have ever seen so far. Lots of creative flower design , figures and shapes.. Colorful and cheerful place. Great place and worth it when visiting Dubai.

Kudos to their effort!. Be prepared to appreciate Dubai for all their efforts to maintain such a beautiful garden in the middle of desert.Indeed the garden is located in the midst of the desert, but the garden is so beautiful and you may tend to agree to their claim that it's the World's most beautiful garden!The entry fees is around AED25 and you can find a small food outlet inside. A camera is a must carry!

Go at night . You pay about £6 to enter here. Nighttime is so pretty all the gorgeous displays are illuminated with such flair.It amazes me how they can keep it looking so lush in the scorching 47 degree heat.Maybe that's why it's called a miracle garden!The garden doesn't have much of a scent which is a shame but the glorious displays are so pretty I soon got over that fact.Worth a visit.

It's a Miracle only. WOW, its a very small word to express Miracle garden. After getting married we visited miracle garden & felt no doubt why name given "Miracle". Its such amazing place. AED 30 is a cost & believe me what you actually pay you will get more in terms of enjoyment. We had around 500+ photographs in Miracle Garden. Its Mind refreshing.
The garden!. we came here last winter it was really a nice experience my whole family really enjoyed taking photo of each view, really nice hope to comeback when it opens again..

Superb!. A Must See! Please visit in the evening time as we can view the flower arrangements with the lighting. The arrangement of flowers in the gardens are continuously over time and very impressive.
gardens. a beautiful garden in dubai.. visiting garden in a hot place like dubai is a bliss .. must visit place /.
It's a Miracle. A garden in a desert, unbelievable. The arrangements so amassing do not want to leave at all. so colorful. unable to close our eye.

Man made wonder. Absolutely superb. Must visit. Evening time is the best time since you can view the flower arrangements both in sunlight and also after the lighting is done. The gardens are known for continuously changing the arrangements over a period of time and it will always leave you impressed.
Beautiful . Had a dream come true experience. Its open only for 2 months and v were lucky to experience this beautiful giant garden. It's colourful and like our of story book.

A miracle indeed. full of flowers..wonderful place to be away from the city chaos...it would be convenient to get down at Mall of Emirates metro station & hop in to a taxi..Not very close to the public transportation system..but,many taxis are there..and operational only during the winter..from Oct-April would be the best time..

amazing experience. A wonderful place to spent with family..We loved the Burj Khalifa model of the flower tower.
A nice place to relax and enjoy
Truly a miracle. You have to see it to believe it. There is a butterfly garden next to miracle garden and there's separate entry fee for the same.

satisfactory. Miracle garden for Dubai is a wonder because being in a desert and to see flowers is great. The formations are nice but its the same flower in all formations. Would like to see a variety with a little more creativity. They should have more reasonably priced restaurants within the miracle garden.
must visit!. extremely beautiful place. everybody coming to Dubai must visit. away from the hustle and bustle of the city, Miracle garden makes one feel fresh and free.

Beautiful Garden. Its a cool place to visit with all the beautiful flowers wide variety of different flowers that are arranged in different shapes ..but FYI during summer.. there's no Miracle garden .. due to hot weather in Dubai it will not survive..because we visited before and nothing to see all are empty :-(.. just only during winter season in dubai..
Nice park. Beautiful arrangements...mostly the same flowers though and not much shade at all...bring plenty of water with you...

Miracle flowers. packed with wide range of flowers organized in a beautiful way will attract the family audience more. Kids will love this place, but they don't allow anyone to pluck the flowers.They put lot of effort maintaining the whole place, anyhow its some thing refreshing to see blossomed flowers in the desrt
Miracle Garden. Breathtaking and unbelievable display of real flowers in a very artistic way. Planys look very well nourished and taken good care of. Once in a lifetime experience.

Enjoyable relaxing attraction. We went here just before it closed for the summer. This meant some areas were a bit tired. That said there were still beautiful flowers and displays to see. Would recommend this attraction for the cooler months

If you like gardens, you will not be disappointed. The garden is very well-kept and there are lots of unique and interesting flower arrangements. A lot of effort to keep the place alive, particularly in the heat of Dubai. Best to visit during winter time, when temperatures are more tolerable. There aren't enough shady areas.
No place like it. This place made me so happy. It was beautiful at EVERY glance. I felt like a princess. Amazing designs. Must do! It was hard getting taxi out of there though.

Mind Blowing Garden. The Dubai Miracle Garden is Temporarily Closed for the Summer Season.. Its a execellent Garden to see but unfortunately We cant watch This Because lot of heat we mIss this But you Don't forget to waTch

Beautiful!. Gorgeous garden. Beautiful flowers. The feeling was like you're not in Dubai. Nice to visit during cold season. Snacks and drinks available inside. Location wise, it's a little far from the center. We took taxi when we went there. Bring cameras and enjoy taking beautiful photos.

Flower lovers paradise.. Wow. If you're a flower lover this is the afternoon for you. I was speechless, not only at the beauty and the creative architecture, but at the sheer ability to keep such beauty alive in the desert heat. Kudos to this agricultural team. Enjoy!
Must come. They are working to make extensions the ticket for adult is 20 aed for extension other 20 aed but it is worth to come here even the weather hot
Miracle place in the Desert.. amazing place in the desert , to make greens flora and fauna. Collections of Flowers well maintained , Good time to visit evening.

Flower Power. Since I started working in UAE every year we are visiting Miracle Garden but then they've really never fail to amaze us. Every year they have new things which is really unexpectable. The entire alocation, design and ideas of flower arrangement is really amazing.
Waiting for the next visit(2016 probably), what Miracle Garden will bring us.

Beautifully done and creative!. Great value for money and something different to do in Dubai. It was smaller than I expected though. Cost is about 30aed per adult but be warned it's closed for the summer months.

Interesting but not worthwhile.. Interesting, but more for kids than adults. It is amazing how they have made it and the design but looks a bit like a kids flower park disneyland. Not really worth the long trip to get there.

Simply Amazing. i visited Dubai 2 times , first time the garden was closed,
second time i visit the garden and its really a miracle .. amazing views so you can take lot of photos , you can spend the whole day with family or friends , my advise you HAVE to visit that miracle garden!

Nice Place, Bad traffic. We had visited this place after hearing about this on the media. While the location is clearly marked from the major roads, when you enter the internal road, the mess starts. It is like a maze without clearly markings. we actually went into a road with a dead end. The garden itself is amazing and the kids will really enjoy the same.
miracoulus garden. a miracolus garden with many flowers arranged beautifully into many shapes and there are also some small restaurants so no need to worry for foodyou will have to pay a fee to enter

Miracle happens in Miracle Garden!. Beautiful place! one of must see in Dubai. It is not so big, however when you understand that the whole garden made of frsh flowers in dessert...you are just wow!castles, buildings, cars...everything from the flowers!!! very cute place)) and romantic pictures after))
amzing flowers in the middle of the desert. amazing garden and pleasant atmosphere to go for some time out. Avoid Fridays and Saturdays as it is too crowded and you will not enjoy it too much.

lucky we are to see this place!!. Few hours after arriving Dubai, it was the first place our family had visited. My mom who lives in UAE, told us that we are lucky during our visit because all the flowers bloomed. She mention that there were times that miracle garden was close because all flowers were dry due to the weather. It was really beautiful. It was my first time to see so many flowers and arranged in different ways. It was really a dream come true to visit Dubai and miracle garden.
Every year most spectacular exhibition of flavours. If you have time you must see it, best to get a taxi, entrance fee very low but it is big and spectacular, worth to see

Flower, Power!🌸. Who would have thought to see thousands of flowers in the middle of a desert! Was so amazed how the beautiful flowers were creatively arranged to perfection. Miracle Garden, Dubai is definitely a place worth stopping by.
Good place. Lush green grdens with beautiful array of flowers but no smell.... no fragnnce.... open only during winters check before you go
amazing. i think the name of this place tells you all about it , if you love nature the flowers and the miracles you must visite this garden

Really worth it's name. Just make sure if garden is open by using website information as garden is closed in summer months. We have been there twice and is worth a visit for once. Best is to reach by 3 pm as you may need 3 to 4 hours

It's really a miracle.. Growing millions of flowers in d midst of nature is actually a miracle. With numerous settings and designs, it's a treat to visit. But in summer months it's closed for some time so better to check beforehand.

astounding!!!. the place is so beautiful that there is never a dull moment. you won't even notice that it is huge and in the desert. just walking there and looking at the flowers is alluring. plus the picture taking is never ending. you won't even know where to pose first. better to go there on winter season and daytime. lots of people go there on weekend so better on weekdays to avoid congestion and enjoy the place. I am looking forward to the next show.
very picturesque. best to go early or in the early sunset. lovely picturesque views and a good photo sessions. but it is very hot during the day to avoid this during hot days.

A nice place to Enjoy!!!. We had visited the place in Dec 2014 with Family, It is a nice place to enjoy and hangout for the evening. Not a place to go and again but you feel nice admist the flowers and garden .

Beautiful. When we came we didnt have any expectations, but what we saw... The garden is huge and it smells so good on different tipes of flowers. Price of entry is very cheap around 5,6€. You can see all different kinds of flowers on different shapes. Come with your kids, you wont be dissapointed.
Worth visiting. This garden is amazing creation. its just amazing. Beautifully designed & well maintained best garden i have ever seen

Beautiful place ..... Miracle Garden. Beautiful flowers...Dubai Miracle Garden .... A must for all the visitors and residents ... Location is superb.Great place for visiting.Thanks and Regards,Utkarsh Bohra

Exquisite. Quite breathtaking. Shows man's creativity and care of the most fascinating theme park .The theme of course being flowers in every shape and form and colour you can imagine. Beautiful . Very very nice place
Good sense for my 2 years-old baby

Good place for your eyes

Colour in the desert. It was amazing to see so much colour in the desert. It was well maintained and there were an abundance of shaded areas to sit in. I would think 1 to 2 hours would be enough time spent here.

Really Sad To Look At. i mean what a waste of time and money..it is in the worst condition and is just an unbarable heat no wonder all the exhibits are just dying out, i can respect what they tried to acomplish here but with all that money you could have also spared in for sprinklers and a better irrigation system beacuse it is pathetic. I was ther in May 2015 maybe its beacuse it was summer i dont know but it really seemed like a waste of time.

Amazing! Such a great time!. I had so much fun visiting the Miracle Garden! Everything was well maintained and the park was quiet and serene. We went about 30 minutes before sunset so it wasn't really hot and there wasn't many people which made great opportunities for photos!
Beautiful garden. One of the best garden in the world. Superb. ..... worth visit...entry fee is 30 aed. Beautiful view. Well maintained and peace. For dis place 5star

Beautiful !. Something new in Dubai, definitely a wonder and very exciting seeing it for the first time. It's not that big, so in my opinion the ticket is a bit pricey just to see flowers. Would not recommend anyone to go in the summer heat as even the eateries are outdoor and unpleasant in Dubai's heat. Good for kids. However, it's a one time wonder, second time round becomes boring.
A very well planned garden. Miracle Garden is beautifully planned. I haven't seen so many different types of flowers anywhere. Everyone should definitely visit this place at least once.

millions of beautiful flower in the desert. you can't believe this, but it is true. you can now see millions of beautiful flowers in the desert that is why it is called Miracle Garden. Every year the design changes so it is worth visiting every year from October to May (opening and closing dates subject to change). Large area to walk around, old visitors can take the buggy car at extra cost

Closed. Opens in December. Yep, this is still being advertised yet it is shut tight and won't reopen until December 2015. We arrived full of expectation after seeing the wonderful photos in the newspaper and magazine adverts (yes, more than one) and the gates were locked. Great, remember that Dubai uses a lot of toll roads and you're charged every step of the way to get there and back. If you're not a drinker, you're seriously limited after a week here. Cinema, Dubai mall, Dancing Fountains, the Creek, another mall, another cinema, another mall... Definitely do NOT come here on a budget.
lost in flowers in a desert country. i went twice till now. every where you look you will see flowers. totally new place. you will forget the desert and Dubai.

An Oasis Between Dunes. One of those places which are enough to keep you awe struck for the whole time you're there, Miracle Garden is truly a mirage in a scathing desert. I would truly recommend it to everyone visiting Dubai during the spring season. From the colours to the uniquely designed shrubbery, this place is an exquisite delight and a much needed respite in a city which thrives on shopping!

Miracle Garden. The garden opens during the cooler time of the year.A very nice place to visit as it has lots of colorful flowers arranged in different shapes.You have to reach the place by car or taxi as its not near any metro station.The tickets are to be purchased on the spot, at the entrance gate of the garden.A very nice place to have some good pictures and spend time in a very refeshing envoirnment with greenry and colorfull flowers all around.

Amazind wonder in a desert!. Located in Dubai Land, at a little distance from the Mall of Emirates is this newly added wonder called Miracle Garden. True to its name, it is indeed a miracle to see such etherially beautiful garden, all made out of using only hanging baskets! There are breathtakingly beautiful peacocks created with these hanging baskets overflowing with dense flowers. There are houses made, shaped after various countries' signature style of dwellings. There are rows of huge buckets, tilted, showing streams of flowers flowing out of them. There are cars full of flowers... The list can go on and on! You need to see it with your own eyes to believe its beauty. The garden opens only during winter season for few months. Recently one more attraction has been added very next to this garden, which is Butterfly Museum. It houses live butterflies as well!

Heaven in the middle of the desert. this garden will surly surprise you after you visit the other attractions in Dubai, that's because no one will expect to find such a beautiful roses and flowers in the middle of the desert.the whole garden is a big bouquet, and smell of the roses will make you forget the desert weather. ask for directions before you go there as its directly on the main Mohammad Bin Zayed highway but the entrance to the park is little tricky.

Very very good, a must see... How do they keep them all alive?. Loved it, been there loads of times... With friends and taken family... Nice to stop for a quick snack and a drink on the way around... Loads of photo opportunities and a genuinely great day out for a few hours...

Beautiful and clever. Petunias don't usually smell, however in large quantities they do! They have created some truly beautiful sculptures with flowers. Well worth a visit with a grown up. Kids might be impressed for a while but would probably get bored fairly quickly. Price for parking is fairly steep - bit of a shock when you consider how cheap it is in Dubai itself. It is in a fairly isolated location.

Who says there's only desert in dubai. If you think you will only see desert in Dubai then think again and visit Miracle Garden. The garden will open during the cooler time of the year and you can see different type of flower arrange in different shape, there were Eiffel tower and burj khalifa last year, but they alway change every year. Worth a visit to see something different in dubai

Such a stunning place. This is one of the biggest collections of Flowers in the world. Check to see if they are open as the Flowers are seasonal, lovely for a few hours of gentle strolling around a Garden

Miracle Garden. It's quite difficult to go there because no proper RTA bus which takes us there. We must take Taxi in order to reach there. It's really a Miracle garden in the middle of a dessert. Dubai did a good job in making this place with the beautiful flowers and landscapes. Once in Dubai, pass by to amaze how amazing the place is.

Amazing and creative garden with perfect landscape. . It's really a Miracle garden in the middle of a dessert. Dubai did a good job in making this place with the beautiful flowers and landscapes. Once in Dubai, pass by to amaze how amazing the place is.

Visit to the butterfly garden. I visited the newly opened butterfly garden which is part of the miracle gardens and it was really lovely. I took my 2 kids of 10 and 11 years old and they were amazed of all the beautiful butterflies inside the airconditioned gardens which are beautifully landscaped. My kids were even able to let the butterflies carefully climb onto their fingers and I got some beautiful photograps as souvenirs. Very sweet place to visit even in summer.

How do they keep them alive?. Considering it is in the middle of the desert, yes it's fantastic! When I think of the mount of water needed to keep the plants in that great condition, I don't think it's a very smart attraction- and all the flowers are annuals, and of one kind..... Just sayin....

romantic. its a breath taking sight to see so many different varieties of flowers with beautiful arrangements. it is a romantic place and couples and newly weds should definitely pay a visit to the Miracle garden.

One time must visit. Not if your looking for the variety that you'd get in most gardens worldwide, its mostly one species in multiple colours, but just the effort thats gone behind this garden in a deser, makes this worth a visit.
Fantasy World. If you love flowers like I do. Visit this place on winter and you'll be amaze how flowers bloom in the middle of the desert...

Rainbow from flowers all day long. It's a must to see this garden at rhe border of the city!Don't afraid, that is far from everything just ask at the Metro-station which is the nearest one to reach the park and take a taxi!It's unforgettable what they can do beside the desert!Pls inform You about opening times - normally is open only till 1 of September.Entrance fee is 30Dhs per person.It is very interesting that there is no any advertisment or info in whole Dubai, but don't miss it!

Heaven in Dubai. A very good place to visit in cooler months. It is full of nice flowers and a place I would definitely recommend visitors to be. Now it is reachable even easier with proper sign boards on Shaikh Mohammed Bin Zayed road.
all artifical flowers. nothing was worth watching all artificial flowers with an entry fee of 30 dhs it is not worth a look !
Surprising. Did not expect to find a garden like this in Dubai. They have some nice flowers and some quirky displays for them. Like cars covered in flowers, or pyramids, etc.

Some Bad, Some Good, But Quite Memorable. The Dubai Miracle Garden is a most unusual attraction. It has some aspects that are not so great, but these are easily outweighed by the uniqueness of the attraction. There are two different garden areas to see - a main one and a secondary garden that includes a butterfly habitat and several large-scale garden outlays. Together, a trip here makes for a memorable experience.The BadThe cost of entry to the main garden is fair by Dubai standards (30 AED), but if you want to see the second set of gardens and the butterfly area you will need to pay a second substantial fee (I can't remember the exact amount, but it was a good deal more than just an additional 30 AED). We didn't want to pay the extra fee, but we figured we might as well since we had made such an effort to reach the gardens.We visited the gardens in April and they still had Valentine's Day displays on show. While there's no harm in keeping these up, it shows a certain lack of attention to detail. The garden is situated in a part of town around which there is a lot of stalled construction. While the garden displays are nice, the background leaves a lot to be desired. Additionally, there are light poles all over the garden and these get in the way of pictures and the general experience.Several parts of the park had a pseudo Disney feel. There were items that were clearly meant to mirror specific Disney characters. For example, they had fairies that looked just like Tinkerbell and cars with facial features reminiscent of the movie Cars. Several of the signs also used a very Disney-like font. While this is not necessarily a problem, the gardens are nice enough that they don't really need to copy anything else, and it comes across as a bit of a distraction.Some of the displays were a little worn and in need of a little attention. There were spigot waterfalls designed to give the impression that the spigots are floating. These were somewhat dirty and the flow of water was not sufficient to complete the illusion.None of these issues are so bad that they should prevent you from seeing the gardens. There are plenty of excellent features to make your trip worthwhile. The GoodThe colors that can be seen around the garden are incredible. This makes for wonderful pictures and quite a splendid sight to see. It's a great place to take pictures of people as the flowers make a nice backdrop.Creativity abounds in the designs of the different portions of the garden. There is an excellent umbrella-lined walkway that throws interesting shadows on the ground while shading those walking underneath. There is a small village where the houses are made entirely of flowers. There is a functional clock made of flowers and several other original floral creations.The bathrooms were clean and free to use and there was ample free parking.The butterfly gardens featured a lot of space for interactions with the main attractions. They offered food that we could hold out to entice the butterflies and there were several times that the butterflies landed on us to rest. This would likely be especially enjoyable for children.Final ThoughtsIf you decide to make the trip, be sure to check on potential closings. The main gardens are closed in the summer, but the butterfly gardens remain open. If you do want to see the butterfly gardens, you will need to exit the main gardens near the back (not far from the umbrella walkway) and walk through a tree - lined path to the adjacent second garden area. If you get confused, just ask one of the security guards and they will point you in the right direction. Even though we came in the spring, it was still quite warm outside and the sun was a force to be reckoned with. Make sure you plan accordingly by either showing up early or late in the day, or at the very least by using plenty of sunscreen. There is a decent amount of walking required to see all that the gardens have to offer, so comfortable shoes would also be a very good idea.The Dubai Miracle Garden is unlike anything you've ever seen before and serves as a nice break from the hustle and bustle of the city. If you have the time, it is well worth the trip out to see the flower creations on display. Bring a camera and you are bound to get some excellent pictures.
A blaze of colour. This is the place to visit if you like plants, flowers and trees all set out I wonderful themes. We have been there several times and always enjoyed ourselves.
flowers in the deasert. you cant believe that all these flowers can live in this hot weather...unbelievable , how they make all these shapes in flowers...million of them

A photographer's playground. Great place for families, and photographers! Expect to snap a lot of pictures while you are there. Wonderful work with the flowers. Closed during summer month. Best time to visit would be from Nov to April.

Not so great as expected. Well , im not sure that the experience was not like expected because it was friday ( it is off day for all Dubai ) and the park was so busy. It was small and you can make a round in maximum 15-20 min, if it was not so busy that you can not pass on the walking track. It was almost impossible to take a picture because it was so crowded. Not big choice of restaurants n cuisine and entertainment except to take a picture.
Amazing place. Its a list of place to see when in dubai. Amazing flower designs and colors.too bad i didnt see all of it as its too hot during our visit. :-(

Worth visiting but with your food. one of the greatest landmarks of Dubai, visit in the morning as sun can get hotter. take food with you as the food is not quite good inside with liitle variety, very less and not cheap. take a photo near big tap.

Flowers in Bloom in Dubai. A lovely place to see in Dubai, especially when all you see in most places is sand.Thousands of flowers, growing & shaped in different forms, beautifully arranged & colourful to look at.An 'Out - Of - Dubai experience, maintained and well looked after.

Beautiful place - must see. We went there with some relatives who live in Dubai only. It is so beautiful. The flowers and the architecture is mind blowing. I will recommend going there around 4 p.m so that you can also enjoy the sunset.

Would you believe you're in Dubai. Just a lovely place to visit for a day of walking with friends and family. Helps you remember there's a lot you can do qualitatively outside of playstations and gaming ;-) I loved the layout and the effort taken to design the Miracle Garden and it's quite rightly named; remember you're actually in desert territory as you step into the garden!

If you don't visit this place, your visit is just a Foul!. Beautiful! If you're a garden, flower, nature,lover or a traveler then you're going to love this place. There are billions of Flowers planted in this garden and that's not just the end. The real beauty is the Flower Art that they've created with a very well maintained atmosphere and which increases the "Stars" when it comes to rate this place. It's Huge. You may click your pictures too. The entrance fee of this garden is just around 35 AED (Dirhams) so far and that's nothing when you see such a place that could be titled "Heaven On Earth". I'd recommend the tourists to make it a mandatory visiting this garden during the trip to Dubai. Thank you for taking your time reading my suggestion. I hope you feel the same about the Miracle Garden during your visit.

Were told we are going to a garden did not expect this. Beautiful all the flowers and different house and the train flowers in car bonnet and the café in the sade to cool down with something cold a must go to

wow. this is probably one of the most bizarre and beautiful places you will ever visit. it is hidden away out near motor city and it is a try floral oasis. I have never been one for the overtly showy gardens - and make no mistake this place is showy, but in a really incredible way there are millions of blooms and scents and displays and the place is one of those remarkable oddities that you simply must see to believe. it is fairly family friendly and a good 2 hours stroll around with coffee shops and places to eat. this place has to be seen to be truly believed -

Breath Taking. It is a very lovely place to enjoy beautiful flowers of different colors, shapes and designs. Houses, cars, hills, peacocks made of flowers. You'll love it. Just be careful that the sun might be strong and you need a hat and some protection. There is a place where you can sit and rest and have some refreshments. A MUST SEE!

Amazing art of flowers. The best thing about this place is that they change the entire setup every year , so each year you go there to see something new, better to go in winter times, and it is a must go place for any touriest.
Beautiful. visited the place with parents and family, they all loved it, the various designs made the colorful flowers where impeccable, there was flowers that i have never seen in my life. amazing
Simply amazing. Creating such a garden in a desert requires lot a effort. We love to go there whenever someone is coming to visit us.

Miracle Garden. This place is nice & family freindly however the variety if flower is not much as you expected.Sitting area for senior visitors & eating for younger ones are weak point of this sight seeing.
Same flowers everywhere.. The place was okay. I wish that there are more varieties of flowers. the place is far flung as well. It good to go to that place once.

Amazing!. I couldn't believe my eyes! Although the weather and soil (desert sand) don't help, this place is blooming! There are so many flowers, colours and designs! Visit during the winter months so that you can enjoy your tour!

Total aesthetic excellence and design grace with plants flowers of all colours and many properties of nicety.. The garden is a real marvel.  How can there be such a beautiful creative out put to bring out so natural scenery with all kinds and colours and shapes of flowers, plants, creepers organised to mesmerize the viewers in a short time?  Not only plants and flowers; but also organised train with engine, set of automobiles displayed in great sequential disposition, creating a small hillock and adding green bushes and creepers to add to natural way with flowers intermingled in total aesthetic excellence and design grace.There are huge artificial peacocks well placed on the lawns adding to the beauty of the immediate environment, in addition to many more things like small fountain etc;There are shelters created with mini umbrellas in all colours over the head as ceiling stealing the show, and on another side, a few soft drinks and snacks available for the tourists to sit around and enjoy these beauties under another creatively developed ceiling.The most interesting facility is there is a buggy also available if needed (of course for a fee of 20 AED per trip ) for the elderly to go around the garden comfortably.  The gardener and the architect who made it and maintain the garden richly deserve appreciation for their creativity and skill and care put in to this "Miracle Garden".It is another must visit attraction in Dubai.
Awesome Place. Place is awesome, having thousands of different varities of flowers.... but still only 1 issue is tht its still artificial.... not good for nature lovers....
miracle garden. What a garden. If we miss that one we have not seen Dubai. It is some distant place from Dubai but it is really a Miracle to pass time in the garden

Wow amazing place . I truly loved this garden and never in my life entered a garden with so much flowers in an artistic way, I really was mesmerised by the way they decorated the place with flowers it was very beatiful

YES, A Garden in Dubai :). So Beautifully Developed and Maintained.
Wow Feeling. !
Avoid going in the late Afternoons as it is an open place.

Stunning. very nice, well organised and clean
It combines art and culture along with fun and stunning views.
I do strongly recommend visiting. If you can go during week days, you will enjoy it more, less crowd

Excellent place. Excellent place to visit & experience flowers all the way.
one will be mesmerized by the absolute arrangement of flowers in artistic way.
The visit to Dubai is not complete without visiting the miracle garden.

Family friendly park. Took my middle-aged parents and young niece to these gardens and we all thoroughly enjoyed our time. It took us between 10 and 15 minutes to reach the gardens from the Springs area (add another 5 minutes if you're travelling from the Mall of the Emirates). There are three entrance gates, so do ask to be dropped off at the main gate (great place to start the visit), as the other two gates are deserted. We paid 30AED per adult ticket and got there at 530pm to enjoy the sunset and cooler weather. We spent 90 minutes walking in the gardens and bought some drinks from the food court (which was also serving hot food: hot dogs and other snacks). There are toilet facilities there too.There are magnificent designs in the forms of the Eiffel tower, Burj Khalifa and a small village; all covered in foliage and vegetables. Cleverly made and presented! The peacocks were stunning and it's worth taking photos in the romantic, light tunnel just behind the convoy of old Mercedes cars (also filled with various plants!).Taxis going back to the city can be easily found from gate 2.Our trip was a welcome alternative to spending time in a mall and we thoroughly enjoyed our time.

Beautiful and Beyond. The mood here is just happy,the minute you arrive in this garden you want to live there forever and ever;it has such beautiful flowers,pieces of art etcIts just lovely.You might want to visit though when its not too hot.
Miracle in desert!. Very nice place to visit... Truly a miracle in the deserts! Only problem is... It is little far from metro connectivity.
Fun for the entire family. just as the name says it is more of a miracle garden, lots of beautiful views. both kids and adults will have a great time.

WHYYY?. We travelled in June and it was closed! We were so excited to visit this place and were looking forward to see this breath taking beauty of nature and our hearts were shattered to know it was closed during the summer. Why did they do so? Because the flowers wilted and died? Well, that ain't a good reason! other gardens and nature areas were all open and being watered regularly. We had to live on pictures. Why, why, why, why would you do that?
A Real Miracle Garden from Flowers. Every corner have interesting decoration to see. All made from fresh and colorful flowers. Make sure you have a good camera with you.

paradise in desert. shocking when in this desert climate such a beautiful place can be developed,its such a soothing experience, located some 5 km from barsha area ,the place is very near to mohd bin zayed road,best too see during 3-5pm
Info!. Closed during summer time because of low season and the heat. Double check opening hours before taking the long trip out there!

Just go!. This is a flower wonderland in the desert. It is well worth the trip. Take the whole family plus some and stroll through a good number of interesting sections all themed differently and boasting loads of colourful flowers. You can buy something to eat and to drink. Don't miss the Butterfly Gardens either!
Refreshing!. Eye pleasing and refreshing. Recommended to be visited in slightly cooler weather to enjoy the place.

Lovely place to visit. . Been there a few times over the last few years and every year it improves. The flowers and displays are fantastic and the place is really well looked after. It even now has a few small cafes/stalls where you could get some food, drinks or ice cream. Just a reminder that it closes over the summer. Also follow signs to Sports City than Arjan to get there.

A trip worth the money. It was a very beautiful garden,however since we visited the place in May, the flora there was not on its full bloom. So one must visit the garden during spring and I assure you the trip will be beautifully breath taking

Disappointed. June is hot. We checked website for opening times. It is quite a way outside of main town Dubai so the taxi was more expensive as a result. However when arriving it was closed. No reference to being closed on the website so very disappointed and let down. Only let down experienced in whole of UAE.
Nice but Small. Very nice and the flower arrangements were amazing, it is a bit small but with a good value for money. If you like to take photos, that's the perfect place to visit
Beautiful Garden. As Dubai Is famous for its architecture design & its uniqueness in building. with their talents they have made this garden a new look & totally different design & look. Must visit.

Roses Garten!. The best thing there is to have a walk and a lot of fotos.But it is a little bit far and you cannot enter with your car or make a grill or take food inside or or or it is just a wonderful big roses Garten with diffrent colours and shapes and so romantic. There is a cafe inside if you want to have a drink.

Really a Miracle in Dubai. This Garden is so beautiful that we forget that we are in the Middle east. I, with my family visited this Garden and were mesmerized to see the variety of flowers and the way they are grown.
very beautiful!. this place is really beautiful. different kind and colors of flowers.even in the evening it is still beautiful!

A real Miracle at Dubai!!. Flowers, flowers & only flowers. As the name suggest its truly a miracle. The flowers are so nicely cultivated with a particular theme. The thinking & innovation is truly worth seeing.

Amazing Place. You must go here when you are in AUH. If you love flowers you will enjoy for sure. A lot of varities of flowers, so colorful. relaxing in eyes, you will enjoy roaming around. however going out from hereis not easy if you dont have own car as its too far from the main city its too hard to find a taxi.

Truly a miracle garden !. Not for no good reason has this garden acquired the distinction for the garden holding the Guineas record for the garden with the maximum no of flowers.Flowers, flowers and more flowers. Comparable to the best in the world that I have been to, including the Tulip Gardens at Amsterdam / the Rose Garden at Delhi.

Yet another miracle of Dubai. The name in itself suggests that this is a miracle..This surely is yet another miracle and obviously its only possible in Dubai...The ever thinking and innovative nation.The garden is wonderful and gave us a image of been in a totally different world
Must visit during the winters. Lovely place to spend a weekend evening. Very refreshing and plenty of photo ops! kids would have fun as well. A lot of options to eat as well.

Truly A Miracle. I have heard abour Dubai Miracle Gardens and I was very excited to visit. I was not disappointed at all. The place is beautiful, colourful, well maintained and quite creative. It would have been nice if the place included a restaurant where one can enjoy food or at least quick snacks while enjoying the view (rather than the current semi-grocery).

how do flowers grow in this heat!. Went for a stroll for a couple of hours early when it opened at 9am. Was pleasantly surprised to see so many flowers in bloom and alive in the heat. Was good for taking lots of pretty snaps. Staff friendly. The flowers though are a bit repetitive - same flowers on all structures.

perhaps more impressive for children. obviously its hard to have tropical flowers and gardens here with the climate. It was not signposted very well to find the place and easy to get lost when you come off the highway. There are no different rates for elderly people even though I took my mum and asked however they then said she could go in for free. The features like the cars and houses and windmills with the flowers are interesting enough but there was no wow factor and I think that children would be more impressed. The gardens are kept very clean and there were a lot of workmen/gardeners maintaining everything. Would have been nice to have like a glass conservatory with air conditioning where you could have a refreshment. The refreshment section which had juice bars in the middle was just an open space covered with vines/leaves however it reminded me of Sharjah back in the 80s the way the kiosks were very out of date shame really. Overall it was an okay experience but would not say to anyone coming to dubai unless they are from the regiion as a tourist this is something they should do much more impressive tourist spots.

very colorful. miracle Gardens is a wonderful place to see but i do recomend only until March they close it down i belive end of march/ they also have the butterfly garden inside miracle gardens which in my opinion is not really worth it
All senses come to live. Even if we got there in the last day of the season opening the view was just delightful...I would say it's better to visit it in December
Amazing. We went there in the evening and we had our own transport. Such a beautiful transformation with flowers. Lot of photo ops, food stations for the hungry too. A relaxing experience.

Beautiful!. Beautiful gardens...you will not be disappointed!! It is a must see if you love flowers and greenery! I especially like the walkway with umbrellas and the village of flower houses!Try to go early in the morning, as it gets busy fast, and its hot! They open at 9am.

A beautiful garden in the Desert !. The garden is a nice way to relax for an hour or so after a tiring walk exploring the Emirates Mall or other Malls of Dubai. The best time to go would be around 4 PM if its not hot.

Wonderful green haven. First of all the place is oddly situated so transport can be a big issue. Make sure you have transport or be prepared for taxi wait. The garden is small but very well done up. Beautiful small houses made of flowers and pathways and artifacts- all green. Feels nice. Not much to walk so relaxing. Some small eateries for snacks/tea/coffee and very affordable ( tea 5 AED for example).

Pretty garden but Beware of the heat!. I went here in the morning to have a browse but without a hat it was immensely intense. I had to try and hide behind my hair! The gardens are nice and they play some soft music in the background which is supposed to be relaxing. There are gardeners dotted around and the cart which can drive you around the gardens if you pay. The plants are made into many things like houses and clocks and other characters. It's fun as long as you can remain the direct sun. Again, I don't think it's something you will do regularly. Perhaps it's better to go in the evenings when it is cooler? They also have a little shop which serves juices but this is literally just fruit thrown into a blender. Bon appetit!

Terrific area to stroll around in the cooler weather. I went here with my family while the weather was cool. It is amazing to see so many flowers in the desert. We had a really enjoyable morning strolling among the flowers. Really beautiful. There are some small cafes and ice cream stalls for refreshments should you need them. I would not go here in hot weather - there is very little shade.
Beauty on the ground!. Incredible spread of colours on the ground. Millions of flowers all spread beautifully in patterns to enjoy. One of many wonders in Dubai!

No Miracles here. Meh. It's alright.Not much to say here. If you are REALLY bored maybe pop along for an hour. Don't expect Kew gardens and you might be happy. Who whole thing looks like it was designed by a child in microsoft paint. There are song quite cool abstract stuff going on, which I liked......I suppose. Clutching at straws now to be honest. I took my camera and hardly used it.Oh, and watch out for those (horrendously unsociable in crowded places) Selfie sticks, I think they must give them away free at the entrance or grow them there. Very annoying.If the name of this place was just "Gardens" I would have been impressed.LOLZ available at the attempted flower sculpture of the Burj Khalifa. Looks like someone got bored halfway through.

Beyond Expectations for something in a middle of a desert. Must visit for someone looking for a greenery in a middle of desert place. As you all know, Dubai is built up on a desert, however, you will feel different in this Garden, lots and lots of flowers nicely shaped in Card, Buildings, waterfronts etc. Butterfly garden is a new attraction added last year. Very beautiful, you can touch butterflies, get them pictured or get a selfie....just amazing exp.
What an experiment!. A great hide-away for some peaceful hours to "recharge" yourselve in (partly) man-made nature 30 minutes away from busy Dubai.
Beautiful display of flowers. What a unique way of displaying flowers. Very leisure venue to visit. Great for camera fans. Would be nice to have a few displays that had A/C.

Nice, but not miraculous.... Firstly it is important to note that to visit the Miracle Garden you must do so via a car you own/rent or by taxi. Public transport to the area is terrible/non existent. A taxi rank is near the entrance for your return journey. If you are getting a taxi I'd recommend you go from Mall of the Emirates due to close proximity and guarantee of getting a taxi easily. The Garden is well maintained, clean and organised to make navigation between the sections easy. Perfect place to take visiting older relatives to take nice memorable photos, particularly if you like panoramic shots. There is an elevated section in middle of garden for just such photos. Please be warned though that ramp up to this area is very steep, if you are pushing a pram or a wheelchair up and down be cautious. On negative side it is a fairly expensive entry price (30 AED) for somewhere you are unlikely to spend more than a few hours at. Entrance to the butterfly garden is another 60 AED on top of original price. As no areas have AC you're also looking at spending a small fortune on drinks or ice creams to keep the kids cool and happy. Much better to go in winter time or early evening so you can enjoy a walk around in the cooler climate.
Amazing and beautiful place. Really wonderul and miracle place. YTou just must visit it. Fantastic flowers and unbelievable colors and ideas. http://groweris.com/blog/?p=659

What money can do.... I think this place needs to go up in `where to visit in Dubai` list as it's a different experience. Avoid going during the day as it is an open space, right under the sun. After a while, everything seems so similar but still we need to give credit that they can keep these flowers alive under so much heat! I recommend to go closer to the sun set as the quality of the photos turn out amazing. Admission fee is 30 AED.

Must visit place. Miracle garden is an unique concept created in Dubai to attract tourists. This place is just amazing and you feel good and enjoy this place. My quick review below:Entry Fee: Paid parkingTime: This place shut in the summer, so call them before you visitLocation: Barsha area (New Dubai) which is between Al Khail road towards SMBZ road. Little far is you are in Bur Dubai, Karama or Qusais areaPublic transport: Available, i suggest reach Mall of Emirates through Metro and take cab or bus from there if you are not driving.Place: Perfect place, don't forget to take camera and you will end up clicking hundreds of picturesParking: Ample parkign available

Nice lay-out, lack of variation, no AC space around. We went there by taxi, no other transport available. The garden itself is neatly laid out, it is a big circle, with different themes, e.g. old cars halfway buried in the ground (?), a bit of Paris, etc. The flowers lack variation, most are the same of two kinds in varying colors. The day we visited the Garden it was very hot, so it became very apparent that there is no restaurant, nor anything else that resembles a space with AC. So we thought about going to the butterfly garden, but tickets are not included in your 30 Dirham entry fee, and we were not sure if there was a cool down area at the Butterfly garden, so we skipped it and left after 30 minutes visit. This is a nice outing probably in lower temperature weather, and if you manage your expectations...

Loved it!. The garden was very clean and tidy. Properly managed and decorated. Really nice place to take pics, memorable pics! I had my engagement pictures taken there and then when I took them back home, everyone loved them! I even displayed them in my wedding entrance. No one believed that there is such a heavenly place in Dubai with lots of greenery. Best time to visit it during winter time, as in the summer it gets really hot, otherwise go in the evening during summer. There is an entry fee as well to pay.
Great place to take moms. I took my mom and mother in law to see the gardens when they were in town and they absolutely loved it. It's a place that will put a smile on your face :)

Nice place for weekend with family...... The miracle garden has traditional flowerbeds that are fashioned in different shapes. You can see hearts, stars, igloos, pyramids, etc. this garden is a definite tourist attraction as the flowers change according to season, every time giving you a new experience. This garden is beautiful even though it is right in the middle of desert. It is completely maintained and efficient enough.

Fairy tales n Dubai. I love this place it is a true enchanted world. What I really like is the atmosphere: relaxed and peaceful.Unfortunately the park was not clean and we were the very first entering that morning. None was neither around to do this service. This is a pity because there were many visitors and this attraction deserves more attention. I am wondering why oter countries more luvky in terms of water and weather do not have such places. Please do improve

great. This is near the Dubai mall and is made very well. They have a entry fees. The ideal time to go to the miracle garden is the evening time as one can enjoy the beautiful flowers. They have small eating joints too which were nice. They have professional photographer who does a good job. The garden also has a cart service available on payable basis which makes the people take a round of the garden. It was filled with beautiful flowers and very well maintained.

A flower paradise with heart arches- Beauty like nowhere else in the world. Miracle Garden is absolutely stunning! There is no other words that come to mind once you stand in the middle of all this flower magnificence. It's the celebration of imagination above everything as well as an excellent example of landscape design. You will see peacocks, cars, houses, Pyramids and an Eifel tower made of flowers, visit an Umbrella's Valley,see the water tap hanging in the air without any pipes with water dropping right to the lake (yes, yes! don't ask me how, just see it)! It's the best place to make wonderful and memorable photos, walk with children, just sit and enjoy pleasant smells, beauty and tranquility of this place. Ticket costs around 10-15 usd for adults and you can stay there the whole day, no one limits you.You will find multiple cafes in the rest area, where you can enjoy a well deserved cup of indian karak chay, freshly squeezed pomegranate juice or Egyptian bakery with cheese, Feta or Nutella inside.Butterfly garden is now open for visits too and the price is included in the ticket. If you go in summer, try visiting Miracle Garden in the Morning or in the evening around 4-5 pm to escape the heat.

One among the must visit in Dubai. Amazing!!!!!!One among the best experience we had in Dubai. We reached Miracle Garden around evening time...... The experience is just amazing..... Dont forget to take your Selfie Stick :) (Most of the people will be carrying their Selfie Stick. )At night they will turn on the lights in the garden. Superb :)
Pretty and calming. A beautiful place with some fantastic flower displays. Great value for money and a good place to take tourists in the cooler months.

Place for you if you love Green.. Its an amazing place to be in just before evening, try and enter at 3pm-4pm and you could easily walk out by evening 7:30 pm.Full of colors, flowers and life. Its amazing to see such a thing in middle of a dessert. Well maintained and do not forget to carry your selfie sticks and additional camera battery. Avoid going there in month of July, Sept, Oct as its too hot and humid in Dubai overall. Overall fun place to be in if you love flowers and greenery. Tourist : Please ensure that you pre-book your taxi with RTA Dubai back to hotel. Public transport is scare near Miracle Garden.

for all landscaping professionals. what on earth can money do visit this miracle garden, very nice but still gives a feel that all man made but worth their efforts, truly unbelievable will surely take you in a animated world!!!!!!!!!

Miracles at 43 degrees C. Great place to spend an evening with family and friends.its maintained superbly despite the roasting temperatures. Entry fee seems to be paltry compared to the sights created inside. A glorious place. Never felt like coming out of it. Thank you Dubai for a marvellous Garden.

"Peace and tranquility". These gardens are simply something to behold. Flowers exquisitely planted and grown as a treat for your eyes and nose. The music playing at the garden destresses immediately and you cannot help but feel happy and relaxed. It is a wonderland, like something out of a Disney movie. Highly recommend a visit.
Wow. with this place I'd like to say that Dubai is one of the most beautiful cities in the world.the garden was so lovely that I didn't want to leave.

Butterfly Garden:“Tropical oasis of colour butterflies,and flowers!.”. A lovely garden surrounds the butterfly habitat well tended with many different flowers, small waterfalls and ponds.We were greeted by a variety of different butterflies flying around your head, it was great!We felt like we were walking into a garden of colorful fairies.The staff were excellent with giving us explanation and also helped us with holding butterflies.A great place to bring your kids. My daughter especially loved it as she could easily catch and let go of butterflies.The working hours of Dubai Butterfly Garden is from 9 am – 5:30 pm.Ticket fee Regular Admission (50 AED)Disabled and kids 3 yrs old and below (Free)

Everything dressed in flowers. Don't expect a botanical garden! It' s a garden where everything is covered with flowers. Nice to wander around. There's also a Butterfly garden nearby, with real colourful butterflies flying around you. The entrance 30 AED the miracle garden and 50 the butterfly one. Note that it's quite far - 70-80 AED one way in taxi from around Dubai Mall. One of the hop- on hop-off buses has a route that goes to the Miracle garden - use it if you take the bus.

No avid gardener should miss this!. Before arriving in Dubai we had researched the Miricle Gardens and I decided I wished to visit them. I travelled over with my young adult children and they said on the last day lets go mum! I suggested they do their own thing and I'd go on my own, but they insisted on coming with me (none of them like gardening). We had an amazing time, all of my grown up children absolutely loved the Miricle Gardens and for garden lovers, you will be in heaven:) we grabbed a taxi from central Dubai and it was pretty cheap, about $25au.
miraculous. beautiful landscapes built with exclusive varieties of flowers at display. its a miracle in a desert for sure.
Good but not fun. I enjoy nature but this was not a fun experience for me. The pictures look better than reality. I think it's for old people and young kids.

Beautiful place. We went as a group of friends, we enjoyed the nice decoration and the beautiful colors, but the climate was too hot. i often recommend it to the people who came and visit Emirates for the first time, good place to visit.

Not during the hot days. We went there in the middle of the day on May 2015 and it was so hot. By this time of the year, some of the plants/flowers were no longer in good condition. I guess it is best to visit this place during the cool months. The garden was nice and refreshing the fact that Dubai is within the desert.

A little bit of brightness and life in Dubai!. So the garden is quite funny when you arrive, but once you start walking around, you just start to take it all in, and see the humor yet the beauty in the place! It is just nice to wander in some nature, and colorful patterns. We enjoyed it very much! Calming for the soul.

Dubai Miracle Garden. Visited the Dubai Miracle Garden [DMG], the proud holder of a Guinness World Record for the largest vertical gardenVery nice with literally thousands of flowers arranged in novel waysRenditions of the Burj Khalifa, Eiffel Tower, windmills, trains and various houses, all made of flowers makes for a fun outingThe heart-shaped displays must be very busy come Valentine's day
Lovely Garden in the desert. Attraction is beautiful. Big enough for people to roam around and quite recently they have expanded further. This is closed during summer.

Beautiful place as it's name suggests!. Myself and my husband visited the Miracle Gardens earlier this month. We took a taxi from Jumeirah Lakes Towers area and this cost around 60aed which we didn't mind, as it saved a lot of time and hassle of getting the metro to the nearest stop then getting another taxi. The drive from Jlt area was about 20 mins as the gardens are located just past Sports City. It was a hot day and we got there around 1pm. We were not disappointed. The flowers were looking beautiful despite the hot weather and were clearly well fed and watered. The grounds are huge and filled with so many different types of flowers in every colour imaginable. There is a huge seating area in the middle of the gardens with lots of stalls to get snacks, hot lunch and cold drinks including delicious Iced tea cocktails. There is a taxi rank right outside the exit and there was a small queue of available taxis so we did not even have to wait for one when we left the gardens. It is an absolutely beautiful place. We spent around 2 hours strolling around and taking photographs and it was a perfect afternoon. This is a must see whilst visiting Dubai as you will not see anything like it anywhere else. Beautiful.

Select the right time of the year to visit. Visit at the wrong time of the year when it is too hot then you may be disappointed as the flowers and plants will not be at their best. That said it is still a nice quiet place to walk around and imagine what it could look like in full bloom. AED 30 entrance fee seems reasonable. A visit to the Butterfly Garden next door at any time of the year is a worthwhile visit to see hundreds of butterflies up close and personal. The additional AED 50 to get into the Butterfly Garden is a bit steep

Miracle Garden.... Indeed!. I visited the Gardens in Dec 2014, and i was totally amazed by this magnificient sight in the middle of nowhere.... literally. They had such a variety of flowers, and the decor was simply amazing...... i loved that there were seating places ..... both shaded and and unshaded..... and while enjoying the sights, you could get a bite to eat as well.... well maintained gardens, beautiful surroundings, and very artistic!...
Most beautiful flower garden ever. The most beautiful place, with the most beautiful flowers i have evr seen. Enjoyed the 9D room with my kids wanting to stay there for ever.

Miracle in the Desert. Amazing place in Dubai.... New Miracle additions to Dubai...Great Place for teens and Newly wed Couples... Place to do a photo shoot .... Miracle Garden is changing every year, with new displays and flower combinations to explore.reached there evening Butterfly Garden is open Now Works only only upto 5:30 Couldn't get as I am Late ...Open From OCT-MAY only Closed in Summers...If your Driving yourself Have a Navigator or else you will be stuck can't get out as Roads Signs are not there to guide Drivers to reach Highway or come back to Dubai.....
It is OK.. Good to visit. It is an oasis in the dessert. Easy acces from the highway. I visited in the middle of the day and it was very hot! Try to visit in the morning and in the late afternoon.

Beautiful. Its a lovely place to go with friends and loved ones.the artistry of how they make houses out of flowers is quite fascinating.There is a mini food shop corner to get a bite to eat or something to drink after your tour of the place which is good.There is a professional photographer if you want your miracle garden photos taken but its not cheap either.Overall its an amazing place to visit,Ideal for couples who are celebrating an event or getting engaged.

Well maintained garden to cool your eyes and lots of photo ops!. Great place to spend an hour with family to admire and appreciate beautiful floral arrangements and landscaped areas. Entry ticket price (AED 50 per head) must be made more reasonable (at least for children) to attract crowds and deserve the attention needed as its located in a far away area and the only access seems to be by taxis which don't come by easily...
One of the Beuatifull Place in Dubai. You will be amazed by seeing the beauty of this place. You will find the miracles they actually did with plants and flowers. A must visit for the couples.

Miracle Garden - Artificial beauty. -:) It stroke of masterpiece, it really needs efforts and money to maintain such a big park with flowers. They should keep open after flowers are died and no more fresh beauty if left due to scouring heat.

Fun garden to walk through. It's pretty easy to get out here, any cab can take you here. There are lots of cabs waiting by the exit to take you wherever you want when you leave. It was maybe like 50AED from the garden to the marina area. It's worth about an hour and its only 30 AED so its a great place to walk through. I think it closes soon for the summer.

NO NO NO. A sad small-ish ugly planted pots garden. If you ever been in any proper botanical gardens around the world this depressing place will leave you really dissapointed.You dont expect this to see in Dubai ... where everything is the "biggest" .....

A piece of nature in sandy UAE. While you do feel it is completely artificial and man made, it is still an astonishing development for such a hot country.Thought do not allocate to much time for it, the garden is way smaller then you think.Definitely worth a visit.

absolutely miracle garden. this one ( miracle garden ) a person cannot miss to see the beauty and very amazing that in hot country like dubai they created the miracle garden absolutely a miracle amd worth to see the miracle garden in dubai.
Floral Heaven. What a great idea, plenty to see and smell and lots of thought has gone into this. Well worth the trip out to see the garden, lots of amazing photos and memories.

Awesome oasis in middle of desert. You won't really believe till u visit this majestic garden. If ur coming to dubai this should be in top priority list. Huge garden with great landscape and so many variety of flowers, you will feel like ur in some Swiss gardens.
sightseeing. loved the way different wonders of the world are displayed through flowers and the best part is that it changes every season a place must see.

You must see it. There is no words to describe this amazing place where all things are made of flowers. They are surrounding you at every step and they are beautiful, colorful and make you feel happy and smiling. :)
excellent garden.. Miracle garden of Dubai is superb. it is well maintained even in hot weather. nice place to do photo shoot. must visit place.

The most beautiful and well maintained flower garden in Dubai. One would often wander if large scale gardening and natural landscaping is possible in a desert.One needs to visit Dubai to see the astonishing garden well manicured, decorated with blooming flowers all throughout the year.There are so many different kinds of themes available in flower structures like vintage cars, european houses, flower clocks and the burj khalifa itself.This garden is a good competition to its european counterparts and is a must visit place for all Dubai Tourists.This garden proves that nothing is impossible in Dubai.

Lovely. This place is a must see if you're into nature. The ideas put into this garden are amazing and I wish to see it evolve and grow and new designs should be added on regular basis. The place is clean and big.. so you need some comfy shose and a camera to capture every corner.Very plasent place to go to with the family.

Disappointment. Went to Miracle Garden in May.It was 40 degrees that day.There were no shades.The plants & flowers looked withered from the heat.We planned to spent 3 hours there but left after less than an hour.Miracle Garden looked impressive on line but it were nothing like what we saw that day.Totally disappointed

Miracle indeed. Beautiful garden in Dubai. I take it the name miracle has to do with how hot it is and the flowers still bloom?! lolEither way definitely worth a visit, weather permitting, it's not big but feels like miles in 115 weather.Great photo ops everywhere.

Overrated! . Looks better and bigger in pictures.. Some of the things were really tacky, isn't done tastefully, just a lot of ideas and things put together.. Not recommended considering the long drive and the ticket price..
Heaven On Earth. This is a must visit place, The place is Amazing. Everything there is made out of beautiful flowers Burj Khalifa, Eiffel Tower, houses, cars.Overall a beautiful experience.
Miracle Garden. This garden is a must fist in every trip to Dubai.....every time you go u will find something new..... New landscaping, flowers and very plesant in the evening

Avoid it. Not at all as advertised or as seen on pictures. Much smaller (we walked around the whole garden in 15min) and disappointing in real life. In pictures the garden looks luxurious however in real life flowers and decor looks cheap such as mdf wood 'photo booth' and random car reckages in between the planting, it looks like a cheap theme park from the 80s. Flowers are also disappointing half were dry or dead, other seems small, they are nearly all in pots.The garden also felt overcrowded with family and children walking over the flower beds being rude and careless. I went with my wife for a romantic evening walk but we both felt shocked and disapointed as we were expecting a beautiful setting, calm and quiet, luxurious and romantic. Finally the road to get there is ridiculously hard to find. It's definitely not worth the money, will never come back.
Amazing!!!😃❤️👍. I have been there a few times on multiple occasions with friends and family. Absolutely stunning and enhancing every year!!!❤️

Truly A Miracle. Very much attractive colorful place especially a photographers paradise , remember to catch the Umbrella Stretch ,
Summer would be a bit disadvantageous so better try during October to March , dont get lost in the car parks or start walking
You really need private vehicle or arranged tours

Little away from city, but worth it . Visit it only if you have time. It takes time to reach it and after reaching it, we should be able to spend 1 to 2 hours there. It is closed from June for 4 to 5 months due to summer season. We should have our own transport up and down. During day time it is hot and during night it is not very illuminated. I recommend to reach in the evening hours.
Visual treat. This is a must visit! The place is beautiful. Everything there is made out of beautiful flowers including burj Khalifa and tour Eiffel.

Breathtaking!. Words cannot describe how beautiful this place is!!! I was completely in awe! Can't believe they made such a beautiful place in the middle of the desert! Takes about an hour to go around and there's so many amazing things they have made!
Beautiful flowers!. We really had to travel to visit these gardens, but it was totally worth it! The pretty flowers and colours are all an absolute visual treat!
Great Place. This was a great place to to go checkout some beautiful flowers and the things they created with it. If you can definitely take the opportunity to check it out.
Amazing!. Must visit place! Quite far out from all the attractions and hotels. The displays were amazing. It cost us 60 dirhams from dubai creek. One way.

A Gem in the middle of the desert. We went to the gardens (recommended by a Royal Brunei Airlines Hostess). We arrived at about 12:30 pm on a Sunday and found the place relatively empty. We were in awe with what they have growing there, colours to dazel your eye balls. Reasonable price to get in but if you want to go to the Butterfly House it is another entry fee of 50 Dirham. (Still worth the price!)
something different. It is a place full of flowers. You can see the burj khalifa, eiffel tower, houses, cars, limousines and many more, all made by flowers.

A garden in a desert!!. Normally, you don't expect a garden in a desert. Even if there was one, being an Indian, one may think, what about a garden, that too which you have not seen!But one would be shocked to see this in the middle of a desert. One of the most beautiful garden you would have seen, this makes you wonder, whether you are in a desert. I am given to understand that in peak of summer, the entire garden withers and they recreate this later. A must see place.

Amazing experience. the garden is an amazing experience. beautiful flowers. A place, where you will love to capture photos at all the places. need a couple of hours to visit garden properly and enjoy the beauty.next to it is another wonder called butterfly garden. a real out of the world experience with beautiful butterflies all over
Wish More Miracle. I visited Miracle Garden with my friends. What I perceived was not in the garden, may be the more development activities is needed. But for kids, the garden is really miracle/
really a miracle..... it is really amazing the way they are maintainig the beauty of the place...superb....everytime when i am coming there i have lot of new surprises...

Truly a Miracle. Dubai has come a long way . In the 70's you hardly saw any flowers . Miracle garden has more then 10,000 variety of flowers and is very well designed. Overrall a beautiful experience.

A dream photo destination.. One of its own. Full of beautiful flowers all over in difference colors and shapes. You will find famous monuments made up of flowers here. There is a very good all country flags train. A photogenic place, where you will love to capture photos at all the places. Spare couple of hours to visit garden properly and enjoy the beauty. Entry ticket is 30 AED.

Beautiful place. It was amazing experience for us to visit this garden...they made beautiful garden in the middle of desert...lots of kinds of flowers and greens shaped with different kind of houses, cars etc. And also there is new butterfly garden inthe compaound of Miracle garden..Butterflies ara amazing colourfull and everysize...I hoghly recommend these 2 gardens ..they must be seen in UAE Tours...
Great park. Brilliant collection of flowers and decoration. Very eye catching. The maintainance is also very good.
Not really worth the long taxi ride. We went on an exceptionally hot day (40 degrees!). It was totally amazing how they managed to plant and keep alive so many plants though.

Very nicely done. This was one of the attractions that we had planned to visit during our trip to Dubai. Knowing how hot it gets in Dubai it amazed us on how well kept the place is and very green. There are a few attractions inside which are worth seeing. However please try and visit the place early morning or maybe around 5 pm (especially in the hot summer season).

Rich selection of nice flowers and trees also few birds selection , nice seating everywhere , safety and calm place t.... variety..colors...As this place is unique place to relax day and Night .... nice seating everywhere...safe place...good for walking or jumping even

Absolutely Beautiful. Miracle Garden is truly beautiful and is a wonder considering that this exists in a desert. The effort on part of Dubai authorities is visible and I must say its commendable. Great place to spend a few hours and click some great pics.

stunning. I liked everything about it. amazing, clean, organised , But crowded during holidays and weekends. stunning views and really a "MUST SEE". very unique experience and nice outdoor atmosphere.

Less than a Miracle. It is a long taxi drive from town and you need to keep your taxi there for your visit. The garden may have millions of flowers but in April 2015 all of them were Petunias. Much of the display is tacky with unsuitable plastic extras amidst the flowers. It was 42C during our visit and there are no a/c areas so you swelter in the heat. If you live in a desert this place may be of interest but others should avoid it

“Fabulous”. The garden was magnificent! Full of flowers and colors everywhere! Such a nice escape in a desert country and must visit butterfly garden which is situated inside the miracle garden. Butterfly garden time till 5pm so manage your time accordingly.check9d show in miracle garden,its small shop in food area but it was amazing game experience.

No exotic flowers. Not worth the trip or money spend (30 AED per person) and then additional (50 AED per person for Butterfly park)Amazing structures, good concept but same flowers (and plain and simple flowers) used. May if you really want to go, go in the evening as I am sure the lights will add the magic.

Great for photos, but not enough variety in flowers. Firstly it's unbelievable that you can have this many live flowers in a desert. I'm sure there's lots of work involved, and we did see some gardeners swapping out flower pots which had faded a bit. The arrangements are amazing, and look great on photographs. The park is huge, so yo easily spend a couple of hours just walking around and admiring the different flower arrangements. I do wish though that there were more types of flowers. They basically boil down to petunias for 90%, and then some daisies and snapdragons. When seeing the garden originally from the pictures, I thought there would be a larger variety.Food and drink are fairly limited, especially in quality, but overall the price is worth it.

Fabulous. I loved this place and as disabled didn't pay -you pay just 20 AED for a buggy to drive round and a free buggy to the butterfly park cost 50 AED .To get there from the marina about 40mins and no more than £10 and you see quite a lot of desert land getting there It reminded me of LEGOLAND but mall the "buidlins" were built with flowers
Beautiful Place!. The garden was magnificent! Full of flowers and colors everywhere! Such a nice escape in a desert country! Get ready for a new profile picture :D
Below expectation. The very generous and innovative idea is ending up into a tired and not very well maintained Dubai attraction.
Amazing. I just love the garden ... Colorful and brilliant ... Also not expensive ... But i think it needs like an appropriate snack or a more of a high level cafe ... A must visit

A stunning display of colour. One of the best flowed displays you will see anywhere, and you need to remind yourself that you are actually in the desertt!!
While this may not appeal to everyone, it is worth seeing once. It did seem that a lot of people were there with visiting parents......
Green between sand. Garden full of colours ! Flower made monuments are everywhere, some ouses, gates, Burj Khalifa, faces, animals... great place to go for a walk and take awesome photos

Makes you feel like Alice in Wonderland. We really enjoyed going to see these gardens even though they are a little far away. We had a hired car and was a bit hard to find with the GPS (since it is a new attraction but eventually found it). The gardens are extremely beautiful and make you feel like Alice in Wonderland. We went in the early afternoon but I would recommend going in the late afternoon or early morning due to the heat. The food and ice cream available there is over priced and not that nice. I think the price was AED30 per adult which is cheap considering the price for most attractions in Dubai. Recommended stay is probably between 1 and 2 hours.

Beautiful. We really enjoyed our trip to The Miracle Garden. It is beautifully laid out old cars done up with flowers etc, we spent over an hour here. Entrance fee was 30 Dirham and we enquired about the Butterfly garden which is separate, we were told the entrance fee to that was 50 Dirham, which we did not go to. It would work out very costly if you had to take a taxi here, it is very rural and dusty road I don't think it would be worth it. Lucky us we were brought here by family.
