Beautiful flowers in the desert. Lovely plantings and displays of flowering annuals all set in unusual displays of buildings,arches and old cars. Would have been at its peak a few weeks earlier when the weather was a little cooler. Still a lovely sight to experience. Don't overlook The Butterfly Park next to it. Another 50 Durham to see but amazing walk through butterfly enclosures. Brilliant butterfly's everywhere amongst tropical gardens. An absolute delight. Great place to take children to experience these beautiful butterflies. A must see attraction.

Great for photoshoots with friends!. We went on a particularly hot day, but the park is charming and you really have to wonder how any organic life grows in the desert. You feel as if you're transported into a kitschy Martha Stewart meets Disney dreamland where flowers are abundant and are shaped into various buildings. Enjoy a rest with smoothie when you're done!

Awesome. I have never seen such an amazing park in my life. it is a must watch place of Dubai. All the designs made from flower and other plants are so imaginative that I was spell bound after seeing it.

Beautifully made but could do a bit more. The pave has been designed beautifully with flowers all over. Wish they could use a bit more variety in the type of flowers and the structures they create. After a while it all starts to look the same. Maybe in their next expansion

Skip this place, way overrated. This place came recommended from several sites and people. It is a bit hard to find, there are very small signs that lead you around until you finally arrive at a dirt parking lot.There is a 30 dirham charge to enter and I have to say you would get a far greater experience watching those 30 dirhams light up in flames than you would entering this place.The miracle garden is a park with several discarded objects (car pieces) arranged to amuse people that have never been park before. There is a far greater selection of flowers to look at at your local hardware store.Whoever managed to convince tourists to go here is a genius.Please go spend the day at the beach or elsewhere.
Average gardens can be skipped. You will find way better gardens in Europe and the US. These had nice flowers but the walkway needs to be shaded to even enjoy a morning walk in here

Beautiful Place to Visit. Nice place to visit and to take some pictures with different flower setup for memories.
The Entrance is 30 dirhams around 8$.

A must visit for anyone visiting/living in Dubai!. Very picturesque, amazing arrangement of flowers in all colours, which immediately cause the "WOW" reaction as you walk in. Real treat to the eyes. However, try to avoid it during the weekends (Friday & Saturday for UAE) if possible as it gets really crowded on those days especially in the afternoon. There are enough food kiosks offering quick snacks and drinks...
Another wonder of the world. Another wonder of the world in the middle of the desert. All around are flowers in all colours in different shapes. It is just for your viewing pleasure.
Wonderful display. To see such vibrant colourful flowers in Dubai was amazing. You have to be careful about the date you go otherwise the flowers are not in full bloom or have died.
Go after-noon. - Try to go after-noon ( 3 pm )- Avoid weekends because it's become very crowded- there is a butterflies garden just beside it, do not miss it :)

Interesting - suit for one time only. I cannot say that this place is not good. Probably it is not my taste to walk among the gardens and watching the gardens and flowers. They are interesting and worth a visit. But it did not call my attention for a second visit, unless I would take someone there that may want to visit it. For me, the first time was just enough.
Must see in Dubai. It is one of the best places in Dubai. The flowers look and smell amazing. You will be supprised what people can build with flowers.

Beautiful!. We really enjoyed it, it is an amazing place. I would recommend to come before it hits 40 degrees. There are places too cool off with water and some snacks but are still outdoors and shaded with the same flowers. Kids love it since it has cars, houses, boats and so.

Beautiful but too far away (expensive). Taking a taxi you will pay around (60-75 from most of the hotels), meaning 150 + 30 ticket per person. We (couple) paid over 180 (circa 60 usd)... very expensive taking into consideration that we spent 1 hour there... it is not big. Still it is very beautiful, excellent for pictures.

Miracle Garden - Creative Floral Display. This unique garden is really an accomplishment in Dubai's hot desert climate. Gorgeous arches laden with flowers lead you to lush floral arrangements, spilling over from hanging baskets to ground designs and quaint village houses completely covered in flowers. Even Burj Khalifa makes an appearance as a miniature covered in flowers.Good luck discovering months open for the public, best guess is appx Nov to April or May when it closes once it's too hot for flowers to survive outside. It's not an overly large attraction, easy to enjoyably walk the various pathways. It's a perfect uplift as you slowly walking among beautiful displays, with snack refreshments available and seats for resting. Entrance fee is inexpensive, around 30 AED per adult.

Good for One Time Visit. Definitely very beautiful and well maintained but very boring after a while. Good to visit once and click few pics. They should add some sort of entertainment factor to the place. AED 30 is a bit too much for that kind of 1 or 2 hours you may wish to spend there and that too after a loooong drive. Comparatively Global village is a better option.

Lovely family day out!. This is definately one of the places to say you have seen in Dubai, lovely day out for the family but would go just now before the really hot weather kicks in. We went during the day but going to go back at night too to see it all lit up. Our 3 year old loved the Butterfly Garden too, I was like a big scaredy cat though everytime one came near me! Ha!

Good Picture Spot. Nice area for pictures. Try to go early as to get pictures without a crowd of people behind you. You don't need an entire day to visit the gardens as it is not huge. it's also next to some sort of theme park so you can possibly plan to visit both.
A paradise. Since I came to Dubai nothing attracted me as the Miracle Garden did I cant imagine how beautiful the naturally plants and flowers there really awesome place

A Garden you will never forget. It is a place to enjoy your day at. Loved the flower shapes of the Burj Khalifa , houses and especially the lady that has water out of her hand. they have many restaurants and have a shield of Flowers on top of the food court area.

Colourful, pretty place. Miracla gardens is something different. Definitely a must visit !There is not much to do besides seeing all the amazing flower arrangements. Yet a pleasant experience.It is a little away from the main city area. Can be clubbed up with 'The farm' which is a restaurant close by.
Wow. the way they have maintained the beauty and sculpting of flowers is mesmerizing especially the replica of Eiffel towers

A Wonderful Collection of Flower Plants. We visited Miracle Garden on 8th April, 2015. The garden is amazingly beautiful. The flower pots were arranged in such a manner so as to give a look of a house, hut, etc. Our children enjoyed a lot.
wow. it's a very beautiful place to visit , garden in dessert !!! that's a miracle ... you can spend 1 /1& half hour here
Its miracle indeed. Very very big, millions of flowers, colours aroud you, resurants , coffe shops, sitting areas, need at least three relaxing hours to enjoy, taking photos to memorise .
flowerssss..... in middle east country like Dubai... so amazing garden its really superb.... its really nice place in winter....
Magnificent gardens. Just when I thought Dubai could no longer surprise me - they built these unbelievable gardens. They truly are miraculous! What a wonderful visit. I was overwhelmed..

Day trip from Abu Dhabi. Had heard good things about this place and it didn't disappoint. The price was just about right - maybe a little too much - but it is certainly an experience!! There isn't a huge range of flowers used to make up the displays (I guess the heat restricts choice) so if you're going for a horticultural experience you'll be disappointed but the wow factor is there in the displays. The best part - although costs extra - is Butterfly World; an attraction linked to the Gardens. Our 4 year old absolutely loved it!! So if you do got a couple of hours to fill in Dubai, I would definitely recommend heading out here! Enjoy.
ITS A MIRACLE. Really fantastic. But to get there is very difficult. Too much traffic also. May be we went on the wrong time. Love the flower arrangement's and all.
miracle indeed. very nice scenes ..cant get how they made it in such a hot weather very nice experience ..could have had more activities
First of Its Kind. => situated outside the city=> Houses, Car, Minautres you will find everything made up of flowers=> best time to visit in the evening=> Entry fees of AED 50

Excellent. Very scenic and beautiful layout to it. You would not believe that you are very close to the desert. It is about a 30 min journey from downtown Dubai but certainly worth the journey. I would recommend not going in the afternoon when the sun is strong as there is very little shade other than to take an umbrella.
Miracle Garden. Beautiful displays of flowers, well worth a visit.Could do with better more varied refreshment facilities.

Miracle all right!. This place was very nice, a garden city per say. There is small houses made out of plants and some great looking Peakcocks. Apparently is only open six months out of the year, they water and replace plants at night. Enjoyed it

A HUMAN MIRACLE. It is not exactly a garden. it is an area where you can see a lot of flowers made items.Houses, cars, trains, statues ,famous building (eiffel tower etc), a tap that seems standing on air, and a lot of beautifull shapes from flower. It is suggested for people who has as hobby or profession the photography.You can not imagine if you do not go there.It has a fee entrance about 8 Euro.

Beautiful Flowers. This place is worth visiting as it has over 40,000 flowers and very pleasing to the eye. It was a taxi ride from our Hotel and the entrance is 30 dirhams per persons but it was worth the money. We went late afternoon so that we did not have to deal with the Dubai heat

A weird, yet boring, but mostly weird acid trip. It's rather pretty but in a mass of pot plant kind of way. Could be a marginally nice place for a picnic, but all in all it's just an odd experience and not really in the odd exciting kind of way especially not for the money. It's the UAE trying to make excitement out of potplants.It's cute and all. And I'm all for a pretty view and a bit of creativityishness.... but not for 30dhs each. If it were a free park I'd recommend it. Else.... nope, to the next attempt to find culture in the UAE ;)

Miracle Garden. Well decorated with flowers - both artificial and natural. the only thing i found a bit compromising is that the real flowers are all small flowers used to decorate. But good place to be with family.

It's definetly a miracle. I was speechless with the garden. OMG! I never ever imagined such an amount of different kinds of flowers, different colours, different everything. Just one thing: it's full of annoying flies. But obviously it's a garden. Anyway, it's fabulous!!

Best gardin I visited in my life. I went to miracle gardin at Dubai with my wife we choked ther whe saw how they make it more than butiful by all kind of flowers and its colors, they gonna open butterfly gardin inside also I think it's will be amazing One I extremely advice any one visiting Dubai to go there he/she will be happy

Great for a visit with Family, Friends & Loved ones. The Miracle Garden is a little far to go, but worth it as they have made fantastic arrangements not only of their vertical garden, but also to ensure that the elders in the family are also taken care of.Lovely settings and awesome efforts of keeping this place intact.

An oasis in the midst of the city!. The garden is truly a sight to behold, so many different colours and some very imaginative displays! It is a little difficult to find but watch for the little signs at the roundabouts and you'll be fine!

Flowers at this scale in the desert!!!. Fantastic place- one can go in the evenings as well, as one can appreciate the flowers in the natural flood lights too. The flowers look beautiful, however please do not expect to see exotic flowers. They only have the normal flowering types, which make the place look amazingly colorful.

Beautiful flowers. If you go to Dubai, you should pay a visit to the garden. Be sure to have car, because the taxi is very expensive both ways. For everyone who loves such places, it will be a nice time spending there.

Stunning!!. I can't believe somewhere like this exists in Dubai in the heat! Although if anywhere in the world was going to do it then it would be Dubai! Well worth a walk round and entrance fee very reasonable.
Nice flowers Nice arrngement - very hot temps (April 2015). Nice flowrs and the arrangement is also nice; it's very hot in the afternoon (11-14h00), I would suggest you go there in the morning.
amazing. Beautiful Place. We all loved the place including my 3 year old. Such lovely decor and amazing photographs to take back home.

Beautiful but expensive.... We visited Miracle Garden in the evening. The entry ticket is 30 dirhams /person. Which we found to be a bit steep after seeing the garden. It is no doubt very beautifully planed and maintained but its quite small. Full of blooming flowers everywhere its a treat to the sore eyes. Houses made of flowers, trains of flower, Burj Khalifa, a clock, a castle, peacocks, waterfalls and what not.. all made of flowers. Very pretty and very very crowded, difficult to get photo op without having people all around you. But it was friday so possibly that may be the reason.It has a cafeteria too. All in all very nice.

Nice..but.... I have visited the miracle garden twice.. the first, two years ago was an excellent experience. Though they were small compared to now, it was better organized.. Now, it has reduced to more of a see from far kinda an experience. I understand that to maintain the flowers, the organizers have to keep the visitors away from getting too close but asking people to stay off the grass is very irritating, especially if you are a photography enthusiast like I am. Though I love seeing the nature in all its glory, especially in Dubai's hot weather, getting close to it would seem much more of a personal experience. The first experience was good cos one was allowed to get close to capture the beauty of the flowers.. now it's more of a see from far kinda an experience. I am sure many may enjoy the experience of seeing it from far, however, I did not.

Nice Place. if you would like to have an escape from the high towers; Miracle garden is the right place to visit , you can have a nice walk between the monuments and the sites, whereby you can find different shapes and types of flowers.
Amazing!. I really recommend to visit this place. The entrance fees are not expensive and one can made beautiful pictures there. Avoid week ends and public holidays as it is really overcrowded.

Amazing!. I went with my mother and it is such a beautiful place and I was so fascinated as to how they've created such a wonderful place with all the green and the flowers in the desert. It's so refreshing walk around and enjoying the scenery and this i would do over and over again. They however need to work on the ticketing area, it's a bit shabby and doesn't reflect the gardening area.

Amazing. It is a wonderfully created place especially in a desert. Fascinating how these people have used there imagination and talent to create such a wonderful place. I appreciated the green grass and colourful flowers .

Very good experience. It's a nice green place, it makes you feel that you're not in a desert! Family friendly, good for a walk and taking some family photos. I wouldn't consider it a "miracle", but it's nice and it's something that your eyes will cherish.The entrance & the ticket counter though is a miracle! It doesn't reflect the high standard of such a place!
Extraordinary interaction with butterflies! And outstanding meals!. You can't miss the butterflies, no matter how much you enjoy the gardens alone! Outstanding experience!

Lovely flowers. "Better late than never" I've been to miracle garden with my friends last February. Since It was my first time coming to Dubai that time, the road was a bit confusing and it is really located a little bit far from the city. As we came inside, It was just a wow for me to see beautiful flowers in the "middle of the desert", it is creatively made with different sizes and shapes. Best time to visit the garden will be like in between December and February which the temperature will be cool. If you feel hungry and tired, they have choices of food stalls and there are chairs and tables as well.
An oasis in the desert. The most beautiful gardens I have ever seen , and in the desert to. Out. Everything is made of flowers , even a small village. A total assault to the senses

Not worth it. Let's get this little bit over first. Yes, it is a miracle that the flowers on show are pretty and a miracle given its location however the rest is rubbish. I like dubai and most of what it has to offer but this was a poor effort. We visited on a whim so we went unprepared. Water is 5dhs for a small local water, entry is 30dhs but only to the gardens. Entry into the butterfly garden is 50dhs and isn't stated anywhere that it's an extra. For what it is I think it's a rip but others may disagree. Sorry

Amazingly creative.. Loved the ideas - different houses dressed in flowers, clocks designed out of flowers, walkways and pathways - everything was floral!wish however, there was a bit of information about the theme and the flowers used.Did not appreciate the commercialism though, should be a quiet restful retreat type place for awe and wonder!

Beautiful oasis in Dubai. This is a nice outing for any age. It's a large park with all kinds of flower sculptures. You'll be amazed at the constructions and wonder how they did that in the middle of the desert. Leave yourself about an hour to wander around or more if you want to grab a drink or a bite. Entrance fee is 30 AED, parking is free. Highly recommend for something different in Dubai.

Beautiful Garden. The direction was not clear enough. We need to take 1 lap because we missed the entrance. Just follow the google map if you have GPS. We went there on friday afternoon around 3.00 pm. It still spring, so the weather still friendly.The garden very beautiful with flowers in different color. And also with the miniatures of world's icons such as eiffel, burj khalifa, and windmills.The ticket fee is 30 dhs per person. Children under 3 yo are free to enter.Behind this Miracle Garden, there is Butterfly Garden. It cost 50 dhs to enter. But, if you have seen variety of butterfly in your country or other place, you can pass this place. It only see the butterfly in few small garden. I've seen much better garden and more vary of butterfly.When we finish with all the gardens, we went out at 6.00 pm. And there were much people than before.So, if you want to take some nice pictures without a lot of people around, just come earlier.

New attraction in Dubai. On our Dubai itinerary for the first time & I have to say it is amazing & worth a visit. Since returning from holiday I have been sharing my photos with my gardening friends. Colour like I have never seen before!!
A miracle in true sense. The miracle garden is really beautiful for all the nature lovers. It is a miracle indeed to see such a beautiful lush green garden in a place like Dubai!

Any thing in Dubai is done in style. Very good place to visit. Must see this and Global Village which is very near to Miracle Garden. In package tour generaly this activety is not offered so one should plan UAE visit and spare one day for these two fantastic faimly activity.

Flowers, Flowers. It is a creative garden with flowers on must about everything you can imagine, houses, cars, animals, people. It is not a botanical garden. It is different yet worth the trip to visit. It is a bit inland from the sea and best arrive and depart by taxi.

Beautiful!!. The Miracle Garden was really nice. It seemed to have a Disney theme which was cool. I'm not so much into visiting gardens but it was nice that the garden had structures made out of flowers. Like the Burj Khalifa, the hearts, the Eiffel Tower among others. Its good for scenery and taking pictures. I recommend going early in the morning so you can get great pictures with not so many people photobombing.

beautiful but nothing much more. It is a beautiful place with a lot of flower sculptures and a good place for spending a few hours. But beyond that the place does not offer much. Eating options are limited and charge over the normal rate. There is not many seating options nor washrooms available.I was disappointed to see that they did not have much variety of flowers in the garden. It is primarily the same type of flower of different colours used everywhere.The location is another issue as the place is hard to reach and out of the way and the worst part is that there aren't proper signs to direct people. Once there the parking scene is dismal and most of the time full.The ticketing counter is not good and getting in is a hassle. Avoid the place in summer as there is no shade and you will burn yourself in the dubai heatThe place is overhyped and even if you skip it, you will not be missing much
Really nice place. This garden is really beautiful,every where is full of flower and you can find houses made of flowers .i recommend everyone travel to dubai visit it.

Decent get-away in the city. Although not much variety in terms of plants/flower - mostly heat tolerant varieties - the garden is a relaxing respite from city life. We especially enjoyed all the flower buildings. My family enjoyed the butterfly garden next door even more.

Really wonderful Miracle Garden @ Dubai. Right in the midst of the Dubai desert, there is this man-made Miracle. I have not seen so many flowers in one garden anywhere (may be with exception of the Keukenhof Tulips garden near Amsterdam ..). The garden is very huge .... spread over two phases I and II. Both gardens have different flowery themes .... But huge landscapes of thousands of blooming flowers. There is also a unique idea of the a village with flowers on all houses. It takes at least two hours to cover both phases ... and be prepared for the bright/hot sun in desert. I visited in February, wonder how the flowers will survive in summer heat later. The garden is rather away from Dubai Metro route, and I took a taxi from the Mall of Emirates Metro station (10+ miles ride ... but not too expensive).Truly, the Miracle garden ranks amongst the Best Flower gardens in the world.

So beautiful. I had never heard of this until last time I went to Dubai. This garden is AMAZING!!! So beautiful. So much work has obviously gone into the design and it is unlike anything I have been to. A bit of a way from the centre of Dubai, you need to get a taxi. There is a little food court with really friendly staff, and toilet facilities. Great to spend a coupe of hours wandering
It's OK. Out of the way attraction and nothing special, I got disappointed, because there's no other flower but Bougainvilla
Indeed miracle. take some time to reach that place, but is beautiful, colored, quite incredible if you realize that you are in the middle of desert.Sun, perfume, flowers.and tourists

Desert Flowers (millions of them!). Relaxing, cheap, leisurely, but probably not of much interest to teenagers, this most unusual of gardens is awash with colour. It has the Dubai 'wow' factor being the world's biggest flower garden and the Guinness record holder for the Largest Vertical Garden.It claims to have 45 million blooming flowers but you'll have to discover the massive adjacent 'fields' to see the biggest continuous expanse of them. The flowers are displayed in 'stunning designs, awesome shapes and eye-catching colour combinations'.The gardens are situated 'out back' of Dubai near Motor City in the North West Quadrant of the Arabian Ranches interchange along Sheikh Mohammad Bin Zayed Road. You may think that being out of the city the roads will be smaller - they're not! You'll need to get there by car, taxi or organised tour.Unfortunately signposting to the gardens is minimal and signposting out of the gardens back to Dubai is virtually non existent. Come on Dubai - you can do better than this!Yes, the gardens are fantastic, but compared to other in-Dubai attractions the infrastructure is, well a bit basic. Everything is there - WCs, Restaurants, glass maze, first aid room, prayer rooms, sitting and playing areas, but it is all a bit, well, basic and uninspiring. Expect vast improvements before Expo 2020. Entry only cost 30Dhs per person, so dirt cheap by Dubai standards and well worth a two to three hour visit. Suggest going early afternoon, then going, without moving your car, to the adjacent Dubai Butterfly Garden and then on, after 4pm to Global Village which is also cheap at 15Dhs. Any bored teenagers will appreciate the fun fair at Global Village and parents will like the various country pavilions. Combine all three places and you'll have a great, varied and cheap day and evening out.

Thousands of flowers in the middle of the desert!. Lovely place to spend there few hours. The place looks very very nice , everywhere you look you will see flowers, many flowers , many colors is like on a fairy tail. The gardens are not in the town. You have to take the taxi ,it will cost you around 50 aed witch means around 15 usd, more or less. Go there to see this beautiful and unique gardens, you wont regret it!

Should be called Eden Garden!. A great place to have a brake from malls of Dubai.Amazing how they keep it all in great condition.Fun place for kids .Couples love it.The food court is not great in terms of taste.There are plenty of choices but no great place.You may visit after having your meal to digest it by walking araound.09:00-21:00 are working hours so no excuse not to see it before the Summer heat.Disabled and kids below 3years of age free but others pay 30 Aed.

Beautiful ... a must see for lovers of all things botanical!. Miracle garden is a beautiful and tranquil place. Its only open in the winter season so it does get very busy in there. We went just before opening time and there was no queue outside, by the time we left there was a really long line of people waiting to go inside. Like I mentioned before, its a really beautiful place to visit but after a while it does seem a bit like you've seen the same flower over and over. One very disappointing factor was the eating area which was covered in flying bugs and flies, also the restaurants were overpriced with very little variety.
Beautiful…. It was really beautiful. A perfect way to spend a sunny day with the breathtaking views, and so many beautiful flowers. Really worth the visit.

it is really a miraculous Garden. the Garden is amazing, the smell and the designs of the flowers just blow your mind :) perfect place for family outing. i heard they have now a small butterflies's haven inside :) can't wait to see it with my little son ^_^

A Dubai Must Do. The Miracle Garden is well worth a visit. After two years living in the Gulf it was great to see some colour! My kids loved it and we spent a couple of hours just wondering around. It costs 30 AED per person to enter and was very clean and well maintained.Next door there is another attraction called Dubai Butterfly Garden which costs 50 AED per person. This place was really great. We were able to take some great pictures of the kids with the butterflies. Would highly recommend a visit to both attractions.

just a regular garden with many garden police. After visiting some european parks Miracle garden is just called a miracle because it is in the middle of the desert. The garden itseld is nothing special. If ever in the Netherlands, don´t miss Keukenhof gardens. These are really miracle gardens!!
Could be better. probably the heat or choice of gardens around the world... i wold only rat average for the miracle garden... could be a greater choice of attraction
Excellent attraction for an 2hr visit in the evening.. we visited it on 3rd april 2015. its a good well maintained flower garden . something different, BUTTERFLY Garden was also good.

Lots of Flowers. Creative use of colorful flowers and plants. Easy to walk around. We spent about an hour touring the grounds, but you can spend as much time as needed.A negative point is the Miracle Garden is not served by public transportation. You drive or take a taxi. We took the Metro to the Mall of the Emirates then took a taxi to the Miracle Garden. The cab fare was UAD 27 going and 33 returning to the Mall.Beware, after exiting Miracle Garden, we went to the taxi stand where we were solicited to ride in a "taxi", which was not a marked taxi and the driver wanted UAD 60 to take us to the Mall.

Beautiful. The name says it all, in that heat a miracle they stay alive, such a beautiful sight, if it can have flowers on it then it's there. Houses made of flowers, peacocks made of flowers, trains and vehicles made of flowers and so much more. Lots of photos to take but don't step on the grass as they will blow whistles at you to make you move. Butterfly garden to see also but this is not included in the price and a further 50 diram to enter.Plenty of food/drink stations. Large grounds, well worth a visit.

A wonderful extraordinary place in the desert. We visited this unbelievable place,situated in the desert, where we found a miracle of flowers of all sorts in a amazing number of designs varying from houses to peacocks covering many acres.This whole experience was totally spellbounding, when you consider the very high temperatures they have in Dubai and present such an amazing beautiful experience.Be sure to visit , if you get the chance.Ŵilf Hodgson

Something different to do!. This place is worth a visit: you're in a very green area and you're surrounded by beautiful flowers arranged in pieces of art! The air is perfumed and you can also visit next door the Butterfly garden. Kids enjoy it a lot, and adults too!

Real Beauty in the Desert. Dubai Miracle Garden is a real wonder of how beauty can be created even in the most severe desert weather. It is a MUST visit location while in Dubai if you love beauty. The flowers and the floral arrangements are just stunning. You've got to be there to experience it. Its breathtaking.

Not worth the trip. I was in Dubai for a 5 day vacation and unfortunately spent time and money to go and visit this place. Just another dumb tourist trap. Sure, its bright and colorful..has some cool structures with flowers stuck in them. Overall, very disappointing and unimpressive.

Unbelievable tourist attraction, trully a miracle. For couples, this is a spot definitely not to be missed! Plenty of photo opportunities with very creative ideas. A mini Bruj Khalifa is there together with mini houses, benches, etc. all entirely made of flowers! Even its cafe has a flowery roof!Try to get to the highest spot in the garden for a great view of the designs. Taking a panorama shot there is really amazing! Although the location of the garden is out of nowhere, the beauty and experience of being surrounded by colourful flowers are totally worth the journey.

Beautiful place to visit when you are in Dubai. Very beautiful place with lot of flowers... Girls would love it.. It's very hard to find this place since highways are connecting all over the areas near to this and you will miss the road more often. Nice place to hang around in day time.
miracle Garden in a Miracle in Dessert. one cannot believe it until you see it with your own eyes. A riot of colors of the flowers in midst od Desert of Dubai is unbelievable.

Unbelievable. The Miracle Garden is simply unbelievable,a little way out of the city but Taxis not expensive.If you are interested in colour,flowers,shapes ,your imagination will be never be the same.DON'T leave your camera at home.

Nice surprise in the middle of nowhere . What a pleasant surprise in the middle of nowhere. The parking looks worrying but once you're in it looks really great. Well maintained, colorful and an amazing smell of fresh flowers. Definitely worth a visit.

Beatuiful Flowers Creations. I loved the way the flowers created different shapes for example a house and big hearts that you can walk through. There are just beautiful flowers of all different colors everywhere in this garden. One can walk at own pace and view these pretty flowers. A must see tour in Dubai for all ages.

not to be missed!!. The Miracle Garden was nothing short of spectacular. There are 45 million flowers. It is not a botanical garden. For example they have many houses that are "framed" but then rather than walls, the entire structure is made up of colorful flowers. I have never seen anything like it anywhere in the world. It is one of the stops on the "hop on- hop off" red bus on the orange circuit

Pretty gardens although a little out of the way. We loved the pretty flowers in all the beautiful colours arranged amazingly. A little out of the way and can be difficult to find if you hired your own car like we did. Not much else to do here, you have to also pay for parking. Was quiet when we went.

Interesting Idea. I went to Miracle Garden obviously because all of the hype. It's defninitely a couples thing or at least with family. They get pretty creative with some of the designs such as Burj Khalifa made of flowers. Overall it was a nice place to visit and take pictures.

Lovely Garden to explore and enjoy. These are so different from the usual parks and garden that we would normally visit. The colours are so vibrant and spectacular. This attraction is well worth a visit but you will need to use a taxi to get there. Taxis wait outside the exit from the gardens, which is on the other side of the gardens from the entrance. Make sure you ask for a Government cream coloured taxi for the return journey or it will cost you nearly double. You can get something to eat as well as ice cream and drinks at this venue.

Very Cool!. I enjoyed this very much. It was a good place to go for a "down" day. If you go in the heat of the day, take sun protection. There is a nice bridal path around part of it the gives some nice shade, but you will want to walk around the whole garden. They do have some kiosks selling cold drinks and light refreshments.

Good value. The entrance fee is very reasonable and the flower displays are worth it. The food on site is not the best but there are a lot of fast-food type options. Be prepared to spend a lot of time in the sun.

Beautiful garden - good photoshoots. A very nice place, well designed with great ideas. Make sure to bring your own food, as the selection there is not so big. The washrooms are not really kept clean, thus this should be improved by the park management. There are two parks (just out in the desert) and the miracle garden is even growing more. It is easy to get a taxi to and from. Just be aware that it takes some time from Dubai city center to get there...

Amazing garden in the middle of the desert. A great break from the skyscrapers all around. Lots of flowers, original designs. A great stroll, you can take a break at one of the cafes or fast food places. The only minus is that you need to get there by taxi, which was very cheap either way.

Floral paradise. Seeing so many flowers bloom in a desert country is no less than a miracle so very true to the name . Full of colours and such lovely bloom , one can just sit back and take all the beauty and the creativity of the designing team in . Thankfully was traveling in March as by next month all the flowers will be dead due to excessive heat. A must see in Dubai so whenever planning a trip just check if the garden is in bloom as its not to be missed when in Dubai.
heaven in middle east. Sooooo beautiful garden full of positive vibes, very tasty barbecued corn & honey roasted nuts. must visit.
"Heaven on earth". Most beautiful garden i have ever seen that too in dessert.Great place to relax and spend quality time with your mate & family.
Truly a Miracle. Miracle garden is truly miracle. A must see place for all age groups. It is probably the the world's biggest natural flower garden.

Great Garden in a desert place. Not really fascinated how they grow flowers here (I'm from the Philippines, and I frequently visit Baguio City for the Flower festival) but the way they have arranged the flowers and maintained this garden is awesome. prepare your cameras and be amazed how your macro shot skills will be fantastic. and panorama too! :)Caution: Cabs in queue outside are so picky and will decline passengers to be dropped-off nearby. be sure to get the plate # and report the driver for them to be fined.

Miracle of flowerland that warms the heart!. Upon landing at the site of the miracle garden in dubai, with such intense heat hovering over you, the sight of this miracle garden of flowers, all over, in different designs certainly warms your heart despite the intense heat! i have not seen such a "miracle" flowers all over the land in different shapes, colors and landscaping, it is magnificent and breathtaking! More so than disney land's fantasy land! It will be worth your time and effort entrance fee is not much either! Go for the land of magic and,yes, miracle!!!!
A true miracle. Dubai miracle garden is a true miracle. It's hard to imagine how they created this in the middle of the desert. A must see place. Definitely worth the 30dhs entry fee.

It's a spectacular miracle!. This garden is the most beautiful landscaped garden ever!It's vast, has many unique structures and lots and lots of beautiful flowers!It's very romantic for couples and a fun place for kids!Also, if you are a photography buff, your camera will be very happy to be here1

Spectacular floral display. As expected, a spectacular floral display... We went in March, it wasn't too busy and took about an hour to see it all. If you're stopping for coffe don't use the stalls on the outside, wait till you get in the middle where you'll find a selection of eateries.

Nice family afternoon. Miracle garden is not open the whole year so check on line before you go. It is amazing what a desert city like Dubai can achieve. The flowers are so colorful and has creative arrangements. The kids loved it. There are eating facilities on site, but nothing fancy, just a few snacks. You will probably spend about 2h walking through the garden.

A miracle in the desert.. An amazing place to visit with kids. We enjoyed all the variety and different flowers on show, the grounds keeper staff are truly miracle workers to keep such a place in the condition is it. A lot for the kids to see and do. Thank you Miracle garden.

Not Worth the Trip. If you're in the area and want to go here it's fine, but it's really not worth the distance to see this. We took the metro to Mall of The Emirate Station and took a taxi to the gardens for 30AED. Entrance was another 30AED each and then we took a cab home. It was an expensive outing and the gardens weren't very impressive. they were more kitschy than anything. If you're in Dubai, go to Safa Park instead. It's much nicer, closer to the city and only 3AED to enter.
pleasant for a couple of hours. the flowers were beautiful and the smell was lovely, didnt take long to look around the place, the coffee shops were nice too
miraculous. Dubai does it again by blooming heaps and heaps of flowers in a burning desert. worth the drive out and you will lose yourself in the place

just like Europ. visit this place when its cloudy or rainy. you would feel like if you are visiting a European country. when you enter the place you can smell the flowers at the door.entry ticket is AED 30 and it worth visiting with your wife or girlfriend.

It is a MIRACLE of colors with Flowers. Miracle garden is indeed a MIRACLE of colors with Flowers and something one can't expect in the middle of a desert. Beautiful flowers and a very well maintained park of all possible collection of flowers. The formations created with the flowers are amazing. Weekends are VERY crowded...try and avoid weekends

Beautiful. Miracle Gardens is beautiful and a great place to take pictures. Everything is outdoors to make sure to go on a day which is not too hot. The place is very far from the city. There is a bus but it stops quite far from the gardens so you have to take a cab.

Good place nice flowers and must be seen. It's a nice place to be seen. It's a bit in the middle of nowhere so it will cost you the same price to get there than the entry fees.But it is worth to be seen once !

Worth a visit. The garden opens only during certain months, recommended for visit from Dec till Feb since weather is nice during the day.. Flowers are taking every form, such as houses, cars, hearts etc.. Nice for photography
Absolutely Must See. If you want to step into another world of beauty and incredible design, step into the Miracle Garden. I only wish I had not been wearing my high heals :)

Not so special. When you expect to visit one of the biggest gardens in the world you will be not so impress when you see it. There are just few types of flowers and not such a variery. You don;t need more than 30 minutes for a visit

Beautiful Greenery in the Middle of the Dessert. I had been meaning to visit Miracle Garden for a while. I had heard about it from friends and read about it in the papers and seen some nice photos. One morning we just decided as a family to go and spend an hour there. After the long hedged road we finally got to the entrance and parked across the road. The price had increased dramatically from what friends had been charged 6 months earlier but we decided it was worth a visit. Once we entered, we soon realized one hour was ambitious. It is a beautiful location and even if flowers don't really interest you, you can't help but enjoy the place. it is a breath of fresh air to be surrounded with the wonderful greenery, the colorful petals and great sculptures they are transformed into when you are in the middle of a dessert.  A lovely place to walk around in the kinder weather. There is lots to see and plenty to photograph. Fun for all the family can be had. Also some nice places to stop and have a refreshing drink or ice cream. We all and fun and look forward to visiting again with the new extension finishing.
A floral delight. A walk thru the gardens with the camera in hand. You will never stop clicking as you take in all of the creative uses of the flowers. This can be romantic.

a must visit place.. amazing place. must be visited with fully charged battery to catch as much photos as you could. but take care from the sun. you must make sure that sun block & plenty of water are with you.enjoy ;)

it is miracle only. this is the best time to visit Miracle garden in Dubai. Lots of flower collections planted there for visitors. Definitely worth seeing it for the amount we pay for it. Situated at Sheik Bin Sayed Road (Old emirates road), you can easily access from Dubai city.

What a disaster!. We searched for the Miracle Garden for 40 minutes in a taxi - without success. We found the sign for it but it was merely a building site! None of the taxi drivers we spoke to knew anything about it. Does it exist or is it merely part of the Expo 2020? We wasted a great deal of money trying to find it. If it doesn't exist, then it should not be advertised until it is ready.

Sunset Date. My boyfriend and I went here around sunset time and I must say that I enjoyed going around and taking photos. Where else can you see lots of flowers in the middleof the desert? Only in Dubai.
Fresh Flower Garden. ''wow'' realizing natural flower in middle of no way. really nice maintaining natural flower in desert. don't miss this who is visiting Dubai.we took nice photo shoot.
A beautiful symphony of flowers!!!. Beautiful Garden!!! You will not feel like moving out from this place!!! It preferable to go here especially during evening time like around at 5 pm!!!!
A delightful place!. If you love colour, flowers and unusual, attractive designs, this is for you! Be aware that there are two sections of the Garden to walk around

Beautiful! Go early if you can. Such a beautiful place to walk around in. Give yourself a couple hours to enjoy it all. And go as soon as they open (I think 9am?). Going that early, it's cooler outside. And the crowds pick up at 10:30/11:00.

Beautiful. I used to visit Miracle Garden every year since it started. This year i liked the most. was there with my mom who loves flower so much. She was so happy and amazed when I brought her. I definitely visit again next year and looking forward to see more amazing Miracle Garden.

If you like flowers this is a must see!!. To see all of these amazing flowers was just amazing. We loved it here and found it fascinating to see in the middle of the dessert essentially! We spent a couple of hours here one day - approx €6 entry fee so very cheap. Worth a visit.

One of the most beautiful places I have ever visited.. It is amazing to find such a beautiful place in the middle of the desert, truly a miracle. The floral displays are breath-taking. If you travel to Dubai, this is a place not to be missed.

Beautiful but limited. The flowers are beautiful but going there alone is not much, an hour is enough. You could spend 2 hours with friends. Suggest making a part of something else in the area, like Global Village.

Stunning!!!. Miracle Garden is truly a miracle considering that this exists in a desert. The effort on part of Dubai authorities is visible and I must say its commendable. Great place to spend a few hours and click some great pics.

MUST see place. First of all, when I was researching the places in Dubai.. The miracle Garden was NOT in top 20! Wonder why??Well.. This should be on your must-see list of things to visit in dubai! It is surprising to see such a variety of flowers, maintained so well under scorching sun and in the midst of a desert!! Every angle, every spot is good for photography and profile pics. We went aroud noon, but may be a better time would be around 4-5 pm when the temperature cools down.

BRILLIANT.... It was a good experience at miracle garden.The garden is very beautiful with the variety of plants and flowers.There are different kinds of structures in the form of flowers which looks very beautiful.and finally the garden is very peaceful ...
Out of the world. Brilliant is not enough to describe it, so many flowers right in the center of desert, seems like a fairy tale, and very well maintained.
Unbelievable!. Stunning! It's unbelievable place on a dessert country. It is Dubai's pride! Lovely garden, the best that I've ever seen in my entire whole life.

not a flower person.... Part of your tour, 30 dhm entrance fee. Alot of different flowers. Has a cafe inside for food. Takes about 20 mins if you walk around the whole park. Its nice all flowers everywhere. Maintain nicely.
Amazing... A good walk with the best view. Amazing work done by the management to stream line walk and view experience.

45 million flowers are used to make stunning designs. Dubai’s miracle garden is said to be the biggest natural flower garden in the world.This garden is beautiful even though it is right in the middle of desert. It is completely maintained andefficient enough.

Piece of heaven in the middle of desert. Went there with two Brazilian friends. We were greeted so well from the beginning untill the end if our visit. At cashier we couldnt exchange our money and a local woman helped us pay the entrance, later we net with the owners of the place and had a chat. So nice coincidences made our visit even more speacial. Made tons of pictures at this colorful garden.
Beautifully Designed... Too many flowers..well placed over miniature attractions like Eifel tower, petronas, burj khalifa etc..Must visit with kids, they will love being there.

Beautiful flowers and place to visit. What a beautiful place to visit, even if you do not like flowers this is still an amazing site to behold. I cannot begin to imagine how many plants there were and the man hours it must have taken to create such a masterpiece. I believe they change the designs every year, so I certainly look forward to my visit next year. It is a vast, clean garden totally full of flowers in all colours possible. Very peaceful and tranquil, even the benches were beautiful. This was our first time at the Miracle garden but by no means the last, definitely worth a visit.

My first visit. I was looking for something a little different to take my Mum to while she was in Dubai. I wasn't sure what to expect.But the Miracle Garden is a beautiful oasis of flowers which was a real pleasure to the senses! A nice relaxing way to spend a beautiful afternoon in the sunshine.

Very pretty and attractive. Its a great experience to see this garden. Lots and lots of flowers in different colors and shapes. 2-3 hours necessary to see all the places. Better to go by 3 pm as before that it will be very hot to go around.

45 Million Flowers?. We were told by our tour guide that was the number. I wasn't able to count them in the 2.5 hours we spent at the Miracle Garden, but there were a lot of them.This place is special. Words really fail to convey the beauty and special nature of the exhibition. If you like flowers, you will definitely want to go, and if you don't like flowers, you should go anyway, because when you finish, you'll be so impressed that you'll write a Trip Advisor review, in order to tell others how much you enjoyed it!

it's all about design. people there are creative with ideas of forming monuments or houses out of flowers... flowers themselves are basic, not much variety of flower types, only with colour and designs... but the place is worth the visit of course

Nature lovers paradise. Nice garden with lots of flowers, photo ops. If you like flowers, nature then you can visit this place.If you are someone who does not get excited with such things, you can give this a miss. I went there because my family wanted to visit. I personally would have given it a miss and can vouch for it even now.

Very pretty. Dubai miracle gardens,very pretty ,very colourful,allow about 2hours to see everything.it is in two parts when you have seen one side you then cross the road to see the second part.there is also a butterfly complex but in my visit it was closed for a refurb.places to get a snack or ice cream available inside.
Must Watch. Feel like an heaven on earth, Flowers in Desert and with an architecture, beautiful i must say, you cant afford to miss is
cute little garden. its cute but not a lot of variety of flowers. the tickets are very cheap compared to the attractions in dubai. however, if you have limited time/day, you can skip this.

Beautiful!. You would never expect this level of gardening in the UAE. Come to think of it, maybe you should. They have beautiful sculptures of flowers that will blow your mind. it is crazy to think that they manage to replant, rebuild this entire place in a very limited time since it is closed during the scorching summer months. It's worth a visti and remember your camera!

A riot of colour. 1.2 million varieties, I'm told. Flowers bring me happiness, and the same was apparently true for all the smiling visitors that day. They are so delicate, I wonder how they survive the summer temperatures, but now, in the coolness, they are thriving. Be careful about the honey-coated nuts, they are delicious and addictive. Recommended.

A miracle in the desert. This was my second visit to the place. It is one of the most breathtakingly beautiful sights to behold. Thousands and millions of flowers growing on arches, houses ( well structures like houses), old cars!! Phase 2 of the same garden is even more wonderful. Definitely recommend a visit here. In fact a visit to Dubai cannot be complete without a visit here.

Miracle!!!!!!. Millions of Flowers, waiting for you to indulge yourself with the wonderful gift from The Goddess Mother Nature. It's a must visit place if you're in Dubai. You've not seen Dubai properly if you've missed this Beautiful Garden and yes of course it stands right per the name given as - "Miracle Garden" . Don't wanna add more on this, gotta leave something for you to give a beautiful suprise from my end. :)
Nice romantic garden. Visited on the evening of February 20th 2015,entrance fees about $9(30 AED).Walking around was enjoyable,very nice for pictures .

love the place. only if you you visit Dubai in time that it is still cool i would definatelly suggest this place. Amazing flower decors , colorful and charming . It is a beautiful place to visit in a city full of buildings
Holiday at Dubai. What a place!!! Hats off to the person who designed this park. The theme, the colors were all mindblowing.

I never promised you a rose garden. I wish they could plant many roses to form a giant rose - A desert rose nd maybe STING could have his next concert here. Well - really a garden is always a good thing; however, I'm not a fan of anything artificial - a desert is barren and nothing grows there which would make most things in a city like Dubai artificial -we all know that ...but a garden?? Its nice and all - but the arrangements could be better. Some are very in your face and some are indeed beautiful - but the experience is not consistent. They could also do well to manage the heat better. However, it must be said - that growing colors like that in a dessert is a wonder indeed!

Wow! in a desert!. This is beautiful done garden and a must visit in Dubai. The entrance prices are a little steeper. It is a well maintained and truly magical garden.A lot of planning has been put for the visitors to have their WOW moment. This is possible only in a place like Dubai! My fav city!!!

Flowers! Flowers! Flowers! in a Desert!. Amazing to see a flower garden in the desert. Must see for any nature lover. A very colourful display of flowers. Golf carts & wheelchairs available for people with limited mobility.

Too good. Great place to be. One place you should visit every time you visit Dubai.The folks at Miracle Garden makes sure that it is just something new every year.This year they have added Burj Khalifa in the garden!
Terrific flower garden. For anyone who loves flowers, the Miracle Garden is enchanting! The biggest flower garden I have ever been too, my wife was absolutely enchanted!

Awesome Flowers. They have made it really nice. Amazed since they have made is so good, in the middle of the desert. A great achievement. The best time to go there, i guess, is from December to February, during the spring season; so that all types of flowers will be really blossiming.
A wow moment!. It is mind blowing what can be done in a desert . The gardens were totally gaudy and way over-the-top but we absolutely loved it! Only in Dubai!
Great place. I heard about this place and when I went there...i felt like am in paradise on earth. Wish i could have that near myhome.

just beautiful. A must see. Hardly anyone there when we visited on 12th march 2015 so walked around freely. Well worth the visit. Unbeliveable how so many flowers can grow in the middle of nowhere. An hour is ample time to have a wander around.

Miracle Garden. An excellent place to visit in Dubai. Remain open during winter only - Normally December to February. I visited the place with my family,including my mom . Wheel chair is available for free, only thing v have to give our ID proof.

Who knew.... Who knew looking at a bunch of flowers could be so interesting? I sure didn't! During our trip to Abu Dhabi we decided to rent a car and spend a day in Dubai. As part of our trip, the Miracle Garden was on our to do list. When my friend told me about it, I had know clue that it was literally going to be garden. Hence, when you're walking towards the gate you see this dare devil figure hanging from a race track. I thought it was a small theme park for kids!! LOL! Nonetheless, when we walked in I was in awe by the trail of hearts, the upside down cars, and the train filled with flowers. If flowers setup in amusing and cute ways don't bore you, pack your camera and head to the miracle garden!

The Desert Oasis Miracle Gardens NOT to be Missed. Our Emirates Flight Attendant said you must go to the Miracle Gardens. Sue and I were so pleased we took her advice.We arrived at the entrance to find that our wheelchair had a soft tyre. The security guard found us another wheelchair to use in the grounds I paid my entrance and because Sue was in a wheelchair her entry was free.The gardens were a real WOW houses, boats, trains, limousines, scrap cars, Disney Characters, Windmill and Castle, Heart shaped Avenues all adorned with flowers growing in full bloom.An astounding array of colours along with Vendor Eateries along the way manned by some lovely friendly staff.We spent two hours we could have done with another two hours to take it all in.

Fabulous attractions . Visited the place with my 2yrs old son...Though he did not enjoy in the beginning,later when he saw the colours around was really amazed.There was a special beauty in this place and it's a good choice if you do have time...The café set up in this place is quite expensive however not an issue for one a while.

Boooooring. I would have expect a beautiful garden with locally a spectacular view. I just saw three big carpets full of colors. It is in contradiction with what I can expect for the level like Dubai. Expensive and boring. Luckily I was not alone. As usual sometimes you win sometimes you lose. In the weekend full of kids and a lot of Noise. Go during the week when it's calm and you can enjoy.

Wonderful !. Visited the garden in the evening..beautiful designs using varieties of flowers & arrangments..nice & peaceful for a refreshing stroll around the garden..Visit in the evening time before dusk, where you can get to see things more clearly..Worth the trip..!!

Real miracle. i am not normally a tourist who likes going to parks& museums but I really loved this garden and really impressed.Very amazing man made designs of flowers will treat your eye and their smell will treat your nose.We enjoyed our time and had a plenty of photos .I went there by my car and it was difficult to find the way as there are no signs showing the road.

Go only if you are a photographer or a flower lover. This place is full of flowers and just flowers.On the positive side its a very well maintained, clean and organized garden. You will see many well made flower replicas of burj khalifa.But that is it. We went there with the family and kids. Kids were not allowed to touch anything (not complaining but there is nothing much to do for kids).I am not a flower lover nor a photographer, so me and my kid were just killing time in the huge flower garden.I would recommend people who love flowers or who love to photograph flowers to visit this place. Else there are many other exciting things to do in Dubai.

Never seen anything as beautiful as this garden. Flowers flowers, everywhere :)Its a must visit if you want to do some touristy stuff. The magnificent garden has everything made of beautiful flowers.Tip: carry an umbrella or scarf as its sunny during the day.

Absolutely Beautiful!. A must if you are in Dubai. You have to take a taxi to get there but it REALLY is worth it. The entrance fee is very reasonable, only about £5, and you can spend hours there. One tip would be to get there early before the crowds come. We were there in a sand storm and everything still looked lovely!!

Pretty flowers. It is a well maintained flower garden, though a bit way out & hard to get to by public transport. The flowers are grown in various shaped props - hearts, windmills, houses, etc. Good photo ops,which is what most people are doing there. Though I've always wondered if it really makes much eco sense to grow & maintain all these flowers. Maybe a garden with plants more suitable to the climatic conditions here would require less resources ( water!)

A piece of the heaven. Miracle garden is one of the most beautiful gardens in the world, the designs and the colors of the flowers are so creative and cheerful, it would make your day... It is amazing through the daylight, not that beautiful in the night, so try yo go there early.... I went in March, so the weather was fine.The entering fees are 30 AED/ adult.

Torquay Municipal Gardens meets Bollywood!!. We visited the Miracle Garden expecting to see a tumbling variety of lush tropical plants etc.Boy, were we in for a shock! It's like an English Municipal Floral Landscape garden gone completely mad. Petunias, geraniums and even cabbages as far as the eye can see. Whoever designed it has had a complete field day - even two rows of upturned cars within a flower bed. The floral architecture is quite stunning and very imaginative - but completely OTT (Over The Top).Intricate watering systems, no keep off the grass signs - but you get whistled at by the "garden police" if you stray from the paths. Would go again when there are butterflies to be seen & as an experience it is quite cheap and worthwhile seeing. Our preference though would have been exotic flowers - not exotic structures.Spotlessly clean and not a blade of grass out of place. Lots of places to eat. Go in the early evening when it is cooler.
Colorful, clean. Around 30 AED (9 USD) by taxi from Mall of Emirates. This place is very colourful and clean. Just be sure not to step on the grass or you'll soon find a marshall running after you :)

Miracle really miracle. Very good . Haven on earth. Every visitor of dubai must see it. It us very peaceful and creat a believe that men can do any thing. It is vision of king of UAE. CA Anil Gupta Jabalpur India

Extremely beautiful. It was full of flowers with a nice architectural design which guides you trough the flower ways.There is also a small open roof car in the garden. You can ride it and have a small trip over the garden.Small eating and juice shops are also available at the garden.

A real miracle. A different Dubai you see here as you hardly get to see greenery and flowers in Dubai. Its not one of the best gardens if have seen something like this in other countries; but its definitely a miracle and marvelous effort to establish this kind of garden in the middle of a dessert. A must visit in Dubai. The best time to visit is maximum by end of February. But if have to visit it later, try out only in the evenings as its very difficult to walk around in the sun during the day time. If at all you need to visit the garden during the day time, please do not forget you sun glasses, cap and umbrella. Don't miss the butterfly garden which is located just adjacent to the miracle garden and is more beautiful though it is small and not fully open to public yet. The entrance fee of AED 30 includes the butterfly garden as well.
Fantastic place. A place full of flowers, wonderful and brings peace to mind till you are in there. Only issue is its quite far away from city, no connection to metro.

Miracle Garden a Must!. For gardens like these to be cultivated and designed in the desert is indeed a Miracle! What a wonderful display of flowers in the most amazing shapes from arcs to actual houses! This is definitely a must see!
Green in the Middle of Desert. Only Dubai can do this....Its a beautiful Garden and makes you forget you are in a Middle of a Desert Region.Well designed and maintained

Unbelievable what has been created. I was incredibly surprised at what is on display - so much creativity in presenting flowers and greenery in the best possible way. As great way to spend the day or just a few hours when wanting to get away from the 'hustle and bustle' of the hectic city of Dubai.
GARDEN With Miracle. This is a garden of miracle...its really a miracle...well maintained... awesome experience...we really feel refreshed...once we r there...

Lots of flowers, but not much more. This is the place to go if you like flowers, and what you can build with them. Its a bit samey though, since its not that much to see and a bit off from city center. On the other hand when (if...) DubaiLand gets built, it can be something to have a look at, but for me it was not worth it to go there.

Beatiful garden, amazing contrast withe the desert. I have visited the Miracle Garden in the last two years; It is an excellent park to hang out with a good company to take lovely pictures and have a good talk.It is loaded with stunning gardens and figures decorated with flowers, the gardening and the variety of colors is impressive and stunning. It is part of Dubai's nature lover spots. You might go all over between one and two hours(it depends on the pace of each person).It is all about colors and figures, but it is not an educational place to know about botanical species. The entrance fee (30 dirhams, less than 10 USD) is affordable compared with the regular price of other attractions in the city. It is great during the winter season, and probably not open during the summer. Good for couples, friends and Family.
Amazing. Awesome display of flowers in the garden...creative way of decorating the flowers...Make sure you visit this place in evening to enjoy by walking around the garden..

Dubai's very own valley of flowers. I visited this wonderful crafted garden yesterday with my family. It is located on the Shk Mohd bin Zayed Road adjoining Dubailand just ahead of Global Village when going towards Abu Dhabi.There are two sections in this garden. One contains the yet unopened Butterfly Garden where there are three deep valley like flower arrangements. This section is smaller to cover and at most take your 30-45 mins.The other bigger section is the extensive one where a whole lot of craft with different varieties of flower has been created which will amuse people from any age group. Be it a train or car or a monument you name it and they have made it out flower. There are food outlets serving interesting tits and bits from Asian cuisine.It is open during the winter months only and can be visited in day or night since in the night the lighting has been well designed to keep the shutterbugs happy.Yes that's one thing you shouldn't forget your Camera since you will get many a flower things to Capture.A complete detailed coverage of both the sections will consume on an average 3-4 hours on how you plan it.The admission fee is worth it aptly priced at AED 30.Not an attraction to miss when in Dubai during winters.

Beautiful and expansive floral gardens. Located towards the Emirates Road in Barsha South, this quite recent attraction always gets top reviews because of its wonderful display of regional flowers and lawns. What I liked best of all was the rather romantic setting with heart shaped archways and statues. Because of the heat in Summer, Miracle Garden is best visited between October - April. Take the kids they will love it.
Very romantic. It's a place where u forget in which world we are,really the flowers and the decoration is charming and breathe taking

Miracle in Desert. When visited Dubai last time this could not be even dreamed, Got to really appreciate the Dubai Ruler and Administration for conceiving, executing and most importantly maintaining it. Simply out of the world !!! Awesome management skills !!Also visited Grand Mosque in Abu Dhabi. Capable of competing with our own Taj, though modern techniques were available for constructing it. Visit the links :https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZqQzDtK7Yc4https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yYkowG_-Z-I

what a great place to visit...... creativity at its best.....the innovative ways of creation and the maintenance is worth appreciation for the entire team. The flowers can be used in so many ways can be seen here.....a must visit for Dubai visitors.......

Sad flowers.... I do not get what people like in this garden.. Perhaps if you have never seen flowers then it might be interesting but otherwise it is just a collection of sad flowers.. If u want to experience a real flower paradise just go to keukenhof in the netherlands.
a green paradise n the middle of Dubai. Thousands of flowers in one of the greenest places in Dubai. Lovely place ! Thanks for this nice green corner in the middle of the desert!

A Different Dubai's Disteniation. Apart of huge shopping malls, fancy restaurants and night spots, Miracle Garden represents an excellent destination for a half day trip for families, friends, couples, .....everyone. The park is full of status which is made from live flowers !! well designed & neat. Ticket fee is 30 dirham per person, kids under 3 years are free.

More than I expected. What a lovely way to spend n hour or so. We were fortunate enough to have wonderful weather, no humidity and heat was bearable. The flowers were wonderful and the arrangements were amazing to see. A lot of care is taken to keep this looking so good and I would advise everyone to go.

The best garden. An incredible amount of flowers reproducing the main world beauties, tour Eiffel, Bury Khalifa, ecc Is amazing to see in such a desert area a garden so large and clean. It's only open in winter months cause of the too hot weather i summer time. Merit a visit!
Amazing. No words can describe this place..so many wonderfully aranged flowers.The entrance is really low,not cheap,but you can see a lot for that money.. Don't miss it

A Miracle In The Desert. Astonishing beautiful. One simply can't understand how is it possible to have this luxuriant oasis in the middle of the desert. Millions of flowers, a subtle perfume fills the air even at noon. Artistic designs, colours and shades. You can always take refuge under a shady alley, under the thousand umbrella alley, or sit and enjoy a pomegranate juice on a terrace covered with flowers. You can't describe it. It is a must see. Wonderful!!! But keep an eye on the prices. The juice seller charged me 50 AED for two pomegranate juices just because I was European. The guy in front of me bought two of the same for 30 AED but he was Arabic. The seller's answer was for Arabic everything is cheaper.

Beauty in the desert. We were unsure whether to do this or not, having read mixed reviews on TripAdvisor. However, on our last day we decided it was worth a look and we were right!We got a taxi from the Marina, which cost us about 50-55AED. There is a small entry fee. The gardens are beautiful- lots of opportunities to take gorgeous pictures. Though if you're a flower enthusiast be warned that there are not a lot of varieties of flowers and plants.We spent about 2 or so hours there, and there is a small seating area where you can buy drinks and food. All in all, it was an enjoyable visit, we had a good time and you should definitely go if you have the time.

Its absolutely a miracle in the desert. As the title says, it is a miracle to have such lovely flowers in all shapes and colours in the midst of a desert. It was well maintained and one can appreciate the effort that has gone in.
Colourful. A fairy tale with all colorful flowers and butterflies around, A must visit for families and kids, you can cover all three phases in 3 - 4 hrs
Miracle. Nice to have lots of pix specillay dose selfie fanatic....many flowers and views to see most i like the Heart shafe.

Very good concept. The concept of having a flower garden in the middle of a desert is really amazing. There are wonderful range of colors of flowers but not variety. I guess there are limited flora that can thrive in the area. It's good that they keep improving the area by adding more structures. Overall, it is a perfect place for picture taking.

not to be missed the craftmanship on flowers. though the flowers are not new for anyone but the artistic craftsmanship of giving them shape and style can be seen only at this place in dubai so this place is not to be missed ! you find amazing family fun , and feel like you are in a wonderland of flowers with so many vivid colors , be camera ready and must visit this place !!!

A miracle in a desert. The garden is situated 20 minutes outside of Dubai, it has many beautifully designed flower sculptures and designs, I guarantee that you will be satisfied. Ticket price is 30 AED.
Valley of flowers. Amazing variety of flowers. visited during April, was very hot. should try and come during winters. Need approx 2-3 hrs to complete the visit

Nice and reasonable family fun - don't forget your camera. The wonderful range of colors and wide pathways make for an interesting family experience. There are numerous photos experiences, so don't forget your camera. The price is AED 30 per person so it can add up but probably goes a long way to cover the water and gardening bill.The flora is more or less tastefully done except for some unrealistic and gaudy get-ups. But generally speaking it is impressively set up and not too busy even on the weekends. The butterfly gardens were closed - apparently they will open in April.

A Wonderland of Flowers. The name really suits the garden. One will get a "wonderland of flowers" feeling. The ideal time to visit may be in January when all the winter flowers are in full bloom. i found the garden especially appealing as the area can be covered by foot in less than two hours, unlike the gardens in Europe. It was cute to see the windmills of Holland, European cottages,The Burj Khalifa, Peacocks, etc., in flowers. Anybody who likes flowers and colours will enjoy this garden.
beautiful garden. A must see if you like gardens and flowers. Great photo opportunities, absolutely beautiful garden. Great concept and worth a visit.
Better Than Last Year!!. This year is different than last year with better organising & different shapes. Very nice Attraction specially for the photographers.
Simply awsome. the amount of flowers is too good....flowers all around....i visited in feb which is the best season to visit this garden..ticket is 30 dh..but is it surly worth..

Relaxing, peaceful. We went just before sunset and saw the displays during the daylight, and under the flood lights. My recommendation is to visit during the day - and also to eat before you arrive because to be honest the food was a real turn off. Lots of artistic photo opportunities. We visited on Valentines day, and many of the displays were following the love theme. I am looking forward to visiting again to see if there is anything new

Nothing special. Quite a pleasant stroll but nothing particularly special, it's well looked after but a lot of the plants and flowers are very similar. The Egyptian food stall does delicious filled breads

Good Garden. The Miracal Garden in Dubai is a good garden and the concept was adopted very nicely, The garden is cared by very tight security.I have to suggest that the garden have nice plants, but they are only colorful and not have any fragnance.But still worth Visit

Truly a miracle flower garden in the desert. I commend Dubai for the concept and construction of this attraction, the place is filled with flowers that are shaped around cars, houses, buildings (one is Burj Khalifa), trains, wind mill and many others. The heart and circular arches of flowers made our visit last February "more loving". And to think this is grown in the desert. The place is not open the whole year and best time to come here would be starting Jan to Mar while it is a bit cool and come early morning or late afternoon for best photos.

20 min and seen it all. Decided to take my sister who was visiting Dubai to the miracle garden, the lines were quiet long to get in, once inside, we were in awe of all the beautiful flowers that surrounded us, however, after walking for only 15min around we felt like we saw it all. There were no information about what flowers were in the gardens, and not knowing much about flowers, they all looked the same walking through the garden. I would suggest a brochure to take in to let you know what flowers you are looking at, or placing the flower names around the garden. Would probably not be coming back or bringing visitors there.

Blooming marvellous. In the heart of the desert, incredible garden of blooms. Interesting artistic use of scrapped cars. Colors in abundance. And lots of locals, as well as tourists. Well worth the visit.

Out of the world experience. A must see for all tourists. Here in the middle of the desert you see a fantastic show of flowers and greenery which is out of this world. Though it is a long ride it is absolutely wort it. The admission tickets are cheap also.
Beautiful garden. Nice place to visit during cool months. Good for families. The garden is beautifully and aesthetically planned. Good treat for your eyes. Worth visiting at least once.

A must visit for all age group. It's one of the must go place, if you visit Dubai. This is a really nice garden, full of flowers set together in an artistic way. Great concept and worth a visit if you are in the vicinity. Pl. do confirm the open and close time before you visit.
Only Garden of Flowers. Must see the beauty of flowers. Flowers are arranged in a very planned manner. Atleast one hour to see full garden

Yes this year it became more attractive than two years back !. many additions and lovely creative flowery decorative monuments been added to miracle gardens where I remember two years back was not even 10% of whats now , a must to take family to visit when they are in Dubai , maximum of 2 hours needed with a coffee break...don't plan a full day for this

very flowery. miracle garden is actually nothing but a garden having all sorts of flowers possible in it. The best part about it is not the only the flowers but also the way they have made structures out of it and most importantly the way the people there able to maintain the rarest of the flowers in the desert environment.

Beautiful Floral Displays. A very pretty botanical garden of sorts and some very interesting and thought out floral displays. The variety of plants is not overwhelming, but the use of the flowers and plants are well done.The attractions on display are worth a visit while it is still cool, but the food stalls and vendors are not that great.Good for an afternoon or early evening stroll around and about an hour to an hour and a half.
Miraculous. Beautiful place in the middle of the desert. nice and quiet, family fun place. excellent and detailed arrangement

Well worth a visit. We spent a very pleasant morning at the miracle gardens. it is simple to get there from mall of the emirates by taxi about 25 dirham. The 30 dirham entrance fee was very reasonabe. The flower displays were amazing especiallyin the desert location. Lots of photo opportuntiies so make sure your camara is charged. We will return when te butterflies are open.

Garden in the middle of the desert seems like a miracle in itself. This is an absolutely beautiful garden. Makes for an amazing place to take lots of pictures. The kind of things they are able to create using a myriad of flowers is amazing. And they change that every year.
