Note, that this garden is situated a little outside of dubai and if you have your own car, it's a little bit of a miracle in itself to be able to find the garden. I would highly recommend it if you like flowers and are spending a few days in Dubai.
Truly a miracle. enjoyed the creativity and the flowers. very pretty loved the way everything was covered in flowers. it is far from mall of emirates and there was a snowstorm the day we went
Colorful . Nice place to relax and enjoy ....If u love plant and flowers u should be here and i like the way u people arrange this place .......

Nice visit. This place is very much under rated. Definitely is a nice place to go in Dubai. You can spend as little or as much time there as you want. Only 30aed entry fee each. Many many photo opportunities. Plenty of taxis when I went.

Spending our 9th Wedding Anniversary with friends in Dubai.. We stayed at the Majestic Hotel. Very nice hotel. Great food @ Service. Thankyou to a Filipino friend who shared some photos, we visited the Miracle Gardens of Dubai. What a Creation. And a Enourmous Park for display. Stunning.

wow. A must see if you like gardens and colour. Great photo opportunities.
It's pictures in flowers.Everything from Windmills to Cars done in flowers. Good viewing places, take the cart ride if you don't walk too well. Close to Dubailand and the new Butterfly garden due to open soon
wonderful park. The largest flower garden in the world. Very nice and big park but very far from the center. Bad connection with the park.

It is really a miracle. Don't miss this if you are in Dubai. Though there isn't a lot of variety in flowers but it is a man made miracle. Best time to go would be around 4 pm. We spent our evening in this garden and the kids loved it. I was amazed to see the way they take care of these flowers. They have made a copy of the Burj Khalifa with flowers so must see. Overall I would rate this as excellent
Oasis in Dubai. Who would have thought you would have gardens like this in Dubai. Outstanding displays of flowers, colours.Wonderful for all the family.Well worth a visit.
Very nice place. its a very nice place and you can take very lovely pics with your friends and loved ones. the food however is terrible and overpriced so do not plan to eat there.

Limited diversity of flowers and ideas. The visit to the Miracle Gardens was disappointing. The variety of flowers (most being geranium and begonia) and arrangements on display was looking limited and repeating itself. Despite visiting in the cooler season most of the flowers were dried out. There is no comparison to any average botanical garden and definitely not worth the drive from the city and the entrance fee of AED 30.

A Work of Art. Its really not that much as its name but if u will look into every detail of each flower sculpture and the landscape they made, it was really amazing... The blending of colors, the patterns itself is really WOW! Two thumbs up for the developer! And by the way, the entrance cost AED 30, food court is also available in the heart of the garden so foods will not be a problem ( and toilets ofcourse). They just don't allow smoking inside. And one more tip, going there on friday is a NO NO. You will not enjoy it that much because of the crowd, specially if ur going there to take pics for ur portfolio. :)

Alluring. Seeing is believing an flowers is every where. Reasonably priced for only 30 AED/person. Designed carefully with flowers (Eiffel Tower, Burj Khalifa), houses, cars etc are astonishing and well-maintained. It captures your attention how things have been organised to come out with a perfect view for picture. Small shop for you can quench or even have a small snacks. Don't miss it if you're planning to visit dubai.TIPS: Best time to visit during winter period - around Oct to March. As of the weather. Time: in the morning and afternoon around 4pm.FYI: Public transport (bus) it's not connected way from downtown to miracle garden, taxi is the only option. It's very difficult to get taxi to return. Approximately about 40 minutes or an hour before you could get one.
Lovely Garden. Went here for a friends bday & we loved it , it's beautiful closed during the summer as it gets hot ! You should go during winter time

WHAT A SPECTACULAR DISPLAY. A colourful experience to remember for ever. This was an amazing spectacle with millions and millions of flowers in all sorts of displays.I would warn you though it is all out in the open so if it is particularly hot make sure you are protected and take a sunshade with you.Had a little bit of trouble getting a taxi away afterwards as you have to wait for someone being dropped off to get picked up.

Very well maintained. One of the best place in Dubai to spend the time. The garden is very well maintained. Access to this place is bit negative. You have to go by cab only. But one of the must watch places in dubai

Lovely, pleasant day out. Very unusual display of flowers. Perfect, fresh and different. You can take a nice stroll through the gardens and will find it hard to spot a dead flower. So well looked after.
It's very open and hot. Even sitting at food station it's very warm, so keep covered.
Strange but Cool. It's quite a weird place but lots of great photo opportunities and impressive displays of flowers. 30AED entrance fee so one of the cheaper things to do.

Flowers... just flowers.. Miracle Garden, in its simplest concept, is a huge park with lots and lots and lots of flowers. For expats here in Dubai, maybe a few random visits is nice for relaxation after weeks of hard work. For tourists, in my opinion, it's NOT really a must-visit. Though, it's a very clean park and perfect for family, group of friends, couples and kids.When you get there, you have to pay an entrance fee of AED 30/person. You will be welcomed with lots of flowers either nicely planted on the ground, around a car, or formed into huge heart arch, peacock tail, houses, so and so. A buggy is available for old people or anyone who wish to go around the park without walking.You can take photos, however, you CANNOT touch, get near or lie down on a bed of flowers because if you do so the security will blow their whistle at you. Everywhere, there's a security manning the flowers and structures to ensure that no one gets near. Miracle Garden is a park where it's legal to see and smell the flowers, but illegal to touch them.Miracle Garden exhibits different kinds of flowers. However, if you're not good on flora and fauna, you'll never know what kind of flowers are there. There are no labels or signs that mention a brief information about the flowers. I hope the park will consider putting 'info' labels about the flowers for educational purposes (this will also be a big help to those schools who are taking their educational trip at the park).Other than the flower sighting, of course, you can go for a stroll around the park or grab some snacks from the cafes, food cart and food court. Food is quite pricey. Two pomegranate juice and two cheese-beef fatayer costed us 140 AED from Egyption Fatayer (and the beef filling in the fatayer isn't real beef; it's corned beef from a can).It may be more favourable to visit by late afternoon until evening as the daytime temperature may be too humid. Do note also that Miracle Garden is only open to public on winter season (imagine what happens to those flowers during Dubai summer with above 40C temperature...).Toilets for men and women are available, and they're well maintained. And if I can remember it right, there are also prayer rooms for Muslims.Transportation to Miracle Garden: if you're not driving or doesn't know the right exit roads, take the Metro line going to Mall of the Emirates (MOE) metro station. This is the nearest metro station to Miracle Garden. From the MOE metro station, go down to the bus terminal and take F30 bus. Tell the bus driver to drop you at Studio City bus stop (from MOE to Studio City, it may take 30 to 45 minutes ride). When you off load to Studio City bus stop, take a cab to the Miracle Garden (5-10 minutes ride). There are cabs at Miracle Garden which you can take going back to the bus stop or metro station.There are NO ATM machine, souvenir shops, grocery stores or pharmacy near or at Miracle Garden. For your info.If you're a first-time tourist in Dubai, my suggestion is don't make this place a priority on your list. You won't feel bad anyways if you missed to see it.

Not inspiring at all. The garden is overrated with few flower species. Not a place for children, as there is one small slide, and you cannot get close to the flowers. Just some hearts and cars covered with flowers. I think a trip on a dhow is a better choice, considering that the second one is much cheaper

A nice walk but that's it. Went to see what the hype was all about. Well, one more proof that with millions of gallons of desalinized water, you can grow a lot of things. I do appreciate that this is a nice walk for families or couples looking for a photo background and certainly an enlightening moment for kids who haven't had much opportunities to see flowers in Dubai but I would have expected a bit more educational aspect. Maybe more flower varietals and some boards explaining what they are? It feels like it's all show and no substance...

Aptly named. It is a fair bit of drive away from the main city, you come upon this garden population becomes sparse and dessert sandy terrain becomes visible. So much greenery and natural beauty in middle of a dessert is certainly a miracle. The garden has themes to which it is re-arranged from time to time and it is beautifully arranged and artistically displaced. Don't forget your camera while coming here. A must visit and a refreshing change form the usual scene in Dubai

Great place for couple of hours. It's really miracle garden. If you desire to take awesome photos for your love story - it's the best place ever. But get ready that your photo battery will be exhausted in half an hour.The only con - too far from metro, no taxi near entrance/exit.

Wonderful Place. Visited the place with my 4 year old daughter and was glad i choose to do so. The garden is well developed with various structures and art work covered with flowers.Specially in conditions like in dubai it is hard to maintain such place during peak summer but hats off well done. it is near by emirates mall a 30 AED taxi ride would take you to this place. Public transport availability is limited and you can spend 1-2 hours hardly. Various food options are available at food court.

A Desert Garden. This is an amazing place for nature lovers. You would be amazed what a care and human energy is used to maintain this Guinness World Record Garden. Over stunning designs, colours and relaxing atmosphere makes this garden and extraordinary place to visit in a deserted country.You can easily spend few hours without being tired. Make sure you take your Camera or Camcorder as it is not to be forgotten.
Colourful sanctuary. Brilliant place to walk around and to enjoy the thousands of plant displays. Well worth a visit on your trip to Dubai. Families with young children will love it
family visit. park necessaty for childresn, beauful designed garden, in middle of desert, ahead of global village, location arjan, Parking available

Beautiful garden. We had visited it last year.It has differerent colored flowers and these flowers also adorned new structures.
It is worth visiting once

Amazing look. The garden was miracle like its name, flowers and plants are very well organized and showed in a great look , there is a mixture between the flowers nature and the houses, cars animals decoration that is unique and I did not see in any other places.

Colourful.... Very scenic... This is a very colourful place full of natural flowers designed in a beautiful manner. Between the hot desert this place makes you feel completely opposite. The greenery and the floral surroundings make you feel alive.
Best place for photography.

Awesome Sight. There maybe a millions FRESH flowers in the whole Dubai Miracle Garden & its awesome! Dubai as part of the Middle East Region has very dry climate & it is impeccable to grow plants especially flowers in this region. With the Dubai Miracle Garden, they really made a miracle growing millions of flowers in this area!!! Kudos to those green hands!What I really don't like though in this 'newest Dubai tourist site' is the SMELL, maybe it is because of the fertilizer they've put on those plants/flowers.
City of love. Really you feel the love and the peace in each corner and flower in this place , i think they design it with bunch of love , clean , every body was smiling

Magical garden in the desert. Every year they build up a new Miracle garden out in the desert just outside of Dubai, approx 10 min drive from Mall of emirates. The amount of flowers and the designs are breathtaking. Especially when you think about that you are in the desert! Perfect for that family photo :)But the best time to be there is when they open in the morning. Soon after you will have groups of people everywhere trying to take that perfect picture and they do not care if you want the same and they are in your way...

Miracle created with Best Flowers. Oasis in Desert.. Simply awesome experience. I felt like I am in a man made heaven. Structures made using flowers are beautiful and flawless. Even those who are not interested in gardens should visit this place atleast once. Requires 2 to 3 hours to view the entire place. A very good photo stop. Much better than the Tulip Garden is Srinagar. Very clean ambience. Waterfall is also too good. Can't forget this place ever.
Good. Clean and nice design though there's not much to view. Small space compare to be seen in TV and pictures. Smell of surroundings are different. I think from the fertilizer.

Seeing is beleiving ...Wonder in Desert. Truly a MIRACLE .in desert country ..beautifully designed and very well maintained gardens......amazing architecture ...must visit in Dubai ..entrance ticket is 30 AED and once can spent as much time as possible

Amsterdam in Dubai. The place is heaven on earth. Must Must See if you are in Dubai. Need atleast 2-3 hours to see the place fully...and is very pretty with lots of flowers, waterfalls, and natural decor made with flowers.
choose the perfect weather. really beautiful gardens. but since u're going to stay outside all the time, choose the best timing and the best weather. i recommend it

wonderful place to see. great place to see so many colorful, flowers in desert , very well maintained, nice for photos, and good options for eating. a very good family outings. Although it is open this 9 pm but as there no special lighting effects no one stays after 7 pm, so if some good lighting effects are added it can be more interesting
Miracle. It is really miracle. Amazing but whatever I write it is not enough, you should go there to enjoy the wonderful smell.

So Colourful. Would've never thought there could exist so much greenery and flowers in the middle of the desert. Food and bathroom facilities are poor but on the whole lovely place to visit with friends and family to get away from the hustle and bustle of the malls.

Where flowers bloom, so does hope!!!. I had least expectation before going since, I had missed checking out this location on trip advisor or online. I thought as an normal garden. But it was beyond my expectation.They have made this garden the most beautiful place with extravagant styling. I must say it was indeed incredible. I have been to so many places but this Garden is the most stylish. They had structures of house, castles, boats, exquite structures made from flowers. It look amazing. Each structure was hollow and had flower pots planted such a way that you dont understand until u keenly observe it. I would say you need 4 hrs minimum if you want to enjoy the place and take pictures. When spoke with a guard, he told me every year this garden comes up with different styling and concepts of flower decorations. So each year is new design. Highly recommended.

Picturesque garden. We went to this garden during the month of February with family spent couple of hours there. It is so colourful that you just love it at the very first sight. It has seasonal flowers arranged in various shapes like heart, houses, trains, clock erc. Its like a dream world. The place has ample space to sit, take pictures, take a ride in golf car around. They say every time you visit, it has different patterns and more additions, so don't skip this even it is your second visit.Park closes well before sunset, so plan accordingly

romantic. Romantic place to walk for an hour and take tons of photos. Beautiful flower arrangements, that makes you forget you are in the desert. Staff should have been friendlier, they don't even answer to hello.

Beautiful Place To Visit. Miracle Gardens is a great place to visit. They have done amazing things with pots and pots of flowers. The flower houses, peacocks, burj khalifa, are works of art! Well worth spending an afternoon walking on the paved paths throughout the gardens! Just incredible!
Garden in Desert. Miracle garden is amazing. Thanks to our friends who lived in Dubai suggests us not to miss this one. There's nothing compared to it.

Lovely !. To be honest I expected even more of what I saw but then again, maintaing such beautiful flowers in a desert is quite challenging. I applause for that. You'll see boats cover with flowers, cars, light houses, a rose river with a bridge, the famous umbrellas and the heart architecture flower designs etc. The restaurants they have are expensive. The entrance I believe I paid 35 Dirhams if I'm not mistaken. Really nice experience and awesome to take photos !

Garden full of flowers in desert. Nice place, best if visited in the eveningSo many flowers, have a blast time with ur cameraTips- small shops for snacks open in it which is nice. Entrance fee 30 AED which is a bit pricey but worth it. About 1-2 hours needed for this attraction. Taxi from mall of emirates cost about 30 AED.
Floweres. Very scenic location. Amazing designs. However very hot during the day. Takes at least 2 hours to do the whole tour.

creative, colorful designs with flowers in Dubai. Nice change from the sand, steel, and shopping. Very artistically displayed flowers some as architectural houses and great "Burj Khalifa." Don't expect a botanical garden, this is about bright color and plants that can endure the warm sun. A few car/truck exhibits for the children to enjoy and plenty of space for walking. Places to get snacks and drinks. Getting to the main entrance once you leave the highway (sign with Miracle Garden) is a maze itself (look for small red/blue signs at roundabouts). Taxi drivers can find this if you don't have a car. Would not recommend the bus. Haven't seen it lit up at night, but may go back without grandchild for that.

It took my breath away!. The Miracle garden took my breath away..i stood there trying to find words... it was too good to be true.Village made of flowers, trains and cars decorated with beautiful flowers, and eiffel tower replica made of fresh flowers...and more to see.

Well made. We visited Miracle garden in january 2015. Its pretty close from Mall of the emirates...approx AED 35 by cab. They have done a very good job at creating this garden. Though i feel they could have maintained it far better. Lots of flowers are dying or dead and have not been cleaned up. But the thought behind the whole garden is great.Also thankfully u get a cab on the way back.

Far but Worth it.... Located almost in front of Arabian Ranches and on the side of Emirates Road, The Miracle Garden its a mix of recycle items from failed Dubailand projects with an ocean of flowers. Its not an easy place to find, specially with all the construction around so you need a lot of patience and a proper map to find this place. The best way to access it, is to take the Mall of the Emirates exit (Umm Suqeim Road), pass below Al Khail Road and take the exit after Dubio Tech (just 2 exits before Emirates Road). After that, just follow the signs.The Garden has 4 different entrances and the entrance fee is not expensive (30dhs = less than 10 USD). The garden itself its very nice. It has hundreds of different floral arrangements around houses, old cars, monuments and halls. Its not a massive place but everything its very organized (something rare in Dubai). There is a strict policy of no standing on the grass so please follow to maintain the garden integrity. Now a days, its a very popular place and it gets crowded, specially in the afternoon, so try to be early to take really nice pictures. Its a nice place to spend a few hours. The only thing missing its a nice cafe place to sit and enjoy the views.

The most beautiful and romantice side of Dubai!. The most beautiful and romantice side of Dubai i wish to be married there among beautiful blooming flowers it's like a fairy-tale there special place for visit all romantic people, couples and princess..

An artistic creative garden. We visited here in December and the weather was pleasant so walking around the gardens was enjoyable. The creative displays this garden includes houses, trains that are covered in flowers. there are some beautiful colourful arches across the paths popular for photos. Also in the gardens are some interesting water features and sculptures.
Great place!. What a wonderful place! Kudos to Dubai for having this kind of place. The flowers are lovely indeed!

Flowers in the desert.. This wonderful place in Dubai is definitely an incredible work of art. It's an amazing displays of flower in an arid country, unbelievably beautiful in the desert environment. Miracle Garden is a place that every person should visit in Dubai. Exceptionally inspiring and thoughtfully done for us to admire the beauty that must be appreciated. The entire area is definitely a wonder to see for every walks of life.

Awesome experience. The place is little bit yet to be developed, but once entered, my goodness what a creation. The imagination really goes wild to see the garden in the middle of the desert & concrete jungle.I really wonder how they maintain it.
Worth a visit. Definitely worth a visit, especially at dusk as the park changes from sunny to night lights. Avoid the weekend if taking photos as it gets crowded
beautiful views. its truly a miracle to see so many colors of flowers in a dessert. Not that many variety of flowers but the designs made from so many colors of flowers is amazingly beautiful.

An extraordinary achievement in the desert. We heard about the Miracle Garden by chance.It turned out to be one of several highlights of our visit to Dubai.The amazing displays of flowers and creations of birds, cars, a train, houses and just huge blankets of colour were awe inspiring.We understand that this is open only during the winter months, but if you happen to visit Dubai during that time, this should be high on your list of sights to see.We would recommend arriving early before the crowds. I think the gardens open at 10am.At present there is no public transport to the gardens so car or taxi are the only option.

really a miracle. To have such a beautifully laid out garden with such colourful flowers and that too in a desert is a miracle by itself. The layout has been very thoughtfully prepared,The flower houses look so attractive. The flower maiden with her up stretched arms is the centre of attraction. The multi hued flowers weave magic. It is really a wonder as to how in this hot climate the flowers are blooming day after day,

Beautiful but Bizarre. My wife and I visited the Dubai Miracle Garden with her parents on a weekday in late January. Admission is 30 AED per person (8.17 USD / 7.17 Euro). The gardens are a striking display of color – laid out in flower beds, hanging baskets, and on various installations (cars, houses, mock-skyscrapers, etc.). It is highly manicured, but not in the style of an English flower garden or Japanese garden. Nothing is labeled as it would be in a botanical garden. It’s strictly designed to astound and surprise – very, very Dubai in approach. It’s striking and beautiful but feels very out of place in what would naturally be a desert. I couldn’t help but be shocked at the blatant environmental unsustainability of it all. Overall, it’s not an A-list Dubai attraction, and a little overpriced, but maybe worth an hour if you’ve already seen everything else on the main tourist trail.

Dubai Miracle Garden. This is an off the normal track attraction. I visted this with my daughter and very much enjoyed it. Everything is colored in flowers and it was a nice place to walk and talk for an hour.

Best Garden in the region. Flowers Flowers Flowers, a wonderful place and the best garden in the region. Nice views all along the garden. flower houses, flowers burj khalifa, effil tower, cars with flowers, n flowers and flowers. Recommended time is 2 hours before sunset so that u can cover the whole garden in the sunlight that's not so extreme and a couple of things just after sunset. So can have both the day and night views of the garden. Entry ticket is aed 30.

Mini Keukenhof. Miracle Garden Dubai is a very nice relaxing place. It may not be in the top 10 list of attractions of Dubai but the place covered with grass and full of nice blooming plants in all kind of forms is very nice.Houses, castles, cars, animals. Lovely to stroll for a few hours. It is a little outside downtown but worthwhile visiting.Entree 30 Dirham.

Beautiful. Very beautiful and relaxing place. Try to go in the afternoon as it was not too busy. What was not good is that you ahve to take taxi there and back and although it's not too far and taxis are cheap, would have like to have an option...

It's a Marvel!. WOW! amazing effort from the people involved. I feel proud as many workers were Indian. Keep your camera's/mobile charged as every spot is an opportunity to click one.Since, it's not connected well with public transport, taxi is the only option.Best time to visit is during the day, with hat and water.Fee: 30AED

A Dutch Treat in Dubai. Visited Miracle Gardens with my wife and blown away at its splendor and decorative sights. The place reminds us of Holland where we lived some 20 years ago now. The windmills and Floral houses did the trick.
Amazing Flowers. A great place to visit and smell and see beautiful flowers. My advice is to go early morning or late afternoon as there is not a lot of shaded areas and it can get a bit hot.

family place. Wonderful and colourful displays of flower. Unfortunately I thought there will be a range of flowers on the site. However was a peaceful visit. Is a good place to relax if you going with family and kids. One hour will be enough to look around.

Amazing flowers but over crowded and overrated. The flowers in the garden are amazing, created in really interesting arrangements, with the most incredible displays. But the place is packed with people posing for pictures, and crammed with kids running all over. Parking is not enough, and it took 25 minutes just to drive in! All in all, there are better attractions in Dubai!

Good place for a day out. if you love flowers ... this is the place to go around with family and definitely a tourist spot. If you have a guest visiting Dubai.. yes..... this is one of the attractions in Dubai.

Amazing!!. Gorgeous views! Can capture breathtaking photos. Reasonably priced (30 dhs per person / approx $8 USD). Quick visit- no longer than an hour or two to see. A little tricky to find via GPS or Google maps, but worth the adventure.

It is a wonder in Desert.. Seeing is believing. It is unbelievable to see so many beautiful flowers in a desert city despite unfavorable weather. The Garden is undoubtedly a Miracle in Dubai. Even in India we don't have such beautiful Gardens inspite of favourable climatic conditions

Village of flowers. A little far out if you are not driving as the F30 bus of which we were advised to take only take you part of the way, also a little disappointed with the lack of variety of plants, but worth visiting to see all the sculptures and the village of houses all made with pots of flowers.

Colorful garden. It's a place to visit when you go to Dubai during the right weather, I cant imagine stroll along the garden during summer :)
November- March will be the best time to visit and take lots of picture.

A miracle in the desert.. It is pretty amazing that such a lovely garden exists a midst the desert. don't forget to see the black flowers and the hanging tap here.Theres also a food court inside.Best time to visit is late afternoon.
Must Visit for Nature Lovers. This should made as Dubai's Must visit place , coz we cant believe our eyes that in a dessert , how come this infinite coloured flowers, Really miracle
Spectacular. Now I am not a gardener and not really into such things but this place is impressive and for the entrance fee very reasonable, nice size too as easy to walk around.

Flowers Galore. Lovely to visit especially in the cooler months between Dec and March. Hundreds of different colours all arranged meticulously, a must see. Also Butterfly World will be opening soon right next door.

A Miracle Indeed !!. Flowers, Flowers Flowers, every where, in the middle of desert. Incredible. They have created all sorts of shapes and decorations using flowers. Truly amazing. A must visit if you are in Dubai.
Best garden i have seen ever... Superb garden with lots of hanging baskets and many designs in flowers..very clean huge garden....and near to dubai city...a must watch place in dubai...

Nice get away. Nice park with great flower arrangement. Great in wintertime, not sure if the flower display will survive the hot summer. Adjacent will be a butterfly park open in March or April.
I will be back then and check it out.

Magical at night!. A oasis of calm in bustling Dubai. The first thing that hits you is the fragrance of all the flowers. The garden is floodlit at night which adds to the experience. Flowers adorn all sorts of structures including upside down houses, castles, cars as well as models of the Eiffel Tower and the Burj Khalifa. Well worth a vist.

Awesome place to go with your special one. Spacious garden with lots of flowers......very nice buildings designed with flowers, just awesome!.Entry isnt expensive, it is a great place to go with your special one, They have new attractions all the time, the time i went they had a burj khalifa filled with flowers and even taj mahal and other iconic buildings

Lovely surroundings!. The garden is a fantasia of colors and lovely flower arrangements, it's a heaven for photographers :) Although I expected more variety in the plant species but it seems the weather has it's ugly limitations after all. there are a few problems with the place as resting benches are limited and far spread with no shade and if you make the mistake of going on a sunny day at noon this can be an issue... All in all it was such a fun experience and we took many many pictures but it's a place to visit only once.

Really a miracle.. I wonder how they do to entertain this garden in Summer. It's a garden right in the middle of a dessert. We visited in January which is a good month as it's winter in Dubai. My boyfriend and I had a romantic time in the Garden walking around with all these beautiful and colorful flowers everywhere. We loved snacking, grilled corn on the cobs or spiral potatoes. There's also a foodcourt in the middle. The garden is kinda popular with people. I bet it will always be crowded with visitors.

United colors of Miracle garden :). If you are like my aunt you will like this place.. she took about 600 pictures in this garden..Flowers, colors, umbrellas everywhere.. and there is a restaurant also.We really enjoy it.. Please count 3 hours for the visit

Very enjoyable!. It's unbelievable how nicely they planted the flowers! Amazing shapes - entire villages made of flowers and what not - the cars, the Burj Khalifa, the giant mermaid, the heart shaped gates, the flowery lakes...very very beautiful. They have cafes so you can quench your first in a hot Dubai day. Worth coming for a pleasant morning!

They say a walk in the clouds is impossible but a walk through the Miracle Garden definitely comes close!. Open in the winter period - around Oct to March, this is a must see for not just tourists but the residents as well. A bit tricky to reach as except taxis or your own car not much local transportation possible. It lies between Sheikh Zayed road and Al Khail road.They have recently opened a second garden but one ticket has tearaways that will be taken by the usher at the gates of either. Both are must sees as have something different for us to gaze and wonder.Beautiful landscaping using lovely vibrant flowers...dummy animals, cars, houses, bridge archways, clocks...all get the makeover with flowers brilliantly laid out. A beautiful valley of flowers is simply awesome when entering through an arcade tunnel. Simply brilliant for 3-4 hours with family. Not much eating options so sneak in some of your own if planning more than 1-2 hours.

A flower oasis in the middle of desert. This garden is located in Al Barsha, which is far from the city centre. It took us about 40 minutes by taxi with no traffic to access the garden. A long ride but definitely worth it if you have time to discover the rest of the city. We spent almost two and a half hours in this beautiful garden. You can see the effort those architects has put to turn this place into something imaginable. The landscapes are fully covered with flowers. There is what I assumed as Burj Khalifa, the Eiffel Tower, and windmills representing Holland all well-built and designed carefully with flowers. It captures your attention how things have been organised to come out with a perfect picture of the place. Note that the garden is only opened in the months in which the plants can handle the heat. So it is your chance to walk while enjoying cold breezes here and there. You can rest at the shaded areas and have a refreshing drink. However, I recommend that you buy yourself snacks from a supermarket or something before you go as the snacks that are sold in the graden are more expensive. Not surprising for a tourist attraction, but if you're going with kids and is on a tight budget it may be useful to consider this.
just a hype. i ha da lot of expectations with this place.. but wasn't that impressed.. and i found the entrance ticket expensive as well..though it was just aed 30 per person but wasn't worth it..

So beautiful place for our memories. Was wonderful garden but they don't have too much service there, there is not small shop or any thing , just by the way we have look and then we have place to take a rest, for example: time for tea, soft drink...

It truly is a miracle garden!!!. Flowers, colors, music and design are all mixed in this spectacular garden.Everything is designed to perfection with impeccable taste.U can even have ur picture developed for 50AED and the photographers are really friendly.However I did not check irregularities in its website as some are suggesting.
one of the worlds best place. This is one of the most amazing place on planet earth, but be ready to walk, its a must visit place in Dubai

Thing to See. Miracle Garden definitely deserves a visit if you are on a long holiday to Dubai. The garden is incredibly beautiful with brilliantly done landscapes all done with flowers. It is quite far from the city so if you are on a short trip which mostly is for shopping or partying, then give this place a miss. But a place like this, confirms super pictures for a vacation

Flower power. What a splash of colour in the middle of a very barren region. The various different displays were really well maintained and the shaded areas a welcome relief from the midday sun. It is a bit out of the way but if you are lucky with the taxis it is well worth the visit.

Lives up to its name. Dubai defies its desert surroundings with extraordinary developments - and this place is a prime example.Millions of flowers in some often surreal displays keep the air fresh in this literal oasis 15 minutes in land from the coast. Half buried cars, windmills, flower peacocks and a village of palaces add to the curiosity of this cooler months only attraction. At AED30 to get it in, admission is reasonable and there's a decent food selection if you want to make a day of it. Look out for the butterfly park opening alongside in February 2015.

Amazing.. These gardens are not well advertised in Dubai but are well worth a visit. The flowers and sense need to be experienced, but probably only in the cooler months. We spent about 2 hours looking around in the late afternoon early evening to look at them in daylight and after dark when they turn on the lights.

Flower Power. Love this place. So so serene and colourful. It's quite nice to see something a little more humble in Dubai but it is still really impressive. I love the upside down umbrellas too. Really fun day out and great selfie background material ;-) make sure your camera or phone is fully charged...! I went with my mum and grandma and once we finished looking around we went to The Farm after for lunch as it is close by. Beautiful day out and highly recommend although it was over quite soon it still was a memorable experience ✌️

Must watch beauty created in desert.. It is a beautifully designed park. Very colourful. Nature lover's delight. One can spend about two to three hours easily in the garden. It is amazing the way these flowering plants are grown, maintained and nurtured.Only problem is to reach there. It is slightly away from main city. What I understood, there are no good bus connections or Metro rail. We found it very difficult to get Taxi to return. We had to wait for about 40 minutes before we could get one.

Flowers in the Dessert. An excellent way to showcase the seasonal fresh flowers on display... Great coverage & in details the layout of the entire area... A must visit for tourist as well as local residents...
Flowers everywhere. The disadvantages of the garden are: not easy to get there, accessible probably only by car, too crowded! But it's very beautiful so worth a visit.

Floral Land. Though everyone says Dubai is Man made but the idea and creativity is amazing. Miracle garden is a must visit place in Dubai. The garden is made of beautiful and colourful flowers in a innovative way. Entry for the garden is 30 aed per person and they have also got few eating joints inside the garden. A perfect place to spend a great evening with family and friends. A must visit place if you are traveling to Dubai. Note - Open from November to May

You see miracle in Miracle Garden!!!. Its a superb place to visit ONLY if you are keen to be within the colourful flowers and designs made with those flower beds. I would not recomend to those who do not wish to see flowers around them or those who are allergic to them. Its a great place to experience and to learn about the flower in a place which is full of desserets around. You get nice and colourful photos with thise beautiful flowers. Girls n kids enjoy the most being into the colourful and creative vincity.

Gorgeous!!. Everything about Dubai is massive! Who could imagine a garden in the middle of desert... Miracle garden is gorgeous... The entrance fee is AED 30 per head... there is a café and a great place to spend time and wander around...

A Visual Pleasure. This place is appropriately named indeed. Growing and sustaining so many varieties of flowers in the desert climate of UAE is truly amazing. There are so many different colorful flowers in such imaginative arrangements that one can't decide where to focus! Don't miss it if you're in Dubai.
vow. If you are looking for photo suit, video clip, you must have to try. It is just amazing. Great mix of variety of flowers with different colours.Simply miracle.

Beautiful arrangement of flowers. This place is a must visit for those who love colours. I had never seen so much color together in life. Little off from the city, but you can club it with Global village to spend the day.

Non existing. I was in Dubai in November 2014 and thought it would be a good idea to visit Miracle Garden in Al Barsha. I went on their website and it stated that phase 1&2 were open to the public with plenty of photographs on show. My daughter and I took a taxi there as there is no public transport available in the area. When we got there it seemed awfully quite. I got a sinking feeling that something was amiss. I looked around and the entrance gate was locked. I found a security guard who was walking around and asked him why the gate was closed. He replied that the gardens were not open to the public as yet. I thought that he must be confused and I told him that the website states that the gardens were open and visitors are welcome. He just shook his head and gave me a pitying look. I got so upset as by this stage the taxi had gone and there was no other in site to leave the so called Miracle Garden. An American gentleman who saw us and realized what had happened offered to share his taxi with us which was a saving grace as otherwise we would have been stuck in the middle of the desert in the heat. This is unacceptable behavior on the part of the people who run this attraction. Why advertise that the Garden was open when it was clearly not? Please check with a reputable source before you visit this place just in case.

Heavenly 💜. Like no place else,Entrances ticket for 30DHS, it starts at 4 pmAna mostly the garden blossoms in winter. Its not available or as flourishing in other seasonsRecommended to go in winter. They have a warm winter there
Good fun. Good fun, wouldn't stay there for long as flower compositions are very repetitive, but worth a visit.
Really beautiful and very nice settings. It's wonderful with its colors and designs, homes and everything is just in flowers!!! Just breathtaking!!

Beautiful place. Must go. This place is incredible. They made so many things using different flower. It is amazing how in a hot weather, they can keep flower alive. It is a nice place to take pictures. If you have pollen allergy, be sure you take medicine b4 you get there

Romantic...elegant...pretty. Full flowing flowery decor..
Florals so lovely.. Captivating colors. So many tourists/ visitors but few resting spots...it would be great if there are some live attractions or shows...
Meh. Flowers, more flowers. Walk. Flowers. Neat... I guess. Went there for a photo shoot. Colorful, but not real exciting.

Like in a mirecle!. Went there next day after my BD.....and it was just amazing! Perfectly beautiful walk! Fantastic pictures! Drinking coffee in between the flowers! Great escape from the city rhythm!

pleasing sight to eyes. We should appreciate their effort- keeping a spectacular flower garden in the dessert. The miracle garden is a little far from the city.It is not very big.You can cover it by walk in an hour. It is really a great sight to see different kind of flowers arranged aesthetically. There are some places to sit and you can get juices and nuts.The honey nuts i got from there is tasty.There is also a cart and he takes around the whole garden in 10 minutes.Plenty of photo opportunities.

Disappointing. Coming from a country with lots of flowers, we were quite disappointed with the current show. It consisted of mainly 3 different kinds of flowers, so not that exciting.Have seen pictures from there that was great, but not this one.

Nice but one time visit.. There are good sights for photos. Nice architecture. One should take about 2 hrs to go around the garden. There are eateries inside the garden. Entry fees of 30 aed seems to be slightly high. At places old flowers were decaying and you can understand it's odour. For me it's just okay to visit once.

Pretty!!!. Absolutely fantastic what has been done in the middle of the desert! I have also seen recent updates that werent there when i visited so it even more beautiful now. Its worth the visit! Do not miss this gem!

Fancy Garden. Visited this place on 29-12-2014. Nice garden that is worth a single visit, avoid weekends. Entrance is 30dhs, has a small food court in the centre, not much to do at the garden itself,except walk around, take pictures and maybe chill on the grass for a while. I had gone to Paradise Garden in Al Ain, Miracle garden is a bigger version of PG. They have changed the garden in winter 2014, there are nice house decorated with flowers and heart shaped arches. Cars scattered, although i am not sure what all that art work means. Worth it if you like gardens

For flower lowers. If you are flower lover be sure to visit Dubai's Magical Garden. Location of the gardens is little bit out of the city but it is worth the visit. Also take note of visiting time, as this attraction is on the open and is closed during hot spring/summer/autumn months.In the garden itself there are various attraction made of flowers: houses, birds, flags etc. It is nice to walk around and take colorful pictures.

Indeed a Miracle. Visited Miracle Garden when a cousin suggested the same. Indeed a miracle in center of desert. The flower arrangements are incredible with the Eifle Tower, streets and houses of France. Worth the visit.

Excellent place! Heaven of flowers! . At only 30 Dirhams you enter a big park of flowers and what they told us that each season will be different from the other. And after a year they will make fruits in there so you can taste them :). Worth to visit really beautiful place

Superb ! not to be missed.. We almost missed it with being lazy on the last day of the trip. But we are very happy to have visited it. So many colorful and wonderful flowers in the midst of dessert is absolutely unimaginable. The flower decorations over different statues, houses, etc are outstanding. It is a place to just click, click, images with your eyes and camera.

Beautiful garden in the desert. A must see on your visit to Dubai. We enjoyed a nice walk through the garden and took in all the wonderful flower designs and structures. A great place for beautiful colorful pictures.
amazing. visiting Dubai and not seeing this is a Faux Pas ! it's beautiful! best if you spend half day there just admiring, having a lunch, relaxing ...

Beauty at its best. Words and pics wouldn't do justice to describe this flower garden. It's the largest in the world. Peacocks, Cars, Burj Khalifa- all find their structures in flowers form. Truly a miracle.

Amazing. Even if you are not passionate about flowers, this place is amazing. It is very clear how much work and planning went into building this place and especially into maintenance.There are bars and terraces inside the Garden, serving really tasty fresh juices.It is a must see when in Dubai.

Mismerzing. You need to see it to believe it, have been going to this place his last 2 years and every year the way the garden is done with uncountable flowers is just unbelievable. It makes you feel in different world definitely you don't feel you are in dubai. One of the best camera shoots we could do here with our family

Beautiful arrangement of flowers.. What a fantastic place the flower arrangements are classic I've never seen anything like it before and I've travel the globe. It's changed every year so I'm told. Brilliant the place is clean with plenty of places to relax, where you can buy food and drinks (came be a bit pricey). There are golf carts for you to ride in for a fee if you don't want to walk. There is a small play area for the young children 20 DHS for 15 minutes. It can be difficult to find so you will a sat-nav, but there plenty of parking and the staff are helpful. There are houses from all over the world covered in flowers, the Paris Eiffel Tower, Dutch windmills, Burj Khalifa all covered with flowers, beautiful. 30 DHS entrance fee very busy at weekends obviously but well worth a visit. Only opened in the winter months.
Too Hyped. It is a good place to visit once but not more than that. The variety of flowers are less, the entry fees is high. Last year was much better. Can be avoided

A Romantic Place - Miracle Garden. The Miracle Garden of Dubai is a place full of flowers , full of colors and full of stunning perfumes . When you enter in the Garden , a powerful perfume is waiting for you on the other side of the entrance gate . Then you can take a lot of beautiful photos with the flowers and the shapes where the flowers are growing . The flowers are growing in shapes like : hearts , cars , Burj Khalifa , Windmills , Eiffell Tower , houses , arcades and lots of others . This place is a romantic place in my opinion . You can go with your girlfriend and visit this place , you can spend a stunning time there . It is wonderful .

If ski in the shopping mall, why not flowers in a desert?. This is just one more confirmation what money, great planning and work deduction can achieve. I am not a flower fan, neither I know what kind of flowers are there, but I was impressed with what they made, built and decorated with flowers.The Miracle garden is on the outskirts of Dubai, towards the desert, and I drove some 20 minutes up to there. There is no metro or bus, so you must drive or take a taxi. If driving, you'll get lost like I did, because no signs, so you must frequently ask other drivers on signals.The entrance is 30 Dirham pp (7 Eur, including children) and it was quite busy with a lot of people. I recommend coming around sunset to avoid the heat, and to see it lit up at night. Allow up to 2 hours for visit, nice for eyes and nose.

wonderland. We visited last December and the weather was perfect, cool breeze, shady trees and the structures were one of a kind. our favorite is the upside down house and the giant clock, truly a rewarding experience for people from tropical climate, makes you realize how bless we are to have trees and plant all year round. for a desert country, everything is possible if you will it and put your mind into it. MUST see place in Dubai. there are buses outside Miracle garden that will take you to the city near Mall of Emirate for a couple of dirham only.

Again its a much hyped place.... We visited there on 13-1-2015. The whole garden can be covered by 1.5 to 2 hours. Flowers are beautifully arranged. Its called as miracle as located in the desert place. Its away from Dubai city. We paid 62 dhs for taxi from bur Dubai. No other nearest public transport system. You can club with global village cost as its very close (7-8 km) to miracle garden. Global village starts only by 4 pm every day. So you can plan to reach miracle garden by 2 pm.then visit global village.

Flowers..Flowers... Flowers..flowers... & flowers. Excellent place for people who love flowers. For me it was average because I personally do not have much liking for it and got bored after some time. The rating is my personal abut for people fond of flowers, it might be higher.

Value for money! . Ok so yes as a lot of reviews say this place has only a few verities of flowers but for the price you pay it's excellent value for money. You can spend a couple of hours just lazing around and it smells amazing! Well worth a visit in my opinion

Beautiful. This isn't just flowers. It is an amazing landscape, an oasis in the middle of the desert where you can shoot really great pictures and relax. There are awesome <<sculptures>> . Entrance is 30 AED and it is better to take a taxi or drive there. You can't enter food, but there are some small drink shops inside.

Breathtaking. It was unbelievably beautiful. The flowers and colours and variety of plants were gorgeous. The different formations especially the model houses were really stunning. I could spend my whole day there.

Miracle Visit. This place is open only during the winter months. Try to go at around 4 p.m. or so, so that you can enjoy the sunset over there. Entrance fee is 30 AED per person. The place is really awesome and makes you feel so very happy. There are restrooms all over and benches to sit and relax. They also have a maze (which is at an extra charge). There are many eating outlets here.

Great for Photography. Miracle Garden offers wonderful array of flowers and one of the most visited place in Dubai during winter. To go in here, one can take the metro to Emirates Mall, from there hail a taxi which will cost around 25-30 aed. Entrance in the garden will cost 30 aed. It is advisable to come very early or late since the heat can be very scorching at noon, it will very uncomfortable and surely one can get sunburn. The garden is a nice backdrop for "selfies" and photo. One can choose from the different arrangement of flowers. If one is expecting different kind of flowers, one will be disappointed since this garden is more on landscaping than the showcasing of different types of flowers and plants. Another important thing to take note is that miracle garden will close during summer.

Absolutely Beautiful Gardens. This place is stunning! I would recommend any visitors to Dubai to visit these gardens. It took around two hours to walk round as we kept finding more and more photo opportunities. Probably best to visit during the week. It was fairly busy but not too crowded . I imagine it will be harder to get the perfect photos at busier times. Lots of seating areas for drinks and snacks. Only 30 dirham's entry price. Don't miss this place!

A beautifully landscaped garden !. This was stunning, much better than i expected. The curator has made different shapes with multiple color flowers. The entry price is good with 30 Dhs and one can easily spend 2-3 hrs visiting the entire garden. you feel like taking a pic at every spot of the garden and it makes for good facebook profile pics. Reminds me of keukehnof gardens although no Tulips here.

Lovely display of flowers. Using only a handful of variety of flowers - mostly petunias of varied colors, some verbenas and geraniums - wonderful and creative display. The idea of Umbrellas for shading creates a lovely ambiance. Innovative use of old cars for display too. Well maintained and widely spread, this is worth visiting at least once. But in summers, it may be a disappointment. Limited food stalls are there. Entry fees are a bit too high - 30 AED/person.

Best Place in Dubai. If you love flowers, you will fall in love with the worlds largest garden of Natural Floral arrangements.Best time to visit is winters. Entry charges is negligible. Dont miss any corner of the garden, else you would miss something wonderful. Do eat the roasted corns. Burj Khlaifa made of flowers was shining in the dark. Petunias in so many varieties is beyond imagination. Dont touch the flowers, just enjoy and praise the beauty. Best Visiting hours : 03:00pm. to 05:00 pm
very nice. its very nice place very quiet its like you are in heaven in middle of desert and i would like to go there again i love this place
Hundred mark. my thumsup in the middle of desert they made a paradise.I am a photographer i got nice shot with my canon 7D.we spended 3 hour.very nice we loved it amazing place in dubai.Dont miss it

Lovely place, but shadow on the alleys is scarce. Entry fee is 30AED for an adult. The place is absolutely lovely, filled with flowers in all sort of arrangements. There is a severe competition, among the visitors, for taking pictures. The place is worth 100% seeing and enjoying, but be aware that except for a few terraces also covered with flowers and providing shadow, while walking on the alleys, there is almost no shadow, so if you plan to visit when the temperatures are rising, maybe it's better to go in the evening. Keep in mind that the weekend in Arab countries is Friday and Saturday (plus of course Thursday evening), therefore the place will get even more crowded.I recommend it - don't forget your camera or smartphone!

Interesting place. Our taxi driver randomly dropped us off here, even though we had wanted to go to the Mall of the Emirates. Random, but I guess quite interesting to see in the middle of Dubai, all these flowers. This definitely seemed like maybe where all the locals go for sightseeing, as we didn't see many western looking tourists around. It's neat to walk around, and perhaps would say it is worth a visit if you had more time to see it, however, when we had only 1 full day to see Dubai's main attractions, it was a bit of a random stopover for us.

Perfect day!!. Wow, what a nice surprise this miracle garden was for us. We didn't have any expectations and we were very pleasantly surprised. The setting is beautiful and so fun to experience. It's not overly big or daunting to walk it all. Don't go in the heat of the sun as it would be way too hot to enjoy. We went during a weekday and it was perfectly attended without masses of people as we've experienced everywhere else in Dubai this trip. We loved sitting in the food court area and we enjoyed Ice cream and fresh fruit juices - the juices were amazing! It's a great place to take pictures with vibrant colored backgrounds.
Beautiful garden. The garden is beautiful with plenty of photo opportunities.There are places to eat, with shaded seating areas to rest, in the garden. Definitely a must see when in Dubai.

Amazing place. I recomend everyone to visit this amazing place and glance all the beauty, so many colors,so many photos)))) and dont forget to go to the Global Village(just 5-6 minutes way by taxi from the Miracle Garden.

Indeed a Miracle. It is indeed a Miracle to have such a beautiful garden in the middle of a desert. We spent around an hour and half here. It provides perfect photo opportunities with beautiful colorful flowers all around. We loved the peacocks and the houses the most.

What a Beauty? A must see.. We visited the Miracle Garden in Dubai and were so impressed by the sheer beauty of nature. The landscaping is extraordinary and so well done. The garden truly reflects this name. A must see if you are visiting Dubai.

Charming. The name "Miracle Garden" is most apt!!! One has to take into account that one is visiting a garden in the desert.....however, although charming, I found it very repetitive in terms of flowers and sets!! The sets were interesting in particular the charming "Peacocks and Windmills" in conclusion, well done Dubai... But if this is truly a "Miracle Garden" I think that there are many many more varieties of flowers that could turn this place from charming to magical. 30dhs per person fair but not fantastic!!!!!!

A must visit in Dubai. This is an amazing place to visit. Absolutely beautiful we were blown away how beautiful it was. Very relaxing. We had and older lady with us and we're worried if there would be too much walking but for 20 dhirams they will take you round the gardens on a buggy. Well I say gardens they aren't really your standard gardens a replica Taj Mahal, a stretched limousine all made out of flowers. If you visit Dubai take a few hours out of you shopping time and visit this fantastic attraction you won't be disappointed .

Fascinating and truly an "attractive attraction". I read a review online that it's best to go during weekends because it's much more fun and exciting. And so me and my mum went there around 4-5pm. It was totally packed with tourists! It gets a little weird taking photos since many people pass by and are just walking all over the place. You'll definitely have another guy in your selfie! Nevertheless, I personally think that it's much more enjoyable if there are a lot of people. So, if you prefer this, visit during weekends. But another reminder is the medium-heavy flow of traffic and the parking space, so you better keep these in mind.As for the place itself, it was definitely amazing. Having such beautiful and colorful flowers arranged to such delightful forms and designs is great itself, but having to see it in a dry and hot place such as Dubai is in fact a miracle. A lot of sights to see, fun and exciting, great for the kids and definitely a must for couples!Not quite sure if outside food and drinks are allowed, but there are a couple of stalls inside where you can buy from but I bet the price is way higher (also not sure about the quality). Wear comfortable shoes and warm clothing! It gets pretty cold especially when visiting at night and the place is huge so you better kick those heels off.I would also suggest that you go earlier in order for you to really see and appreciate the surroundings since the lighting's not that good and also if you're there to take good quality photos.There are also a couple places where you cannot step on and take photos on, you'll know where. A lot of the guards there will just tell you to get off hahahaFor 30AED/person, you could enjoy and walk around the Miracle Garden. Have fun!
Brilliantly Arranged. A beautiful peace of heaven in the middle of the desert, all kind of flowers well arranged and displayed, should not miss it if you visit Dubai.

Magical. It's kind of unusual for the Miracle Garden to be placed in a desert-y area but come to think of it, Dubai never fails to amaze. Flowers are so nice to look at, they all look fresh and in full bloom. All themes and sections look really unique and nicely done. Will surely look forward to next years theme and showcase!

Every bit a miracle. This Garden in the middle of a desert typifies the spirit of Dubai...mesmerizing, soothing, gentle scent of flowers wafting through the air...what else can one ask for. A must do in Dubai. You can spend 45 minutes or laze around the whole morning/afternoon. The garden changes every year so if you are going again, you will find new displays. For Indians it looks like this song was really taken to heart when this garden was built - "Jo soche, jo chaahe vo karake dikhaaden - Ham aag lagaa den paanii men, Patthar pe phuul khilaayen!!"

Wow it certainly is a Miracle. A place were everything around you is covered in flowers. Don't think it's the type of journeys that will last only for a couple of hours , We spent almost 5 hours and were willing to spend more. Very romantic for couples , very fun for families and very relaxing for elders. Just make sure you have a camera ready with you. The only draw back was they have only two restrooms for the whole garden so we had to line up for going to the toilet every time.

A feast to our eyes. Flower, flower everywhere... The miracle Garden is filled with full of flowers with lots of beautification and decorations. One should never miss to visit this place, while in Dubai. A wonderful treat to your eyes.
its really miracle. nice garden with lots of flower to see and the landscape its really beautiful.....but its far from the city its in south of barsha

Effort worth appreciating!. Miracle garden as the name says is a garden filled many many flowers. Lots of beautiful decoration to see. There's definitely a great effort put in to come up with such a huge garden. U need to visit this place to understand the value of it. It's very romantic too. It's pretty big enough so yeah a couple of hours minimum will be required to explore the whole garden. The house decorations for me were the prettiest. It wasn't very much crowded on the day I went but slowly more people r getting to know about it. A good evening spent with wife at the miracle garden.

Awesome Experience! Must see!!. What an awesome amazing experience! You can get tons of photoshoot opportunities. Every corner, angle gives a new perspective. A theme park, made all of flowers!To get the best of the opportunities, suggest to visit in the early morning (opens at 9 am). Crowd will be less, letting you take pictures without lots of crowd in the background (and you are a pro and know how to exclude the crowd yet taking the desired frame). If you are a visitor, avoid weekends and public holidays to avoid spending long hours in queue to buy the tickets.

Flowers flowers and more flowers. Kudos to the people who have made this happen, Growing and maintaining so many types of flowers in the Desert is a huge ask but hats off to the people who have done it and are maintaining it

Worlds largest natural flower garden. Amazing the way they have built this... Surrounded by natural flowers this is definitely the best garden ever .. After all it is the worlds largest natural flower garden .. Entry costs AED 30 per person above 3 yrs.. Kids will love it ... You need a car to reach there as its a bit far away from the center of the city. A must visit if you have the time.

Blooms in desert. Excellent Dutch garden created in desert of emirates. Every one in the Group of 20 senior citizens felt that it was a visit of their life time. The garden has been rightly given the name, "Miracle garden". This garden should be in the itinerary of every tourist.
exellent. Went there today with my family and friends. Millions of flowers and beautiful. plenty of opportunity for people who love flowers, photography

Awesome Place!!. Went there today with my family and friends. Millions of flowers and beautiful. plenty of opportunity for people who love flowers, photography. Going there tomorrow to take more photos.

Nice Place, Creative. Went there on New Years Day and I can see why it was busy... A really nice place to go :)Some amazingly creative garden ideas in the outskirts of Dubai (Al Barsha South).Lots to see and do but could be a little more interactive. Very busy with people vying for good photo opportunities.Pram hire was very handy, lots of food and drink to choose from as well. Lots of seating for everyone to relax. Wear a hat and sunscreen!Taxis are there to take you away, so we experienced a quick getaway.At AED30 per adult, good value for money for a half day adventure.

So much prettiness. Millions of flowers! It's a beautiful place. If you have hay fever, you want to avoid thus place though! But seriously, it's a lively place for a nice photo, and a mist pleasant way to kill a couple of hours. All in all, it was lovely and my children loved it! It's a bit out of the way, so if possible, keep a car with you when you go. Or arrange return transportation before you get there.

Beautiful. We visited it during May and it was absolutely amazing and beautiful although I would recommend that you visit in the winter months as it's very hot during the summer months and is truly a beautiful place to visit

Nice attraction. Indeed it is very interesting to see such nice garden, so colorful and creative in the middle of the desert. It is an huge area where you can see many different designs, pictures, all made with flowers. Even the Burj Khalifa is there made of flowers. Also there's a large area where yiu can sit to refresh, sit, drink and eat something. It is very warm, so wearm confortable clothes and shoes and take a hat and sunglasses. Camera is mandatory of course!

relaxing. An amazing place! The Garden is open just for 5 to 6 months. Though most of the seasonal flowers are petunia in different colors but the way the park is designed is applaudable. I really like the way UAE is creating different areas of entertainment to attract tourists and boost their economy. Must visit!

Amazing Garden. The miracle garden is not an easy place to get to but once there it is worth the visit. The garden is adorned by many colorful flowers which compliment the various structures/objects/birds such as Eiffel Tower, Burj Khalifa, train, peacock, cars etc... We visited the garden at about 2:30pm and it was really hot and the strong rays of the sun caused some discomfort. Would recommend a visit around sun set when it is much cooler.

:) best part of my holiday. A beautiful morning spent in the garden. 1. ensure that the gardens are open at the time of your visit as flowers are seasonal2. contact the garden management before your trip or check their facebook page to ensure they are not under renovation. Was difficult to get them on the phone / reply.Our hotel did not have the correct information so ended up wasting a day doing something else.should be open in December as it is tourist season and winter in Dubai. 3. ticket is 30 AED. worth it. 4. there is a maze inside the garden for additional charge, seemed like fun if there is time.5. one can hire the golf cart for 20 AED to take your group around the park -with 5-7stops of 1 min each for photos. we walked as it is not a huge park.6. ensure you take sun umbrellas/ sun glasses or hats. The sun is quite strong.7. snacks available at the back section of the garden - Egyptian pancakes, potato on a stick, waffles, smoothies. all upto 20 AED. Great few hours away from the malls

Unbelievably beautiful and stunning!!!!!!. This garden is truly a miracle ...so many beautiful flowers blossoming in different shapes structures is just breathtaking!!Burj khalifa, mini train,lady face, motor cars, limo etc etc all created with different colours of flowers is truly extremely creative and simply beautiful!!!!!Don't miss it...its a must see!!!!

Nice place, not easy to get to. Getting there was a bit of a treck, we took the metro to the mall of emirates and took a taxi from there, it cost 30aed. It is possible to take a taxi from the stop before, FGB, which is a shorter taxi ride. On the way back we took a taxi to the FGB stop, however it cost us 50aed. the driver has to make a long u turn. We did not take an official taxi on the way back, but on checking the taxi calculator, this was the correct price. The actual Miricale garden was nice, it had lots of quirky arrangements and was very colourful. It was quite a peaceful place and only took about 40 minutes to see the whole place which was enough for us anyway. We were advised that the food options were not great so we ate before we went, but it might be a nice place for a picnic if you like that sort of thing.

Worth a visit while in Dubai. The garden is quite far from the main Dubai city center. No metro to take you there. You can go by either bus or taxi. Taxis are easily available to and from the place. Children below 3 yrs and people on wheelchair enter free. For the others there is an entrance fee. The garden is pretty spectacular - although not the best I have seen. They have currently developed only phase I of the garden and phase II is under development. Its definitely a place worth visiting. Will take you about 2 hours to see the whole garden leisurely. There are buggys available to take you around too but the garden can easily be covered by foot. You can take some nice pictures here...Its very colorful and very pleasant. We visited it during the day time and it was not very crowded.

A Pleasant Surprise! . One doesn't expect to see this. Least of all in the middle of a desert. But as one enters the gates of the Miracle Gardens, the 'Oohs' and 'Aahs' are spontaneous. The whole place is filled with colourful blooms. Kids just loved it. Open only during the winter months. Try to be there early in the morning. Finding the place was a bit difficult - but that's part of the fun.

Truly a Miracle. It looks like animation in real life.thousands of flowers grown in the middle of desert and arranged in beautiful patters.the entry fee is very nominal. This is a MUST VISIT attraction of Dubai.perfect spot for family pics.
Beautiful. This place was unbelievable beautiful! <3 Will definitely recommend to anyone who visits Dubai. It is only a 15-20 minute cab ride from Downtown Dubai

Very Nice. I've never experienced a garden like this and things you can do with flowers. Amaazing!!!!And to think this huge beautiful garden, right amidst sandy dessert, is indeed a miracle. Extremely difficult to imagine how so many colourful flowers bloom in the dessert. And the way the flower beds are arranged with art structures, is amazing. A must visit for nature/ flowers/garden lovers.A Must to visit

Amazing garden.... A lot of flowers with different designs wich make from this garden a unique garden... Very clean... Best place for taking pictures with a nice backgrounds.... A lot of parking for cars.... Entrance fees is 30aed(8$)wich means it's affordable... The worst thing is that there is no sign board on the way from abu dhabi to reach the garden
Hilarious. I guess I've never experienced a garden like this which is why I found it so funny. The things you can do with flowers these days!

Amazing Garden. We were just in time any later and it would of been too hot. They made the flowers into so many different shapes. It is well worth going to see but not in the summer. You can spend some quality time here.

Unbelievable miracle in dessert . Touted as world's largest garden, this huge beautiful garden, right amidst sandy dessert, is indeed a miracle. Extremely difficult to imagine how so many colourful flowers bloom in the dessert.And the way the flower beds are arranged with art structures, is amazing.A must visit for nature/ flowers/garden lovers.

Simply beautiful. This is a lovely place & a must see sight. Millions of different flowers in a desert give you amazing feeling.The best time to go is around 3 to 4 pm. The ticket is affordable Aed 30 per person but a bit distanced from dubai downtown.Dont forget to take your camera. The pics with flowers are incredible.

A Miracle Indeed!!!. Miracle Garden as the name suggest is a Miracle in Dubai indeed. Located at Al Barsha, a little further away from the main city, does not make it a less travelled tourist attraction. Taxi are available to and fro. At present no Metro connection are available. Lovely flower arrangements, beautiful landscape, very clean, best spot for nature lovers and do not forget your cameras. Outside food and drinks are not allowed inside, but there are many eateries selling sandwiches, shawarmas, samosas, pizzas etc.

Vould be better. Like shown on the pictures, the garden is a nice escape. The flowers look nice, although there are not many forms, but more one and the same (many houses) over and over. The options for food and relaxation need definitely improvement. We had a pizza whichwas less than average, the other offer was pasta deep frozen and packed, for 39AED a bit pricey for this quality. And now to mention the worse thing, all over the food area there were so many flies that you had no chance, as soon as you sit down they jump in dozens on your food and drinks. All in all, nice garden, nice idea, but needs so much improvement when it comes to service.

Wonderful and worth a visit. This is a very large flower garden in Dubai Land area. It has state of art landscaping features and hardscape features such as houses, animal creatures, and attractions such as Khalifa and Eiffel towers all worn by flowers.There are some restaurants in the garden and toilet blocks.The entrance fee is AED 30 per person.

The flower garden. The Miracle Garden is one of the most wonderful garden in the world. Full of colorful flowers, planted around houses, arches, peacocks, cars, shades, gates and other designed frames and structures. Most of the flowers are seasonal and some of them never planted in the Gulf region before. visitors will get an eyeful of colors they did not imagine existed in flowers. You can find small cafeteria for selling snacks, cold and hot drinks, ice cream....etc.Entry Fee: AED 30; children under 3 enter free; disabled enter free

Tourism. It was a nice moments when we visited the garden and it worth to spend time to visit itA place with flowers all around the garden and houses build with flowers I am sure everyone visit this garden will feel he is in a heaven

Beautiful but pricy snacking. Gardens are absolutely beautiful and a great day out with friends and family. Just be careful not to pay a fortune for your snacks. Had two Nutella fatayers from the "Egyption Fatyer" (as they spelt it) stall and two cokes for a whopping grand total of AED 90 or US$25. As I am a resident, I know thats not how much fatayer usually is, its just a thin type of crepe, but was forced to pay seeing as we got the bill afterwards.

a hidden treasure!. this was one of the major positive highlights our our family tour to Dubai. spectacular natural flowers with a wide variety of colors. seeing a burj khalifa (smaller version of course, haha!), european style houses, and several structures made completely out of natural flowers was an amazingly beautiful experience for us. not too expensive either, just 30 dirhams per person which more affordable as compared to other attractions in dubai. a MUST visit!!
nice garden. it is a nice area to hang around with lots of flowers and plants just a bit to far, you need to take a taxi to get there

Unique Garden.... Calm and peaceful place, recommend to visit once with family. The ticket costs 30 AED, which is quite high. Location is quite far from main city. Baby carts & Electric cars for families are also provided at extra cost. Good place to relax and hangout with family in cool weather.

Visit to Miracle Garden..expensive.. I guess. After been staying at UAE for nearly 06 yrs, We decided to visit ' Miracle Garden'. No doubt its beautiful , but a fee of 30AED ( approx. 9$) for adults ( and kids above 3yrs), is more I guess. especially , if there is nothing much to do, except just stroll around at the beautiful exhibit of flowers. For a family with 02 kids, we paid 120 AED, just to stroll the garden. On the positive side, the garden is beautiful. It has extensive range of flowers, nicely laid out. Its good for one visit though..

Wonderful Garden. ... This is very nice place for everyone! Families, kids, friends.All those appreciating beauty and outdoor walks. I went with my friends they are very happy, We enjoyed . There are also buggy cars for those who can't walk distances.

First time encounter. I am a resident of Dubai for over 7 years but this is the first time i visited the place. The price increase though and the half of the garden is not yet open by the public. The variety of the flower is not the vast but the decoration is extremely awesome. Would suggest to visit during day time to grab the opportunity to take a picture and to see the view with sunlight.

An overwhelming experience. beautiful, vibrant, soothing and colorful. Great flower sculptures and beautiful setting. lush green oasis in the middle of desert. A must in UAE for sure weather you live here or are visiting.

Garden with only one type of flowers!! . You'll see variety of different subjects covered with same type flower.
If you live in dubai and you have visited everything why not going there for change otherwise for tourist not worth wasting your time there.

A must in UAE. Thought it is bit outside the main city but it is worth a visit. Cost AED 30 per head to enter but once you enter you will realize that the AED 30 is nothing in front of the hard work behind it.. The way flowers are being decorated and the way they have taken care of the garden you will be amaged to see that..
Colourful . It's really nice  There is a lot of nice colours designed in a very nice way It's perfect place to relax

Perfect place to walk around take pictures and admire botanical wonders!. Gorgeous garden,bursting with color.It is well maintained.and beautifully done. For flower lovers its a retreat.The day I went was between rain showers and it was breathtaking and I could sit there all day enjoying the beauty.Totally delightful experience!!

Worth a visit. We went on its first day of opening for the season. Great flower gardens, but I think it would look more spectacular in a months time when the flowers have grown more.
