Can imagine it wouldn't be nice on a hot day, but mild temperatures in December and January would make for a perfect visit. It cost us $AUD15 by taxi (or AED45) and quite a nice drive. Taxis easy to catch on way home too. Great picture opportunities if you love flowers and colour.

Amazing work. First.. don't visit this garden in summer .. it's killing hot & humid. Try to come between October & January. It's really amazing & huge. You could spend full day there just walking and medidating the fenominal work.

A miracle in the Desert truly.. As the title suggests it is truly a miracle. Could not imagine their efforts to have maintained the garden in such hot climate. The landscaping was marvelous. The ideal time would be early in the morning and late in the afternoon to have good pictures. http://www.dubaimiraclegarden.com/

Very nice Activity for Kids and grown ups. the only downside of the visit is the weather- if it is hot then it is not worth the hassle. however; the visit is nice and the floral decoration; creativity and the shapes are to be enjoyed. You don’t need more than hour for this visit; try as much as you can to time it before sunset when the sun is a bit friendly

Closed untill november. We wanted to go there and see the "Miracle Gardens" but after a nice car ride trough some high bushes and roundabouts in the middle of the desert, we parked in front of a closed gate with a big "closed untill the day of Dubai" sign.It would have been ok but the problem is that on the site it says it is open and there is no way of knowing if you don't waste your time going there...

Lovely venue for pictures. The Miracle Garden is a lovely venue with thousands of kinds of different flowers and art made of flowers and recycled goods. It's a perfect place to take photos or photo shoots. Entrance fee is very reasonable. It's a very picturesque and tranquil place to just take a walk around. Once you have visited once you've pretty much seen all you need to see.

Terrible organising. Was really looking forward to go. Visited the website it advised of the opening hours and timings. When we got there it was closed until further noticed but no notice on the website. Drove all the way from abu dhabi. Very disappointed.
help!. can you advise if this will be opened by november 13 2014? we really want to go but we're not sure if its already opened. thanks in advance!

Amazing garden. I have been with my kids last year and we were very impressed with the designes of the flowers. It looked really impressive and we took lots of pictures. I just found the entrance ticket to high.
They have nice choices of foods, big +++

Stunningly Awesome. I never expected to find a place like this in Dubai, no wonder Dubai is one of the top destination for tourist. They always make things possible. It's really worth a visit, though it's far from the city center and somewhat located in the middle of the dessert which makes it unbelievable. It is well maintained and there's just a lot to see. I never cared about the heat of the sun and the area is just so fascinating. There are food stands located inside the garden where you can sit, grab some snacks and relax while enjoying the view.

A Must See in Dubai. This Miracle Garden is a must-see when you visit Dubai. One must ready the cam for loads of shots. Every part of the garden is so beautiful. One tip though: go here at almost sunset. Especially when it's summer, you won't make it long under the sun. Almost nowhere to sit down here under a shade.

Lovely garden but.... Went with my friend and her mom, also her mom friends :)Pros- large garden,oozing with colors- recommended for everyone, families, couples, friendsCons- not wide selection of flowers, no roses at all.- no rides for kids if you have kidsTips- if visitng during summer months or even feb its scorching hot so i recommend to come 4pm onward. Wear sunglasses because there is not much shade in the garden.Conclusion- worth a visit! i will visit again once the dome is done, i hope they will have all sorts of roses!Personal Thoughts:The garden is lovely but it is more like all colors and shapes but not much peaceful feel into it, i prefer english gardens. And i am sort of disappointed because they dont have roses at all during my visit, not sure if they have it seasonally or just dont grow them at all, but considering they will have a closed dome garden in the future, they may grow them there. sunflowers, and stargazers would be nice too.

Creative flowers. A huge garden that has many creative idea has been done to in many flowers and colors and also types. But I really recommended to go to by winter when the weather and heat goes low a bit. And the entry is 20 dhs per person.
Nice place for family. Its a nice place to visit during Winter. Dubai has done lot of Miracles compare to this. but this is a nice place to go...

Paradise in middle of desert. Really i enjoyed being there, even i visited it twiceit's attractive place for flower loversYou can see different kinds of flowersalso flower design are awesome, a lot of shapesKids will like it; there are places for kid’s famous characters and animals Try to visit during winter time, because you’ll walk a lot and spend most of day there.Visit during day time

Respite in the middle of the desert and tall structures. The garden gives something natural at last amid the vertical skyline of Dubai. The Miracle Garden has a beautiful floral display of different shapes and sizes. Certainly gives a fresh feeling to the visitor.Mind the weather conditions here. Although the garden is closed during scorching summers, nonetheless, during April and May, the daytime visit is very difficult. Try to reach around the sunset. The garden looks better at day/sunset than at night

Prettyy pretty pretty. This is a place for everyone! Families, kids, friends.. All those appreciating beauty and outdoor walks. I did the mistake of seeing this place during the summer (super hot!) enjoyed it anyway.. I recommend visiting it when the weather is good. There are also buggy cars for those who can't walk distances.

Underwhelming. Yawn. Just the same types of flowers going for miles and miles. Nothing special really. Not even exotic flowers but the common flowers you see on the road. Not worth the trip especially since this is really far away from the city. A total bore. It's become popular for those who live in Dubai because we stay in a desert and places like these with lots of flowers aren't very common. I just went out of curiosity but was disappointed. No need to waste your time here, especially if you're a tourist.

Amazing !. Miracle garden is an amazing place for anyone vising dubai during the winter , it is very colorful and has lots of flowers that will simply make your day . A must for all the flowers lovers !
A Paradise!. This is one of the most amazing place to go while in Dubai. There are millions of flowers beautifully arranged all over the garden. Too bad its close during summer months...

Flower Enthusiast Paradise. Miracle Garden is a giant flower park but the flowery attractions is not repetitive. Varieties of flowers decorated pots, shopping cart, even houses and cars. There's also a replica of the Burj Khalifa adorned with flower. It's slightly away from the main site and only modes of public transportation is the taxi. However, the attractions is worth it and not to be missed. Future plan, miracle garden 2 is coming up. Too bad miracle garden 2 is still under construction.

The most beautiful place where you feel like you are in heaven.. Amazing designing of flower beds and walls and hills and cares and so on. So creative and heavenly to be there. You can spend a day or half a day as you can buy light snacks and drinks too. Amazing pictures can be taken and have beautiful memories of this place.

Millions of flowers worth colorful mood. Can bet on it, the mood shall be rain rain to be at Miracle garden. An innovative way of nurturing the flower plants and an excellent maintenance. Visit in winter around 4 pm and spend at least 2-3 hours to cherish the beautiful ocean of flowers.
When its opening?. Can any is tell me that its open for visitor in spemember? Official site says that it will going to open in October.My travelling date is 16 sept.

The best of spring!. You need:-trasnportation (as this is in the outskirts of Dubai)-good camera-sunblock-sunglasses-water (there are food places but OVERPRICED)Time allotment: 1 hour may perhaps be too much. The area is not big, but its nice to take some time to look around.
A must see place in dubai. Miracle garden is a beautiful family place to go for. Many designs made by flowers which makes flowery arts pieces.

Amazing!. This is really a must if you visit Dubai. The garden is literally an oasis in the middle of the desert. It is quite far from Downtown Dubai. The best way to get there is to take the metro to the Emirates Mall and from there take a taxi (about 20 min away at about 30 dhs cost or 7-8 euros). The garden is amazing. There are all sorts of cars covered in flowers and even a few houses. There are also some of the worlds attractions (like the Eiffel Tower or Burj Khalifa) made entirely from flowers. There are all sorts of amazing patterns made entirely with flowers. The entrance fee is 30 dhs, but it's free for the disabled and children. I know the garden is isolated and quite far even for Dubai standards, but it is well worth it.

AMAZING FLOWERS in the desert. when you are in dubai be sure to add to your itinerary the miracle garden, you will be amazed how they cultivated the garden in the middle of the desert. the area is nicely arrange the different kinds of colorful flower imported from different countries. its best for wedding proposal or love celebration. be sure to visit during february month. it is not hot. bring with you a jacket it is cold during that month.

Beautiful place for a onetime visit. The garden is open only during the cold months from Oct/Nov to march/april every year, there is an entry fee to enter and outside food is a total no no at this place.. a vast area has been landscaped and planted with lots of beautiful and decorative flowers. Its worth a one time visit. if you have kids below 5 yrs i would recommend a stroller for them since it is a very lengthy walk.
Miracle garden Dubai. So many flower lovely site to see,you can have light snack there and sit and have water /coffe.It not very big 1 or two hours max time frame
Beauty on the sun. It is the place worth for visiting. Beautiful flowers, houses and autos made of flowers. You can get there only by taxi, and it is rather hard to find taxi on your way back.

Miracle. Its truly a miracle...!! beautiful colorful and fresh flowers at Desert land and that too in variety shape you can never imagine for...!! Take it a Car,a building, a tower, Burj Khalifa model, peacock, Tree, Fountain....what you can think of and the flowers are there to show you their beastliness...!! Really enjoyable..!!

Weird and wonderful. I'm not sure what to make of this place?! I have no idea what it is trying to be??Firstly, if you are in Dubai on holiday for a short stay, don't waste your time, there are much better things to do!If you live here however, definitely check it out at some point. It's part flower garden, part art gallery. It's not quite big enough, or quirky enough to be cool. But it can definitely be expanded and worked on to become something much bigger and better.Got some good photos.. Yet still completely baffled by the place!

Beautiful !!!!. What can I say except....beautiful !!!My mum ( in a wheelchair) had a wonderful time here. What a stunning place! We went in March and the weather was perfect....not too hot you could still walk around comfortably but having said that, it was lovely to sit under the areas of cover...The cafe...The covered umbrella walk. Make sure you take a camera as we took loads of pictures! Check opening times as the garden closes at certain times of the year as it's just too hot. Got round easily with the wheelchair so font worry about that at all.....and the wheelchair user gets in free too!!!

If you must see lots of Petunias in a fancy layout..... .... Then this is probably the best Petunia collection in Dubai and you should go.If you are exepecting a "miracle" garden then dont go. Looks a bit like the flower beds in a Theme park like Alton Towers but they charge you 30 dizzer to look at them.Theres cars burined with flowers in them, a walkway with rotting umbrellas above it and a Burj Khalifa made of plant pots.Nice for a walk out and to grab an icecream but its not that great after 15mins.

If you have extra time, why not!. Nice place to spend the afternoon. Clean & well taken care of. Restarents & cafes on site for one to relax & enjoy the afternoon breeze (traveled in Feburuary so the weather was nice!) Not easily accessible by the metro. I think you have to get of at the metro station & use a cab. Ours did not really know where it was!

Great place to unwind!. Really enjoyable, after trying to vidit several times and was closed, nice art with flowers and well kept, just little expensive but something different in the middle of the desser! Must visit!

Beautiful unique and ingenious. Amazing place to be in after you see only the desert, camel and sand! This is a fascinating experience . It's a MUST to visit the Miracle Garden, it's amazing how can get this place full of flowers in the middle of the desert! It's so colorful and so full of life.

Thousands of flowers. This is a fascinating experience . There are literally thousands of flowers . They have been displayed in so many ways . A Flower wall surrounds the gardens and creating a unique environment that is relaxing as well as amazing
Seeing is believing and it is literally a miracle how quickly the gardens appeared !

Mind Blowing - Dont miss this place. Entered this place @ the right time, evening , sunset time.
Beautiful weather, I have no words to describe for the sculptures they have made out of flowers.
For the ticket price I paid and what I experienced, was like I got 1000 times worth for what I paid.

Nice, really good effort. Thanks Dubai. It's something a bit different and it's nice to surrounded by all of this plant life etc. I'm not sure how sustainable it is but it's a pleasant place to be and my Wife and Mother enjoyed taking the little ones there.

Desert Oasis. Who can think of a garden laden with fresh flowers in the middle of the desert! only DUBAI.
Pretty structures made of flowers and greenery makes you feel in heaven in the arid surrounding.

beautiful and unique place... its a v.beautiful garden filled with countless flowers of different kinds widespread on a huge piece of land,marvellous work indeed regarding the maintenance of this garden specially in the hot weather of dubai.its far away from the main city, their is an inappropriate arrangement of sitting and shades which is quite irritating,but its a must to visit it atleast for once because of its beauty and uniqueness..

Breathtaking. This is an amazing and breathtaking place to visit in the hot deserts of Dubai... This is a truly beautiful work of art... One can appreciate all the hard work by the staff... The colours, the variety of flowers, the decor... Just mind blowing.. I commend the visionary behind this amazing creation... Every visitor to Dubai should take time to visit this place...Requirements: Stamina to walk, preferably to be done during the cooler months, a good camera with lens options and an eye for appreciation...

yet another miracle of dubai. 1.economically reachable from mall of emirates metro station via taxi2.as usuall a dslr is a must3.beautiful place to experimnt photography with your kids,they will look super cool in th surroundings4.variety of flowers is limited,wud have been nice if many were there
Beautiful. Once in Dubai, it's a MUST to visit the Miracle Garden, it's amazing how can get this place full of flowers in the middle of the desert! It's so colorful and so full of life. I loved!

Amazing scenery. Amazing scenery attractive flowers requires toooo much walking you should be in all ur energy to be able to finish phase 1 and walk to phase 2 ... Phase 2 is still not fully operational.. Perfect place for photoshooting.. If you are a photography interested person charge ur professional camera and head there

Amazing garden in the desert. Colourful, Vibrant and neatly arranged flower combinations - must be seen to believe.
Note: Not near the Metro, need a cab from there.

Refreshing garden. You will really appreciate God's creations! I was with my son and he couldn't help but take photos! My friends were awed too, For a minimal entrance fee, one feel relax just by looking at the flowers.

Flowers n flowers. Most of the tour packages don't include this place. But I assure you that if you visit the garden, one will start loving the way flowers can be grown. Flowers in the desert that too millions. Very well maintained park. Good security so that no ones destroys the beauty. Not very expensive only 30AED per person. Go in the evening when you can see the beauty in daylight as well as in the night when lights are on. Kids as well as adults will love the place. No food allowed in the garden. But you have cafe's inside.
Recommended for good times!. A beautiful place to hang out with family. Kids will have a lovely time. Even though it's a great place to visit, the enthusiasm loses after the first 30 minutes!

The Miracel Garden. This is one of the most beautiful places in Dubai- man made bu tno tbuildings multi millions of flowers shaped into models of the Burj Khalifa, houses, cars, waterfalls, roundabouts and peacocks archways, garden walks it has to be seen to be believed. Have never seen anything like it in the World fabulous place for weddigs in fact we saw one when we were there. There is another such attraction in Al Ain called the Fantastic Gaden but I have not been there yet. Wors cannot describe the beauty and wonder of it it has to be seen to be believed like almost anything in Dubai. We went on Valentines day and it ws all made up with thousands of red hearts they do themes with the scenery absolutely wonderful

In Pictures Much Better than Reality. When you see the Pictures of the Miracle Garden on Internet, you feel that you should go immediately and see it. You will expect a big variety of flowers and a refreshing environment... but the reality is different, you will not find a variety of flowers and you feel that it is cheap to a certain extent.However I can Guarantee you that you will take some extremely beautiful pictures there... It can be visited once per life in case you are in Dubai and you have some free time

Its all the same.. We wanted something different to do so took a trip out to miracle gardens. Its 30 Dhs each to gain entry. If you want karted about the place which defeats the purpose its 20Dhs as you will find out when every kart stops and asks you when your walking around.We went in the evening and the flowers even in the dark are showing signs of the heat as they would do now its hotting up.Is it worth it id say no not really not just now theres nothing of a miracle about it al the flowers are the same just organised in a different fashion. nice change tho. Going in the winter might be a option but i wasn't impressed at all.

Worth putting up with the heat.. One minute you are in the desert the next in an oasis of colour. The Miracle Garden is a twenty five minute taxi drive from Downtown Dubai so on the way you get to see the outskirts of the city. Although there is so much construction work being done, before long the gardens will not seem so far out of town. As soon as you go through the gate you see the beautiful colours from the thousands of plants. They are not just planted in beds and hanging baskets but also in some very quirky containers such as old cars, bikes, cottages and various three dimensional shapes.We went in the morning and had the place almost to ourselves. That would imagine that was because of the heat. The evening is supposed to be the best time to visit but then the garden will be more crowded.Be aware that if you go through the day it will get very hot and there is very little shade. But don't let that put you off. Take a hat and enjoy the spectacle.

It's called Miracle for a reason. Breathtaking views, wonderful decorations, and an amazing smell of nature. You will be surprised by the beauty that this place holds, the numerous types of flowers and colors present all around you. It's definitely a place to visit and could be a wonderful experience for families and friends.

Awesome garden. Its very hard to express the beauty of miracle garden...flower and only flower everywhere..with an extraordinary design...what a beautiful thought behind each and every art ...simply superb..a very photogenic place..i visited there in the evening time so missed the real beauty view ...but then also i spend a wonderful time there..definitely a must visit place of dubai..ample car parking space..there are 2 types of parking ..one is valet parking and one is free...there is an entrance fee of 30 AED...closing time of garden is 9pm....truely miracle garden.
Beautiful. Beautiful place, you can see how much effort is put in it.In the middle of a desert, a extraordinary oasis.A must see for flowers fans.Best pictures with my wife.

Never visit on a Friday.. I went there with my family last February on a Friday. The weather was perfect for family time but the huge crowd definitely killed it. You can never even get a decent picture because of the photo bombers and the cafeteria area is unimaginable. We regret spending our afternoon at the garden. The garden was unarguably beautiful. I guess our timing was just wrong.My tips:1.) Visit during winter season. 2.) Never visit on weekends.3.) Never take limos that are waiting outside, it's expensive. You can take a bus from the garden to MOE or wait for Dubai taxi.4.) Bring your own food. They have limited food options at the Garden cafeteria.

Miracle indeed!. Such a beautiful garden in the middle of the desert. I cannot even maintain a dozen plants properly but these guys here are maintaining millions of flowers.This is a favorite for the wife and kids. Ideal for newly weds to take pretty pics and fill the honey moon album. The creativity is excellent, the colour range for the flowers is tasteful and there is an extra as well with tunnel type gardens and giant stadium type floral patterns. Tiring but worth every dirham and every minute of your time spent. There are better times to visit than summer, and some more water fountains would add value.Cafes are available, they even have Nachos, Noodles and a good range of soft drinks. You can bring water with you and save on the 5 Dirhams per bottle. One important point is that there is no Metro Connection. So the damage is more than 30 Dirhams per ticket, you may need an extra 100 dirhams for the taxi.

Fantastic place to visit.. Let me make it clear right at start that don't expect any exotic flowers here. But the way it has been made is simply beautiful. Its a welcome change from the endless malls in Dubai.

Shade and water features needed. Had read so much about this garden on the net but we were disappointed. Perhaps the hot weather is playing havoc with the flowers, as it would - and it looks a little unkempt. However it is amazing to see this this in the desert. Some water features and more shade would be great. Water features would help I am sure. Tidy up the seats and tables etc..(plastic wrapping torn and still on some chairs - uninviting) very few visitors when we were there but a hot day. Entrance and car park looks unloved and uninviting. 30dhs entrance per adult, worth the money?

Nice but could be managed better. It's a beautiful garden in the middle of the desert, so kudos for that. However, in May when I visited, the flowers were all a bit tired looking and a bit sparse in some areas. I'm not a horticulturalist but it seems it could be better maintained. Also, the website is rubbish. It doesn't even show the map of phase II and most pictures are rendered drawings. Signage from the road leading to it is also too late and you need to cut across 6 lanes of traffic to exit if you don't happen to be in the right lane.There are some food kiosks to buy snacks and lots of seating areas to sit and enjoy. Go later in the day when it's not so hot.It's not bad and nice for a walk and be around nature.

Not worth the detour. This recently added but very outdated attraction is definitely not worth the detour, nor the parking fee of AED 30, and even less the entrance fee of AED 30 per person. It is an old fashioned and not very well maintained gathering of flower pots which are supposed to give the impression of larger statues. Looks like a fifties entertainment park...

Not much, just flowers. Not much of a place. Yeah, it's a vast hectares of beautifully structured flowers. You can take pictures but that's it. There's really not much to do there. Be sure to come on the late afternoon, so it's not too hot.

So much to see and be wowed. Excellent gardens a must see if you are in Dubai, there was such an amazing display of flowers in all sorts of different themes. Make sure you take a good camera.Although this place is in a bit of an isolated area there are few shuttle buses running to emirates mall etc but i found there was a lack of Taxis in this area which could be looked at but nothing to put you off you may just have to wait a bit. Overall a fantastic floral garden and a credit to Dubai.

Innovative & colourful!. This is one of its kind and must say a wonder in desert. May tour agents don't guest but its really beautiful and one of its kind. We can see the different structuring covered with different color a of flowers.The public transport could be a slight hinderance for returning back as its a bit off city limits. One could take a metro till Emirates mall and then take a cab to the garden. The garden now has 2 phases and closes at 9pm.Its better to visit the place later part of the day.the vibrant colours of the flowers and the arrangement would have one lost in its beauty!

Magical but very hot. This place is so beautiful. There are many different flowers with different structure. I like the concept of flower house with sink cars. But it's very very hot in there.I suggest go in the evening like 5-6 pm instead of 1 pm like I did

Magical!. This place is magical! Great architectural structure, perfect for photography session as they are millions of different flowers in the area, you can never go wrong in any of it. I love it! it is in a far location but it is worth the visit especially if you are visiting Dubai.

Flowers above sand. Dubai, the desert kingdom can be so colorful and beautiful can be assessed only when you visit Miracle garden here. It is in rather secluded place and if opting for public transport, we need to avail taxi from Mall of Emirates on First Gulf Bank metro station. The journey might cost you around 30 Dirhams. Entry fee is 30 Dirham when phase II has started. Earlier it was only 20AED when only Phase I was open for public. You enter into a sea of flowers, taking all possible and renowned shapes. Try to be there in the latter half of the day, to avoid heat and also on weekdays, if you love to be clicked pretty often. You might not be tired of seeing flowers and shapes, again and again and you can easily spend around 1-2 hours. They have eating joints available, slightly heavy-priced but overall it can be a great day’s outing to be here.

Oasis in the Desert. With 45million flowers in 72,000sqm area and all are surrounded by a flower-decked wall, Dubai Miracle Garden is the most beautiful and largest garden in the World. Just cannot believe you are amidst the desert .... simply mind-blowing . Hats off to its makers N care takers. Given a chance would never ever want to get back home from here. Missing out on going to thz place would be the biggest loss from watching a true miracle happen .... !!!! Indeed the MOST MIRACULOUS GARDEN <3<3<3

Nice place. The garden are very nice, best place to make photos, litle far for us, i drive with no gps in my car so i got lost, not alot of people know about this place, i asked friends who are living in Dubai about it and the did not know it. I think they are building more, ther are some areas in the park not so nice. If you have time you must visit.

Miracle Garden. This is one of the prettiest garden i've been to. Though most of the travel agents don't suggest it, it's a place to visit. It's amazing how such pretty flowers grow in a desert. It's something you shouldn't miss.

FEELING BEAUTIFUL W/ FLOWERS...AMAZING!!!. Amazing! every ladies want to have a flowers around her, there we can call a "flower paradise." a beautiful place where we can relax along with our friends and families.Natural Flowers blooming in the desert..which we can see how they created it in very amazingly design and land scaping...

Flower Miracle. If you love nature its the place with lovely fresh flowers with different statue...don't miss the phase 2 also, you will get combined ticket .... on weekend you will get shuttle service from Mall of Emirates up & down... so plan it
Nice place to visit . A place to fresh up the mind. Lot of colors really pleasant for eyes and also nice place to take some photos in natural background.

Spectacular wonder in desert. An amazing place to visit with mind blowing high tech arrangements.Being nature ,gardens and flower lovers we had a great time among one of the most wonderful " man made "natural flowers miracle in desert . Dubai Miracle Garden ,contains up to millions of flowers ,as far as the eye can see, decked with various vibrant colors blooming on the ground or hanging from arches , passing under fairy tail ,heart-shaped archways groaning with flowers, you can’t help noticing the scent ,isn't as strong as you might expect.,.An other battle to enter in Guinness Record for the world’s biggest flower garden with longest flower wall , Flowers in the shape of hearts, stars, layers , igloos , prominent land mark ,animals,flower river ,Happy Birth Day zone ,gazebo zone and a car zone too ,........this isn't a park – it’s more a work of art and you’re expected to treat it as such a picture perfect place ,where you can find 100s of places to click but please avoid visiting this place on Friday . there'll be lots of people and you wouldn't be able to get good solo pictures. before visiting try to check the website for not missing any thing coz we still missed few of the zones .For the direction more sign board on the main roads should be added .Surely upcoming seasons would be bringing loads of more miracles there to attract us .
good experience. The garden had been made really really well..very colorfull and very good.You can have the best pictures here.Try going there in the evening as it is really hot in the day there

flowers like never seen before. If you like flowers, then you should not miss the Miracle Gardens in Dubai. For 2-3 hours the two Phases of the Gardens are a must in Dubai. There is also a terrace in Phase 2, from where the gardens are incredible.

Flower garden in the desert. Amazing to see lots of flowers and unique flower arrangements right in the middle of an arid desert. Fantastic colors and very good arrangements. If you want a break from the very urban feel of Dubai, visit this place. An hour or 2 is already enough for this place.

Worth a visit!. excellent array of colours. limited variety of flowers but their arrangements and combinations make them look spectacular. good outing with family. Phase 2 is also now open. Buggies also available for 30 Dhs - useful for senior citizens and children. we had gone in end March and the weather was quite pleasant. weather conditions should be considered before visiting these gardens esp in the months of summer. good photo opp.

30 dirham value. its a almost worthfullness, but location is far also going from bur dubai its 45 AED coming back evening time no taxi for around an hour but thanks to garden managementthey helps alot to go to next destination.Really flowers they decorated with wonderfull attempt Dont forget for PHAse 2 also vegetable section fee is 50 AED but they

Love or Hate. While I was not terribly excited about the Miracle Garden, if you love gardening and flowers you will have a great time. There are millions of flowers and hundreds of places to take pictures. The price is hard to beat for something in Dubai.While you may not care, she will love the place.

its a miracle indeed. its about 15mins drive by taxi from Mall of Emirates. cost less than AED30. entrance fee aed30 per adult. 1 hour was enough for phase 1. we didn't have time to go to phase 2 which was the sad part. But otherwise, it was amazing to see lots of flowers in a desert. just an advice, avoid going to this place on a Friday. there'll be lots of people and you wouldn't be able to get good solo pictures =)
Must see!!��. This place is worth visit.. it's a long driving to get there. Cost me around 60 dirham. Millions of flowers. So pretty and it's perfect for pics.
Nice place to see local flowers. The flower arrangements are nice, but people leave their decency to take photos. Kids enjoy this place. Worth visiting at least once this festival of flowers!

Lousy place. Buy a seasonal flower that you find everywhere on streets.. Mutilply it by millions.. Thats Miracle Garden for you.. Millions of flowers of same variety.. a variety which is very common, has no appeal, beauty or exclusivity.. The place is extremely far off and not worth the time and efforts.. I wish they had more variety of flowers, exotic flowers, rare flowers but no... same boring flower. Dont know why people go there..

A must visit. It is realy a miracle garden. Visited the Miracle Garden along with my wife and two kids. We enjoyed every minute. Cafterias offer good snacks for good price.Better to visit during day light.

Perfect destination. It was not surprising that anything could be found in Dubai - after all, there is the Ski Dubai :) but the formations and the vast area make is so pleasant to know that there is one more outdoor attraction to visit there - very organized and beautiful.

Worth the trip, if you can find it. Don't be duped by the parking.. Finding Miracle Garden can be a little tricky, as it is well off the beaten path for most visitors to Dubai. For those that have lived here a long time, it's where the failed project "DubaiLand" was supposed to go. For Visitors, it's on Umm Sequiem Road was behind the Mall of the Emirates. Once you pass Al Khail Road look for the signs. Now, once you get moving on the road towards the garden you will reach a gate, and there's a sign for Valet Parking for 50 AED, and a small parking with a sign for 30 AED. DO NOT BE FOOLED. These are not your only two options. Keep driving and you will come another big parking lot that is free, and a second entrance. Don't throw your money away on the first entrance. The gate fee is now 30 AED per person as Phase II is now open. We went in mid-March, so the weather was great. I'm not sure how pleasant it will be in the blistering summer temperatures Dubai is known for. There was plenty to see and tons of photo ops. Being a week-day it was not too crowded. Phase I is basically a large ring with tons of different arrangements, old cars, and various metal designs covered with flowers. The theme from Titanic played on repeat the whole time we were there. Strange music choice for a flower exhibit. The skeleton of the old entrance to DubaiLand still remains off in the distance. It's pretty dilapidated, but can be cropped out of most photos. The security guards were friendly and helpful and would take your photo if asked. Getting to Phase II is a bit of a walk, and across a small street. Phase II seems to be smaller for now and was basically 3 huge pits covered in flowers. There was a small walkway down to bottom of each pit with rails etc... It took us about two hours to g through it all. Make sure you have good walking shoes and are well hydrated. There are a few places that sell food and drink along the way.

It really is a miracle!. These newly-opened gardens are jaw-dropping! With 55 million blooms in flower right in the desert, your camera and eyes go into colour overdrive. Millions of flowers cover an array of objects and shapes including cars, houses and even shopping trolleys. It is all very impressive. The gardens are only about a 15-20 minute taxi ride from The Walk area of Jumeriah Beach and entry is very reasonable (only about $10 Aus per person). Allow at least two hours to see all the gardens, both Phase 1 and Phase 2. Bring hats, sunscreen, water and a camera with a lot of memory! This is a Dubai stunner and should not be missed.

Simply marvelous...!. Miracle garden is totally aligned with it's name. Man made miracle. It was really very pretty flower garden with millions of flowers planted and cared in number of shapes, ideas. Simply soothing for eyes in such a hot weather...:)

Calm place but boring. Nice colors, calm place, nice arranging ideas but nothing creative nor interesting. Flower pots have arranged in different ways. Most the flowers are of the same type Petunia flowers or similar. We went by taxi from Albarsha 20 to 25 mins and as it known, taxis in Dubai are very expensive. Once we arrived there, there is also ticket desk to enter the garden. Anyhow, the garden is not that much to waste your time or money.

Refreshing scenery. Must see world largest flower garden in the world... For relaxing place for sight at get away from busy city in dubai and to get out from the sandy desert... Cheap affordable price can bring ur food or snack inside the garden best place for lovers couple family with children and of course best place taking photos group family and the unlimited selfie.. But the only not good un that place was not accessible for commuters specially if u dont have own wheels u may end up not finding the place not easy to find the location and less to find taxi or public transport... But the garden is open till midnight that is great for those want to stay little bit late...

Miracle Garden .............. Beautiful Flower show ........... Near Dubai Motor city. Awesome ...........Awesome ........... Awesome............... Excellent Garden.It is rightly called as Miracle Garden.All the superlatives can be used for this beautiful show of flowers in Dubai Miracle Garden.I thoroughly enjoyed the Garden.Flowers are designed in the shape of Peacock,Heart,Clock and so ........... many.Superb Garden.
Oasis. A very refreshing escape from the city and within easy access. Very beautiful. Great for families and Photographers.

a flower garden amid desert!. Dubai Miracle Garden is a unique garden, where unique designs can be seen. All designs are made using flowers which can stand the weather of UAE. The flower has many unique designs and is a perfect place to spend your afternoon especially during the so called winter in the UAE. However, some may not find it very different, especially Europeans, because the flower is composed of only 2 to 3 types of flowers. Thus, the variety in flowers is missing and this is mainly because not many flowers can withstand the weather in the UAE. So I do consider it a miracle in the UAE. I think it is a must see if you are visiting Dubai between December and March. It is a nice escape from the indoor malls and skyscrapers of Dubai.

Garden with full miracles. Excellent place to visit little away from Dubai but its worth a visit. One can enjoy varieties of flowers and their colours with multiple combinations of their shapes and colour. Really an excellent and well thought of design concepts.
Very Pretty. Very beautiful garden, a must-see if you are not too rushed for time. The range of flowers isn't that big but the way they use them and the designs they create are quite amazing.

Most creative Flower Garden. Firstly, I had to grab a Taxi from what I believe was the closest Metro Station to the DMG (Dubai Miracle Garden) which is Mall of the Emirates station. The Cab ride was around 35 Dirham. Entrance to both Phase 1 and 2 is 30 Dirhams.The sheer amount of flowers and colours here is unbelievable. The Aroma in the DMG is amazing of course...stay away Hay fever sufferers LOL.Definitely worth a visit. Phase 2 is now also open which boasts even more creative Flower Gardens.Still lots of construction going on so there is more on the way!

Really miracle !!. This is the one must see attraction in dubai, if avoid it it may be a huge loss !!. Very nicely organised and there are only flowers and even we can't see the leaves, well maintained, make sure that you are selecting the right blossom season. Enjoy the real fower show in the dessert !!!. Dont Miss...

Dropped by, spent an enjoyable 2 hours. This is on Emirates road, so we just dropped by on our way to Global Village. It is delight to see so many colors at once. They have made peacocks, lanterns, buckets, hearts, cars and even Burj Khalifa out of flowers!It is not a very big area, but taking a lot of photos took almost 2 hours.Although, I would have liked it even more if there were different kinds of flowers. This is just 1 kind of flower in the entire garden.

Fabulous find. Beautiful flowers in all sorts of shapes and designs. Someone described this as a bit disneyesque which is probably true, but it's really lovely. Tranquil, colouful and creative and well worth a trip there. A very unsual Dubai attraction and away from the madding crowd. You need to drive or get a taxi but it's not expensive and entry cheap too. Do go and look, you will be surprised.

HEAVENLY FLOWER SHOWER. miracle - all is in name of this garden., a miracle of sort & eye catching beauty.drip irrigation engineering put to best for creating such a beauty in sun scorching as high as 50 degree + in summers.20 dhs is ticket cost reasonably priced.variety of restaurants and juice bars to keep you refreshing.50 dhs is taxi one way fare for reaching from burjuman area.one should visit this for best of photography results.dont forget to autodrome kart racing next to this venue :)

Fantastic display!. Absolutely loved my visit here...wow wow and wow!Beautiful garden displays out in the desert!! It's not the Chelsea flower show but it is gorgeous with bright colourful displays of all sorts of things in flowers. I really enjoyed it...go early as it gets really crowded.
Very Nice. Very Nice Garden with well-decorated shapes. I like the design of each shape there, such as Burj Khalifa, Houses, Cars, Peacocks etc. Worth To Visit

Nice. It is very nice attractive, yet a bit far! It was too crowded due to weekend I guess full with families! Yet the roses are amazing! Design and decoration,,helps to pass up to 2 hours... Make sure you are not allergic to pollen or you will keep sneezing. Don't forget to go to gate 2 as an extension.

Paradise on Earth!. On my recent visit to Dubai I visited Miracle Garden just after Valentine's day and was awe-struck at the imaginative way in which the colourful flowers were displayed through out. The garden is divided into 2 areas and though Phase 1 is better established, Phase 2 is expected to be a spectacular display as well when fully opened. Phase 1 mainly includes flower huts, flower falls, flower archways, flower hearts pathway, umbrella pathway, flower lamps and flower boats. Some of the more remarkable structures are the three peacocks at the entrance, two of which have opened tails and one has a closed tail. The Burj Khalifa replica in the middle of the garden made with colourful flowers is stunning. The Cars zone and the Animals zone is also very interesting and a great place to pose for photos. The seven flower pyramids add to the beauty of the garden. The Falcon is a very imposing structure at the back.Phase 2 is a 3 minute walk from the Phase 1 and includes the brilliant round shaped butterfly garden in 3D and decorated with flowers. The aromatic plants garden and edible plants garden are still being established in Phase 2.The entrance fees to the Phase 1 is 20 dirhams and to Phase 2 is 10 dirhams. Opening times are from 9 am to 9pm on weekdays are I believe longer on weekends. Parking is not a problem as there are both paid and free car parks. Lots of cafes and ice cream shops inside the gardens and plenty of shade to sit and enjoy the riot of colours! The mid day sun can get unbearable and the park provides a buggy for elderly visitors or families with young children(which can cost 10 dirhams for 3-4 passengers) and takes one around the park with two stops to jump off and take quick photos. This service can be requested when purchasing tickets at the gate. All in all a great day out and highly recommended for parties or weddings!

Lovely displays. This was a fairly long taxi ride,but did enjoy it.So much work must go into the displays.Did not actually take long to look around.Lots of flowers but mostly the same variety in different colours.Having been once i would not return.

Secret Garden as its just opened. We went in the evening because we did not know until our taxi driver told us about it and its only been open for about 30 days. Great flower show and what an imagination, it great for the whole family.
Treat for the eyes. Miracle Garden is a great collection of flowers from all over the world. The arrangement of flowers is quite creative. We visited it after sun down and didn't feel like leaving.

Flower Power…a place to take guests and kids. Lovely to see and walk around. Little ones and senior citizens get in for free but the entrance fee is not expensive ( 15dhs). One insightful thing my dad pointed out' no birds or bees or any insects roaming around'…after which i got an eerie vibe. The only pests there were the loud ppl who think their culture allows them to sPeak obnoxiously loud.I would recommend it to all guests (easy to find), can take you max 45 minutes (walking, pics, talking). Things missing: flower variety, proper staff without annoying whistles, litter cans, water fountains, signs (with instructions "stay off grass" or "type of flower") - could be closed in the "summer", look out for that. Go get some flower power…!

Don't go in the morning. My kids enjoyed the place although we were alone there. There was hardly 2 staff looking after us. Probably evening could have been better to visit it. we spent 15 minutes to finish the trip!!
A muat see place & wonderful attempt by its owners. Its wonderful to see how the owners have designed this place. I liked their attempt in growing these.little plants using old cars and boats.

Very nice. Garden is nice and great, amount of flowers is really huge.For better improvement, more kinds and colours of flowers have to be considered and few more arrows from the main road till the Garden are needed.
Miracle Gardens in Dubai. Beautifully laid out gardens. Very colourful and interesting. As you walk into the gardens, you get a strong scent of the flowers.
just a miracle. must visit place ..as its only opens in winter..awesome gardening..wonderful colors..all the age group will enjoy ..
Its a miracle.... Our eyes got wide seeing this...such a beauty...in a desert.....you feel one is in Europe....it's so colourful and well maintained..if you going dubai...this is one not to be missed

even with the annoying whistles this is excellent. We were promised that the Miracle Gardens would be reopened during our October visit to Dubai but they remained firmly closed so day 3 of this Spring trip we made for it. It is extraordinary. We love Botanical Gardens world wide. This is not what Miracle Gardens offers. It offers colours, fragrance, shapes, water, and creativity. Peacock birds in many colours, cars, boats, animals, buildings, all in various different flowers, and colours. Yes the "security" guards blowing their whistles mindlessly whenever a child go near the UAE flag exhibition (just put some signs saying keep off) should be returned to the unemployment pool in Dubai; but the cafes and children's play areas are pleasantly staffed. What a place for a wedding!

Breathtaking. Relaxing to the eye and delightful to the nose and mind,this flower garden is perfectly designed with new ideas as the different brands of cars with flowers.a lot of photo opportunities. It is a must see

Excellent flower show. This place is great. They have decorated these flowers in a beautiful way. My wife just loved it and I could see many more visitors going mad to see their amazing work. There are few cafes inside also. Spent around 2 hours there in which we could cover most of it (with pics). The flower house, Flower clock, Ferrari, Burj Khalifa, and other shapes like heart and flowing water were too good.A must visit for anyone coming to Dubai. Fee AED 20 only and opens on Friday also when most of the other things are closed in Dubai. No Metro nearby; hire a cab. Kids will love it.

how can they grow flowers in the middle of a desert ?. astonished and amazed by the flowers in miracle garden.variety of flowers along with some good flower arrangementcan blow your mind off.best time to visit is November to February

A Must for Flower Lovers. Worth a visit ,gr8 place to take picture. The place is quite far out of town though u can club it with a visit to the Dubai outlet mall the Miracle garden if on the way .A good change from the city crowded with malls.
another must see. Another must see that you shouldnt miss. Imagine the beatifl flowers landscaped in the middle of the dessert. Very nice. Highly recommended place to visit.

Beautiful Gardens.. The gardens were absolutely beautiful,the array of colours,the smell,the way it was laid was wonderful.Although it was four or five different plants,the way they planted them was amazing,in metal structures,plastic pots,cars and shopping trolleys etc.Definitely worth 20 dhs,and definitely worth a visit especially if you love gardening and come from rainy uk in February .

Good for a stroll.. Very colorful, huge, pleasant. But there are just three or four varieties of flowers. Good place if you have nothing else to do. Looks very exciting when you enter. But once you have seen less than a quarter of it, it starts to get a bit too monotonous.This could have been better.

a good initiative!. a good initiative taken by the government....there are always trying new things in Dubai...however if you come from europe this attraction wont impress you too much as you have flower growing all over the place. the entrance to this place costs 20dhs per person children below 3 go free. once inside you can take your time and walk around or take a caddy car ride for 20dhs that pics you anywhere inside the garden and drops you exactly at he same place. (you can just ask the security guard to get you one or...pull one over on the as they ride along) you also have some cafeterias but its quite overly priced. conclusion...if you live in Dubai you must make one visit.

Lovely but not a miracle.. Miracle Garden though not exactly a miracle is still a worthwhile place to spend some time. Though we came by car, believe there is bus service from mall of emirates. Its a bit far from the city center. Entry fee is 20 dhs per person.The garden is arranged beautifully and flowers are cleverly adorned in item as varied as a car, jeep, cottage, peacock, trolley, etc. My visit was spoiled mainly on account of two things...1) Hype...it has very few variety of flowers. More of a clever floral arrangement. So there definitely was a gap between expectation and reality.But still thanks to the bright colors makes for a pleasing sight and 2) Visiting the garden on a Friday!! Rarely could i get a single snap without a stranger in the background! So do plan your visit on a non weekend day..

wonderful experience. These gardens are amazing. A riot of colour and design. An oasis of calm and beauty. A testament to creativity. A lovely afternoon out. If you like flowers, colour and beauty, do not miss, and don't forget your camera.I particularly liked the 'umbrella pergola.Top class!
Excellent flower show. Amazingly designed and maintained flower park. Visitors cant stop them from photography. Very nice combination of plants selection and colorful flowers.
Something Different. It is a very interesting place to visit. I was so surprised of the how they arranged and made it so beautiful. It's a nice place to relax and enjoy.

Go and see it. Never mind comments about time it takes Being artificial No insectsExpensive car park You will need couple if hoursLots of camera lifeOf course it's setting is artificial but beautiful Been to Dubai lots and yet to see lots of butterflies and bees anywhereCar park right at entrance and 30 AED not bad value Can't wait to see what they do next well done miracle garden Dubai

Stunning gardens. Who could ever believe that they are in the desert when they visit these amazing gardens, an absolute must for your trip to Dubai. Definitely need your camera on hand for this tour around gardens of many descriptions, decorated cars, houses made of flowers and the most beautiful hanging baskets I have ever seen.

Beautiful, but artificial. Someone has clearly done a lot of work here. There are some really stunning displays of very colourful flowers. It's quite unlike anything I've ever seen before.There is, however, a nagging feeling that it's all completely artificial (which of course, apart from the fact that it is made with real living plants, it is). Somehow I think plants lose something when they're displayed in such an unnatural setting.What I found really strange, and was a testament to the artificiality of it all, was the almost complete lack of insect life. If you had that many flowers in Europe, it would be alive with bees and butterflies. But not here. I saw just a couple of insects (something a bit like a hoverfly, but I'm not sure exactly what it was) on one of the beds, and a lone ant on one of the paths, but that was it for insect life. Not a single bee or butterfly anywhere to be seen.Very strange.

Paradise. Wooow. It is the most elegant attraction in Dubai. We liked it very much. if you like flowers and nature do not miss visiting this true Miracle. We enjoyed a very long visit there. Don't forget your camera and there is too many shots to take. You can not stop roaming around this amazing place. It is equally beatiful noon and night because of good lightening there. Do not miss this Paradise.
Amazing!. Hard to believe you are in a desert. Flowers are breath taking and beautiful. I love the area with umbrellas, very colourful. My kid sisters loved the place. Had so much fun.

Awesome garden in desert,everything is possible in dubai. Wonderfull place, i really love it, but pls go during sunlight, u wl really get nice pic.awesome place, i leave in dubai since 12yrs,n believe me this is the one of the best place, specially for the people who love flowers n colors.
Incredible. You are guaranteed to forget that you are in the middle of a desert when you visit here. A riot of colour and ingenious designs. Definitely worth visiting.

A must visit place in Dubai !. After checking out this place online, I was not expecting much but I was wrong. A great place to visit , place full of different flowers arranged in different shapes, styles ,colors . You will be able to cover entire park in 2 hours . The only suggestion would be.. recharge your camera battery completely and come here .. :)

Truly miraculous.. The Dubai Miracle garden is another impressive feather in Dubai's cap.The DMG is an absolutely lovely park to spend a few hours when in Dubai. The miracle garden is just that - a garden with absolutely stunning flowers in various shapes. The Burj Khalifa, Cottages and Peacocks all make for amazing photo opportunities.The down side is that there is nothing else left to do when you have walked around the park and taken your fill of pictures.The park is open from 9 am to 9 pm. Late afternoons are the best time to visit. On weekdays its relatively quiet and there won't be crowds spoiling your photo's at the attractions.There is an Aed 20/- entrance fee. Children below 3 are free,The park has golf carts that do a round of the park; and the drivers will tell you it is Aed 20 Per Person. It is actually Aed 20 Per round trip and not Per person, so be aware.Right across the Miracle Garden is a Butterfly garden under construction. Coming soon to the city that has it all.

5 types of flowers with nice decorations. The visit, together with taking pictures, took us no more than 30 minutes.There are some people who will guide you, on the way, to the paid parking - avoid them. The paid parking is 30 dhs while 50 meters further you have another parking, plenty of slots, completely free of charge. You just need to follow the Miracle garden signs from the main street.The entrance fee - 20 dhs - quite pricey for what they show you inside.Do not think this is anywhere close to any botanical garden from Europe. There are only around 5-6 different types of flowers.  The charm comes from the way they used the flowers to do some decorations - check the pictures.Overall, nice to pay a visit but do not expect to be taken aback by it. It is

Best Garden. This is the beat flower garden I have ever seen.It's a place we must visit if we go to dubai...There is a variety of flowers-some are colorful, different shapes.And the best thing I liked about that place is the "Happy Birthday" written with flowers

Flowers. It is not easy saying something negative about something so pretty, but ultimately, it's just flowers - there's nothing more to it. No fun facts, nothing interactive, nothing to get excited about. Also, don't go on race day. The noise from the Autodrome next door is very distracting when one tries to get in touch with nature.

Garden in Desert. This place is such that you can not expect what is inside garden.But once you enter the garden you do not feel you are some where in desert.The place is little difficult to find as it does not have a proper road sign to it,s approach.The place is flowing with flowers but flowers are in pots by way of flowing streams,animal shapes,car beds.Though you can not compare this with Dutch garden of Kukenhauf or Butchart Garden in Victoria Canada as those gardens are based on flower beds in ground but for desert this place and efforts are are worth one watch.The entry ticket is AED 20 per person.

Indeed a miracle of human ingenuity. This is unbelievable: 45 million fresh flowers growing right in the desert. The flowers are in pots by way of flowing streams, animal shapes, car beds, flowering walls of a house. How all these are maintained beats meas you do not see any one tending to these during the visitor time the whole day.

suprise in a desert. its a very nice colourful garden, great collection and well maintained, perfect for families and ladies, obviuously not a guy's thing. but worth vising once. they ha ve introduced shuttle service from and to mall of Emirates metro station for AED 5/- per way which is very good as its very far from station and will cost around AED 40 otherwise.

8/10. Dubai Miracle Garden reminded me of Keukenhof in the Netherlands. It's the best place for nature lovers and photo bugs. Every spot is Instagramable! Food and drinks are pricier. We took a cab to get there and out. But there's also a bus service from Mall of Emirates.

A must in Dubai but a little far. My wife love the flowers so it was one of our stops in our trip to Dubai. We had to take taxi to go there from Mall of Emirates. The quality of the gardens is stunning and the decoration is too marvellous. It really surprise both the quantity of forms and decorations that they use to show the flowers. You can feel really well in that place, it's very calm. We had the opportunity to take plenty of pictures.

Garden. We went to this place on a Friday and it was extremely crowded. Considering the hype surrounding this garden we found this to be an average garden. With no play area around kids do get a bit cranky. The flowers are all beautifully arranged in the form of cars, houses etc but compared to any other flower garden one would rate this less than average. The flowers are not the exotic types but the normal ones that a Dubai resident would find across the street. All said it is still worth a visit for a tourist in Dubai though i would rate the entrance fee slightly on the higher side.

Nice theme of collecting around 45-50 species of flowers in different forms and shapes of artificial images.. Nice theme of collecting around 45-50 species of flowers in different forms and shapes of artificial images. House, Car, animals, built of flowers. Nice theme and creativity. A hard and well managed concept in desert.A good visit with children.

A must visit place in Dubai. We didn't have Miracle garden visit in our planned itinerary but were told by our friend that is a must visit. Hence we visited there. entry fee is 20dhs per person including kids above 3 yrs age. But its fantabulous. The floral arrangement is so beautiful. you just want to get lost in variety of arrangements done. All flowers colors are so vibrant. They have made peacock, complete houses, heart shapes, various cars.. and many more.. Its far away from city but can be clubbed with your global village visit. Be sure to visit 2-3 hrs before sunset so you can capture good, memorable pictures. No public transport facility available so you need to be on your own..Njoy

A place to relax. When we visited Miracle Garden there were not many people there, but we were quite early I think. The flowers were beautifully arranged into houses, cars and other shapes. The area was huge so we had a lot of space to ourselves where we could enjoy the fresh air and the quietness. There were a few cafes on one side of the garden where they sold drinks and something to eat. We experienced it as a quiet, good-smelling, and nice place to walk around and relax. At some places there were benches, but very few ones in the shade, so we would suggest to bring a hat or something to protect you from sunburn. If you did not want to walk so far it was possible to just sit by a table and enjoy the view. A very pleasant place to visit.

Nice way to spend an afternoon. When we went there, there was barely any crowd. It was nice because you don't get people into the picture with you, just flowers, simply flowers. If was fun looking around the different structures made up of flowers. Cars made into giant flower pots, flower peacock, flower houses and many others. I think this was rather a quite romantic place especially with the heart shaped tunnel, of course, made with flowers! Better think well of the weather before going there. There were not much shades if you think you can't bear with the sun. We went there at around 4 pm in the afternoon, it was not that hot and the wind was cool.

Good place but very crowded. The flowers were arranged beautifully, cars and house decorated with colorful flowers and stuff like that but that's about it. If you have visited Europe then you will find this place to be just average. It was extremely crowded the day i went and there was a huge traffic to enter this place. It will take one less than 2 hours to look around this place.

Miracle garden January 2014. My wife read some reviews prior to visiting the garden and some appeared rather negative. I was worried that when the wife and my 2 boys went they would be disappointed. This was so far from the truth. They adored it. Firstly you have to go with an open mind by remembering just where in the world you are. Its a deserts. What's been achieved is indeed amazing all things considered. And the vision to do it is typical of Dubai and the approach to everything where nothing is impossible. The only thing she wanted was for it to be bigger. I believe there are plans as we speak to do just that. The photos we have are fantastic. Shame you cant smell them. If you love gardens and flowers and understand the work and care required to achieve it you will adore this place. If your a person who dwells in the city and have never done any gardening you will still enjoy it. Lovely place to sit and read a book. I only ask, as I do of many public arenas, that more areas were set aside to sit and have a picnic amongst it and just savour the day. But I am bias as i do love a family picnic :-)

Creativity. Very beautifully organized garden, many different types of shapes will be found like cars,house,burj,pots,peacock and hearts. Parking is available. Cafes are also available but not many choices . Entry fee ios 20 for adult , recommended to visit once :)
Wonderful. Beautiful place, full of life and so unexpected for a desert place like Dubai. I would certainly come back.

Pretty Gardens. The flowers are not unusual, but they are arranged beautifully. Some are arranged to look like peacocks, hearts, flowers, etc. There are partially buried cars and boats that are decorated with paint as well as by flowers.

Not Such A Miracle. After hearing all the hype about this flower garden our family decided to visit. Entry was a very reasonable 20AED. But the flowers only consisted of different coloured Petunias and Marigolds. Very crowded and the constant sound of the security guards blowing their whistles at the visitors who got to close to the display, made it a less than calming experience. You need a car. If like us, who caught a taxi. Trying to catch a taxi back was chaos. There was no taxi rank, so it was a crazy scramble to get the few taxis available back. After waiting 2 hours, with no success we headed back to the motorway and after a15 minute wait managed to flag a taxi down. I think some of the flowers on roundabout in Europe are just as impressive, and free.

Worst place in Dubai. This is really the worst place in Dubai. It has nothing other than flower pots organised in a terrible way. The ticket is high for such a lousy place. Even the parking is not free. Definitely not recommended by any means.

Think its a dubai thing....ie its a miracle to see flowers in Dubai. Was rammed the day we went (1st Jan). Good value but maybe go earlier in day so you can take a pic or 2 with no people. Food reasonably priced. Be warned there is no taxi rank so choice is a log walk to the made road or a scrum to get one.

Pretty colors, but a far cry from miracle garden. The garden is away from metro and other touristy areas. Therefore, you should either have a car or rely on taxi to get there. But having seen the flower festivals and gardens in other countries, I was disappointed. The garden is a miracle because it exists in the middle of desert, agree. For someone, who is less traveled, or always lived in an economically depressed or hot desert region, the colors and the sheer number of blooming flowers is probably overwhelming. But flower arrangements are made out of simplest petunias in different color arrangements, and the entire garden can be covered in 20 minutes (or 30 if you pause at a cafe and eat ice cream). The entrance fee of 20 AED is a very much reasonable (about 6 USD), but the entire experience was a letdown. Honestly, you get more flower choices and color variety at Schiphol Duty Free stores.

need different types of flowers. The miracle garden is good effort to have a colorful garden in the midst of desert,but sad part is that it can be covered within 15 minutes,and one must go there if u have your own transport,or else be prepared to wait till a taxi comes in with some tourists.the entrance fee is reasonable,20 dirhams,but it would be better if there were variety of flowers .

Beware of the Parking Con!. After much hype by the media, today I visited the Miracle Garden with my wife.Having seen the Keukenhof Garden at Lisse in Holland, we were expecting something extraordinary. It was a letdown. 80% of the flowers are just Petunias in different colors/arrangements. We were out in 15 minutes flat.When we drove in, the cars were stopped by a valet in a vest. He asked me to lower my car window and informed me 'Dh.50 parking to the left and Dh.30 parking to the right'. Not seeing ,much difference between them, i opted for the Dh.30 parking. Once inside, I noticed people entering from another gate and upon enquiry found out that there was a free parking.When I was returning to my car, I stopped the valet who had guided me and asked him why he spoke the incomplete truth, that there was a free parking ahead. He had the gall to tell me 'because you did not ask for the free parking'. This in my dictionary is a classic CON!

A colorful option for short time visit.. It is a world of flowers, nicely maintained. Amke sure you have a good camera with enough memory and battery charge. The entrance fee of AED20 is very much reasonable. The flip side is the poor food court. It is better to make it a pre luch visit or an evening visit.

Miracle garden..good effort...but need more flower types. The garden is colourful, but filled almost same flowers only. The food and beverage facility is poor and over priced. But entrance fee is reasonable with AED 20.

Miracle Garden - Beautiful Colours. Dubai Miracle Garden is about 25 minutes drive from Deira. The entrance was reasonable at AED20 per person. Opening hours are 9am to 11pm but best to check their website before you visit as it may change and is also not open in Summer. Loads of colourful flowers which is a really welcomed sight when compared to the daily desert grey. Had a really nice time here just enjoying the beauty of the flowers. Not to be missed for any tourist. Phase 2 will include domes with butterflies, I hope it opens soon.

Nice location - with millions of flowers in sandy desert. beautiful garden with millions of flowers and arranged nicely in the circular garden in the middle of desert. we had been there with family - nice place to visit

"Beautiful garden in the Desert". I visited in early December the week after it had re-opened and in my opinion it is definitely worth a visit. The entrance fee is reasonable and it is another lovely surprise in such a diverse city. One cannot fail to admire the creativity that has gone into its design and some of the wonderful creations. I particularly loved the houses made of flowers. It is easy to walk around - allow approx. 2 hours for the visit to see it at your leisure and perhaps a short break for a drink. If you can it is probably better to visit either early or later in the day as there is very little shade from the sun apart from the small café where you can get a drink or light refreshments. Don't forget your camera - lots of unusual photo opportunities. They are working on Phase 2, so it will be interesting to see it when it is finished.

Colour ful. Although this is a fairly new attraction in Dubai they are working hard at it. We enjoyed the hour we had walking around the colourful displays. There was no problems getting there, we took the metro to The Mall of the Emirates and then a taxi.
Visit with Family. Really amazing..worth going there and even entrance fee is very minimal. We had short time but still we enjoy a lot and surely want to go next time taking long time.

A unique & beautiful experience in the midst of desert. While in Dubai, a unique experience to see flowers spread across the huge garden. All flowers setup well in different formations like heart shaped, UAE Flag, overhead, etc...Also some creativity used with cars, animal shapes, peacock formation. Quite an experience and worth Dhs 20 per head. Amazing place for photography with family & loved ones.With rarely many tourist destinations with natural scenic attractions, this one stands out within a desert country. A one time must visit place.Food is expensive so feed yourself well before entering the park & the possible 2 hour trip. Make sure you go early evening to catch it during daylight as well as avoiding the afternoon sun.

Amazing things we can do with flowers.. It's a great place to visit and get your postcard photos clicked for your life time memory. It's advisable to be there at a time so that you can have atleast 2 hours of daylight as your visual pleasure vanishes with the sun. Eatables are available but, quite expensive so better to be equipped with few brought from home. If you are a visitor to Dubai don't miss this attraction.

Flower Garden on a Desert. We had a wonderful visit in this place. It is located somewhere in Dubai Land near Global Village. The place was so beautiful displaying thousands of potted colourful/beautiful fresh flowers! The best time to visit this place is between Feb-March as the weather is still nice during this months and the flowers are all still on their full beauty. On April some flowers will be withered or start to wither already as summer season will be starting by then. This one of the must visit place during winter here in Dubai, UAE. They opened this place to the public between Feb to May 2013 I think. So I'm now excited to see it again by next year of which month I don't know yet.

Wonder in Desert!. It has been my passion enjoying the beauty and ambiance of renowned garden around the world whenever I visit a country. Miracle Garden of Dubai is one of its kind that influenced me after visiting Nishat, Shalimar and Mughal Gadens in India and Pakistan. It houses more than a millions blooming flowers of great shape and structure.Miracle Garden of Dubai has a world record in Guinness Book of Records for its longest wall of flowers which further add to its beauty and excellence. Miracle Garden is well equipped with all modern facilities one may need, therefore a must to visit.
Be in the middle of a Million flowers!. Just like a fairy tale. it is worth visiting with Family and friends. it is like an Oasis in the middle of the desert!

"Amazing garden". when i visited this place i believed that everything is possible in Dubai! This is a desert city with the most beautiful flower garden in the world.
The art and designs of the flowers is so amazing and fascinating. To anyone visiting Dubai don't miss out this place.

Great garden of its type. We visited the Miracle Gardens whilst having a few days holiday in Dubai at the end of March. They are situated at Al Barsha South so a quite a lengthy taxi ride from the centre of Dubai. There is also a bus (no 30) which runs from the Emirates Mall on Saturday and Sunday afternoons. We took a taxi with a very helpful and friendly driver who agreed to come and pick us up at a specified time. As taxi prices are reasonably cheap in Dubai this was our preferred method (about £10 each way).These gardens are definitely worth a visit and are only open during the winter and spring months - not sure when it finally becomes too hot for them. and this was their first year of opening. They consist of huge areas of bedding plants in bright colours – mainly petunias and pelargoniums but not just in flat beds – they cover pyramids, archways and even cars. We wandered around happily for over 2 hours, just glad we had put sunscreen on. There are a few shady places to sit and enjoy an icecream or a cold drink but most of the gardens are in full sun.We thoroughly enjoyed our visit though if you prefer quiet eco-friendly natural gardens they are probably not for you as they definitely come into the bold and bright category.

really a miracle. its a miracle, created in desert. full of flowers and great designs. i have never seen such even in a tropical places but they could create same in a dessert. great place and worth visiting.

Manna in the desert. If you are in Dubai and in the season and do not have any particular disliking for petunias, then you should not miss the Miracle Garden. There is nothing but petunias of all hues and arrangements ( the few geranium and coleus plants are hardly discernible in the riot of colours). Enough to keep you clicking away in all directions for hours. This right in the middle of the hot desert and nothing for miles around by way of trees . I wish they had a way of keeping this park open through out the year even if it meant a few million flowers or a few dozen colours less. I liked the way the plants were watered. Recycled sewage water, it appeared , from the smell that wafted across occasionally but the drip lines were cleverly hidden in the scaffolding and potting mix. And speaking of pots (melting pots that is) , the diversity of the visitors themselves lend a colour to the Garden- Arabs, Indians, Philipinos, Europeans, Chinese….

Decoration is Nice..... Was there with my wife, the entrance fees i found alittle too expensive. Well in term of decoration they done a great job with differrent color of flower and creativity, but in term type of flower, not that much, as I can see most of the decoration having similar flower just different color only

Best Visited at Sunset. Best appreciated at night time. Flowers are the same. It's the concept of having these flowers grown in the desert that you may say a good start, eventually this will improve. Bring kids and don't forget the camera.

Best place. I believe Miracle garden is one of the best places for a natural flowers lover. i was there with my friends we really enjoy the place. It was amazing,,,,! i recommended to go evening time, there is more people.

Miracle Garden -It warms your heart!. You don t have to love flowers to enjoy the place, it feels your heart when you see it.I ve read that some people didn t find it easy to come..so I did my research home from..and I when I was there.,..not only that everybody knew where it was precisely, but there are signs every 500 m!!!so it impossible to miss it!We took the metro to the Mall of Emirates and then a taxi to the Garden, not more than 30 ÆD, and ou don t have to worry for a getting a taxi back, because there are coming one after one..! we waited 4-5 min, and there are toilets and telts ..I was told that theres no shadow..yes it is..you can also sit and enjoy a cold juice..don cary watter like me!entrance is only 20 ÆD. I hope you ll enjoy it as much as I did!

Magical. The prettiest part of the Garden is the use of colors and shapes. The flowers are only of one kind however i like and appreciate the experimentation of colors. Its recommended to go before sunset. Kids and Young Girls would love it. Guys of love taking pictures of the former !!!

Not so good experience!!. Apart from the colorful flowers there is nothing at this place. Need alot of maintenance as the plants were dying because of crazy Dubai weather. At one area they made a corridor like place with a lot of umbrella shades, but its painful to see all the price tags hanging from it.Clearly you can see that the garden is made only to make money and not for the love of nature!

worth the excursion. recently been to dubai and literally had to search for miracle garden. not many people from dubai knew about it and this was not included in our group tour itinery. so a few of us broke away found a taxiwala who knew about it and went. This place is way out of the city almost in the midst of the dessert but once you are the flowers are enchanting. not many variety of flowers i do agree but incredible colours. and the way they have cultivated them using very less soil and water. overall worth a visit once.the taxi with waiting charges cost us a lot but as i said it was worth it indeed a miracle in the midst of a dessert.

Worth a visit...just. The Thai wife and I took a taxi from Deira to the garden early one Friday. Entrance fee of 20 dirhams each is a reasonable fee.
