The garden doesn't have a huge variety of flowers but what they do have is colourful. And colour is the reason to go, not varieties, not smell and certainly not shade trees. We enjoyed a stroll around in an unusually pleasant temperature of around 25 degrees. There was even a sprinkle of rain. There were a couple of very basic kiosks and the coffee was drinkable.A bit of a surprise were the taxis waiting outside when we were ready to leave. It is a bit out of the way and I was half expecting a bit of a wait. We decided we will take some of our house guests out there from time to time.The restroom facilities were clean.

So far the worst garden in Dubai. I have been to almost all parks and gardens in Dubai. This has to be the worst park in Dubai. They have lesser variety of flowers than any average nursery would have. It is usually the same flower, different color all across the garden. Many of the plants had withered and were dying. Enough care is not being taken. Places for children to play are very limited. All you have to do is walk through the small park and back. In fact, many people were showing the dummy elephants and giraffes at the dubai properties group office to their children rather than the boring fare here. And 20AED for entrance to this park is a rip off.

Worth visiting the miracle garden. A Garden with so many blooming flowers in the middle of a dessert was indeed a miracle. A must visit in the months between October and March . April before the end is also a good month. Also check for the dubai cricket stadium located close to the miracle garden.An amusement park would be opened quite shortly next to the miracle garden

Spring splendour in the middle of desert!. We got to visit this colorful offering of Dubai, just before it was closing for the season (April end)...Entrance fee of AED 20 per person, looked a bit on higher side, but at end of our trip, we felt it was worth it!A mosaic of flowers in innovative patterns and bright colors awaited us. A camera is a must, for it is criminal not to take photos in such a picture-perfect location...Food stalls are there, so that the tourists can re-energise themselves as they complete their round of the garden. The vertical garden is worth a special mention, as it is officially recognized by Guinness Book of Records as the World's longest vertical garden.In all, in the few months that it is open (Around January to April), it is worth a visit for Dubai-bound tourists.

Ok but..!. I liked it in general but i guess you need to pick the right time of the year. We went in april and it was somewhat withered away. And it needed some more activites. In addition, the road to get there is a bit confusing so you need to be carefull.In addition, at sunset mosquito were out so watch out for that.I guess when the whole area "Dubai lands" (I belive it will house Disney lands + Universal Studios) is developed this will be on of the nice attractions.

Must-see...if you like flowers. This place is almost IMPOSSIBLE to find. We drove around for 40 extra minutes looking for it. There is only one sign for it on the main road (D63) so be sure to budget time for getting lost. Hint: it's located behind the big display of the motorcycle guy riding a roller coaster.Anyway, once you get there (20 dhs entry fee for adults and kids 3+), this place is really beautiful. The flowers are gorgeous and are arranged in lots of interesting ways. There are WCs available but not much shade and no drinking fountains. Make sure to bring water if you visit during daylight hours.Also, it's best if you treat this as an attraction to be viewed, rather than a place to kick back and sit and enjoy. Basically, you are not allowed on the grass and the gardeners will blow their whistles at you if you get too near the flowers.If you like flowers, you will like Dubai Miracle Garden. If not, meh, it's probably not worth it.

Heaven on earth. I visited Miracle Garden Dubai this year for the first time I felt I was missing the miracle on earth for all these days. I have not seen such wonderful and miraculous collection of flowers in my life why I can say in anybody's life. I was just spell bound to see so many varieties of flowers I ever seen in my life.The visitors cant believe their own eyes and went near and touch them to see whether they real that type unimaginable collection never seen before of flower collections were there for view.Elders and children alike enjoy the rare collection and took photographs as memorable event.Available and suitable at winter seasonsI must visit olace for any vistor and residents of Bubai and UAE.

A little oasis in the desert. A lovely place to visit. Nice floral display.very hard to get to amd out of!! Great spot for a relax and drink in a little oasis. Well worth a visit, but not to stay all day.

Dubai Miracle Garden. The flowers are beautiful and there are many displays to view and photograph. I visited on a Friday afternoon, which was quite busy. There is not much shade, although there are tents provided with seats and refreshments are sold. The website has posted the following notice, AnnouncementDubai Miracle Garden will be closed on Wednesday (May 01, 2013) in preparation for the next season. A big surprise awaits you in the next season..... Please follow our page on facebook and visit DMG website for the updates and opening date. The entrance fee is 20 AED for adults. I took a metro to Mall of Emirates, then took bus #F30 from bus station outside MOE, direct to Miracle Garden, which is beside Dubailand. The bus runs every 25 minutes from 2pm to 10pm on Fridays and Saturdays only. The bus journey back to MOE was long though as it went to Arabian Ranches. As other people have mentioned there was a lot of whistle blowing due to people getting too close to the flowers. Over all I had a good experience and enjoyed my relaxing trip to Dubai Miracle Garden.

Amazing. I am not that much into garden exhibits but this place is stunning. Impressed what they have done with the flowers and it is a fantastic spot for photos. Due to close soon as apparently they will be putting on a roof according to the taxi driver, so def include it on your list if you are visiting Dubai soon.

Visual treat :-). A big colourful garden in the middle of a desert is a treat to the eyes....this place is literally in the middle of desert with no metro or bus access...you have to either take a taxi or drive a car to reach here.There are flower pyramids, flower dome, flowers on cars, flower peacocks and rows of colorful flowers on the ground.....in comparison to Switzerland or India during the spring time, this is just a little place but for those staying in a desert, this is definitely a miracle.Kids and adults will equally enjoy this place.
Nice to hangout ! Pretty n nice for dubai spring time. Nice display of flowers and arrangements ! Pleasent for evening, visiting n hanging out with friends !

Must see it !!. Mabrook Dubai !!Beautiful flower garden in the middle of the desert !!.If you go with your children better visit between 4pm to 6pm. I do not recommend to visit between 11am 3pm as there is no shade.

Worth seeing, but go in the evening.. The tickets for this place were only 20 Dirham, which is cheap for Dubai, but we went around 12pm and regretted it. There is little to no shade available and you get a sharp whistle blast from the multiple regents if you sit down on the grass. My five-year old niece was pretty exhausted after an hour or so of walking through (she went looking for fairies). There are plenty of bathroom facilities available, but no sources of water unless you want to wait in line at the informal concession stands. Separate (gender) prayer tents are there, but they are sweltering in the direct sunlight. I really wished these guys installed misters and water fountains here. If you want to go, go during the evening. But it's pretty!

unique spring flowers in the desert. it was Friday when me and my friends visited this place so it was a bit crowded, kinda far from city center, its beside the motor city, u need to pay dhs20 entrance fee, wide variety of colorful flowers shaped in different forms and landscape, caretakers will not let u go on the grass for taking pics or even step on the flower lines if u are a foreigner but if u are an emirati they don't care at all, some snack shops are available and u can rent some traditional carpets if u wanna lay down. during our visit the flowers are just blooming thus it looks unpolished. overall its a nice visit feeling some spring flowers in the desert though the usual varieties like roses, tulip, lilies etc. are missing.

Amazing flower show. Last week of March i visited the garden with my family. It was an amazing experience for us. I heard that there is a garden in Al Ain but we could not go there. When we visited the place there was a sand storm also. Some how we managed the climate and we took many photographs from there. There were many domes, peacock designed with flowers and plants, there was an emirates logo with flowers. You can find area ceiling made with small umbrellas. A negative thing I wish to tell you that the lack of enough clock room facilities. Especially in ladies side there was a big queue for using toilet facility. Being a garden the children cannot find anything for them and walking hours to see the garden made them tired. The management can have something there to make the children happy.

A little over-hyped at this point but pretty. I was very excited about seeing this knowing that Dubai does everything in an over-the-top fashion but, although this is pretty, this attraction probably needs another year or two to get my "miracle" rating! It's out of the way (unless you're going to an amusement park called Dubai Land which it's next door to), there isn't any shade and the sun can be merciless, the "garden" is basically all petunias and there are nasty whistle blowing guards all over the place! I see one reviewer says it's a good place for a family picnic but I can't imagine that would be permitted and you would all melt anyway! It's also about $20USD per adult. We took the metro to the Mall of the Emirates then caught a cab so it was a bit of a hassle and fairly expensive to get there and back. Having said all of these snarky things it IS a very pretty place and it's nice to admire something other than architecture or shopping centers in Dubai. But if you've been to beautiful gardens, maybe the Singapore Botanic Garden, this will be a disappointment unless you're a major petunia lover. If you do go do so as early or as late in the day as you can. We were there mid-day and the heat was oppressive and the little food tents set up along the perimeter had all run out of water and only had juice to sell. They have plans to do much more and I suspect it will be lovely, if not a "miracle" in a couple years, but right now I'd probably skip it. I have a travel blog and wrote a post about our (rather funny) visit there. If you'd like to read it it's at http://bit.ly/YFUn6M.

Excellent spot for a family picnic. Lot of color. Flowers on the ground, on slopes, up the walls- everywhere! Small pond with fountain. Tents with chairs to have your snacks. Small quaint cafe shop. Play atea for kids would make it complete.

worth the taxi ride to see. It is an explosion of color in a very hot desert. We spent about an hour walking the grounds of the Miracle Garden and worth the about $5 entrance fee. The flowers are done well and some excellent shot with the camera. You are free to roam about and it was just a very pleasant time. I would go in the morning as I could see it getting pretty hot there and shade is available, but limited.There is food and water on site, but it is remote with a lot of taxi drivers not knowing where this place is as it is still pretty new. The place was busy, but that was because people drove themselves there. We just got the taxi out as they were dropping someone off, so keep that in mind. We might have been lucky.

Overhyped distraction. Dubai is a miracle city in itself, and when Dubai calls something a Miracle, it really sets the expectations v high.It was valentine's day and I decided to surprise my wife by taking her to this place; 1, Coz its so-called Miracle, and 2, my wife loves flowers. By d way, she is v knowledgeable about flowers. Guess what! surprise had a price which I had to pay later for spoiling the party (secret).1. There are v less and ugly species of flowers in this place.2. When you think of a Miracle garden, it cannot be without roses, jasmines and more importantly that fragrance and soothing feel to your eyes. None could be found here.3. Parking arrangements are not too good for the big crowd attracted to the place due to media hype4. Access to the location is v complicated with v limited sign boards5. If you like photography, then mind you the place is poorly lit6. And last but not the least, the place is not worth even small entrance of 20 bucks per person as you feel sorry after spending it there instead of so many worthwhile things in Dubai.7. Tourists particularly, beware! This place is for those who have seen sand throughout their lives, and never saw a flower. At least back in my home country, I have seen a lot of greenery and colorful flowers much better than the best in MIRACLE GARDEN.I wont be surprised if in coming days Miracle Garden would turn into ruins...

Done expect a Miracle. What a misnomer !!! especially in Dubai. It has lots of flowers and fairly large (not by dubai standards), however in name of varity its just different colors of same breed. You will barely find a second varity of flower. The watering of the moss on which flowers are growing has incresed humidity of the park very much and walking is big effort. At spots moss is rotting and smell is very bad.And top of it ticket costs AED 20 per head a steep for family.

Riot of Colors - never miss. Riot of Colors - never missThis garden is by many standards a fantastic sight for the eye in a desert. A wonderful thought from the creators and all the staff who maintain is much appreciated by all. The shades and hues of the flowers present well for some photography. This is a seasonal attraction only during the spring perhaps. A must visit place far from the commercially focused malls in Dubai for both visitors and residents alike. In fact I have visited the flower show at the Bangalore Lal Bagh several times and the annual flower event in Ooty and Coonoor in India once as well. I find the Dubai Miracle Garden comparable or even better given the fact that only a few species can grow in these harsh weathers were fertile soil and water is a constraint. This is such a real example of 'if there is a will, there is a way'I bow to the HH, The Ruler of Dubai who has such a vision and wonderful heart that is reflected in the unimaginable multitude of colors from mother nature. You ought to see it and experience.

A garden in a desert. A beautiful garden planted with millions of flowers in the desert.This is what you find in Dubai.Amazing city,it never disappoints you.The 14 millions Petunia flowers in all colours and shades,designed in several shapes is a beauty .On the 4th of April, the 14 million flowers will be replaced with fresh ones,creating different shapes.The layout of the flowers needs upgrading,but it seems according to the Ingineer in charge that many new ideas will be implemented soon, since it is only the beginning of this project.

Do not over expect. Garden in the desert is what makes this place a miracle. The idea itself is beautiful and attractive. What I didn't like about the place was the combination of colors, it annoyed me to look at a bad mixture of colors. in some cases I wondered about who designed the place, and I said to my self how could someone make a flower look ugly!I think the place worth a visit, it is a great runaway from the desert in the desert. Go have a look, hope you enjoy your time there

A piece of Paradise!. If there is an Eden, then Miracle Garden must be a part of it! 14 million flowers in all forms and shapes and colors are brought together to create this masterpiece. Pictures in teh Garden will make everyone at home oh and ah. The entrance fee is 20 drh, but it is worth it, it is not one of those boring botanical garden, but a truly bright flower wonderland. Even in the scorching heat of the desert petunias were as fragrant as is if there was no heat at all. They have different sculptures, and arrangements of flowers so its not same old rows of pretty flowers. It takes about an hour, to walk through the whole garden. It is an eye pleasing place for sure, and if you worry for your kids getting bored hit Dubai land next door, you can even walk there!So two rabbits in one shot

Miracle Garden -pathway to heaven?!. If Dubai ever lacked anything ,it's amply made up by this new attraction -the newly created Miracle Garden! Dubai boasts of everything concrete but for once it has come up with a totally natural attraction for nature lovers. 45 million flowers creating a riot of colors in the middle of a desert is no small feat! As you enter the gates of this heavenly place ,you pass through the seven hearts to an enthralling vision of flowers in all colors and shades created by God .There are rows and rows flower beds creating a sea of colors imaginable.And then there are walls,pyramids,baubles,falcon,peacocks ,all created by flowers and more flowers...a feast to the eyes like never before,here in Dubai!

Great display of flowers. we came here during the opening week. Really impressed with the way that they have made it and designed it. Really is a miracle to see the different colored flowers spread out in the middle of a desert. Most of the  flowers seemed to be wilting and dying so I'm  not sure how long the flowers would survive going into the summer. That really would be the miracle, trying to keep it alive. But do visit during the daytime on weekdays when you can avoid the crowds and get better photos, if you are into that sort of thing.

beautiful flower display. Visited this new attraction on a beautiful sunny day after school ended. The flowers were a sight to behold, colours vibrant and all in different shapes. Price bit high for children same as adults, but the displays were outstanding even appreciated by the children. Downside perhaps a small play area for the children would have been appreciated as they could soon get bored.

Lots of flowers - smells wonderful, but kind of small attraction!. Took family over the the NEW Dubai Miracle Garden for a look see - nice for maybe one hour and it's in town so very handy! I would not say that it is the nicest flower garden I've ever been too by far! All the same it was a nice little visit and close to home - I would suggest it for a great place to take some wedding photos, if your look for a great backdrop for portraits.

surprise in the desert. Was going to visit gardens in Al Ain but they were closed. My daughter-in-law read in the paper were they had opened in Dubai. My son surprised me with a visit. They are beautiful and worth the ride. So many colors and the smell was wonderful. We spent about two hours walking around with our two grandsons looking at everything. Was a great time.
A colourful surprise in the desert. If you enjoy strolling around a park full of flowers then this place is worth a visit! I lost count of how many photos we took between three of us.
